Upon return shortly after 4pm, I was told - again in a patronising way - that my room has been upgraded two categories. Well, I've paid for that upgrade with a SUA, so no favours were done. No offer of late checkout was extended, so if you stay here know your rights - I'm Marriott Titanium and as such I am eligible for 4pm checkout, which when requested was applied but, again, not offered proactively.
The $50 scam destination fee includes $50 credit for F&B (guess what - you can't use it on the day of departure!), $75 laundry credit (sufficient to wash and fold 2 pairs of undies, 2 pairs of socks and 2 polo shirts) and some credit for the hair salon. Museum tickets are no longer given.
As a Titanium member you get zero welcome amenity other than the choice of breakfast or 1000 points. Most hotels will leave you some chocolates, fruit bowl or some other token of appreciation for your custom, but penny-pinching here is quite obvious.
The Bentley house car which is so prominently advertised on the hotel website is not a Bentley at all. Also they would not let you take the car with luggage (for clarity, by luggage I mean a backpack and a carryon). Park Hyatt somehow didn't have a problem with that.
On the morning of departure I've found a letter pushed under the door: an offer of 25k Marriott points for giving up the guaranteed 4pm checkout and vacating the room at 12 noon. Quite an insult to second-top tier Bonvoy member in a hotel that charges >$1000 per night. Boy, they were desperate for that room. At 11:30am I've got a call from front desk to ask if I could check out by 12pm because they need the room and if I'd like to stay they'd offer me *another room* for 4 hours. I've never experienced anything like this. The offer went up to 30k points. I've settled at 40k, as I couldn't stand staying there any longer.
Checkout is an experience too. The clerk dealing with me had difficulty comprehending some basic English. They didn't even bother asking how your stay was. They knew it was crap. My absolute favourite was when they said: "you can stand there and wait until the bellman is done with that customer". So five star!

title: Pleasant stay
text: I stayed at the St Regis for a weekend. I enjoyed every moment of my stay. This is one of those hotels that make you feel good...We had a high floor room with excellent views. The restaurant and bar was very good as usual.

title: Expensive mediocre
text:
So unfortunately a lot of disappointment.  We really pushed the boat out for somewhere special
To stay in NY.  £1000 a night ( inc breakfast) and it was … mehhhh - the bed was comfy … the staff forgettable the butler service - was actually a lady whose first language was not English ( or American ) on the phone - after the 6th attempt to explain - as expected the booking was messed up!
All of the above was raised - and I requested to speak to the manager …. But nothing! 
Such a shame. I really wanted to fall In love and have an amazing experience we could repeat …. Expensive mediocre.

title: are usually a very good experience ther!
text:
Love the location.
We had a couple of problems with housekeeping that was disappointing. Number one we had no remote control then we got one that did not work!! We were supposed to get coffee dilivered to our room at 6.45 didi not come until seven. I'm not used to that becouse ussually the service is awesome...

title: OUTSTANDING AS ALWAYS
text: Once again we had an unbelievable stay at the St. Regis.  The location is the best in all of NYC.  When we were first checking in ,our favorite employee was not there.  We knew the hotel had been closed for a while as all hotels in NYC were due to covid.  It was too early to check in so we went to lunch.  When we got back our fav Julissa  greeted us.  We were so excited to see her!!!  Everything was just fantastic!!  She goes above and beyond to make sure our stay is very memorable and one of a kind!!

title: Wonderful stay!
text: I frankly don't understand some of the negative reviews.  This was our first time at this property and it was simply perfect.  We were in NYC for a weekend stay to celebrate my 40th birthday.  From the start, the hospitality was outstanding.  Everyone was kind, gracious, and welcoming.  We were upgraded to a Grand Luxe room and from our perspective it was fabulous.  If you're looking for a sleek modern hotel, this is not it, but it hearkens to a former era, and to me this is most welcome.  The morning coffee service is great, and they were kind to acknowledge my birthday with a bottle of Laurent Perrier which is one of our favorite champagne.  We will be revisiting the St Regis again in the future.

title: LOVING IT!!!!  Still here for one more night… the staff, food, amenities— are all much better than expected & happy!!!!
text: I am delighted with our stay— still here— staff, food, amenities much better than I was expecting… can’t wait to return and VERY SAFE— treat COVID very seriously— but still very friendly and helpful… GREAT JOB!!!  Location is the BEST! Thanks again

title: Beautiful Hotel but a bit hard  to Justify
text:
This was our second stay and overall it was very good. The staff was very friendly and our room was very comfortable. And I just love the history of the hotel; you can almost feel it. The location is excellent. 

However, the St. Regis is costly and you definitely get what you pay for. We got just the standard room and once again it was toward the back of the hotel and overlooked a brick wall. The room was lovely but definitely had signs of aging. I was also disappointed that their famed Bentley was again not running and no real reason as to why. Last time it was “in the shop”. My kids were so disappointed! I was also disappointed that the long standing tradition of sabering champagne no longer happens. It did on our first stay and it was awesome. This time I guess they blamed COVID. But with the bar being packed, elbow to elbow, with paying customers, there didn’t seem to be a health worry there! BTW I do like the King Cole Bar but it could be updated for sure.  

Room service was just ok. Kids wanted cookies and milk before bed and they were promptly delivered but they sent substitute cookies that my kids didn’t like. In room coffee the next morning was enjoyable but came in at whopping $120 ( plus service charges) for a pot of coffee and two bagels. Lastly, We were going to the parade that day and asked for an extra hour to check out and were denied. Just an hour to refresh and relax. They are very stringent on their check in times too. 

Despite my modest concerns we did have a nice stay in an elegant and historic hotel. If there’s a next time, I will have to see what the better rooms go for. But not sure I can justify $1,500+ a night.

title: Status means nothing when booking with points
text:
This is one of 3 locations of the Hotel St. Regis we have stayed in. Normally we love the hotel because the rooms, amenities and staff are normally great. The staff we encountered while in NY was was phenomenal (and I wish they still gave those cards to people with hotel status to reward staff like that beyond just tips) but who we encountered personally and how things turned out generally were very different.
 Despite status and letting them know we  were staying there for our son's 3rd birthday the experience really fell flat. Perhaps it was because we used points that they decided to put us in a back corner of the 7th floor in a suite that had certainly not been renovated. But the room was poorly kept and clearly dated (see photos fingerprints on mirrors, dirty walls, damaged furniture and there was no body wash until I found housekeeping in the hall). I also found myself needing to email the concierge 3 times in order to get information on vegan dining options. I get it, not everyone is vegan, but I asked both about the room service and local restaurants and the first response I received was a canned answer in the form of a pdf of local st. regis favs (including steak houses). When I followed up to clarify (vegan, please help, is there more info on room service) I was sent the pdf of the room service menu. The response failed to  mention there was no room service being served outside of breakfast at that time,we found out only when we arrived adding to the uselessness of the response. I sent ANOTHER email essentially calling out, you are the Concierge of the Hotel St. Regis in Manhattan and I KNOW you can be more helpful than this. Only then did I get any insights which were limited, and late.

title: Best US Hotel I've Stayed At
text:
Stay Report - 12/23 - 12/24

Location: Great obviously.  Easy walk to the E/M Station at 53rd and 5th as well as a bunch of other subway stations.  Being close to 5th Avenue, Park Avenue and Lexington Avenues means plenty to eat at, drink at, see, do etc.  The only complaint I have if I have one is that 55th Street backs up easily so any car coming to pick you up or drop you off can take a minute.  It's easier to meet vehicles or be dropped off on 5th.

Hotel: What can I say that hasn't been said about this place? Beautiful lobby of course with a lovely dining area and of course the King Cole Bar.  No waits for elevators which is a bonus, even the hallways and stairwells look lovely.  Even more importantly is the staff down to the last person is impeccable at hospitality.  Service was on par with any Asian or European luxury hotel I've stayed at.

Check In: I guess if I wanted to complain I'd mention there are only two agents working and because they give such good service you can wait a minute or two in line waiting your turn.  But once you're in front of the agent it's really nice that they are so helpful and give such great service, so I won't complain.

Room: I had booked a regular room on points and used a SNA to get an upgrade to a Grand Luxe.  It was a really nice room with a full living room, large bathroom with separate tub and shower and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in.  The butler service is incredible too.  Every time I rang for my butler they were there in a minute and provided so many nice little touches like coffee and tea in the morning.  

Dining: Drinks at the King Cole Bar were very nice and service was great there too.  Titanium Breakfast covered the American Breakfast which was two eggs, choice of meat, potatoes and bread with coffee and juice.  They were nice about substitutions too.

I spent 100,000 points on one night here and I feel I got my money's worth.  Where else can I say that about?

title: Disappointed lifetime Platinum Member
text: We booked back-to-back reservations, which thank goodness had a cancellation policy of 24 hours. After less than a day, we cancelled our second reservation and moved to the Langham on 5th Ave. The Grand Deluxe Room was in horrible condition. Most disgusting was a huge white stain on the grey couch that’s pictured. We were told that they had no other rooms that were at the grand deluxe or higher level for the duration of our stay, even though the website showed many categories available when we searched for the dates of our stay - other grand deluxe rooms, Astor suites, deluxe suites, st Regis suites, and even grand suites - same exact dates of stay. Also, although they entice you with a $130 credit for breakfast, they don’t tell you that it doesn’t include gratuity or a mandatory $36 delivery charge for room service. Our first breakfast resulted in an overage of almost $80 for 2 orders of French Toast and a Benedict, which were mediocre. The once warm and accommodating butlers were now robotic and absent. What happened? This has long been my favorite hotel in NYC, with more than a dozen stays over several years pre-Covid. Pandemic or not, I’ll look elsewhere. They simply don’t care anymore.

title: House car is not a Bentley! Butler service underwhelming.
text:
Normally I don’t write reviews, but I had to write this one. I’ve been staying at Marriott properties for a while, and I’ve generally had really good experiences at them. This was my first time staying in St Regis, and honestly after spending over $1500 per night, I am underwhelmed by what this property has to offer. I chose this over the Ritz because of its butler service and the Bentley house car that is advertised right on their website. 

Let’s start with the house car. It’s not a Bentley anymore, and instead it’s a Cadillac Escalade. They are not on the same level. If you don’t have the Bentley anymore, you should not advertise it on your website and social media. The Bentley was one of the factors that lead me to pick this over the Ritz!

Second, the butler is not capable of doing much. All my butler did was bring me tea, and when I asked for desserts, he said that he simply can’t do it. This kind of behavior cannot be accepted from a 5 star property. 

Third, I am a Marriott Bonvoy gold member plus I booked through the Amex Platinum card’s FHR program, which entitles me to room upgrades, late checkouts and various other benefits. When I checked in, none of that was acknowledged, and I was given the most basic room even though they actually had upgraded rooms available right on Expedia that night. When I told staff about my Marriott Status and told them that I booked through the Amex Platinum’s FHR program, they just said that there weren’t any other upgraded rooms available…. Which was a total lie. My friends who stayed at the Ritz that night had all their benefits printed right out the moment they checked in, and they got exactly what they were entitled to and paid for! I should not be asking for this stuff, it should already be given to me! 

I am also entitled to guaranteed 4PM checkout, which they honored… after I asked for it (normally other hotels automatically do it for you), however… they sent me a letter in my room the next morning saying that if I check out before 12 instead of 4, I can get 20k Marriott points. Someone who can spend this much money on a hotel does not care about 20k Marriott points. This was rude.

And lastly, the “superior” rooms are just small, dark and have tiny windows. It was quite depressing inside with the plain white walls. At first they put me in the 13th floor, and the room had the view of a brick wall, when I asked for a room with a better view, they put me on the 19th floor in another very plain and bland room with white walls and the view of another brick wall. 

I expected better from a hotel that charges $1500 (with tax) per night for their cheapest room. There are better hotels and rooms for this price, I hope this review helps people make better decisions.

title: Solid
text:
One of the best Covid travel experiences. Had been years ago before changing ownership. The space is still very much the same. Service is consistently reliable. 

Sent a gift certificate to a colleague recently who only had nice things to say about the spa. Hoping to try that out during our next visit!

title: Reopened with the same service and ambience
text: Just returned from staying at the Ritz in Paris and the St Regis is definitely on a par with the Ritz. In fact when we stayed at the St Regis in September, still under covid protocols, it had more amenities than a comparable Ritz suite, e.g.,butler, morning coffee service, shoes shined, clothes  pressing, Nespresso, filled ice bucket, waters, chocolates, etc. It was wonderful to catchup with the St Regis staff who had been out of work for over 15 months. Here’s hoping everything can return to normal soon.

title: Absolute Heaven
text:
In my mind this is a bucket list property and after staying there for my first time in August 2021, I felt fulfilled on many levels.

I was upgraded to a suite and the service was some of the best I ever experienced at any hotel in my life.  I could have spent hours just studying the architecture and decor of the lobby...this hotel is very very special.  Location right on 5th and close to Central Park and other attractions.

Highly recommended and when I can swing it...my favorite property in NYC!

title: Disappointed in service & room
text: I was ultimately very disappointed and will not choose to stay there again, it will also sway me to not stay at a St Regis again, honestly. I’ve had better experiences at Marriott Courtyard than I did here. The rooms are gorgeous, but my room phones were down so I couldn’t utilize the butler service or any room service, questions etc. while I was in the room. Also my bath water was greenish yellow - when I called from my cell phone to tell them, they said “we’ve heard this before, so sorry” and nothing was done. At other marriotts I’m able to check in early, and with them, I had a show that I had to be at at 4pm, Bc it started at 5 and they didn’t have a room ready for me before then so I had to get ready in the bathroom. No thank you!

title: AMAZING STAY at the St. Regis NYC
text: This was our first trp back to NYC since January 2019.  The accomodations at the St. Regis were beyond amazing. From the overall extreme cleanliness of the rooms, to the impecable attention to detail and service, this was by far a highlight of 2021. The team at the St. Regis is real.  They go above and beyond.  Erik at the front desk was remarkable.  The suite came with butler service.  Lily was incredible. So kind and helpful.  John brought our breakfast and was extremely personable.  You won't meet a nicer guy than Pascal who works valet.  Looking forward to our next stay. Thanks again to the team at the St. Regis

title: Spectacular Stay
text:
We just finished up a one-night stay here and it was absolutely wonderful! The rooms are gorgeous, the service was fantastic, and the food was delightful. One of my best hotel stays as of late.

Check-in: We arrived early at 11am, and one of two rooms was ready at about 3:45pm and the other was upgraded to an Astor Suite and available a bit closer to 5pm, which was fine with us. All the team members at the front desk were very kind and helpful, especially Orville, who went out of his way to check on our rooms and ensure we were comfortable. 

Rooms: We had one Grand Luxe room (used SNA) and one Astor Suite (upgraded from SNA Grand Luxe upon asking). Both were meticulously clean, well-maintained, spacious, and simply gorgeous. The bathrooms were beautiful and the water pressure was amazing in the shower. Both rooms had butler service, and our butler, Tamara, offered incredible service, going above and beyond for even the smallest requests and being very proactive.

Food/Beverage: Drinks at the King Cole Bar were delightful and breakfast at the Astor Court was delicious (the French Toast was a highlight). 

Service: Every team member we encountered was kind and helpful, and all requests were responded to quickly. Orville and Tamara were stand-outs, going above and beyond and making a big impact on our stay. Couldn't have asked for more!

Thanks to the St. Regis team for a wonderful stay - we will be back!

title: Everything But The View
text: My husband and I just spent a weekend at the St. Regis for a birthday staycation. The staff went above and beyond to make for a special weekend - our butler (Christian) coordinated complimentary champagne, fruit and chocolates which made for a special start to the weekend. The room was beautiful, though the view was just awful. There was a film over the window so you couldn’t see through- and what you could see was just scaffolding and the other side of the building. I felt like we were in a cocoon - picture attached. The woman at reception said it was their best available room. However given my husbands Marriott status, thought they could have done better. We didn’t want to complain, but if we stay in the future will definitely say something to try to get a better window and view next time.

title: A+ stay. All the glitter is gold.
text: The St. Regis NYC is a special, historical gem to be treasured. 5-star luxury accommodations and service, prime location for strolls in Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, and fine dining. Pratima Kandel, Operations Manager, was a standout host and wonderful ambassador for the brand. One of the most memorable trips together as a couple.

title: Rundown, and Classless
text:
I've stayed at this hotel many, many times in the last 8 years - mostly since it was convenient for work. And despite its increasingly rundown nature with every passing year - I did so out of a sense of habit and familiarity. I'd frankly never had (and fortunately never needed to) interact with their staff since I'd basically come back to the hotel to sleep essentially. 

My husband was joining me this particular trip for a celebratory weekend that included US Open finals, etc. and this hotel, and its bafflingly un-trained and just utterly classless staff came so close to ruining it (fortunately my husband had the wisdom to cancel the reservation and move us to Park Hyatt immediately).

The facts: I'd planned to check-in after we flew in and then go to meetings. 9/11 security made all flights terribly late and I went straight to work while my husband went to the hotel with our bags. The room was booked on my Corp. rate and the hotel informed him extremely high-handedly (signal 1) that without my business card they will not honor the Corp. rate. (My husband obviously does not carry around my business card) so they told him that until I came around - they'll make him put his CC for the regular rack rate - which he promptly agreed to and signed off on. However, now that these feckless buffoons that the St. Regis NY calls its "front desk" had found themselves down the path of their pathetic puffery - they obviously felt the need to impress upon my husband their (non existent) superiority by throwing out phrases like "Sir, hotel checkins are at 4 p.m. Don't you know?" (yes, he'd made the heinous error of showing up at 3.45 pm). There was not a single area to sit and wait (their lobby belongs to a motel that rents room by the hour) - and after my husband STOOD uncomfortably on the side of a pillar for 10 minutes one of the attendants grudgingly let him sit in the restaurant area (which they gate off during the day). 4 pm came and went - no signs of a room - and when my husband finally went back to ask around 4.45 since he had a 5pm Zoom (by legal contract, the room should have been made available at 4) - he was talked down to by another unrefined character that offered no apology and added "You'll get a room when we have one available". That being the last straw, my husband cancelled the reservation and moved us to the Park Hyatt nearby.

I was incensed when I learned about this ordeal around 7 pm when I finished work and called the hotel. My suspicions of the hotel's egregious incompetence were immediately confirmed when a manager called Zach answered and offered me gems such as "I'm sorry you felt that way". Seriously, what bottom barrel school of hospitality has this staff been scraped off of the floor of?! I get that it's impossible to hire good people right now, but if the hotel had any self-respect or regard for reputation, they'd close before subjecting guests to whatever they can hire (and not bother to train). The sad truth is that if you've not been around dignified or classy people before and are suddenly thrust in front of them haplessly, and without appropriate training  - you're deluded into thinking that being a service person at a somewhat elite NY hotel encompasses being (tactlessly) rude and (completely undeservingly) arrogant. Such a travesty - that's where your tips come from, dude.

 [I should call out that despite my clearly catty - although 100% accurate - review here, my husband is the most mild-mannered, kind person you'll meet so there's absolutely nothing he could've done to warrant this litany of insults. They behaved this way because they're untrained, fundamentally lack class and dignity about how to treat another human being (forget the fact that his patronage pays your bills!), and because obviously their management lets them get away with it].

title: Avoid; Rooms Chic, but Service Horrendous
text: While I'm trying give the benefit of the doubt during the pandemic, the St. Regis New York is a hotel I will never patronize again.  Arriving at 11pm, a bellman simply watched us get out of our SUV and manage our own luggage up the stairs.  Check-in was an abysmal process with a front desk gentleman who was both disgruntled and aloof.  A manager was no where to be found; on the phone with a "guest issue."  I laughed when the front desk agent gave a room key out to someone without verifying his ID and accused a woman of not being a guest.  He also explained to me and another guest that there are no amenities during this time (e.g. no room service, bar closed early, and that you could go outside to get a drink).  Upon entering the room, the "butler" knocked and when asked if we needed anything (water), he told us we already had water in our room.  The shower drained poorly.  The towels had makeup on them from a previous guest.  At least the bed was very comfortable and WiFi fast.  They also did accommodate a late check-out request, but had to laugh again when another bellman was on his phone at the front desk while checking out and didn't offer to help us with bags/taxi/directions.  It is a beautiful property and the rooms are very lush, but you're going to get better service at the Hampton Inn a couple blocks away and would strongly recommend you visit the Park Hyatt or Mandarin Oriental nearby or even the Four Seasons down near World Trade.  All three properties have trained professionals who can deliver on service expected at $700/night.

title: Not Worth It
text:
This hotel appears to offer luxury, but you get the same amenities as a Residence Inn.

-Stayed here one night to celebrate my wife's birthday, with note on reservation.  During check-in, there was no welcome acknowledgement of the special occasion, nor of Bonvoy elite status.  Not looking for free goodies, but a note or greeting would of been nice.
- Was told we were "upgraded" to a better room, but going from a Grand Luxe to a Deluxe looks pretty equivalent.  As Marriott's website advertises, "captivating views" of the exterior were indeed that - staring out a window into the interior well of the building from the 7th floor certainly made the room seem more like a glamorous prison cell than being on top of the world.
- Advertises extreme cleanliess...except for the cashews on the floor by the bed left from the previous occupant.  
- Butler service has been reduced to only the suites, as I was informed.  Was able to get shoes shined, but no unpacking or pressing of garments anymore.  Was able to request an iron and ironing board, as they aren't normal room features.
- No complimentary coffee or tea in the morning, and no fruit platter or snacks to welcome you in the room. Guests can fix themselves coffee or tea in the lobby if they desire.  On the food specifically, explanation was that COVID prevents them from having fruit (or food in general) in the open.  However, if you go to the fitness center, plenty of bananas and oranges sitting out in the open for guests - a bit of a disconnect.  Also, if you would like coffee or tea in the morning in the room, you can pay for it with room service.
- The Bentley is not available, and won't be until at least the fall (and potentially winter) time frame.  Confirmed this with one of the drivers, the hotel stopped using the car during the pandemic and has not brought it back.  Mercedes is great alternative, but again, feels slightly deceptive to keep advertising that feature when its not available at all.

Let the front desk know at check-out that the stay was underwhelming - could overlook a lot of things, but not everything.  Jonathon at the counter took down my name and number and assured me the manager would want to reach out.  Days later, nothing heard. *shrug*

All in all, it's a beautiful property and very fancy looking, but in terms of those luxurious touches the St Regis is known for.....  save your money and either go someplace else that has more of those amenities ready for patrons, or just go to a Residence Inn.  This property just doesn't seem ready yet for prime time.  COVID's been challenging for properties across the board, but without those fine touches, hard to see what currently separates the St Regis from the competition.

title: Not a good value for normal people
text:
I stayed for one night by using the Marriott points.  I will not spend $1000 a night to say in any hotel.  Even using the points, I thought it was not really worthy. 

I am a Titanium member. I stayed in a superior room which I thought it was  basic with very old fashion decoration.  I didn't get any upgrade by either using the suite night award or complement upgrade.  

I don't know what the Buttler service is because they didn't answer my page.  They are probably busy serving the people staying in the suites.

I think this hotel is good for people willing to spend a lot of money to book the expensive suites.  If you only book the basic room, there will not be any good service.

title: Magical Stay in NYC
text: Covid prevented us from celebrating a milestone birthday last summer, but our recent stay at the St. Regis made up for it. From start to finish the hotel staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable. Doorman Tomasz was especially kind and helpful. Front desk staff was great and the Concierge team of Harold and Krista are hands down the best. We had morning breakfast in our room and hotel staff who delivered it (I forgot his name) was absolutely wonderful. As a Marriott Titanium Elite member received upgraded room and room was stunning. The St. Regis will be our go to hotel when visiting the city from here on out.

title: Highest Standard in the US
text:
At Pre-arrival time, Freddie V from reservations and Krista S from Concierge helped us make excellent arrangements that made our stay very exceptional. They took excellent care of us on stay preference, occasions celebration, dining reservations, and more minor details like balloon requests (we are very impressed on how St. Regis New York cares about their guest's experience).
At check-in, Trang from the front desk gave us a warm welcome to St. Regis and explained the hotel's history/offerings to us. She offered us a very spacious room. Butler Lynn Li (10th floor) introduced the amenities a few minutes after we got into the room and gave us excellent welcome fruit plates and Champagne. She took the extra mile to deliver a lovely turndown service with music. 
The next day Christina from the front desk works hard to confirm a deluxe suite upgrade, which is impressive. Second room butler Dolores (6th floor) is also very friendly and attentive. She helped us with every request (suite has full butler service), like laundry, coffee/tea service, amenities requests, and packing. It's hard to describe how outstanding a full butler service takes us, and we feel Dolores tries hard to make our stay better by addressing every detail. Dolores inspired us with her spirit and pride as a member representing St. Regis, and she is a star in hospitality. 
The rooms and suites are gorgeous, but their service and design are legendary. After trying two different rooms, I feel that everyone in the hotel represents their highest brand standard. We look forward to coming back soon.

title: Flawless Birthday Stay
text:
As a Platinum Member, I decided to upgrade to the Fifth Avenue Suite with additional fees. The Fifth Avenue Suite is just gorgeous and everything during the stay was perfect! The service was exceptionally fantastic and the loyalty as an elite member was honored. The breakfast was terrific as well, and I received special gifts and greeting cards from Mr. Geray, Celia, and Jie as it was my birthday. Besides, I like their complimentary shoe shining and overnight laundry service. 

This was absolutely an unforgettable experience and I cannot overstate my appreciation for Mr. Geray, Celia, and Jie. Without their efforts, this stay couldn't have been so impeccable. I am not even able to say one bad thing about the hotel and will choose to stay at St. Regis whenever I travel to NYC in the future. Strongly recommend it as a top place for celebrating your special occasions (have recommended it to my friends!).

title: The suite is the new place you have to stay in NYC
text:
The suite is the only place I’d stay in New York!
Zach gave us great service and gave us a double upgrade to the suite and it was all we could ask for!

Bathrooms and shower pressure were hands down the best I’ve had in years at different hotels. Only poor experience was by Jonathan at the time of check in but other than that it was great

title: Not worth the price
text:
I don’t write a ton of reviews (despite staying in hotels 50+ nights/year) but felt compelled to write this one because the St Regis is so expensive and I had been wanting to try it for years. The short story is: it’s quite average, and I don’t know why one would stay here over the Mandarin Oriental other than location, especially considering the MO is usually 20-25% cheaper.

As a Marriott Titanium I was given an upgraded room, but what I would have preferred was a room when I arrived (at about 3.30pm), instead of not having one until 4.45pm (and then had to rush to a 5pm appointment). No one asked which would have been better, and the staff over promised and under delivered on the time it would be ready.

I’m not quite sure what the butler service benefit is, and maybe it’s still COVID reduced, but I never met or saw the butler, and when I paged the butler I didn’t receive a call back for quite a while, and so instead just called the front desk for the issue I had (the link to the WSJ they were providing for guests didn’t work). Despite raising the issue—not a huge deal in the grand scheme—I was somewhat surprised that no one went out and just bought a WSJ for me given the reviews I’ve read of this place? But anyhow, they just apologized that they didn’t have a way to provide any access for me.

The workout room was pretty nice, but again slightly underwhelming for the price of the hotel (one peloton machine that was in use by another guest for a full hour; an odd assortment of weight machines; a reasonable collection of dumb bells but oddly missing some weights, like the 45s).

The room service breakfast was very good, but I’m glad it was included as an elite benefit, because $140 is quite steep for any breakfast (the EDITION has at least as good, if not better, breakfasts for about half that price by room service).

At any rate, at half the price, it would be a great hotel. At the price, I can’t see staying here again; the service would have to be dramatically better.

title: Horrible experience
text: Still COVID shutdown. No room service. Heater didn’t work and to fix it you have to leave the room. Had to go over to the Peninsula Hotel to use there bar which was functioning just fine.  One good thing was the shower was high volume.

title: 25th anniversary
text: This hotel was great. We had our own butler that all we had to do was pick up the phone to call. We had a great time and the hotel room was very spacious and luxurious. The staff was great and they provided everything that we needed to enjoy our stay in New York.

title: Absolutely incredible
text: This St. Regis is so beautiful! I had an amazing suite over-looking the city with a great butler. It is one of my favorite hotels that I have stayed at. Everything about this hotel is amazing. The beds were very comfortable.

title: Memorable experience
text: St.Regis is one of my favourite hotel chain. I had great experience at this hotel. The room is big and make me feel very cozy. Great service and facilities. The staffs are very friendly and offer genuine service. I will definitely stay over again.

title: La storia in un hotel!
text:
Che dire se non esprimere l'emozione per aver soggiornato in questa perla.
Servizi e personale ineccepibili, bar che ha fatto la storia così come i suoi cocktail.
Camera superlativa, non perdete il "st. regis sabering ritual" ogni sera alle 18 in punto per dare il benvenuto alla sera come faceva J.J.Astor, il fondatore della struttura.
I'll be back!

title: St. Regis means excellence
text:
No matter where you are in the world, the St. Regis guarantees a great stay. This is no exception for the St. Regis in New York City, the spaces are beautiful, very elegant with the touch of New England fashion. The rooms are big and tidy, however I had the bad luck of receiving a room that smelled of cigarettes. As I notified the front desk housekeeping took care of this scent, even though it didn’t leave the room completely the amazing bed and a goodnight sleep compensated for this inconvenience. 
The concierge in the hotel was very helpful and managed to get us a place for the restaurants we wanted to go in the city, the service overall was great as our five day stay.

title: Location and Service stand out
text:
Recommended by friends, we go on. St Regis made our stay in NY fabulous.

Location cannot be better, very centric and your right at the 5th Av!

Good bars and restaurants are everywhere around, central park and museums too. 

Our room was comfortable, modern, stylish. 

Remarkable is the story behind the building. The architecture is phenomenal and we'll look forward to celebrate new years ones more in NY.

title: One night of luxury stay
text: Could not fault... from check in to check out the staff were amazing, the room was luxurious with nothing left to chance. We dined at Astor court and then the staff reserved us a table at the King Cole bar on a Friday night no less! It was a bucket list night we planned during our month long stay in NYC and now I can die happy 😍

title: De lo mejor en new york hotel!
text:
Como siempre mantiene su standar de calidad. En servicio y comodidad 
Su restaurant excelente y las habitaciones limpias y mobiliario de primera el servicio de concierge del piso de primera y profesional vale siempre la pena por algo dali ! Lo frecuentaba al hospedarse aqui  , tracional desde principio de siglo pasado

title: Excellent friendly staff great position near Fifth Avenue
text:
We stay  here as there was to be a conference which was eventually cancelled Unfortunately the conference was cancelled so we only ended up staying one night
We arrived very late and the computer system was down. The young lady behind the counter got us into our beautiful room very quickly as we were exhausted. The hotel was absolutely charming and the level of service was excellent.

title: Thumbs up!!!
text: The classic St. Regis New York which was founded in 1904 by one of the wealthiest men in America, John Jacob Astor IV a billionaire who died on the Titanic. The St hotel itself is wonderful. We were greeted by very friendly staff. The breakfast we had was always fast andexcellent.

title: What a place "Paradise"
text:
Julianna at the front desk was such a pleasure and made the beginning of my trip a 10. Everything after her was just a follow-through of great service.
Room is great the bathroom was a ten 
Service is great

title: St Regis - Rip you off with hidden fees
text: Watch out at this hotel.  They won’t tell when you check in but they will when you check out.  $51 daily resort fee and $2 occupancy fee, per night, on top of the city and state taxes. After staying with them for decades in numerous cities around the USA and beyond, loyal customer, spending untold dollars...if I didn’t pay it, I was told to stay elsewhere.  A hotel that doesn’t value loyalty, charges very high room rates and still feels they have to hold their ground on charging these obvious money grab/profit enhancement charges, shame on them. If it were an honest business, they would put those fees in the room rate and let the customer decide if they want to stay there.  For my money, I’ll be skipping the St Regis and taking my business to any one of dozens of great hotels in Manhattan.

title: Tea in the afternoon......
text: The room was beautiful.  The food was delicious.  The tea superb.  The service attentive.  What’s not to enjoy.  Spend an hour or so before your evening starts and the relaxation will invigorate your evening.

title: WONDERFUL WEEKEND STAY!
text: I was there last weekend to meet up with some friends. This location was perfect. Pretty easy to get in and out. Check In was a breeze. Really enjoyed the room. Very nicely appointed. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Classy and grandeur.
text:
Grandeur, spectacular, luxurious, historical... Pick any word and it would fit this hotel perfectly well. If you wanna splurge a little bit, either on your points or your wallet, you should consider this property.
My gf and I were fortunately enough to stay at St. Regis NYC for 5 nights during the Christmas season using points. All suites were booked out and we were unable to get an upgrade and I did appreciate the extra effort to upgrade me to grand luxe.
The room was perfect in every single possible aspect. Butlers were very friendly and their services were top notch. 5 days of room service breakfast were delivered on time.
I'd say I'm 95% satisfied with St. Regis NYC however there are a few minor improvements.
1. I was not informed about the waived destination fee on stays over 4 nights. It caused a bit of problem and took 5-10 minutes to be solved. This is a minor thing.
2. The f&b system being dumb. It's related to the plat free breakfast credit. Again, a minor thing.
3. If each room could have 2 rounds of free coffee or tea rather than one in the morning, that would be even better.

title: 鑽石胸針失竊，缺乏聖誕氣氛
text:
本來以為來瑞吉可以好好享受聖誕，結果倒是感受到瑞吉的傲氣，第三天鑽石胸針被偷，馬上跟管家說，結果來了一個先生說隔天會請主管跟我聯絡，隔天沒人找我我問了說退房時會確認，因為主管休息，結果退房那天，說系統沒有記錄，做了再次報告說我離開紐約(一週內)會跟我說，結果我要離開當天打給瑞吉，還是沒有處理。

然後跟萬豪的客服說，最後是，瑞吉的保險沒有包括這個，而且找不到是誰，與此同時我朋友在瑞吉掉了數千美金，真的是滿滿扒手的飯店，我不知道是不是監守自盜，但是保險箱沒有用，八成有通用密碼能開吧。

無所謂了，老，陳舊，服務傲慢，而且餐廳其實小又不精緻，不會再來。也不推薦來，一樣的價格隨便五星酒店都比這間好，給我升等我也不要再來。

title: Best hotel
text: This hotel is the best anyone can experience in NY. Lovely staff and great room and facilities. The service is truly great and everyone was so welcoming. I recommend people to stay here and i think it deserves the name it carries.

title: Excellent experience!
text: From the welcoming staff , to the sumptuous room . Just lovely! The service is excellent and the space is fantastic. If your looking for midtown the St Regis is a great choice. Thanks to all the staff from management to housekeeping that insured a wonderful stay. Looking forward to next time.

title: Great location!
text: I love St. Regis properties and stay in them whenever there is one.  This property was in a great location.  Iconic bar with great food and drinks.  Room were beautiful and spacious (for NYC) and the level of St. Regis service certainly did not lack.  I did feel lke the sabering was an after thought and it didn't feel like much of a tradition or ritual as it does at other St. Regis properties.  Overall we wold go back when in New York.

title: One of New York's top choices
text: This is one of the remaining "classical" or "traditional" hotels in New York. While the building is not new and this can be noticed in a lot of little details, it has been updated a few times and it provides comfortable rooms and outstanding service. In the heart of midtown Manhattan, it is within steps of most places where visitors might wish to go, but it is the front desk and concierge services that make the hotel outstanding. It is pricey, but well worth the expense.

title: Perfect way to bring in the new decade
text:
I planned this trip as a dual celebration - my wife's birthday which is also on New Year's Eve I had reached out to the Concierge and the GM in advance as I have found it often helps ensure a warm welcome and sometimes also helps prevent some of the service problems that we read about form time to time at almost any property.  I was contacted by both phone and email several days prior to our arrival by the hotel manager (general manager was out on annual holiday leave) and concierge who helped arrange for flowers in our room for my wife's birthday welcome.

I have been fortunate to stay at quite a few very highly rated hotels worldwide, and I am very happy to report that our time at St Regis was perfect in every way. 

It is a grand old hotel and has been very well maintained. Agree it does not have many wide open spaces as another reviewer mentioned, but it is reflective of the era in which it was first built and provides and elegant and intimate effect.

We were warmly greeted on arrival around 1.30PM. I had planned on just dropping our bags and returning later in the afternoon, but I was very happy to learn our room was already available for check in right then.   

Front desk check in staff was friendly and efficient.  I was greeted at the front desk a few moments into the checkin process by Laurie, who gave us a brief overview of the hotel and facilities, including the restaurant and King Cole bar.  Laurie then escorted us up to our room, which I expect at fine hotels but which does not happen as often these days. 

Hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays!

We were hoping for a suite upgrade per my Bonvoy Titanium status but given that we a.) booked this fairly late in December, and b.) we were staying over New Year's eve- one of the highest demand periods of the year for most any hotel in NYC, I was not surprised we did not get a suite.  We were however upgraded to a Grand Luxe King room and it was absolutely beautiful, and one of the largest non-suite rooms we have ever stayed in for any NYC property (photo posted here in the review). 

To top off the perfect welcome to the property, the staff surprised us with a very nice plate of chocolate strawberries and a extremely generous gift of Perrier Jouet champagne, as well as two hand-written welcome/happy-birthday cards.

Butler service by Tamara (16th floor) was impeccable and we were very glad to have been able to spend a few minutes speaker with her several times over the stay.  She is warm, and wonderful and a real asset to the St Regis.  

We found room service food to be excellent, especially for a late-night meal.  

Bed was incredibly fantastic, and bathroom was very well equipped with TV-in-Mirror, large tub, separate shower, double sinks, separate toilet area, and marble top to bottom.

Doorstaff, and all other staff we encountered were all very friendly and accommodating.  The King Cole bar is much smaller than I expected but I very much liked the intimacy.  We were quite lucky to get a seat after only 5 minutes wait, but every day we did see people waiting much longer, so you should hope for the best but expect a wait.  Auston was very friendly behind the bar and look forward to our next visit to see him there at King Cole. 

I would also like to send a special thanks to Melanie in Rooms, Octavia, hotel manager, and Mr. Geray, GM, for following up with me to make sure everything was going well for us at various point in our stay.  I am a long time loyal Marriott patron, with some family ties back to the Marriott's through my grandfather and father, and it is high quality, friendly, and genuine service as we were shown at The St. Regis that will will continue to keep me loyal to the brand. 

I very much look forward to our next visit to the St Regis and would highly recommend it as a destination hotel for any special event you may have planned in NYC.

title: Wedding anniversary in November 2019
text: For many years we celebrated our wedding anniversary at Park Hyatt New York but we decided to celebrate it at St Regis New York in 2018.  We loved it so much that in 2019 we decided to go back there for our 28th Wedding Anniversary.  Our stay in 2018 was so good compared to other hotel stays and so we expected that this year's stay will regress to mean and not be so great.   However, it was actually much better than our stay in 2018. It was simply amazing.  We were given a beautiful room, most likely the best room we ever stayed at.  The front desk was so welcoming especially considering the high season of November/December in nyc.  The room service food was out of this world,    And, the biggest shining star was our butler Olivera.  She made sure that we had the best hotel stay ever.  She took care of all details, from the check in to the check out.  We have never seen someone who cares so much about her hotel guest but is also so proud to be an employee at the hotel.  We felt like we were at home and not at a hotel!   We now plan to celebrate every wedding anniversary at St Regis New York and we will always ask for Olivera to be our butler.

title: Amazing Property!
text: This is apparently the orginial or flagship St Regis, and it shows.  The property is just magnificent, the staff is incredible and service is very polished.  We booked a regular room, but were upgraded due to status to an ENORMOUS suite.  Beautifully appointed, very large, all of the little details taken care of...including the welcome basket, chocolates with the turn-down service - special attention for the needs of our 7-year old daughter.  The staff is just amazing, with complete attention to detail.  Cannot recommend enough!

title: 素晴らしいホテル
text:
同じグループのリッツ・カールトンとは天と地の差
レセプション、バトラー、ベルともにスキルレベルが高い
しかし私が待っているのに他の人を先に車に乗せて1時間以上待たされたり、短髪の女のコンシェルジュの態度が以上に悪い
バトラーボタンは機能せずバトラーはこない
朝食のアスターレストランスタッフはくってかかってくる始末
地下の美容室は汚らしいオヤジが1人いるだけでとても行きたいような場所ではない
おまけに初めて使うバッグがガッツリきづつけられた

title: Thank you guys
text:
When words are not enough to express the st Regis New York....

We can only say thank you to all the people who are working here. 
Especially the front office team. Miss Sarah and Miss Susan are wonderful persons. They are so friendly. 

The Consierge team is the most professional I ever saw. 

The boys at the door always there to help. 

The restaurant and the bar are iconic places. 

Thank you guys for everything...

title: Left the hotel with being sick and a billing puzzle
text:
The hotel is beautiful, located in a very convenient location. Most hotel employees I interacted were nice. However, I may not want to return for several reasons.
One, since we were going to stay in the hotel for a special occasion, I contacted the hotel via email about a week before my stay (the hotel never contacted me before my stay, as some other luxury hotels do to their guests). I sent email to stregisny.res@stregis.com (General) and newyork.concierge@stregis.com (Concierge), two and the only two email addresses listed in the Contact Us section of the hotel’s website. However, the hotel has never replied to me.

Two, while it’s our first stay in the hotel, I learned from my previous St. Regis stays that the brand was very proud of its “Family Traditions” program. However, throughout our stay, our little one was never given any treatment from the program, null. I just quickly checked the hotel’s website when writing this review. It says, among others, “Families will delight in special welcome amenities and turndown rituals designed to showcase the uniqueness of each hotel or resort’s destination, including delectable treats, child-sized robes, slippers, and a step stool for the little ones.” Very disappointed, particularly given that our stay included the Christmas Day!

Three, the room temperature was set at 72 in our first day, but we were waken feeling cold the next morning. I looked at the thermometer and apparently the temperature was lower than what’s set to. So that evening I raised the temperature. That didn’t improve the temperature at all, unfortunately – the next morning there was a seven degree difference between the goal and the real room temperature. I got cold because of that, and still have the running nose at this time. The low temperature itself is not a big issue. We should have contacted the hotel maintenance immediately, which might solve the issue. What made me sad was during the check-out, when I showed the agent a photo showing the seven degree difference in my room, all I received was “we will check it.” No apology was ever offered. 

There was also a billing issue. During the check-in, I was informed that as a Titanium Elite member, I was entitled two complimentary American breakfasts or the equal value for any items. I only needed to pay the extra if my order costed more than the allowance. The benefit also applied to in-room dining. We used breakfast in room in one morning, when I also ordered an additional item, smoky salmon. I was not given any bill when the food was delivered, even I asked. During the check-out, however, my bill included a close-to-$200 in room dining charge. The check-out agent didn’t seem to be professional –he first said I was only entitled to American breakfast, anything else, I had to pay. After talking to his colleague, he finally agreed that that’s a billing error, but didn’t know the amount of the allowance. After talking to his colleague again, finally he was able to deduct the allowance from the bill. The in room dining charge after deducting the allowance was more than $60, which I’m still confused and don’t think it’s right. During the entire process, I was never offered to review the in-room dining charge details. Since there as a line behind me during my check-out, I didn’t insist to ask. But I’m still puzzled and think we might be over-charged.

I heard nice words from my friends about the hotel. That’s why I chose it for a special occasion of our family. But I left the hotel with being sick and a billing puzzle. Very disappointed. Maybe I set my expectation too high. If it were a three-star hotel, it would be a good stay. But it’s not only a St. Regis but the St. Regis New York …

title: Elegant Stay in a NYC Legend
text:
Had a fantastic stay at the legendary St. Regis. What all the other reviewers have been saying was pretty much my experience. Awesome location, outstanding service, very well appointed rooms. I can easily end there really but if interested...will share a few additional thoughts...

-I didn't care for the "destination charge" of roughly $100. Sure, you could apply it to food/bevarage, dry cleaning and I think salon services so very easy to 'get your money back'. But just sort of tasteless in my opinion. 

-The hotel is 100+ years old and unfortunately their public spaces are very limited. No grand lobby here. In fact, nowhere really to even sit if you are waiting for someone. Would be awesome if the Astor Court restaurant could be moved somewhere and the existing space turned into a sitting area/extension of the King Cole Bar.

-The King Cole Bar is an institution. However, I think it needs some refurbishing. The bartender was surprisingly abrupt and as hotel guest I didn't really enjoy having to wait 25 minutes to get in. 

-Christmas decorations were disappointing. Not on par with the reputation/expectations of the St. Regis.

-Champagne sabering was great fun but wish it was slightly more ceremonial.

-Unless I missed it in the basement, very odd there was no little sundry shop.

-Our room was gorgeous/very comfortable but unfortunately it was interior and both windows looked out onto brick walls.

Despite my unfavorable observations...it was a really enjoyable stay. Especially if you are fond of "old New York'.

title: Bloody Snapper
text: Took me seven Bloody Marys to remember it was Bloody Snapper. Another three until I realized it is Red Mary. Kept ordering and eventually I read the menu... I had it all wrong all night long. But the guys at King Cole spoke my language! Thank you

title: What’s not to love!
text: Our stay was magical.  Despite the busy holiday season they proved why they’re worthy of their 5 star rating.  The location is ideal and walking distance to about everywhere you want to go this time of year.  My only knock, is the dining room needs a little improvement.  I would rate it more like 3.5 stars, still good but not at the same level as other 5 star hotels.

title: First time for everything ...
text:
First time I have ever stayed in a hotel and had to wait 30 minutes to sit down for breakfast (at 9am on a Sunday).

Non hotels guests had reserved breakfast at 9am and were seated ahead of me. Surely if the breakfast room is so small the hotel should not take external bookings!

Also check in was a farce. 

Does not feel like a 5 star hotel. More like an average Marriott.

Shame as the location is great.

title: Lovely hotel
text: This hotel is exceptional!  Starting with the perfect location all the way to the floor butler.. we had a wonderful stay.  Concierge was great giving us umbrellas when it rained and free tickets to the museum.  The beds and pillows are heavenly.  Hotel rooms are quiet and well appointed.  Butler brought us tea and coffee each morning and afternoon.  Only negative would be that our room had no view... but we did not care.  I can’t wait to go back!!

title: Disappointed as a Repeat Guest & Ambassador Elite
text:
Overall:
Was an OK/Average stay, but not interesting for more than a night or two. Look at nearby Peninsula property instead. Also have heard the Chatwal is appealing as well.

Inconsistent/disappointing service (except for Butler!), unusual room issues and nightly fee even for rewards bookings all don't add up to the usual St. Regis property expectations.

Check-In: 2.5/5 - Below Average

Room: 3/5 - Average

Location: 5/5 - Excellent

Service: 2.5/5 - Below Average

Overall: 3.25/5 - Slightly Below Average

---
Check-in:
I flew into LGA airport and arrived to the hotel around 3PM in the afternoon. I listed the arrival time in the reservation online as 3PM in hopes that I'd have a room ready before the hotel's usual check-in time of 4PM. When I arrived to the hotel, there wasn't much going on in the lobby, only a few people. I booked the Superior room on the Marriott app using Bonvoy rewards points for 3 nights (12/23 to 12/26) -- the redemption was 75K each for 1st and 2nd night, and 85K for 3rd night on Christmas. Before check-in, I noticed that the app showed me in a Grand Luxe room (two-room type upgrade from entry-level Superior room; rewards stays can only be booked into the entry-level Superior room). At check-in, the front desk asked if I have stayed before at the hotel (I have once a few months before this stay), and acknowledged my Ambassador Elite status. I tried applying 3 SNAs (Suite Night Awards), which were denied prior to check-in. The front desk agent acknowledged that my SNAs were denied but didn't give a reason as to why; The Marriott app still showed that 5 different suite types were available for sale at time of check-in. When I asked why my SNAs didn't clear, the front desk agent went into the back office and came back with the offer to upgrade me to one of the available suites (the 5th Avenue suite in particular) for an additional $1,000 per night. I declined this offer because I thought it wasn't a good value for me, considering I was originally trying to use 3 of my 10 Suite Night Awards. After I declined this offer, they said that my room wasn't yet available to check-in and told me to leave my things in the lobby and come back when they'd call me. I left my belongings checked with the front desk and they wrote my name and cell phone number on a little post-it. The front desk agent told me he'd call shortly. After walking around 5th Avenue & the neighboring area for about a hour without a phone call, I decided to walk back to the hotel and try my luck in person. By the time I arrived, a long line of guests going back to the elevator area were queued up to speak with either of the two check-in agents to get to their rooms. They promptly gave me keys and I was on my way to the room.

My main disappointment with check-in was the fact that my SNAs were denied without a reason, that even as their published top-tier elite I didn't have a room ready, & that I was offered a cash upgrade to a suite that indicated revenue management gamification (withholding upgrades and devaluing the rewards system entirely).

Don't get me wrong - I'm very appreciative of the double-room type upgrade that came with the acknowledgment of my rewards status, but the differentiation presented between my last stay as a Gold (mid-tier) and now as a Ambassador (highest tier) elite member is negligible. 

---
Room Info:

The room was very nice and well-appointed - very large, only other luxury room similar to St. Regis room size in NYC is found at the next door Peninsula. Decor was very art deco/glam/old school and really liked it; Furniture was functional and very aesthetically pleasing. Most rooms (except designer suites) stick to a mix of bold cold velour/velvets, mirrors, and gold accents. The rooms also have small control panels (one stationed next to bed and one on the desk) that allow lighting controls and temperature controls, as well as turning on privacy or housekeeping door lights (only lighting worked for me).

The A/C unit showed an error on the control panel saying it had a network fault (didn't work with the smart panels), but still could be controlled manually. The A/C control panel wasn't accurate and was about 3-4 degrees off from actual temperature. Had to set the A/C fan on HIGH and turn it down to 66 degrees to get to desired temperature of 70. (Temperatures in Fahrenheit) 

The bathroom did have significant wear and tear (see photos) & was unusually compact/small (smaller than closet). Whenever you'd take a shower, half of the bathroom floor would be flooded and there were always completely sopping towels on the floor due to this. Water pressure is very high/good, though. Plumbing for the sink had an issue where a high pitch whirring sound would start sporadically. Wallpaper falling off, visible grout/humidity issues, and such can be seen in photos as well. 

The room had two TVs -- Both rooms have a 40" (or so) basic HD Samsung TV with the usual Marriott entertainment software. Watched about 20 min of background TV on the living room TV and shut it off after getting annoyed that the audio sounded muffled and the speakers sounding blown out. Not a big deal as not much time was spent in the room (more things to do in NYC than watch TV).

The room had two phones (one cordless, the other corded) -- the cordless phone's battery was old and needed replacement -- phone call "shut off" as I was speaking.
---
Service:

Service didn't seem like a 5-star hotel, more like a normal Marriott. Front desk agents were a bit snobby, and service wasn't detail-oriented by any regard. The property seems to be a bit on the profit-maximizing side of things right now.

The $50 daily fee, which is applied to both paid and rewards bookings, is strange. You can use the fee amount toward a few different options including local museum tickets or F&B credit.

I used the F&B credit for each night - a ginger ale & one fruit plate, final bill was $50.59. 

The only exception to the less than average service -- the St. Regis butler assigned to my room block, Pavel. Pavel was amazing - I took advantage of the morning tea service twice. Pavel was very friendly and very prompt. His business card also explains that the hotel offers E-Butler service where you can email butlers; Haven't tried it, but seems interesting. 

Depends on which Butler you get if they tell you about the complimentary services - but if they don't tell you, you should know that every stay comes with free coffee/tea service before noon daily, free packing and unpacking services, and free pressing of 2 garments.
---
Location:

Excellent location - right on 5th Avenue. Proximity to shopping, Central Park & Rockefeller is very convenient. 
---
Other notes:
- A few days before my stay, I called the front desk to confirm that the Bentley house car would be available during my stay. The front desk confirmed this and let me know it just came back from service (was in the shop) and would be available. Upon arrival, no Bentley. Asked doorman, said if house car was there... and then he told me the Bentley was still in the shop. They advertise the Bentley house car everywhere, and the front desk wasn't informed well. 
- Front desk check-in area seemed very overwhelmed during usual check-in times. Agents were hurried. 
- Christmas/Holiday decorations in lobby were very nice, had gingerbread house and lights up/trees above the check-in area. 
- The front desk says tips are included with breakfast benefit at Astor Court; Not true - be sure to tip waitstaff out of pocket. 
- 22% Mandatory Gratuity for in-room dining + $8 mandatory service fee

title: Great stay over Christmas
text:
My girlfriend and I recently completed a stay at this property over Christmas and we absolutely loved it. 

We booked a Superior room and were upgraded one level due to lifetime titanium elite status. The room was well-appointed, spacious (NYC standards) and very clean. The bed was comfortable, the room (6th floor) was quiet and we slept great the whole stay. 

The location was great for what we needed. 

What really made this stay great for us was the amazing staff that we interacted with, especially the butler(s), maids and room service. Everyone was so friendly and genuine. I regret not getting their names because they should be acknowledged as they are an asset to the St. Regis NYC. 

We are already making plans to take family back for a trip in the spring.

title: Disappointed
text: Hotel was nice.  Butler service was very nice.  However, our guaranteed 4pm check in (which we should’ve had early checkin with Marriott gold status and FHR) didn’t happen until 5:15 and multiple nudgings.  Then, we were given an ADA accessible room so there was no bathtub and NO window.  We paid >$1000 per night for no window.  And no bathtub.  And a 5:15pm checkin.  Very disappointing for our Christmas holiday.

title: Issues with Service Recovery
text:
I’m a fan of St Regis New York, our last stay 2 years ago was a perfect and memorable one. So we had to return celebrating our special day.

The service is top notch as we remembered. Front desk talents Julissa, Shelomie, along with others were friendly and professional. The concierge were the best of the best, Domenic and Peter both were delightful. Their attention to details were incredible. A true embodiment of les clefs d’or! The doorman Hector and Jaime were truly friendly too. It was such a joy.

However this time we were unfortunate to encounter several issues across the housekeeping, sanity, room condition, King Cole Bar food standard and service under a short amount of time, which changed our fond memory of St Regis New York. Luckily we had the chance to meet with Jesenia who provided her genuine care and professionalism to our concern, which restored our faith in this property. 

I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the hardworking staff for delivering the high level of service here. Before leaving, I took a stroll downstairs to browse the historical collections of the hotel again. Although I am not sure if the recent sale to Qatar would results in any change, I still hold high hopes that next time we return, St Regis New York could deliver what we had the first time.

title: One of a kind, but frustrating billing issues
text:
The St. Regis is truly charming- you can feel the history throughout the property.  The hotel has a great attention to detail both in its design and customer service.  The location of the property was perfect for a visit mainly focused on Christmas attractions.  The room definitely had a luxe feel and was a comfortable place to relax.  I especially appreciated the TV integrated into the bathroom mirror, and the fruit and chocolates left in our room when we checked in.  For Marriott status, I received a one category upgrade from a Superior to a Deluxe room (I was offered a two category upgrade, but I declined due to a floor request).  For the most part, customer service was what I would expect of a 5-star property.  Julissa and Jesenia at the front desk were exceptional and made sure that anything we needed was taken care of, from check-in to check-out.  Prior to my stay, hotel employees were very responsive to inquiries about room requests and activities, and always responded in less than an hour.  The one department that could use some improvement is room service, as there were a handful of issues (an incorrect item, a forgotten item, and a billing issue post check-out).

Unfortunately, the billing issue with room service soured my impression of St. Regis a bit.  On the day I checked out, I received an updated bill from St. Regis later in the evening reflecting a room service charge from that morning not included on the initial bill from check-out.  While I did order room service that morning, the amount charged was about double what I was anticipating.  Furthermore, the remaining portion of my $50 destination fee had not been applied.  I reached out to St. Regis first thing the next morning via email, and later in the day on the phone.  Considering how responsive hotel staff was prior to my stay, the lack of help in resolving the billing issue was disappointing, to say the least.  My email was never answered by an employee of St. Regis, and instead I received an email from a corporate Marriott employee two days later stating a request was “filed” but not providing any further details. Four days later, I have yet to hear any follow-up.  When I called St. Regis about the issue, the operator just transferred me to an outsourced Corporate office who did not understand the problem.  In the meantime, the bill emailed to me from St. Regis and the bill on my Marriott account are reflecting different amounts.  Of course, my credit card was charged for the more expensive balance (the St. Regis’s emailed bill).  While my destination fee was applied in full to the Marriott copy of the bill, the room service amount is still not correct and it now shows three room service orders, when I only had two.  Needless to say, it’s incredibly frustrating when balances and charges keep changing and no one directly from St. Regis will address the issue.

title: Afternoon tea delightful!
text: Such a lovely afternoon with friends and an elegant afternoon tea. Highly recommend for people seeking out a more traditional tea service in the US. They served scones with a very nice jam and lemon curd. The tea selection was very nice (and unusual) and service was perfect! Will return for future tea time!

title: An outstanding team with great big hearts!
text: This is our second stay at The St Regis and let me just say.........I NEVER imagined the second stay would be better than our first stay BUT it was!! The team at The St Regis definitely goes way beyond even MY expectations! Being a 5 star hotel you expect a certain level of hospitality!! Well, The St Regis bypassed that level! Between the help I had booking our initial reservation with Octavia Marginean-Tahiroglu to or butler, Tamara Nisonova to Laurie Forsthoff EVERY SINGLE THING & REQUEST WAS MET MAGNIFICENTLY!!! It was a pleasure meeting Octavia upon our arrival, she was delightful, helpful, accommodating & thoughtful! Tamara was MARVELOUS!! We wanted to bring Tamara home to Ft Lauderdale with us! I can go on and on!! The bottom line is this is my NUMBER ONE hotel while visiting New York from now on!! Thank you all for such a PHENOMENAL stay!! The St Regis team was the icing on the cake for our mother/daughter get away!! MWAH!! Thank you!!! Deborah Kelljchian & Cassidy Peters

title: True landmark
text: One of the best hotels in New York, period.  The hotel is pricey but you get star treatment from the get go.  Highly recommended.  The bar is a particular treat, one to the top meeting spots in Manhattan.

title: Wonderful Grand Hotel on Fifth Avenue
text: For many years The St. Regis had a reputation for being old and stuffy - I found it to be the opposite at every turn. My first impression came when we stepped out of our taxi on arrival - the doorman/bellman opened our car door and greeted us with a big smile. New Yorkers are not known for their easy smiles - this gentleman was welcoming and gracious - I wish I could remember his name. The location is wonderful: 55th Street at Fifth Avenue - an iconic address if there ever was one - world-class shopping - and window-shopping - is right out your door. Our room was big and elegant, with comfortable and sophisticated seating scattered around - with a crystal chandelier to top off the room. This is what I think of when I think of an elegant New York City hotel room. The bathroom is big and glamorous - I loved the television set within the bathroom mirror - I like to watch the morning news while getting ready for the day. The rooms have lots of lighting options - with button panels everywhere - so one can set a mood with good lighting. The lobby is small and very elegant - The Astor Court restaurant is an elegant spot with wonderful food - and my favorite bar in midtown: The King Cole Bar: warm and elegant. Careful: the cocktail munchie tray will ruin your dinner. Or it could BE your dinner. The Maxfield Parrish Old King Cole mural over the bar is fabulous - I could sit there all day and enjoy a cocktail. I keep using the word elegant - because that's what it is. I am excited to return.

title: 高級ホテル
text:
マンハッタン5番街にあるマリオット系列の高級ホテルです。
サービスは行き届いており、部屋には専属のバトラーが配置されていて快適に滞在できました。

title: It just keeps getting better
text: Huge shout out to Christina at the front desk. Always very professional and helpful. We love the St Regis. Even though I am lifetime Platinum so I don't need to "chase it" every year in NYC the St Regis is where it is at. Service and sophistication and traction. Best Bar and Best salon!

title: 5 star hotel
text: I had a lovely time here with friends and clients. The staff is superb and the doorman is my personal favorite- Jim Sheehan (hope the spelling is correct). I come here often for lunch/work meetings and the stay was even better. We had a doorbell and personal butler and the room was very spacious for NYC. It is a bit pricey, as to be expected since it is a St. Regis, but everything was perfect. The bar in the back corner of the lobby is a personal favorite. The location is also amazing- few blocks to Central Park. You right in the heart of 5th Avenue shopping, great restaurants as well museums. A++

title: Great location and nice service, but not perfect
text: I have experienced both high and low things about this hotel. Location and Service were excellent. You can enjoy everything you want while you are staying in this hotel due to a very convenient location. The service was also great. Every staff was nice although they were very busy to serve many guests during Thanksgiving break. However, the room was not very luxurious. It was inferior than what I expected. It might be different if I stayed in a suite room. Then, my question is that " Is this suite room worth for New York city tour? " I am not sure.

title: Great location, classic rooms
text: Avoid the rooms on the inside.  The view is of the interior of the hotel.  Service is exceptional as is the location.  They don’t have coffee service in room but the butler service is quick and coffee is real.   Bathroom is huge but only one sink.

title: Absolutely Stunning
text: We have stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria and the Plaza, but for sheer elegance, the St. Regis has them both beat.  We stayed in the Astor Suite and it was amazing.  A gorgeous sitting area, beautiful wallpaper and decor, and a luxurious bathroom.  The bathroom very conveniently has a separate shower and bathtub plus a double sink.  The service was impeccable.  Upon arrival there were perhaps eight bottles of water waiting for us, and this was replenished each day.  For coffee or tea you have to call the front desk, but the coffee or tea is delivered very promptly and in an elegant fashion.  In addition, a personal butler orients you to the room and its features upon arrival, and then is available at any time for additional assistance/service.  The lobby is quite attractive and the personnel there are very helpful as well.  The Astor Court restaurant is just off the lobby.  I would recommend this hotel without hesitation, and it will be our hotel of choice whenever we are in New York.

title: Picture perfect!
text: Stayed here for a wedding of a family relative. the hotel has a very luxurious vibe. Not your ordinary hotel. They have high standards of room quality, one of the best hotel food and great service.. couldn’t have asked for more.. took pictures everywhere and ambiance was really nice.

title: WORST SERVICE AND CHECKIN EXPERIENCE
text:
NYC St. Regis has possibly the worst services of all St. Regis properties. I’d carefully avoid the manager on duty with initials AV (won’t list the full name for his sake). I’ve stayed roughly 140 nights this year in Marriott this year (which is sad), and despite being a Ambassador Elite Marriott member I’ve never been treated this poorly. Took me 30+ minutes to check in, “helping me find an upgrade room.” He then tells me there’s a deluxe room for upgrade, and when I say I will take it, he basically takes it back, saying just kidding and that it is just for 1 night. I said I am happy to take it just for 1 night, and he proceeds to say he prefers not to put me in the room if staying for 1 night. (1) How could he not even be slightly apologetic, and (2) Why would he even bring this up in the first place? At this point, we’ve been standing at the reception for 25 minutes, without them offering us to sit or without any amenities. 
He then comes out and gives me a normal standard room...no apologies. Just arrogantly says if you are not happy with this stay feel free to cancel and we’ll charge you for the night for late cancellation. WHO SAYS THIS TO A GUEST, let alone an Ambassador??? This guy really do need to learn how to treat people better. I honestly felt so offended I was about to leave for another hotel and pay for the cancellation. 
When heading for the elevator, still no word or even slightest sense of apologies for making us wait out to dry. 
Admittedly I’m staying at a corporate rate where it restricts upgrades, but that said no one should be treated like this, especially if it’s St. Regis that prides itself with service, especially with an Ambassador. 
Would give this 0/5 stars if there is an option.

title: Family/work visit
text: Wonderful work/family trip. Didn’t get an upgrade but life goes on. An oasis in the middle of New York. We were very pleased with our stay and very happy with our decision to spend 5 nights here with my family. Convenient location to so many interesting spots in the city. We look forward to our return.

title: Beautiful and Elgance hotel, but HATE Shower/Tub combo
text:
Upon my arrival, I was looking for a doorman because there are stairs to enter the hotel.  My right knee is injured, so I was not able to carry my luggage up the stairs.  I had to look around for 5 minutes before I walked up to someone that appeared to work there and asked if this was the entrance.  He took my luggage upstairs.   The check-in process was a little confusing at first because I was not sure where to go or who could help.  It was busy and hectic.   One of the ladies at the guest services helped me, sorry I can’t remember her name, she was friendly and helpful.  She did a great job of explaining the amenities the hotel offered, along with my benefits from reserving using Amex FHR. 
I was able to check-in early.  I requested/asked if my room had a walk-in shower.  She checked and said yes, but the room did not.  It was a shower/tub combo.
