I did not raise a fuss because she mentioned the hotel was full and she was not able to offer me an upgrade (a benefit for Amex FHR).  I reviewed their website and the pictures displayed the shower/tub combo for the room I chose.   It was an oversite on my part.  I will never give a “So call” luxury hotel five stars that does not have a sperate shower and tub.  For the price you paid for this room, it is unacceptable not to have a walk-in shower.   It was hard for me to get in and out of the tub, I was afraid I would fall.  Using the handheld showerhead also made a mess and had water on the floor. For this along, I would not stay at this hotel again, unless I had a walk-in shower. 
A few other things to be mindful of, the butler service is ok, but we did not like having to call then wait for the butler to be paged and call me back.   We waited over 30 minutes for ice.   Also, there was an issue with the water backing up in the sink (rm 1829).  If you use one sink the other would back up, it was gross at times.  Most of the staff never spoke to us.  It was only one person after coming back from a basketball game that said have a good night, other then that we were never greeted.  If you reserve using Amex FHR, the bunch is not included as breakfast, we learned an expensive lesson.   
I will finish with the positives.   The food was amazing in the Astor Court.  The drinks were great in The King Cole’s bar.    It was busy at the bar Saturday around 5:30pm, but the hostess did an awesome job at controlling the crowed and getting us a seat.  We ordered room service and did in-room breakfast, which was great. Again, great food.  The bed, pillows, sheets and comforter were heaven.  We slept like babies, which was great after coming in town from a weeklong business trip in Connecticut.   The water press in the shower/tub combo was excellent, I really did not like the combo.    The bath amenities, laundry services, gym, shoeshine and turndown services were top notch. 
I love New York and travel here at least 5 times a year for business and pleasure.  The city offers tons of hotels and Luxury hotels.  If you are ok with a shower/tub combo then you would have a pleasant stay at St. Regis.

title: Outstanding Five Star Hotel with Fantastic Service and Location
text: The staff of this hotel all went beyond expectations to make our stay wonderful. We especially appreciated the Bentley house car, butler service and concierge assistance.  In-room Breakfasts were memorable. This hotel represents American luxury at its best. The St. Regis is a class act in an understated and warm environment. Rooms are very comfortable with every amenity and traditional furnishings.  We hope to return soon.

title: Beautiful Hotel with Old Style Elegance and Service
text:
The rooms are lovely; very comfortable beds, gorgeous linens, luxurious bathroom with great bath products.  The level of service is exceptional whether it be at the front desk, the restaurant, bar or out front with the doormen.  Everyone goes out of their way to make you feel welcome.
Despite being in the middle of NYC the hotel is very quiet.  The King Cole bar is well known and always crowded; it is not the place for a quiet drink but it is a fun stop at the end of the evening.

title: What happened to customer service! Omg! Terrible
text:
I am checking in to spend a night with my family at the St Regis hotel this dec 7. I am a Marriott gold preferred member and have stayed and spent a lot of money at this hotel many times. Just realized I am not going to be able to check out of my room till 5:30 and they want to charge me $1100 to check out a few hours late. Insane!
When I spoke to the manager Jenisa she was rude and didn’t seem to care at all. There was zero flexibility or concern for my situation. I am appalled and shocked. 
Where is the customer service and care for a repeat customer. 
Be wary!!! This hotel is headed to the dumps. To bad.

title: Front Desk Service needs Improvement
text: Booked the St. Regis for a special evening in the city with my husband using points (A LOT of them!!). Called the hotel on the way into Manhattan, as we were checking in late (after 6 pm) and hitting a lot of traffic. We were very pressed for time as we had tickets for a show and dinner beforehand. When we arrived, we were told our room was not ready! After waiting 10 minutes, they offered us a suite instead (a very special one I would add), however the prior occupants had smoked in the room and they needed to air it out. We chose not to accept the smoky suite, and was instead given half of our points back via Bonvoy. Checked our bags with the valet and was told they would be transferred to our room prior to our return from the show. When we got back to the hotel at 12 AM, our room was ready, but our bags were not transferred. So now had to wait for them to be brought up (not long but at 12 AM it was frustrating). Room was lovely, except the TV was broken and completely nonfunctional (cable connection broken). REALLY? Honestly they should have comped our whole stay.  Other notes: ample closet space (rare for NYC), nice linens, bathroom, etc in the room. Check-out and Check- in too slow for NYC and had to wait nearly 30 min for the valet to retrieve our car. All in all, would not stay here again. We prefer the service of the Four Seasons downtown.

title: An amazing stay, with exceptional service
text:
We recently stayed at the St. Regis, NYC (our first at a St. Regis) for a one night stay, on our way through New York.  We were using Marriott points so we also requested a Suite Night Award upgrade, which unfortunately was not approved. We arrived just before noon and our room would not be ready for at least an hour, so we decided to try out the King Cole bar.  While the cost of our drinks and appetizer was not cheap, the drinks were well made and the food was excellent.  As we still had some time to kill we decided to doing some shopping on 5th Avenue.
While we were out shopping the front desk called and was happy to inform us that if we didn't mind two queen beds they had an upgrade available to a Madison suite Room 1635, which I quickly accepted.  Upon arriving at our room we were happy to find an expansive suite, with two bathrooms (a his and hers) along with separate living room area.  The room came with complimentary butler service, which was provided by Olivera and Tamara, which I can give nothing but the highest of regards to.  They both made us feel welcome, and explained all the extra amenities that they and hotel provide.  We have never stayed at such a fine hotel, that made us feel both welcome, and extremely pampered. We will be hard pressed to find a hotel that will top our stay at the St. Regis!

title: Only visited for the King Cole bar
text: I look forward to the day I could actually afford to stay here. It was gorgeous inside/ out and it inspires one for a better life. Enjoyed a lovely cocktail at the King Cole bar and explored a little after.

title: Excellent Stay!!!
text: I am a Bonvoy lifetime titanium elite. It is rare to have such a wonderful hotel experience as this one was. I was advised that my suite night award was granted five nights before check-in and we were upgraded to a beautiful deluxe suite. When we arrived at 2:30pm, we were checked in by Christina, who could not have been nicer, and informative about our elite benefits. She apologized that our suite was not ready but should be at 4pm. We went to the Astor Court for a late lunch, and went back to reception at 4pm and our room was ready. We were greeted by our butler shortly after our arrival to the suite and our luggage arrived promptly as well. The suite was large, well maintained and very comfortable. The next morning we went to the Astor Court for breakfast and our server was Cesar. He had been with the St. Regis for many years and was not only an excellent server but very personable as well. The next morning when we went for breakfast and asked to be seated with him, he greeted us by name as we entered the dining room. The food at the Astor Court was very good. The hostess  Elena was very nice and helpful the entire time of our visit. We went to the King Cole Bar after a show one evening and it was packed. The manager was able to find us a couple of seats at a high top which was fine for a drink before retiring for the evening. The housekeeping was outstanding as we indicated the room was ready for cleaning when we left for our daily excursion and upon our return everything was in order and spotless. We used room service a few times after returning in the evening and we received our order in 20-25 minutes as indicated and the hot foods were hot and the cold were cold. Finally, we wanted to thank two front door men, Greg and Lenny. The day we left was Veteran's Day (we truly thank each and everyone of our veteran's who sacrificed for us and our families, god bless you!). Since the President was in town to give a speech there were secret service, NYC police, barricades, etc everywhere and the street in front of the hotel was closed due to the President leaving to give a speech. These gentlemen were very helpful in advising us where to go to pick up our car and would have taken our luggage wherever we needed if we asked. Overall the level of service, the quality of the accommodations and dining were excellent. We could not have asked for a better five night stay!

title: Un tuffo nel passato
text: Abbiamo voluto soggiornare in questo hotel che gli amici ci avevano descritto come "unico". Le nostra aspettative non sono state deluse perchè abbiamo trovato quella atmosfera romantica di un tempo passato che cercavamo. Anche se non si trova lo sfarzo di alcuni storici hotel europei considero buono l'arredamento delle stanze e ottima la colazione. Davanti all'ingresso sostano sempre troppe auto in attesa ed i clienti all'arrivo non sono adeguatamente assistiti con i bagagli. Consiglio vivamente di soggiornarvi per alcuni giorni almeno una volta nella vita. A pochi passi dalla 5A AV, tutto è raggiungibile a piedi.

title: Flawless experience
text:
Spent just one night but already planning a return visit!
Check in was quick and I received a nice upgrade to a beautiful suite.
Hotel is well maintained, the decor is charming and all the staff were excellent.

title: Beautiful property with every luxury you need
text:
Stunning St Regis, definitely one of the must tick off if you are a Bonvoy member.  The property is tastefully decorated (a little old fashioned but that makes the charm of this place) with every amenity imaginable.  The rooms were a little more modern and very comfortable and inviting with beautiful bathrooms and the most comfortable beds.  The rooms themselves however a little small even though we had upgraded to a higher category but this is not unusual for New York.

We also gave the gym a try (mostly because it had a Peloton which was a great opportunity to give it a try) and started off most of our evenings at the King Cole Bar, would highly recommend getting some cocktails here. 

We had breakfast included and ate of the A la Carte menu which had the usual options except that portions were very big (given the normal price one would hope so!).

The staff (reception, restaurant and concierge) were very helpful and friendly and helped out with a number of requests.  The hotel also has a Bentley which can drop you off in a 10 block radius which was a nice little added benefit.  

Overall, a wonderful experience which was near perfection.

title: Perfect Luxury Hotel Stay and definitely a favourite!
text:
It was my second time back to New York and I’ve always wanted to stay in the famed St Regis and glad I did it this time!

We stayed in the Astor Suite and while I was abit skeptical looking through photos before booking ‘coz I wasn’t a fan of red interiors generally. However I was completely changed when I stepped into the room.

The suite was spacious (obviously) and definitely exuded luxury and glamour in its own way. The St Regis branding was also subtly weaves into the furniture and decor you couldn’t miss. 

Bed was extremely comfortable and it was a bonus as both of us fell ill midway during the trip and had to spend more time in the room to rest.

Butler service was prompt and wonderful. Knowing that we were ill, they remembered it even the next day and told the butler on the next shift to pay extra attention just in case we needed anything extra. That was really thoughtful and lovely. 

Bathroom was decent sized (though not the largest I’ve had for a suite) but I loved the tub and shower area. Shower pressure was strong which was important for me. 

The hotel location being next to Central Park was definitely a plus coz we had a long stroll there before we checked in as we arrived early. 

We had a quick drink at The King Cole Bar, the original birthplace of the Bloody Mary.y husband ordered some samosas as finger food and boy they were surprisingly good!

All the staff were friendly and helpful and it’s definitely somewhere I’d return to stay again! It would be my dream to try out the Dior Suite and the Bentley Suite. 

If you’re coming to New York and would like to indulge or pamper urself, you must stay in the St Regis without a doubt!

title: Timeless and Flawless
text: Spent four nights having not been to St. Regis in 10 years.  The property is simply outstanding.  From the personalized greeting of doorman thru front desk agent and luggage attendent, the check in made us feel like we had returned home.  The lobby continues to be a throwback to days gone by.  King Cole Bar was packed.  The iconic Bloody Mary is a must.  Every butler experience was outstanding.  The suite had updated lighting controls.  Housekeeping was friendly and thorough. All staff is guest centered.  The Remede bathroom amentiies were appreciaited.  Will return.

title: Old school glamour but didn’t hit expectations
text:
An old-school, iconic New York Hotel in a central location. The room was glamorous and spacious although starting to look a little tired. Aside from the room I was disappointed this hotel didn’t have more to offer.

Located on a busy intersection - the hotel was in a good location to explore NYC. Check-in was great. The porter took my luggage as I left the taxi and the girl who checked me in asked how my day was etc. I arrived at 1pm and my room was ready which I loved and she had upgraded me on account of my Bonvoy status. A great start! I was not escorted to the room but when I arrived my luggage had been delivered. 
I always knock off a point for a destination fee. They are unnecessary - especially at this caliber of hotel. If they offer such value they should be optional.

On entering this room I was impressed! It was very spacious and had an old world charm - it felt very comfortable and loved the décor. The bed was extremely comfortable (although pillows were too soft). On closer inspection the wallpaper was coming away and there were a lot of marks and scrapes on the walls. I think a hotel such as the St Regis should have constant maintenance teams - as it wouldn’t take much to tidy up the room. Also the TV was too small and an older model.

I love the perk of the butler who brought tea when I checked in and again in the morning. They were very nice! Service was great with the front desk and Butler.

I had breakfast at The Astor Court which was ok but not worth the price. The hostess’ were both a little surly so didn’t really make me feel  very welcome. I am disappointed this is the hotels only restaurant as it really is nothing special and the tables are so close together.

Overall I was underwhelmed by the amenities of this hotel. No spa, no real lobby where you can relax, one average restaurant - ok the King Cole bar was cool but that’s it.

I’m happy I’ve stayed at the Original St. Regis but I think I’ll keep trying other hotels in NYC.

title: Total perfection
text: The St Regis is absolute luxury with impeccable service and without doubt the best hotel in NYC.  Our recent stay coincided with the UN and therefore was subject to some issues relating to access to the hotel and security.  The St Regis staff were very accommodating and we were ecstatic to receive an upgrade to a beautiful suite to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The room was luxurious, spacious and very comfortable.  All the staff were professional and welcoming, from front desk to bar and restaurant staff, the butler and housekeeping. The welcome Champagne and chocolate coated strawberries made for a warm welcome after a long flight. The evening Champagne sabering provided an opportunity to not only have free French Champagne, but mingle with interesting guests staying in the hotel. The location was perfect and we couldn't have asked for a better hotel for our stay in New York. The St Regis is exceptional on all fronts.

title: There is no better hotel in NYC
text:
My wife and I staycation here 3-6 times a year

The regis is a level above every other hotel in NYC a true luxury experience

Check in is always smooth and inviting. 

Rooms are large for NYC and beautiful  

Beds are comfortable. So comfortable I own the bedding 

There’s butler service. They will bring you free French pressed coffee (tip your butler) they will also unpack your bags and iron items for you (2 a day are free)

There’s always fresh fruit and chocolates in the room

The king Cole bar is great people watching 

There’s a house car (a Bentley) that will drive you to Times Square or anywhere within 10 blocks (tip your driver)

Checkout is easy. We drive in so we call down for our car. Check out on the app and valet always has our car ready to go

If you haven’t stayed here and find the opportunity to make sure you do. It’s an experience that will spoil you forever

title: After 25 years, this is going to be my last stay
text: I was stunned at the poor level of service on this trip.  I think the clincher was that the hotel manager refused to speak with me and delegated me off to a low level customer service person who thought an $11 bottle of wine would do the trick.  I have stayed at the St. Regis at least 50 times and maybe 100 times over the last 25 years for both business and pleasure.  The location is great and it improved when they fixed it up.  But their complete lack of customer service or respect is astounding.

title: great location
text:
Great location
nice room and bathroom ( grand deluxe )
small hotel that has lots of charm 
butlers were very helpful and nice so was our filipina housekeeper
The only two issues
breakfast quality is the worst I have experienced
bread is awful , eggs were not good nor was the bircher muesli or the fruits.. tried different foods and all was really very bad quality
Most of the time calling any service was a problem as nobody would pick up the phone so had to wait for a butler to call back
But overall it s a well managed hotel , and I would return in same room category

title: Absolutely a first class experience in every way!
text: Stunning in all aspects. The room was fantastic!. We had a Grand Luxe room that was spacious and extremely well appointed. Amazing! Classic luxury all the way. The service was stellar in every way from everyone. Probably the best service from top to bottom we have ever experienced. Could not have been better. The public areas are beautiful. We also got the opportunity to have a Rolls Royce take us to dinner on our last night (they normally use a Bentley for this service but it was not available that night so they substituted the Rolls...worked out well for us!) To use this service it is on a request basis  and can not book in advance. Basically, you take your chances that the car will be available when you need it. The doorman knows where the car is and it’s ex-ected return so you can determine if it will work for you. No doubt the best St. Regis we have stayed at! Highly recommend!

title: Great Room
text: Impressed with the room and service overall. Great amenities as well as food. Reception and bell provided their best services. Location is also convenient and close proximity to some of Manhattan’s most visited spot. Not satisfied with Doormen though.

title: A Love Affair with a Rocky Beginning
text:
Full Disclosure: I'm a Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Elite and I booked this property with points ... I'm calling this year, "My Year of Points" ;).  I have friends that stay at the St. Regis in NYC and Aspen several times each year and decided that it would be good to try. 

I reserved connecting rooms as I was traveling with my mother and two daughters (tweens).  When we arrived (early) our room wasn't ready and we checked our bags.  My first impression wasn't great .. it's not a beautiful lobby and the greeting was not super friendly.  But we were ready to see the city and so we headed out.  I would like to add that subsequent to our first greeting every person at the hotel was incredibly gracious.

During the day I received a notice that we'd been upgraded.  When I arrived at the hotel I inquired about the connecting room and was told that in the upgraded room it wasn't a possibility.  I then requested that they remove the upgrade and just put us back into the original reservation level as connecting rooms were necessary.  At this point they informed me that that wasn't possible immediately and so we went into ONE of our future rooms as the other was "being cleaned".  I told the gentleman at the front desk that we were fine and we would simply get the second room when we returned from dinner.  When we got back the room was still not available.  Not going to lie ... we took an 8 a.m. flight and this was 9:30 p.m. and we were ready for bed.  I was already composing my scathing trip advisor review ... when they came out and had the problem solved ... and we were put in a two bedroom suite.  The room was magnificent and "interior" is usually bad, but this room was beautiful and SILENT(a rarity in any city).  I wasn't just pleased because things worked out incredibly well, but also because they just did the RIGHT THING.
Every service at the hotel was amazing.  We had lunch in Astor Court which wasn't my favorite food but the service was outstanding ... we had drinks one night in the King Cole Bar and it was a lovely experience.  Our room butler, Tamara, was kind and brought very thoughtful treats for my littles ... 

The location is incredibly convenient in midtown and I will certainly be back.

title: Best Trip Ever!!!
text:
Best Trip Ever!!  Our stay at the St Regis, NYC was amazing.  Every floor has a butler and ours was Tamara (16th floor).  She made our hotel experience so wonderful we didn't want to leave the room!  She brought us tea, coffee (french press), fruit, sweets
and snacks.  Because this trip was to celebrate a birthday, Tamara surprised us with a bottle of Champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, flowers and a beautiful note... Wow!  We attended the hotels nightly Champagne Sabering then enjoyed the hotel bar for cocktails and appetizers.  Next day after touring all day, we returned to our room only to find a beautiful tray of chocolates and bowl of fruit!  Thank you Tamara!!!   The room was gorgeous and hotels in a great location!   We'll be staying at the St Regis while visiting NYC in the future!

title: Phenomenal Service and Stay
text:
I stayed at the St. Regis for one night due to a last minute business trip.

Two days before my arrival I used Marriott's mobile app to communicate with the concierge at the St. Regis to request a reservation at Carbone for the evening of my arrival.  I was fully aware that Carbone only accepts reservations made 30 days or more in advance.  The concierge informed me that they would do their best, and they absolutely delivered.  I received confirmation later that day that I was confirmed at Carbone for the evening of my arrival. I have Domenic from the concierge to thank for making that happen.

When I arrived at the hotel, the front desk notified me that I had been upgraded to a Deluxe King room.   The room was extremely spacious, especially for New York.

Based on the exquisite service I received from the concierge, the front desk, the bell captain, the bartender, the house car chauffeur, and the butler assigned to me during my stay, I can definitively say that the St. Regis New York far exceeded my expectations and I will absolutely stay there again when I return to New York.

title: Superb
text: We splurged for our 40th Wedding Anniversary and stayed at the St. Regis - they totally make you feel like a King and Queen - Butler service - the breakfast was excellent - all worth the money - we reserved Marriott

title: 5**** Fabulous
text: Location is awesome, literally just off fifth avenue, walking distance to everything. The hotel is beautiful and the staff couldn't do enough for us. We had use of the house car which is available for all guests on a first come first served basis within 10 blocks, that was handy when a bit tired walking. The rooms are luxurious and the spotlessly clean. The beds are really comfortable. The staff were fantastic, so helpful and friendly. Would highly recommend.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Gorgeous and spacious room.  I have stayed at some newer “chic” boutique hotels last few times and found those hotels to have tiny and badly designed rooms and everything inside looked cheap (rather than chic).  Now I really prefer old school luxury hotels.  Service is amazing.  I had afternoon tea at Astor Court and it was delicious!  I’m missing the place already!  Definitely coming back again!

title: The BEST!!
text: Our stay was for a girls week-end that was planned months ago.  We were not aware that the hotel would still have United Nations dignitaries as guests.  We were treated with utmost care.  The housekeeping staff were friendly, accommodating and prompt.  Front desk answered every question.  Restaurant staff were incredible. Highly recommend enjoying breakfast and their famous Red Snapper!!

title: Wow just wow
text:
This hotel is beautiful like any other upscale hotel with great gym and restaurant however the customer service is truly the most amazing customer service I’ve ever experienced...

Their attention to details is just incomparable.... recognizing birthdays, needs and so on throughout the hotel not just front desk.

title: ⚜️ St Regis ⚜️
text: Çok keyifli idi St.Regis’te konaklamak. Tüm detaylar, konfor ve lüks çok doğru miktarlarda sunuluyor misafirlere. Her şey çok iyi düşünülmüş. Çok dinlendirici odalar. Şehrin en keyifli caddesinde, hayatın tam içinde.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Absolutely amazing and historic hotel convenient to everything. We enjoyed a suite that was classically decorated and very spacious. Food and drinks at the King Cole bar was a must and we really enjoyed the atmosphere. Loved using the hotels complimentary Rolls Royce to take us to dinner at a local steak house. The cars use is free within a ten block radius of the hotel. Great stay at a great hotel made even better by their amazing staff. Service and attention to detail by the staff was superb and they seemed to even anticipate our needs or requests and were always so helpful and friendly. All in all we enjoyed a wonderful stay at a place that felt like home with staff that felt like family.

title: Excellent Stay at The St. Regis
text:
We just finished a wonderful, 5 night stay at the St. Regis. I had planned this stay 3 months prior, as during the stay I was planning on proposing to my girlfriend. 

Service: When we finally arrived, the hotel was completely full so they weren’t able to upgrade us to a suite, however because of my titanium status and the special occasion, Suehaiti worked to get us moved over to an Astor suite for our last two nights. Further, when I told her of the special occasion, she offered me her card to help coordinate champagne after the proposal. We also interacted with the concierges for dining and tips on things to do, and everyone was extremely helpful, and down to earth - specifically Robert who went above and beyond to take several photos for us and even called ahead to the restaurant to let them know of our special occasion. However, our favorite hotel employee, our butler Tamara, really made our trip special. Tamara worked on the 16th floor, and from our multiple interactions you could tell she was proud of her 22 years at the hotel, which really came across in her service. When I told her I was planning on proposing, she helped me brainstorm a few things, like rose petals on the bed and chocolate covered strawberries with champagne. She was constantly asking if she could do anything to make our stay better, and at the end upon leaving the hotel, it felt like we were saying goodbye to family. 

Hotel hard product: While I generally would prefer modern decor in a hotel (like the Andaz Tokyo for example) I thought the hotel was very tastefully decorated. Everything was very elegant and felt fresh, without being tacky or gaudy in the least. The room felt like you had been transported back to the early 1900’s, however it had all the modern amenities ( multiple tv’s, Bluetooth Bose radio, tv in the mirrors) one could want. After sleeping in the bed for 5 nights, we are strongly considering purchasing a St. Regis bed and sheet set as they were both so great. The only thing I would change is the room didn’t really have the greatest views, however that’s understandable with the hotel’s location and historic building. 

Food: Because of my aforementioned Marriott Titanium status, we were able to order room service breakfast ($140 credit in the room or a $103 credit for breakfast if eaten in the lobby). Everything we ordered was excellent, especially the pastries and freshly squeezed orange juice. We also tried the King Cole Bar, as this is where the Bloody Mary is rumored to have been invented, however this wasn’t our favorite as it was loud and crowded, with drinks that weren’t anything special (especially for the price, a Bloody Mary will set you back $25).

Location: The hotel had an excellent location, only a few blocks south of Central Park and walking distance to several subway lines and buses. Location wise, we were pretty happy with everything.

Overall, we had an amazing stay at the St. Regis, and if we were to return we would choose this hotel again in a heartbeat.

title: Like my mother has been resurrected and is caring for me
text: I stayed at the St Regis as a guest for 2 weeks in late August to early September in 2019. I was treated as more than an honored guest the entire time by a plethora of staff. This hotel is all about Hospitality, the "H" in that word must be capitalized when the word is used to reference this hotel. Have you ever wondered what it might have been like to have stayed in a first class cabin on the Titanic - strictly in the days and nights before disaster struck? Or, perhaps you have wondered what it might be like to have a bedroom in the Dakota? Well, staying at the St Regis is about as close as you are likely to experience either.

title: Almost Perfect
text:
My family just wrapped up a wonderful six-night stay at The St. Regis New York this past month. Before I get into any more detail, I fully acknowledge that the guest rooms are in need of a renovation. They are very well maintained, but do not feel fresh or especially luxurious.

Now for the positives: Contrary to some other reviews on here, service was consistently excellent across the board, with the exception of one server at breakfast that failed to recognize our order had been lost, causing us to wait a full hour and a half for our food. Special shoutout to our butler Lynn and Javier in Astor Court, who were truly exemplary. Additionally, the concierge and bartenders we interacted with were also great.

We were provided with a double upgrade to a Deluxe King suite for our stay, which provided ample room. The second bathroom was especially useful for family members to use when getting ready. One of the greatest perks of The St. Regis is its location. The property is close to pretty much everything, and the Bentley service, which we used a few times during our stay, is a nice way to get around.

Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to return to The St. Regis again. It is truly a landmark hotel in the city, and the staff helped us feel extra special during our stay. If the hotel renovates its guest rooms, it will be the best hotel in the city.

title: Used to be my go to...
text: I come to NYC fairly regularly. At least once every few months...  for awhile St. Regis was my go to. The rooms always seemed a little bigger a little nicer...  until this last stay I just had.  Maybe I was very lucky in past stays or maybe they did some remodeling...  typically I travel for work so it was ironic the one time my wife comes that they give us the worst room ever...  I’m telling her how great the Regis is ahead of time - then we get to our “handi-room”. The design of the room was so poorly setup we barely had room to open our suitcases (room service we ordered had to give us a hand off bc they had no room to set anything down).   We had tiny hall areas to slim windows.  But what ultimately was the kicker - the bathroom.   One small sink with no counter space. The toilet right behind it. And then the amazing 3 foot shower.  Yes you heard that correct- a shower head that was 3 feet high. We had to aim it straight up to try and take a shower...  needless to say - I won’t be back anytime soon. Additionally for those thinking SPG or Marriott status matters - I’m here to tell you it doesn’t. I travel a lot and have great status with SPG... They wouldn’t move rooms for me even when I offered to pay more (and for ~$700 night there are better spots).  All they said was - “maybe we can move you to a diff room for your last night or two if something opens up”.  Check out the Four Seasons or Ritz for a similar price.

title: 뉴욕 최고의 호텔
text:
뉴욕 최고의 호텔이라고 평가한다. 직원들의 친절함과 배려 감동스러울 정도.

식사도 매우 좋았고 룸도 매우 만족했다. 다만 룸에서 소음이 들려 잘 잠들지 못했다

표현을 잘 못하겠지만 최고의 호텔이다 세인트레지스는 날 실망시키지 않았다.

title: Summer Break in the City
text:
Spent 5 nights at the St. Regis.
Great location right on 5th Ave, near all the high end shopping. 
Service staff were friendly especially at the breakfast.
Food (breakfast) was good.
I stayed in 2 interconnecting rooms deluxe.  Rooms were of a decent size for NYC.
I enjoy the butler service of St. Regis -  but coffee that was brought was not great.

The reason I gave this a 4 and not a 5 is that compared to my other St. Regis experiences. - Rome, Florence, Maldives, Abu Dhabi I felt that the original one did not live up to the services of some of the newer St. Regis around the world.

As a platinum member they gave me a late checkout till 4 PM and extended it to 530 PM.

title: Classic luxury at its best
text: We stayed there for a family visit to NY and had a wonderful time.  I did stay on points and with elite status received an upgrade to a beautiful suite.  This hotel is a historic property and you feel like you are somewhere special - a true destination property in an industry where many hotels may seem similar.  The service was perfect, the location great for midtown and Central Park, and we could not have asked for a better stay.  Having stayed at other luxury properties, the St Regis never disappoints and is in a class all its own.

title: Birthday Treat
text:
We spent the weekend at The St. Regis to celebrate my birthday.  From check in to check out, service was flawless, polished and professional yet friendly as well.  We booked through Fine Hotels and Resorts for our first night and used points for our second.  I had assumed we were going to be treated "less than" as we were using points, but I was happily incorrect.  As this was a stay cation for us, we checked in exceedingly early.  Our room wasn't ready, but as we ran our errands I received a phone call letting us know when it became available, and that a small upgrade was given to us as well.  Our room was very large for NYC, with a comfy seating area.  The furnishings and fixtures were very well thought out.  As we love to indulge in Room Service, there was ample seating for the room service table, including a folding chair that was exactly the right height for the table.  Well done!
As for the Room Service itself, dinner was prepared with high quality ingredients, arrived at the correct temperature and was very tasty.  So much so that we stayed in on our second night as well.  The clay pot curry was yummy and the naan served with it was perfectly grilled.  
I must also give credit to housekeeping.  Our room was immaculately clean and toiletries were replenished daily.
But what really set the hotel over the top was their acknowledgment of my birthday.  They had a special birthday dessert after our tea service and in our room a delicious plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of Pinot Grigio welcomed us the first evening accompanied by a hand written note.  It was extremely thoughtful and more appreciated than I can say.
Oh, and they have a fabulous selection of TV channels.  Thank you for including Bravo in the lineup!
I only have three negatives and they are minor - 1.  The breakfast from room service was not up to the same standard as dinner.  The juice, coffee and bacon were excellent, but the rest of the meal tasted like it was under a heating lamp for some time.  Also, I asked for no eggs on one of the plates but received eggs on both mornings.  Not the end of the world, except for the fact that I can't stand the smell of eggs and it permeated the rest of the items on the plate.  2.  The Astor Court does not have the old school glamour I remember.  It seems smaller and darker now, which is a shame as the remainder of the hotel is so bright and cheery.  Service though was consistent with the rest of the hotel.  3.  The Windows to our room needed to be cleaned.  Badly.
Overall however we very much enjoyed our weekend.  If you're skeptical about choosing this hotel, don't hesitate.  The location is fabulous and the hotel is an icon.

title: A Beautiful Hotel
text:
I checked out of St. Regis and couldn’t wait to review the hotel. The hotel is a gem in New York. One of the best hotels I have stayed. 100% Luxury. The staff are the best, polite, warm, helpful ready to do anything to make your stay as pleasurable as ever. 
The rooms are beautiful. We stayed in a standard room on the 18th Floor. Believe me a standard room here is a junior suite in any other hotel. We have a 24 hour butler available to make your stay memorable. The bed is son comfortable. The bathrooms are large with everything you need. The sheets are changed and laid anytime you sleep or sit. The slippers are changed everyday. You get a fruit plate daily.  
The hotel has Bentleys to take you with a 10 block radius in Manhattan. 
Then the breakfast is made to your specifications with freshly squeezed juices, all types of teas and coffees. 
I totally enjoyed my stay. Will definitely be back.

title: High tea
text: On recommendation from people to go here rather than the plaza, it is worth it. Wait staff are great and attentive. Great atmosphere and you can go to the bar after woods. Did get some other great tips from a couple of locals.

title: Amazing Hospitality Experience
text: Stayed here for 2 nights using our Starwood Account. Found it to be by far the best St Regis hotel we have experienced. From check in to checkout, the staff were all fantastic, without any pretentiousness or arrogance. A special mention to the Butler team (George and Adalberto) and the whole concierge team including Harrold and the lovely female attendant. Not to mention the night desk manager who's name I have forgotten.  Was attentive, friendly and very generous in his offerings. We spent the two nights celebrating our anniversary and could not think of a better hotel to have spent it there. The only negative was the service at the King Cole Bar- I found the sole waiter to be rude and uninterested in helping all tables. It was clear from the onset that there were tables that he would wait and attend to at the drop of a hat, and others that required the guest to ask for service. Was the only area of the whole hotel that I could be critical of! That says something about how amazing the hotel was and what a wonderful experience the St Regis NYC offers. We are already planning our next trip and can't wait to return to enjoy the classic St Regis service. Well done to senior management, you should be very proud of your establishment and its staff.

title: Highly recommend!!
text: Luxurious and upscale!!  This place definitely  makes you feel pampered!!  Beautiful property!!  The staff are very attentive!!  Great location too!!  I hope to stay again someday!!  It’s the nicest hotel I have stayed at in NYC!!

title: Warm Decadence
text: If you’re going to New York and want your hotel stay to be as upscale and friendly as possible, then head to the Saint Regis on Fifth avenue. Surrounded by upscale shopping this equally upscale hotel will greet you immediately with the most professional valet team in Manhattan. On to the front desk with a warm and friendly welcome in the most incredibly upscale lobby with a ceiling to marvel at. This hotel is a gift to Marriott Bonvoy members. Splurge with your points and you won’t be disappointed. I was fortunate to get upgraded to a “Fifth Avenue Suite” that was modern day luxury at its finest.  Professional butler to boot so why bother pressing your own clothes?! Room service is fast and professional..Kitchen is awesome with an incredible pastry chef so don’t skip dessert. If you’re looking for decadence with a warm friendly and professional staff then go ahead and pamper yourself at the Saint Regis. It won’t be your last visit.

title: Old school luxury at new age price
text:
Another weekend in NYC for a show and dinner, thought we’d splurge at the St Regis. Had great expectations but came away underwhelmed. Maybe the Marriott Bonvoy influences. 
Our suite though well appointed seemed dated. 
Public spaces are nice but not world class. 
Not in the league of the Mandarin.

title: Loved the workout room and the entire St. Regis experience
text: Jenelle was amazing. She made the workout room inviting, fun, and comfortable. The workout room had up to date equipment, cold towels!! Along with cold and room temperature waters plus fruit, newspapers, and magazines. The best breakfasts I ever had. My favorite was the french toast. The full breakfasts will fill you up till dinner time.

title: The best location, Luxury and History
text: Location is awesome, front - desk experience is a pleasure. Rooms are pristine, big, With style but modern and the showers are powerful. Breakfast at The Astor is not the best experience, too complicated and expensive, service impeccable. Room service is fast and good. Please for next time you need to have smart TV’s

title: The Best Hotel
text: My husband and I were in NYC for 5 nights for World Pride 50 and chose to cash in a boatload of Marriott Points for five nights. It was without a doubt, the finest hotel we've ever stayed. The check-in was extremely welcoming, easy and we received a requested upgrade for our stay. The room and BA was large & luxurious. While the shower and door small, the large shower head and water temperature cannot be beat. The butler service was very responsive for absolutely everything, 24 hour service, but when it came to ice, it was always delivered later than we would have liked. We even called ahead one afternoon asking for a delivery of ice to the room and it didn't come for 15 mins after we arrived. I was going to suggest they add ICE to their handy dandy APP where you can request many services without having to call, leave a msg and then get called back. Not a big deal, but we had B'way shows & dinner resys that don't wait, so that stuck in our craw a little. The breakfasts (which were included since we are Titanium Elite Marriott members) was fabulous and especially having it delivered to the room each morning was a real treat. Always on time, hot, fresh. We were able to utilize the Bentley car service just once during our 6 days there which was a real treat! Our chatty driver laughingly complained that the drivers seat of the Bentley must have been built for a Mexican because it was too small for him, hmmm? He also mentioned the Orange One without any provocation. Another hmmm.

title: As good as it gets!
text: We had a very Pleasant stay with the St. Regis this spring: Booked a Deluxe Suite for a week and got upgraded to a massive Metropolitan Suite with 2 huge bathrooms and views over the city. The location is perfect and you are close to all the good shopping and the museums. MoMA is a 3 minutes stroll away. You can walk to the Carnegie Hall and even Lincoln Center (or you can take the complimentary Bentley house car which was great). Staff was super nice and helpful. We liked our butler Leyla a lot. She was very kind and helpful and brought complimentary tea and coffee a couple of times. Room service is great, super fast and efficient. We also enjoyed breakfast at the Astor Court very much. We were originally planning to stay at the Lowell but doubt that we would have been assigned such a nice room. Only thing we missed was a proper lobby to sit while you wait for you car to arrive etc. and a swimming pool.

title: Titanium Review of the St. Regis
text:
We stayed at the St. Regis over the July 4th holiday for five nights. We used points for the entire stay. Here’s some information to let you know what to expect if you decide to stay here:

Marriott Recognition - We received an upgrade to a Deluxe Room on the 15th floor. Although the room was not a suite, it was beautiful with a sitting area and a gorgeous bathroom. We opted for the free breakfast as our welcome gift. This allowed us to order the American Breakfast (two eggs, bacon/ham, potatoes, toast, coffee and juice) off the menu for two, valued at $43 per person (we were responsible for the tip) in the hotel restaurant.

Customer Service - The customer service received at this hotel was OUTSTANDING! The bar service at the King Cole Bar was lacking on several of the visits with the exception of Angel, whose experience and attention to detail came through as the top bartender. Everyone was so attentive, accommodating, and kind. Jose was excellent checking us in, concierge services were amazing (they were able to get us reservations at Tiffany’s Blue Box Restaurant), service at breakfast each morning was flawless (thank you Mohammad), and maid service was quick and impeccable. The hotel service we received was some of the best ever!

The $50 Additional Daily Fee - We found it odd that this fee is added to your daily rate, but enjoyed the amenities that came along with it. We used the $50 non-accumulating daily food and drink credit at the King Cole Bar (which amounted to two drinks). The bar service was spotty, but the beautiful atmosphere made up for it. We used the daily $20 laundry credit, which amounted to one piece of clothing dry cleaned. We also used the two free daily tickets to the Met. Unfortunately, the MOMA is currently closed for renovation through October 2019. 

Overall, our experience at the St. Regis was world class. It was one of the best hotel stays we have ever enjoyed in NYC. We highly recommend the hotel and thank you all who made our stay so enjoyable!

title: Best of the Best since 1904
text: If your into top line service , rooms , food and o comic establishments this is the place. Had 4 nights here and service especially the butler service excellent. Breakfast in room every morning. Couple deliveries to our Desiree’s location In the it Rolls Royce. Last minute hard to get in dinner reservations. And don’t forget the King Cole Bar where the Bloody Mary was invented. Must Visit in NY.

title: Add it to your bucket-list
text: We stayed there for a wedding at the hotel. The entire stay was a wonderful experience. From great services, excellent food, a great bar to the rides in the 2017 Bentley. The room and service were up to the cost of the room. Location is best.

title: Old-School Luxury
text:
We spent five wonderful nights at the St Regis.
Everything was great.  The doormen were very helpful and very friendly, the lady who checked us in was very nice and she even waived the daily destination fee because we had booked so many months ago.
The concierge was helpful with directions, change for a twenty, or an extra piece of chocolate.
The butlers were outstanding.  They always came so quickly when we would request coffee, and were very nice.
When we ordered room service, it was fast, hot, and delicious.
The room itself was lovely.  Very comfy bed, comfortable furniture in the sitting area, nice TVs, very nice bathroom with a big tub and excellent shower.
Personally, I could do without the tub, if it meant a bigger shower, but the shower was plenty big, and had great water pressure.  The TV in the mirror was a nice touch, especially when watching the NBA finals in our room.
Biggest complaint about the room was the lack of windows.  Only one window, with no real view.  We could see people in the kitchen across the way (3rd floor).
On the other hand, our room was very quiet.
Turn down service was nice, with new slippers every night.  Oh, and there were those yummy chocolates - dark and milk chocolate.  And fresh fruit and bottled water daily.
We ate at the restaurant twice, and it was very good, although not inexpensive.
We had drinks and sliders in the bar on our final day.  Also quite good.
We took the Bentley to the Colbert Show one night.  Very nice.
We were able to walk to the corner to see the Puerto Rico Day Parade, which was a lot of fun.  Plenty of shopping in walking distance, as well.  
MoMA was just a few blocks away.  This is really an excellent location for a New York vacation.
I would gladly stay here again, and would recommend to anyone.

title: I don’t understand some of the negative reviews
text: We stay at the St Regis at least four plus weeks a year, and have for many years. One review complained the upgrade to a suite didn’t accomdate 4 people. Yet the one bedroom suite only has a king bed and no rollout couch. It really only accomodates two people, as it should. For four guests one needs a two bedroom suite. In regard to a french press versus a Kuerig, live a little. Maybe what is happening is that when people use their upgrades (now more frequesnt because of the Marriott merger) for a suite they don’t understand the amenities - the suites are not set up for numerous guests. I have stayed at the other mentioned hotels and for service and comfort nothing compares to the St Regis.

title: Nightmare!
text:
We are Titanium Elite - made the reservation months ago to celebrate last day of school with our two children.  We used our Suite upgrade from Bonvoy. Received confirmation our suite upgrade was confirmed. Needless to say only 3 of us would fit in the suite - where was my 11 year old to go..... the closet? 

Arrived @ 7pm - our suite wasn’t ready - come on, 7pm?? We were told for a mere $1000 per night they could get us in a larger suite that was ready. I’ve been a very loyal Marriott member for 25 years and this is how we were treated. 

Question - where was my 11 year old going to sleep? Back and forth with front desk manager - Petro who had obviously never  taken hospitality class showed us a double room the  would accommodate our family - dark, low floor, depressing - WE LEFT THE ST. Regis and went directly to the Ritz Carlton Central Park were we felt welcome! 

To the nice intern at the Front Desk @ the St. Regis - if you want to learn how to treat A guest transfer to the Ritz!

title: Colazione al st Regis
text:
Ho problemi di allergie e in questi giorni sono attenta al cibo. 
Per non incappare in situazioni spiacevoli, faccio colazione negli hotel di lusso. 
Il servizio è ottimo. 
Il cibo eccellente. 
L'atmosfera tranquilla e rilassante. 
È vicino a casa e posso tornare con piacere. 
Il miele che mi hanno servito era di ottima qualità. Tutto benissimo. Posto consigliato.

title: Our Favorite NYC Hotel
text:
We LOVE the St. Regis NYC.  The service, the rooms/suites, room service, and attention to detail are a few of the reasons that we continue to stay at this property. The location is also very convenient for shopping, theater, dining, etc.
The hotel is elegant, while also very warm and accommodating.
We look forward to our return to the St Regis in the fall.

title: I'm a fan
text:
I had a points stay at the St Regis over Memorial Day weekend.This would be out of my price range for a cash purchase, so I'll acknowledge that up front.

It was, however, an incredibly comfortable five nights.  
Every service encounter was great - the desk, the butler, etc.

The best shower I've ever had anywhere.  Such water pressure, and always hot.
Page the butler in the morning, and they'll bring your NYT paper and tea as you get together.  I got to ride in a Bentley to Central Park West on my way to the theater at Lincoln Center. 

500 sq ft in Manhattan.  It was awesome.

title: Will Not Return
text: We received a status upgrade to an Astor Suite, which was spacious and elegant.  Aside from excellent service from concierges Krista and Domenic, the room was the only positive aspect of our stay.  Requesting service at the St Regis New York was like pulling teeth.  Our server at the bar was rude and front desk staff was not remotely welcoming.  I sustained an injury before our trip and was required to take an epsom soak 3x/day as per my treatment plan.  When I requested more bath amenities to accommodate, I was left a voicemail saying that I could purchase extra amenities at the front desk.  We had also requested drip coffee instead of french press for our second morning, as the french press on our first morning was so full sediment that we barely drank it.  They would not accommodate that request either and said it would cost extra (even though it's a cheaper item on their IRD menu).  There were several instances like this where we just felt baffled by the service at this property.  It could have been so easy for them to bring the drip coffee, or bath salts without charging extra or making us feel uncomfortable for asking.  The service was closer to that of a Best Western than a St Regis and we were happy when it was time to leave.

title: Great Service
text:
Great hotel, location, breakfast, service with butler. If you are service oriented and you love attention to detail you will love this hotel. The description of other reviewers give you a clear idea. 
We had one of the bigger King rooms with a small seating area and the room was very posh but we had a view of a wall, just a brick wall, and that took away from a glamorous NYC stay! Although our stay at the St. Regis was enjoyable I would not stay here again unless I was 100% sure I got a room with a nice view and no one can promise you that up front, unfortunately. That's why the 4 stars.

title: An excellent stay dampered by annoying billing issues
text:
The good thing first: this is an amazing hotel. They rooms staff clearly pays attention to even the smallest details.  It's comfortable, welcoming, and enjoyable.  I don't have a single complaint with the hotel or its rooms, or the quality of the food in the restaurants, room service, or the bar.

But I had to call down three times because of incorrect charges on my account.  These each took longer to resolve than they should have.  Then, after I checked out, another incorrect charged was posted (apparently a bar charge from the person who checked into my room on the day I checked out).  This constant annoyance put a damper on an otherwise very enjoyable stay.

The front desk is too small and understaffed.  When I checked in, the front desk area was chaotic with several people waiting to be checked in at the only two stations available at the hotel.  Not a great welcome to what's supposed to be a blissful luxury hotel.   

I am sure many people don't check their bills carefully and have been charged for hundreds of dollars of incorrect charges.  When staying at any hotel, and particularly when staying at a hotel that charges these rates, one should not need to be constantly on guard from being pickpocketed by the hotel.

title: 高級ホテルなのにアットホームな対応
text:
マリオットのポイント利用で6泊しました。結論から言えば、部屋などのハードもサービスもどちらもいままでNYで泊まったホテルでは一番良かったです（ただし朝食はバカラのほうがおいしかった）。
うれしかったのは冷蔵庫、電子レンジ、ネスプレッソを無料で貸し出してもらえたことです（ネスプレッソのカプレスは別料金）。バトラーさんは１フロアに１人常駐しているようでが、朝忙しい時間にはなかなかコーヒーを頼んでも持ってきてもらえなかったりしたのでネスプレッソマシンは特にうれしかったです。
又、コンシェルジュに教えてもらったレストランはすべておいしかったので感謝しています。
他のスタッフもみな感じよく対応してもらえました。

唯一残念だったのは。通販で頼んだものをホテル宛てに送って受け取ったのですがそれに５ドルほどの手数料がかかったことです。いままで数々のホテルで同じことをしていますが、手数料がかかったのは初めてで驚きました。しかも高級ホテルなのに。聞いたら契約書には書いてあるとのことでした。「No thing is free in NY]ってことなんでしょうか？

title: Wow! Just, wow!
text: Drinks and dinner at the famous St Regis in New York. Watched the traditional sabering of the champagne, and had a fantastic dinner. The history of the hotel is captured in display cabinets on a basement floor, and is worth looking at. Wonderful, friendly service, by people clearly proud of their establishment. Many thanks to Tony for his personal service, and fascinating insights into the hotel.

title: Charming
text: Best service!  Ein wahres 5 Sterne Hotel. Wunderschöne Zimmer, super Lage und ein Service, der keine Wuensche offen lässt. Butler Service auf der Etage. Breakfast a la cart, einfach fantastisch. Immer wieder gerne.

title: Nice Property, Average Staff
text:
The location, rooms, and amenities at this hotel are all very good. Although the property is obviously very old, it didn't feel that way. Being right on 5th avenue, and only a couple of blocks from Central Park was very convenient for our weekend, and the breakfast--which is served in the hotel's only restaurant--was very nice (though it wasn't amazing)...

The staff struck me as very unbecoming of a property like the St. Regis. Front desk was lifeless and seemed to care very little about guests, and butler service was extremely slow and--similarly--unenthusiastic. Shocking.

If I received this sort of lukewarm reception as a Marriott Ambassador guest, I can only imagine how casual travelers are treated. In the future, I will certainly look elsewhere for luxury in the city.

title: Very Dissapointed
text: I love the St. Regis brand and was very disappointed with this St. Regis. The hotel is outdated. Some of this is its charm, I admit but then some of it is just old and too used--such as the couch in our suite, tile in bathroom, caulking in the bathroom, etc. The elevators are small and slow. The most irritating thing is I booked specifically after calling and asking if this location had a club lounge and was told they did. Upon arrival, we learned they did not and clearly need to educate their staff. I would have booked at Ritz or JW knowing this. My husband is a Marriott Titanium elite, so when travelling with our child choose hotels with lounges for convenience. We literally paid over $30 for our daughter's kraft mac and cheese and a shirly temple. I am fine with paying a premium, but expect a premium product. So maybe homemade mac and cheese or maybe it had carrots as an appetizer to make it fun for her. Also, the house vodka was absolute. Completely horrified when I saw that on bill. I don't mind paying $25 for a martini, but again would expect at least kettle one etc. It wasn't even cold either--so not drinkable. I will say the location was great. Close to everything we went to.

title: Somewhat disappointed
text:
I have come to expect better from St. Regis.  

My wife and I came to New York City for a quick overnight getaway to celebrate my birthday.  We have stayed at several St. Regis properties in different parts of the world, and always raved about our experience, because to me a stay at St. Regis is typically an experience, not just a hotel stay.

This weekend we arrived at the hotel at 4pm, just in time for our check-in.  We were greeted by a very robotic young lady, who informed us that unfortunately our room was not ready on time, so we were told to leave our phone number, and we will be called when the room is ready.  We did have dinner reservations that evening, so we wanted to get in to our room asap to get ready, but it was fine for us to go and walk around the city for a while.

We finally got the call that our room was ready around 5:30pm, so we went back to the hotel with enough time to get ready for dinner.  When we got up to our room, the room was already turned down for the evening, which I found strange, and the view from our room was into a wall, with someone else's window. Again, this was fine.  We were here for 1 night, and barely had enough time to get ready anyway.  What I also found strange is that St. Regis prides itself in the butler service, but the butler did not stop by the room after our checkin to say hello. Also not an issue. 

The rest of the stay was uneventful.  We checked out in the morning, and left.  Nothing special, nothing special about the room, no memorable moments, no memorable interactions with the staff, no memorable service, nothing to remember or cherish about our visit.  What a strange experience for a St. Regis.

title: Grateful and Thankful Thanksgiving week
text:
In the past 20 years, I've travelled all over the world for business and have nearly 4,000 in hotels.  I've had the pleasure to stay in many beautiful properties but what makes this one stand out is the outstanding service from the entire staff.  

J. W. Marriott, Sr., the founder of Marriott had a saying that was the cornerstone of his empire.  "Take care of your people and they'll take care of the customer."  It's obvious the general manager at the St. Regis lives by this everyday through the day to day operations of his staff.  

I celebrated last Thanksgiving at this special place and look forward to another amazing vacation at the St. Regis next week.  

I highly recommend staying here at least once if you're traveling to New York.

title: Elegant in every way.
text: This experience reinforced the notion that you get what you pay for. First class in every way, from the doorman to the front desk, to the concierge, to the bellman, the wait staff and the accommodations. It is a large hotel with a boutique feel. There is so much attention to detail and making sure each guest feels special. I’d give it a 10+.

title: Wonderful hotel!
text:
I just checked out of the St Regis NYC after a three night stay. Our stay was so extraordinary!  I wish I could give this hotel 10 stars.  

Everything was perfection!  Our room was beautiful, and massive by NYC standards.  Our butler kept our room stocked with fresh fruit and water and happily brought coffee whenever I requested it, for free. 

The concierge made our visit truly exceptional.  For years I’ve wanted to have dinner at Gramercy Tavern, and as this was a last minute trip I was unable to get reservations.  I asked the concierge for his recommendations for dinner —and with one phone call he had us in to Gramercy Tavern (which was also wonderful!).  They were equally great at providing directions or assistance getting anywhere and always had a smile and were happy to help.  

Staying at the St Regis NYC has spoiled me for life. This is my new favorite hotel, and I’m looking forward to many future visits.

title: Superlative Service at Iconic Luxury Hotel in the Heart of Manhattan
text: We had heard of the Saint Regis, but had not yet stayed there on our various trips to NYC, and I decided to give it a try. Originally. my daughter and I were to stay there on the way back from London for Easter. However, I wound up having to fly to India on business, and made arrangements for my daughter to stay at the Saint Regis without me (note she is a legal adult, I am fairly confident such arrangements cannot be made for minors).  Once I realized the shift in plans would impact her stay, I immediately called the Saint Regis to make the appropriate arrangements. From the first phone call, the staff were extraordinary and helpful.  I spoke with the concierge, front desk, and then shift manager who all understood my desire to have a safe and comfortable experience for my daughter, as she would now be arriving alone. The concierge graciously helped me to arrange a car and driver to pick up my daughter from the exit of customs & immigration at JFK and bring her directly to the hotel; he went to great care to take all of her details and all of the information needed to ensure a seamless experience from airport to hotel. With her safety my number one concern, knowing a trusted hotel car and driver would provide the transportation gave me great peace of mind. The shift manager arranged for a warm welcome, and helped me get the billing straight, leaving my daughter to use her credit card for incidentals only. What we did not know is that she would arrive sick as a dog from a bug she'd caught towards the end of the London leg of the trip.  Checking in with what turned out to be a double ear infection, the Saint Regis staff leapt into action to help her recover quickly.  They sent tea, and arranged special ginger concoctions, and made sure she got swiftly into bed, while we made arrangements for a medical assessment and ensuing issuance of remedies. Throughout all the complexities of a sick youngster alone in a big city, the Saint Regis staff shone. Everyone was so nice and so kind, and very, very helpful.  24 hours laters, after a lot of ginger tea, soup, and now antibiotics, my daughter checked out feeling a world better than when she arrived.  As a parent, it's impossible not to worry about our children, no matter their age.  For my daughter to arrive so ill, and receive such wonderful treatment - all while I was on the subcontinent half a world away - was of tremendous comfort to me.  I really cannot thank the staff enough.  We will be back, and now St. Regis has made us a customer for our future visits to NYC (when hopefully everyone is fit and well!). By the way, the hotel is beautiful, the food excellent, and the rooms very comfortable too.

title: An Extraordinary Experience
text: We intentionally planned an international trip to start with a positioning flight to NYC so that we could experience the St. Regis.  It is extraordinary.  We enjoyed every aspect of our stay.  Our accommodations were excellent and the service people we came in contact with were each very helpful and friendly.  Three fun things we did “on property” were the 6pm champagne sabering, sipping a Red Snapper (aka Bloody Mary) in the bar where it was created, and taking a ride in the house car, a brand new Bentley!  It is also in a great location within short walking distance to many points of interest in midtown Manhattan.  And the frosting on the cake, the St Regis is now part of the Marriott family.  We paid for our stay with points.

title: Lovely hotel with disappointing service
text: My husband and I stayed for an overnight getaway and loved the hotel location, ambiance, amenities and our concierge was lovely however the breakfast situation was a bit of  disaster...we were actually seated after a long wait and then asked to get up from the table because they wanted to seat someone else. We tried to explain the situation to the front desk and they were extremely rude and disregarded our complaint. We would not go back.

title: Dissapointing Service for a luxury hotel
text:
Disappointing check-in experience with a poor attitude of the Front Office Manager and a poorly trained Receptionist - the whole experience was cold and inviting. After having to express my concerns in front of an audience of guests, which was terribly uncomfortable for me, the number of apologies from staff were overwhelming, All the apologies were simply not necessary if there was a warmer more welcoming and caring welcome at reception.
I was ready to walk out! I stay at St Regis properties around the world and spend 80% of life travelling and the service at St Regis was by far the worst. I will never return to this hotel.
Butler service was average at best, seemed uninterested to provide service.
Food and beverage was terribly overpriced, Service at Breakfast was extremely slow - took 20mins to get a coffee. breakfast food was ok, not the high quality I would have expected.
My final bill was overcharged and reward points were not recorded.
Every department of the is hotel has issues - except the Porters!
The overbooking of the reservations team somehow become my problem,  I don't check-in to a Hotel to have to experience the Hotels' poor reservation practices.
Assistant Manager forced to clean up the issues.

title: Melhor hotel que já fiquei na vida
text: Hotel lindo, super clássico, confortável e com uma localização incrível. Fiquei no maior quarto, que conta com dois banheiros, hidromassagem em ambos, sala e uma cama grande de casal. Quando cheguei havia um café da manhã no próprio quarto me aguardando. Foi uma experiência incrível.

title: Mr
text: It is very good hotel one of the best hotel I stayed in. Location centre of New York very nice room perfect clean modern everything was new food delicious room service very good bar service very good. I strongly recommended

title: Amazing Staff
text: Service was great.  Valet- Lenny and Pascal were on top of everything from the moment we arrived to each time we walked out the door.  Gave perfect directions to my wife's appointment, got us a car for dinner and took of all the small details. Great, front men.  Front counter staff(Jusissa, I think) was polite, friendly and upgraded us as a Amex bonus.  Room was amazing.  Miranda bought us tea and took care of all our needs and little details that helped Sarah.  She was a pleasure to work with during the stay.  Most importantly Sarah and I would like to thank Jon at the Concierge.  Jon took the time to sort out our reservation that Amex messed up.  Jon got us a reservation for a sold out restaurant on really short notice.  He also did multiply other things that truly made our stay so comfortable.  Thank you to all the staff for a wonderful stay.

title: Legendary hotel
text: A hotel with a lot of history. Definetly in my top ten of must stay hotels. Rooms could need a bit of a refurb but services are superb. Great bar with the best blood Mary I've ever tasted. Will be back for sure

title: 质量下降的可怕，中国客人慎入
text:
作为万豪终身钛金会员，过去几年在这里住感觉都很好。但这次感觉非常差
1、提前要了牙具和拖鞋，答应的很好，入住后根本没有。
2、非要四点才能入住，房间准备好了哪怕都不给
3、如前面一位客人评论，这家酒店貌似对亚裔客人有明显的歧视(而且还发生在他们的亚裔员工身上)和极度不礼貌。那位客人是问能不能让我早入住，被怼“你可以多订一天”。我是排队办完手续，被告知20分钟后四点整再来拿钥匙，通常酒店这种情况都会准备好钥匙不会让你再次排队，如果这里规则不同可以礼貌的说明，但实际上我找之前办理手续的亚裔前台问可以给我钥匙吗，得到的答复先是“我正在给这位客人办手续，请你等着”，等我等了五分钟那位客人办完后再问，又不耐烦的说“大家都在排队，请你去后面排队”，结合前面那位客人的评论，前台显然就是对亚裔客人很不想服务啊。
4、能理解没房不能提前入住，但是有房也要四点入住，同时又大量给客人推迟到4点的check out，于是该酒店就会在四点整出现入住和离店客人一起排大队的盛况。整个酒店管理不是完全业务就是以折腾客人为乐。

title: Classic Luxury
text: Front desk check in can be a challenge depending on time of arrival. The location is fantastic if you plan to be mostly in midtown otherwise stay away since traffic has gotten so bad in Ny. My suite was spectacular and was the quietest I have ever had in NY! Never got to King Cole Bar since there was a line each night to get in. They should give some preference to hotel guests.

title: Poor Treatment
text:
I received an email from the hotels reservation manager who stated that my award stay and room booked under the rate used was not eligible for suite upgrades. I have ambassador status with about 600 nights across 4 years and in those 4 years not once has a property ever sent an email that read “your rate is ineligible for suite upgrades and certain elite status benefits”. Even if it was a corporate rate I was extended the hospitality and given a welcoming effort to upgrade, at the very least. 

I cancelled the reservation with Regis and booked a room at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park under the same rate and with the same amount of reward points. Followed up with a call to ask for an upgrade and the two rooms on the same floor. Their response was “of course” and they delivered.

title: April Weekend
text: Nice visit, no issues, nice room, good location to Central Park, subway. Restaurant food very good, fresh, service excellent, New York prices!! The bar is small and tight, known for bloody Mary’s though manhattans were very good as well!

title: Several problems
text:
I am sorry to say this but the service at St. Regis NY was not what I had expected.

1. We reserved two rooms and after checking in one room, I was told to wait there for the porter would carry the suitcase to the other room. However, nobody including porters or butlers came to our room for 2 hours...We felt we were unwelcome at this hotel. Also, after moving to the second room on the different floor, I called the butler for tea. She told me she did not know I had already checked in the room. This was 5 hours after I checked in. It seems there is no communication among reception, butler and porter section.

2. We stayed there for my birthday. St. Regis kindly offered me a dessert invitation at the restaurant. However, we found the letter around 10 p.m. after we had already had dinner there. So unfortunate to miss the opportunity to celebrate the special occasion.

3. After coming back to my country, we got the invoice. We found that they charged us "honor bar" fee. We had no idea what this was so we sent an email to St. Regis directly but didn't get a reply.  We also contacted Marriott desk about this issue and were told the hotel would contact us, but it seems this will never happen...

The meals at the restaurant, the location and rooms of the hotel were excellent. Probably, I expected too much to this five star hotel. I would choose a different hotel such as Ritz-carlton and JW Marriott next time I go to NY.

title: Completely Perfect
text:
I experienced the St Regis brand for the first time this weekend, and everything was completely perfect.

The room itself was comfortably sized, absolutely beautiful, incredibly quiet, and as my wife described everything "it feels like we're staying in someone else's home."

From the flawless service from every member I encountered, to the simply wonderful breakfasts in the Astor Court, to the excellent drinks at the King Cole Bar, I'd strongly recommend anyone staying to enjoy the amenities of the property.

title: Absolute Perfection
text:
We are loyal Marriott travelers and I was very happy to find that the St. Regis is now a member of the new Bon Voy network. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the St. Regis and will be very hard pressed to stay anywhere else while in New York. While we were there, whenever anyone would ask how our stay was, I would say "absolute perfection". There was no other way to describe it. Not for the faint of wallet, but if you're looking for the best, this is it! 
- CHECK IN/ROOM... We were greeted warmly and were very happy when we were upgraded from a Superior to a Grand Luxe room. The room was ready despite checking in early! Our room on the 7th floor was huge by NYC standards and we even had two sinks in the bathroom which was nice, especially for New York. Decor was opulent. They have managed to find the perfect balance between old and new and the end result is true luxury with a modern, clean feel.  
- BUTLER SERVICE... This is the first time I've ever had my own butler and I fear it has ruined me for all future hotel stays! I believe each floor has a designated butler. They are available at the touch of a button. Our fabulous butler arrived at our room immediately upon check-in to introduce himself and offered to unpack our bags which we were thrilled to let him do as it allowed us to go to lunch after a long morning of traveling. The butler also brought French pressed coffee every morning which was a very nice touch. Lastly, our butler absolutely saved our trip when my husband realized at the 11th hour that he forgot to pack cuff links. Minutes after speaking, she arrived with not one set of cuff links, but multiple options! 
HOUSE CLEANING... room was gorgeous and clean. Turn down service was impeccable.  
CONCIERGE... great suggestions with a smile
BELLHOP/DOORMAN/CAR SERVICE... all went above and beyond. We enjoyed taking the Bentley to dinner one night. 
KING COLE BAR...we had been to the KCB for a drink before and loved it for its cool, clubby atmosphere. What a fabulous option to have just steps from the elevator. It's definitely not a secret as it was always packed! 

Thank you, St. Regis. We will be back!

title: Elegant and Regal
text:
Our room was a little on the small side but came with a Butler, who was very special and most efficient. We came up for a wedding and our clothes were wrinkled from the travel.The matter was handled faster than we requested and the hotel was booked.
As a matter of fact, usual check in is 4 PM we arrived prior to 12. They took my cell and we went to lunch. The room was ready within an hour and a half.
We went to the Armani Restaurant on 56th and Fifth. Phenomenal choice, food, ambiance, the views ( Harry Winston's & Vanderbilt's mansion) beyond words.
We saw Pretty Woman and that capped a wonderful 1st day ending  at Wolfgangs for some small plates and Martini's .
The next day was breakfast at the hotel, elegant and very mixed upscale crowd.
A league of nations; NY !!
Wonderful, people watching, then preparation for the most fantastically over done garishly cultural family wedding I've ever been to. 
A real " Jaw Dropper", had an amazing time. Got back 4 AM and still ready to go
I love NY.....for a long weekend

title: The worst SR I ever been
text:
全世界最差的瑞吉酒店，前台装逼到不行。万豪钛金卡会员，早上九点半到酒店一直到四点才给入住。我倒是无所谓，关键前台说要早点入住为什么不提前再订一晚上？从此拉黑！第一次也是最后一次！！

As a 900+ nights Hyatt globalist, very hard to understand why this hotel attitude so arrogant.

The restaurant take 30mins+ make a omelette, the taste sucks, can’t believe the latte cost 12dollars taste worse than a instant coffee machine one.

I trying confirm when the room is ready, the front desk asked me, why don’t you book a day in the front if you wanna CI earlier? 

So, this is the service as a first SR in the world.

title: Wonderful stay with my granddaughter
text: This was my second stay at the St. Regis NYC and this time I invited  my granddaughter from out-of-town. Christina, at the front desk, took care of us like Princesses! It was my granddaughter’s first visit to Manhattan and staying at the super elegant St. Regis enhanced the experience. She absolutely loved everything about the hotel - the scrumptious flax seed blueberry pancakes at breakfast, the sophisticated lunch with ambience at the King Cole bar, the perfectly prepared salmon at dinner, the luxurious baths she took at night and the specially arranged ride by doorman Matt in the Hotel mega luxury car. The entire staff was amazing as usual and I am already planning my next stay! It was like a fantasy vacation - our accommodations were heavenly. Thank you all so much and kudos to you! Ann G.

title: Dining
text: I went to the St Regis for an anniversary brunch. It was a really special occasion, or that was the intent. The home of the original bloody mary, has clearly fallen from the forefront. Countless others have replicated and improved their recipe. The other menu items were equally underwhelming and overpriced. If you are looking for fine dining, please find someplace else. This place has seen its glory days and is now just getting by. Such a shame.

title: A landmark hotel restored like new.
