text: What a surprise, it did not have the musty scent of being built in 1904!  Our suite was meticulously clean, quiet, luxurious and very comfortable.  Service was very professional and prompt.  Unfortunately, guests have to climb a few steps to the ground floor and push their way through the heavy revolving doors.  The lobby was tiny as typical of old buildings but one doorman on duty was inadequate.  Not recommended for guests with poor vision and gait disorders.

title: St.Regis Experience
text: My husband and I stayed ( this is our second visit)  at the St.Regis this weekend and had a very pleasant experience. Hotel is located steps away from the 5th avenue  shopping. Excellent service and professional staff. Drinks at the King Cole bar is a must try. Excellent breakfast service. We will be back.

title: Our favourite in NYC
text:
We stayed here in December and besides a fairly surly check-in the experience was excellent. Rooms are on the small size as you'd expect in an older hotel, yet very clean and comfortable with good service from the butlers. Bar and restaurant have great service also with high quality food and beverage offerings. One afternoon the bar was packed and the restaurant are busy and noisy and we just wanted a quiet cup of tea - the waiter quickly arranged a table in the small book shop for us to have our tea in there! Excellent response! little touches like this make for an excellent hotel.
Hotel Bentley is also really nice for a ride to Lincoln centre or a restaurant!

title: Great stay at the St Regis New York
text: We had a great time at the St. Regis New York this weekend. Celebrated my daughter’s 14 birthday in style. Spacious rooms with great decor - we stayed in the deluxe suite with excellent views of 5th Ave. The service at the 100+ year landmark is exceptional. Definitely one of the best hotels in NYC!

title: Amazing, superb and phenomenal
text:
I spent 2 days at this hotel in late February on a business trip to NY. I selected based on being one of the best Starwood properties in NY.

All in all an amazing experience. The hotel recognised Platinum Elite status, but was unable to accomodate an upgrade to a Suite. However, the room provided was more than enough. Beautifully appointed, with plenty of space and all the necessary amenities, including a bathtub and walk in shower. 

The location is very handy to Central Park, 5th Avenue and a subway stop is less than two blocks away.

The service is amazing, with concierge arranging a complimentary dessert course at a nearby steakhouse they helped book for me.

The breakfast options are excellent, although be warned the prices of most items are very high. Possibly the most expensive coffee I’ve ever had. 

The gym is very well provisioned and the equipment brand new.

The bar downstairs is very lively and a lot of fun. 

A 10/10 rating on this hotel.

title: Luxury without Pretention, I promise!
text: We came to NYC for a special birthday for just one night and chose the St Regis mainly because of its location.  From the moment our Uber pulled up to the door, we felt welcome as Jimmy greeted us at the door. At the reception, we received an upgrade to the 16th floor where Tamara warmly welcomed us off the elevator and showed us to our room. She spent time getting to know us & explained all the amenities offered by the butler service, including the Bentley parked out front for first-come-first-serve trips within a 10-block radius & fruit, coffee, tea if we wished. The room, beds, and baths were luxurious! One night was certainly not enough to take in the grandeur of this gorgeous hotel!  We loved every moment!  If you’re looking for a place for an extra special occasion, don’t think twice about staying at the St. Regis!

title: St. Regis is Divine
text: One word summarizes my birthday stay at the St. Regis: “Perfection!” Everything from the doormen to the front desk to the waiters in Astor Court was amazing; and the Butler service (3rd floor) was fantastic. I cannot thank the management and staff enough for making mine and my wife’s stay so eloquently perfect. As my wife said to me as we were leaving: “We’ve finally found our Place; from now on, we stay at the St. Regis.”

title: Top luxury in a New York City hotel
text:
It's no surprise to say the St Regis New York is a beautifully run property that is one of the best hotels NYC has to offer.  It lives in a category with only a few competitors and it's worth noting how it distinguishes itself from other properties such as the Peninsula, Mandarin, Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Plaza,etc... All these hotels have high-end rooms, fairly good attention to detail, amenities, location,etc..  So, how is the St Regis unique?

The rooms are massive  - especially for NYC standards.  And the possibility of an upgrade is likely.  High ceilings, high end electronic accoutrements, luxury bath products, perfect beds/linens, silent windows are all there.  Suites , if lucky enough, are exceptional.  One distinguished feature is a butler attendant for each floor to address all your needs which is much more efficient and personal than typically seen even at 5 star properties.    The butler quickly provided coffee, pressing, toilet products,etc in an easy manner.  All so smooth.    The fitness room was full of high end equipment and well attended and cleaned continuously on the 19th floor with a view.  The King Cole Bar - is uniquely historic.  To be there is to be romanticized by the classic NY hotel bars of the early, mid 20th century.  Truly a stand out.   The Astor Court lounge for breakfast and lunch was well serviced and delicious.  The setting was  just exquitely luxurious, but never did I feel too out of place or stuffy.  They let you be as you are - on vacation or business, enjoying the food, drink and service.  The only negative is the lack of more seating in the lobby area as compared to the other hotels.  It does have many nooks and side rooms on 2 levels which lend a historic charm , but in a fantastically luxurious, manner.  This no Palm Court, Garden Area, Time Warner mall setting.  It's fits a private, secluded luxurious visit that just happens to sit right off 5th Avenue .  The Park is viewable from higher floor windows and a 4 minute walk.  The staff overall was extremely professional.   The St Regis does not have the busy-ness of a Four Seasons or Mandarin (though it lacks a top-flight destination restaurant (just take the Bentley they drive you around in to 11 Madison,etc...) in the hotel, but that may be a positive to avoid any extra non-residential people coming in and out of the hotel.  

Bottom line - the personal nature of the very high end professional service (butler and front desk) and the layout quaintness (though the Peninsula does have a better spa/pool) makes this a perfect spot for a midtown oasis.

title: Taken my breath away...
text:
I arrived at St Regis last night after 33 hour's of travel and 3 flights... From the minute i saw the facade of the hotel (which felt more like a hollywood set than anything real life) i knew i was in for a treat. From the gorgeous girl (Shalome) at check-in, the most amazing housekeeper at turn down, to Roel the concierge, to John who just delivered my coffee with a complimentary juice and croissant....(i must have looked hungry) this place does not disappoint. i anguished over where to stay this week and at one point had reservations at 5 different hotels but i could not be happier.
Steeped in history - it was the first ever hotel built in NYC, this place feels special and did i mention the location - wow ! first stop American Girl shop, it literally was a 3 minute walk quick FaceTime with my 7 year old back in Australia before her bedtime. Then a brisk 20 minute walk to The Nomad Hotel for drinks and dinner. haven't even been here 24 hours or tasted their world famous Bloody Mary but I'm already sold! OMG and the bed linen, HEAVEN!

title: Classy Hotel
text:
We just stayed at the St. Regis this past 2 days. As my daughter puts it, “It’s the classiest hotel we have stayed” the extremely warm welcome while checking in. The line was long and we were immediately offered water while we waited. They welcomed my daughter with a nice little bag with a momento.  The butler service was amazing. The service was absolutely fabulous. The rooms were onate and the wait staff at the restaurants and front desk were top class. Truly a delightful NYC experience. Having traveled and stayed in hotels for nearly 25 years, this was one terrific experience. 
We would love to go back there the next time we are in NYC.

title: Wonderful
text: This is a beautifully restored hotel with all of the modern amenities. We stayed one evening for our anniversary. We were upgraded to a larger room that had a sitting area. For NYC the room was much larger than expected. We stay in the city every few months and I think this is the largest room we have ever had in NY. Breakfast in the morning at Astor Court was very good. The only real negative is that the bar gets very crowded at night so if you want to go relax and have a drink it may be a good idea to make a reservation. We tried to go and have a drink but there was no seating - you can sit in the restaurant but the bar looks very nice and relaxing.

title: Best NY Hotel
text: This is one of our favorite hotels in NYC.  The location is excellent, the rooms are beautiful and the service is the best. We have stayed here several times and have never been disappointed.  The food and bar are fantastic.

title: A return to classical service
text:
It is very apparent from the time you enter the lobby that the hotel has been serving customers for many, many years. If you judged the hotel merely by the lobby and the hallways you would immediately doubt your choice as the lobby is small and the common areas, while well maintained, are in need of a facelift. 
However, the rooms are another story in that they are spacious, well appointed, and comfortable. The service here is what you would expect from a hotel in this category, with attentiveness at every level. As with the vast majority of hotels in NYC they tack on a "destination" fee, which was once a "resort" fee until they understood the ridiculous nature of that term in NYC. In this case its $50, which can be used for many things including your bar bill or food bill. In other words its a price increase, much like a baggage fee and its quite annoying. The $ 50 doesn't even cover the cost of 2 cocktails. i wish they would just give the all in price like foreign hotels and be done with the irritating, hidden prices. By the way try and get a cocktail around 5 PM and you will be hard pressed t o find any room in the bar.

As mentioned the service is top shelf, the location very central and you will get a good night of sleep.

title: Another Fantastic Stay at this Iconic NYC Property.
text: The service at this hotel, hands down, beats any other hotel in New York City.  My stay was over the holidays 2018.  The hotel was completely soldout. I needed to use my Marriott Platinum Elite benefit to check out at 4pm.  Even though the hotel was sold out, they had every right to ask me to leave at 12noon, they extended the 4pm check out for my stay.  The St. Regis NYC went above and beyond.  For that, I thank you.

title: Pretty good option in NYC
text: The butler service is excellent. I cant remember our butler's name off hand (either Juan or Jose) but he did a phenomenal job in getting our items pressed and polished in a timely manner. The room was spacious with an old world charm. Would return again!

title: Afternoon Tea at the St. Regis - A civilized experience
text:
This review is for the Afternoon Tea service at the St. Regis.  

Beautiful hotel and a beautiful setting for their afternoon tea service.  The food was delicious.  The service immaculate and leisurely; this is not a rushed experience.  The music was good.  A true relaxing experience.

title: A pleasant surprise!
text: I was nervous about booking here for my husband's birthday weekend since Marriott has taken it over and another poster mentioned a back-up at check-in. But we were pleasantly surprised at the warm, professional service of everyone we encountered. Our room was lovely (and obviously an upgrade from the SPG points room even though I only have Gold status). The $60. surcharge was a bit annoying, but we had drinks by the fireplace outside the noisy King Cole bar and easily met that spend. The concierge made our reservation across the street at the Polo Lounge and we had a great table. Our butler brought us coffee in the morning and hot chocolate/warm cider was on offer in the afternoon. A very special experience!

title: Best Hotel in New York
text: It's the best of the ones where I have stayed so far. Perfect, professional service. Wonderful and beautiful suite. We also enjoyed dinner and drinks at Astor Court and Old King Cole. Thank you, St. Regis! People at the Ritz-Carlton at Central Park should learn with you guys!

title: Fin de semana new york
text:
Como siempre , el servcio de primera, la calidad de la anfitrionia unica, los detalles siempre cuidados , las camas. Sabanas almohadas la limpieza , en fin todo 
Un lugar donde uno siempre regresaria!
El restaurante muy bueno y su personal de primera tambien 
Los banos impecables! 
Por eso es lo q es este hotel!

title: Perfect for a Stay-cation
text:
My husband had meetings in city and although we live close by, we took advantage of staying at the St Regis for two nights.  The service and food were superb, and we had our own butler who pressed my husband's suit at no charge.
The Old King Cole bar is always a beautiful, fun hang out, but we ate dinner at Polo across the street.

title: Phenomenal Stay
text:
St. Regis Great service! A must stay if in New York City.

I had the joy of staying at four different St. Regis Hotels over the past five years. With this one, the staff excelled beyond any possible standard. I was there over New Year's Eve; the restaurant, fitness center, and salon were something to experience. In the salon they even serve you a cappuccino or coffee while waiting.

title: Weekend get away
text: This Hotel had all the amenities one could hope for. I especially liked it’s luxurious feel and it’s butler service. We stopped in to the Metropolitan Museum of modern Art with free tickets from the concierge.  Our breakfast was served to us in our room and it was a feast for the eyes and for the lips. We try the famous cocktail that originated there and just a warning the alcohol content is very high.

title: IF YOU ARE PLANNING A TRIP TO NEW YORK AND WANT THE BEST HOTEL
text:
If you have plans for a trip to New York and insist on staying in the BEST HOTEL, there
is the ST. REGIS, 55th and 5th avenue -- and then, there is every other hotel in Manhattan.  The Regis is Regal in every sense, service & surroundings and there is nothing they cannot provide. The rating needs at least SIX or SEVEN stars and I've been staying there since the 1930's.

title: Best stay ever
text:
My wife and I took an anniversary trip earlier this month. We knew it was a slower time in the city but got a major upgrade as a Marriott Platinum member to a big suite. From Check-In until checkout, my wife said that this was the best stay we’ve ever had anywhere (better than a few 4 Seasons, Ritz Carlton’s, etc). It was a phenomenal stay and we were able to use points.

The $50 daily destination fee actually provides a lot of value. We were able to use the tickets to MOMA (normally $25each) that afternoon as we dropped our bags off that morning we arrived. There was a $50 credit to the King Cole Bar - phenomenal bar with great drinks and apps. 

Our butler, Tamara, was a great help through our stay, delivering coffee and even surprising us with champagne to celebrate our anniversary. She also explained the butler service and how some of the switches and such operated in the room. The room was exquisite and incredibly clean and comfortable.

For breakfast, we enjoyed the option to use our platinum breakfast benefit as room service. The credit was sufficient to order most anything on the menu but we opted for the standard breakfast of eggs, bacon and pastries which was superb.

We were slightly disappointed that the complimentary Bentley car service was under repair, but were very pleasantly surprised that the 2019 Maybach was there to drive us to the train station instead.

We are already planning another trip. Thank you for a trip we will always remember.

title: Off the chart
text: This was a weekend trip to NYC and we treated ourselves to a night at this hotel. We were not disappointed. From the arrival with Patrick assisting with our bags to Julissa and Francis delivering a 5 star arrival. Samuel sharing on the ride up to our room the amenities of the hotel as well as history. To Jose and Luz our butlers the staff was amazing. The room was well appointed and spacious. We want the bedding package from this hotel. My wife loved the oversized tub. Room service was exactly that, Christen was friendly and shared about our breakfast that was fantastic. This was our best hotel experience in the last 10 years. Cannot day enough good things about this hotel.

title: Annoying....
text: My boyfriend (ambassador level spg member) used one his suite night awards for an upgrade at the St. Regis for my birthday. Obviously I was super excited! When we checked in, we were shown to a “regular” room. My boyfriend immediately said we have a suite confirmed via the app. The man who showed us to our room said “oh I’m sorry. Call down to the front desk and see what happened.”  Realizing he sounded a little obnoxious, he decided to call down and inquire about it. Like duh??? After calling the front desk, he told us there was a “glitch” in the app and it wasn’t confirmed on their end (again weird) but as soon as a suite was ready (a few hours), they would give us a call and we could switch rooms. Again, I was super excited!! Well that was more than 24 hours ago. I’ve since checked out and flew home to Chicago. Still waiting for that call! Get it together St. Regis. At the very least, a call to tell us you for whatever reason we couldn’t move to suite would of been appropriate don’t you think?

title: Great Stay, but Missing that St. Regis Service
text:
My friend and I stayed here while celebrating my birthday and her upcoming wedding. We decided to treat ourselves to a night at The St. Regis, which is the original St. Regis hotel. As a former resident of the city and a very frequent visitor, it was definitely something we were looking forward to.

Upon check-in, the double room we booked wasn’t ready yet. No big deal. We were given some drink vouchers and made our way to the bar to wait. Once our room was ready, we went upstairs and immediately walked out. It absolutely reeked of cigarette smoke. There was no way we were staying in that room. We went back down and told the front desk. Our luggage was brought back down and then we had to wait for another hour for a different room. The next room was a handicapped room. Not only did we not want to take this room away from someone who would need it, these aren’t exactly easy to be used. The toilets are way too high and the showers are even with the floor which makes the bathroom floor soaking wet. Back downstairs we went. We had to wait another hour for a king room, just so we would be sure to get a room and hope that three times would be the charm.

Our room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The butler service at the St. Regis is always a nice touch when you need coffee, tea, or pressing services.

Overall, we had a good experience. However, it did not live up to the experience we expected, nor the service I have received at other St. Regis properties internationally.

title: A great stay for NYE
text:
I booked for a three night stay for NYE. The stay was for a surprise proposal to my girlfriend and i wanted to book a stay somewhere special. The ST Regis NYC is precisely that.

Pros:
- Location is amazing. Walking distance to some of the most amazing spots in NYC.
- Staff; the butlers, front staff, bar staff, and concierge services were amazing and make the experience that much better. I let them know I was proposing and they went out of their way to make our stay that much better.
- Hotel condition; the property is classic and timeless. However, I’ve stayed at many historic properties over the years that were not maintained. None have met the level of upkeep maintained here. The result is classic luxury defined. Even the ice buckets are fancy. No detail goes unnoticed here.
- Marriott Platinum Recognition: I saved SNAs for the trip, although with the holiday I didn’t think they’d go through. I didn’t receive a suite, but did get the next best option on a high floor with a beautiful room and view of Central Park. Free breakfast perk could be used for room service. The best breakfast experience I’ve ever had at a hotel and provided an amazing value. Probably the best perk I’ve received for being platinum level and makes the loyalty to the program feel worth it!
- Romantic: all in all. This property is classy, luxury, and romantic. Perfect for special occasions. 

Concerns:
- Pricing. The upper level for both cash and points rates. The experience justified the high cost IMO. But, be prepared going into to it. Expect $25 cocktails at the bar. $45 breakfasts etc.
- Daily credit: they gave you a lot for the $50 fee. However, the confusion resulted in three different folios when trying to check out. Be sure to double check prior to checking out, because it’s just confusing. Especially if you have multiple charges for laundry, bar, restaurant, and salon daily.
- Some staff: the vast majority of staff define five star service. Professionalism defined. However, two were just plain rude and I don’t really know why. The door staff and the hostess at the restaurant. New York I guess. But, still. They were thankfully the exception though to wonderful service that the St Regis is known for.
- Updates needed: the bed was not five star level. I don’t know if we had a bad mattress or what. But, the bed was sort of hard. No topper to provide a “cloud” like five star bed. Disappointing. We probably could of asked for a topper and it been provided. But, I didn’t think of it while there. Some technology could be introduced to the property without losing the historic luxury aspect. Why no remotes for lighting and window drapes? Why aren’t the luxurious towels heated if not the floor?
- Never asked but also never saw the courtesy car. 

All in all, the property is amazing. It provided a one of a kind experience for a very special occasion and one of the best hotel stays I’ve ever had. The high cost is justified and worth it for special occasions due to the location, staff, upkeep, and luxury aspects it provides. While small improvements could be made, it is without a doubt a five star hotel and don’t hesitate to book. Recommend using the daily fee credit for pressing services as soon as you get there, grabbing a Red Snapper Bloody Mary in the bar, and room service breakfast! If you’re reading this review, you might be wondering if the hotel is worth it. It is! Do yourself a favor and go check it out.

title: Surprised at the poor management of this icon. Never again
text: Horrendous stay at St Regis NY last week. Never felt so unwelcome and discriminated. Found blood stains on the pillow after returning to hotel one afternoon and the manager's immediate reaction was it must have come from my family. Not sure what's worse - the discovery of blood at a hotel of this caliber or their dismissive response. Elitist  hotel that makes you feel it's our privilege to be walking it's hallowed floors. Wasted splurge on what I thought would be a special stay. As a platinum member with close to 100 stays a year I haven't had many negative experienced with SPG during the past 15 years ... never thought it would happen here. Even found dirty cups at the restaurant, and other mishaps that I rarely see even at a Aloft or Elements properties. I will say the Old King Cole bar was great with friendly bartenders. Skip the hotel and hit the bar.

title: The little things matter....
text: The rooms were nice and updated on par with 5 star hotels in NYC.  The main reason for the two star review was how the management handled a car service issue.  Each top shelf NY hotel has their own in house contracted car service... when I tried to point out an issue we had with our pick up from the airport the St Regis duty manager first said we don’t have control over the car service—which is partly true and partly not so true given that they certainly have leverage... secondly when I pointed out the rather oblique response they said they would investigate and upon “investigating” came back with a tepid response which did nothing to satisfy my concerns with the lapse in service.  All aspects of the clients experience are important and passing the buck on something that they in fact have some control over (the charge for the car service was on my hotel bill) was disappointing and not commensurate with what I would expect from. 5 star Manhattan hotel.

title: Oh hell!! How will anything else live up to this..?!
text:
What else can be said about the St. Regis NYC, other than that’s its PERFECT in every single way...what a stay we had!!  

We were booked into the Deluxe Suite but was advised on check in, which was smooth and efficient, that we’d been upgraded to the St. Regis Suite, which was an extravaganza and a feast for the eyes! Huge living area, separate bedroom and two bathrooms (one with a jacuzzi bath tub in) all separated by beautiful hallways. It was like an apartment. There wasn’t a crack in the paintwork or a stain on the carpets or upholstery, everything was pristine.

Our butler was lovely and brought us fresh coffee and chocolates a few moments after we got to the suite, later she brought strawberries and champagne as we were celebrating- which was a very special touch. We made regular use of the house car, which came in very handy.

On our first morning we had breakfast in the room, which was delicious! Best scrambled eggs and salmon I ever had.

We are SO glad that we decided on this hotel as the luxury hotel competition is high in NYC and there was a lot of choice. There is no other hotel in the city quite like this one and we hope to back as soon as possible.

title: Another Wonderful Time @ The St. Regis
text: Just finished another wonderful two night stay at the St. Regis.  We checked in on Christmas night and as a Platinum Elite we were given an upgrade to the Madison Suite with 2 double beds which was perfect for my family.  Our butler was attentive and everything was always clean and tidy.   We took advantage of the Platinum breakfast option and one day ordered room service and the other day ate in Astor Court.  I prefer eating in the restaurant.   The only con would be is because check-in isn’t until 4:00, the lobby gets very congested and crowded in the afternoon with people waiting for their rooms.  Other than, a wonderful experience, and we look forward to returning next year

title: Simply Amazing Mother/Daughter Evening
text:
My 11 year old and I stayed here the week before Christmas, and had the most lovely time!  As a Lifetime Marriott Platinum Premier Elite member, we booked the room on loyalty points, and also requested a suite upgrade using a "Suite Night Award".  We were assigned the "Madison Suite", which did not disappoint!  We were blown away by this majestic suite!  It featured a long hallway with a bathroom at each end.  We each had our own tub for bubble baths and TV on the "in-mirror" televisions.  A large living room with ample seating, and a bedroom fit for a queen with a gorgeous chandelier. Our butler checked in with us, and offered to unpack our suitcase, press our garments, or bring us tea/coffee.  She was very pleasant!  

The room was spotless, turndown service was nice, the chocolates, fresh fruit, water, bathrobes and slippers, cookies and milk brought by the butler were amazing.  I promptly ordered mac n cheese room service for my little lady the evening we arrived.  It came quickly, hot and set up for a queen!  Our complimentary room service "American Breakfast" (Platinum perk) in the morning exceeded our expectations.    This was the quietest NYC room we have ever stayed in, and we've been to many!   We would have loved a ride in the Bentley, however, we were going to the Beacon Theater, and that was out of their service area.  They travel 10 blocks as an FYI! 

Overall we absolutely LOVED our stay at The St. Regis, and we will definitely be back!

title: Setting the standard for the best of NYC
text:
The St Regis is simply the best hotel in nyc. I’ve recently stayed at a bunch of other wonderful hotels including the mandarin oriental, the park hyatt, and the ritz and the st Regis is simply the best. The rooms are well sized, modern and luxurious. They rooms all have drawers (something that the park Hyatt lacks); have usb charging ports, are fairly sized (the mandarin rooms are a little small) and exceptionally well located. 

Room service is a little bit expensive, but if you are an SPG platinum member, breakfast is complementary. Jon, one of the gentlemen, who brings the food is a delight in the morning. Nestor, one of the butlers from the 7th floor is incredible and always helpful. 

If you can afford it, the st Regis is simply the best nyc has to offer.

title: Luxurious stay with timelines problems
text:
The hotel is beautiful and it was a treat to stay here. I appreciated them securing our luggage for our early arrival before our room was ready and after our check-out when we wanted to use our destination charge at the hotel restaurant (Astor Court - extremely overpriced). However, there were a few problems that should not have occurred at such an expensive hotel. We had requested early check-in (elite platinum member status) and not only were we not checked in early, our room was not ready for nearly 4 hours past the normal check-in time. Therefore, we only had about an hour before we had to leave for our dinner and show. We told our butler (everyone who stays at the St. Regis has a butler) that we needed a shirt ironed beforehand (complimentary service). Well, we tried paging her when we needed to leave for our plans and received no response. The shirt was not returned in time and we had to leave without it. There was never an apology for the late check-in or the late return of the shirt. To add to this disappointment, we received a letter at our door in the morning. At first glance, I thought they were offering us 12,000 points to compensate for the inconveniences. Instead, they were asking if we would check out at noon (instead of the 4pm late check-out guaranteed to platinum elite members) in exchange for 12,000 points. We were staying at the hotel for a special occasion and already lost at least 4 hours of enjoying it on the day we checked in. We were not about to cut our vacation any shorter. 

Summary: It is a beautiful hotel, but I was very disappointed by the way it treats platinum elite members - I can't imagine how other guests are treated! These two grievances may seem small, but they were two major disappointments for our one night stay.

title: Fails at the most basic task imaginable
text:
Truly unbelievable experience... on Christmas Eve of all times. 

Apparently spending $24,000 in one year with Edition/JW/St. Regis/Ritz doesn’t earn you the dignity of actually having your reservation honored here.  No upgrade or special treatment asked for or expected—simply looking for the room I booked. 

Amateur front desk staff took 30 minutes to attempt to find a room at 6:30 pm, which is well after standard check in time. The incredibly rude, hostile “manager” Abby handled the situation incredibly poorly. She further had the audacity to act like she was doing me a favor by not downgrading me to whatever was left over.

This is not a 5-star hotel by any means. I can’t imagine how this hotel got the reputation it has... though in looking at these reviews, it seems to have taken a real nosedive this month.

This place desperately needs new staff, better inventory management, and maybe a decorator to tone down the patterns and make it look less like a garish New Jersey wedding hall.

title: Really poor for a luxury property
text:
I am writing this midway into a very unimpressive stay here.  Check in was chaotic (it took nearly a half hour to get checked in at 4:45pm, with a line of 15 people for the 4 staff members available).  Luggage was piled all over the lobby.  And for a luxury property, the amenities fall short.  No iron in the room, no coffee maker or Nespresso, no spa.  Yes you can order all of this but service is slow (>1/2 hour to get coffee) and given the rates charged, all of these amenities should be included.  

For those considering this property, I'd suggest the Peninsula across the street, which has much better service and amenities.  Both properties are somewhat dated, but the Peninsula is far superior in just about every way.

title: System glitches, poor service, and dirty rooms...
text:
Just stayed at the St. Regis New York Saturday Dec 15th and the experience was abysmal. I had high hopes since we were celebrating my wife's birthday and the St. Regis fell short in ever aspect. 

2 days prior to our stay I received an email that my SNA cleared and that's when the problems started. After receiving the email, I went into my Marriott account to attempt to see what room upgrade was granted and my reservation no longer existed. I called Marriott support and they couldn't find my reservation either. They called the St. Regis and the hotel confirmed my reservation was still on file and my SNA did clear for a Grand Suite which was an excellent surprise and would help make our celebration truly special. If only it were true.

On the day of arrival, I used the chat feature in the Marriott app to ask if/when my room would be ready and they indicated that it would not be ready before 4pm. A little disappointing, but not surprising. Upon arriving at the hotel to check-in at 3:45 that is when the true St. Regis experience began. Check-in was chaotic and slow. The receptionist seemed irritated that I was trying to check-in, spent about 5 minutes at her computer and back in the managers office before telling me the room would not be available for a while. I asked her to confirm it was a Grand Suite which she found incredulous. She went back into the manager's office another 5 minutes or so, came out and told me almost all of their guests are platinum and have already checked-in so no upgrade was available. I explained to her that this was a SNA upgrade that had already cleared and showed her the email. She took my phone back to the managers office for another 5 minutes or so and eventually the manager came out and told me it was a system glitch and no, I would not be getting any upgrade. Very disappointed, I asked them to do what they could. We would have to wait another 30 minutes or so before the room was ready, but we could wait in the lounge. We proceeded to the King Cole Lounge which had a line out the door and a 30-45 minute wait to get in. We went to the Astor Court and received the same, nothing available. We were able to find a couple of seats in the common area and got drinks which were "comped" even though we had $50 in F&B credit so I don't know why they seemed they were doing us a favor comping us our drinks. At 4:45 our room was ready so we went up to quickly change before heading out for our evening plans. The room had a half eaten fruit plate and half empty soda bottle in the refrigerator, a large mold stain on the carpet, and long strands of hair in various spots in the bathroom. Clearly it was a rush job to get the room cleaned. I was somewhat disgusted, but still trying to celebrate my wife's birthday and have a good time. We went out and had a wonderful evening in NY and returned back tot he hotel late that evening. 

In the morning, we were meeting friends for breakfast who didn't want to spend $100 for a simple breakfast at our hotel so we ate elsewhere so I can't speak to any kind of breakfast at the hotel, free or otherwise. I received my folio the day I checked out and everything seemed in order. The next day I received an updated folio with over $124 in honor bar charges which I'm still trying to get corrected. 

Overall, other than my entire experience with the St. Regis, we had a great time celebrating my wife's birthday in NY. I plan on never returning to the St. Regis, though. Their service was subpar, even for a standard hotel. The condition of the room was poor. I had to spend literally hours dealing with reservation, check-in, and billing issues. The hotel was a huge disappointment.

title: Décevant, tout sauf du luxe
text:
Certes l’hôtel est beau mais si vous voulez du luxe ce n’est pas la bonne adresse. 

À 15h30, notre chambre n’était pas prête. On nous propose d’attendre jusqu’à 16h30 pour un « upgrade ».  Nous avons attendu et nous n’avons pas été déçu. Premièrement, il n’y avait aucune attention pour célébrer notre anniversaire. Ce séjour devait être une surprise et ce fût un véritable fiasco. Ce n’est pas faute d’avoir écrit avant sur le chat de l’hôtel ou par mail, d’ailleurs les réponses aux questions dans les mails avec le service de réservation étaient incomplètes, il a fallu renvoyer un deuxième message pour avoir la réponse. Après avoir été dans plusieurs St Regis, nous avons le statut élite platinum premier, nous avons toujours eu une attention. Ici, il n’y aura aucune reconnaissance de votre statut ou votre fidélité à la marque. 

Par contre, nous avons eu le droit à un service catastrophique. La poussière se marie avec le mobilier abîmé, les chandeliers ne sont même pas droit, la literie trouée, les murs tachés, nous avons même pu trouver une serviette mouillée avec un poil en cadeau ! La serviette avait été bien pliée, vraiment très étrange pour un hotel 5 étoiles à plus de 1000 dollars la nuit. Un 2 ou 3 étoiles fait mieux. Bien sûr, une fois les commentaires fait, nous avons eu le droit à la visite d’une femme de chambre, un électricien... comment vous dire on a pas profiter de la chambre. Le butler devait venir nous présenter la chambre, on l’attend toujours, une autre personne est venu faire son travail. Clairement, à moins d’avoir de l’argent à gaspiller cet hôtel n’en vaut pas la peine. A noter qu’il y a des frais de resorts qui donne droit à un crédit sur la nourriture, des entrées au musée... encore faut il que l’on vous le dise avant de vous donner la facture finale au moment du check out. La personne a la réception était désagréable et ne voulait rien entendre. Nous avons reçu une facture avec des frais qui ne faisait absolument aucun sens. Ici, il n’y a pas moyen de discuter avec les gens de l’accueil, ils ne feront rien pour vous. Si vous êtes pas content, il y a un problème, ils vous répondront désolé on peut rien faire faut payer.

Le restaurant de l’hôtel offre un service quelconque, rien d’un hôtel de luxe, 15 minutes pour une prise de commande, c’est un peu long, surtout quand les serveurs sont sur leur téléphone ou s’amusent entre eux. Quant au homard, il était caoutchouteux. 

Un seul conseil, éviter de gaspiller votre argent et aller ailleurs. Le service et la qualité de St Regis n’est pas à cet hôtel.

title: Beautiful property with some service flaws
text:
I was so looking forward to a 3-nights birthday weekend stay at the legendary St. Regis New York and while the hype and rates certainly reflects the grandeur of the property itself, certain aspects of the service should be improved in order to better maintain the highest standards of the St. Regis brand. 

Pros:
- Check in was efficient and room was ready upon arrival even though hotel is fully sold out
- Some of the butlers really love and takes pride in their job, and it shows. Some don’t (see below)
- The property is absolutely stunning with its beautifully decorated lobby, hallways and rooms.
- Sheets are ultra soft and luxurious
- Clean room and bathroom
- Delicious breakfast

Cons:
- Location - Imagine 5th Ave in December. Yes, its beautiful, and with beauty comes a HUMONGOUS amount of tourists. It makes the already bad NYC traffic even worse especially in front and around the hotel.
- Bed - While the bed linens are absolutely divine, the bed itself needs replacing as I can clearly feel the coil on my back when sleeping or just sitting in the bed (i’m a 200lbs man)
- Bentley - While it is a nice to have the Bentley take you around 10 blocks radius, in reality, it is rarely available. Imagine a sold out hotel and 1 car in NYC traffic. Good luck! What annoys me though isn’t that, but the fact that I’ve been told by the Concierge that the car WILL be able to take us to Lincoln Center, the doorman refused to do so and instead said that the further they can go in Columbus Circle. Get your facts straight people!
- Bar - Good luck getting in King Cole Bar! There is no separate line for hotel guests and the line can be long depending on time. Also, the $25 Bloody Mary’s isn’t worth the hype (if any it just goes towards the cost to insure that famous mural)
- Room Service - Breakfast was an absolute feast! However, some miscommunication issues needs to be addressed such as asking for wheat and got multigrain, ordered a bacon cheeseburger and gotten a normal one, have to explicitly asked for iced water otherwise they don’t bring you any (like, seriously? it doesn’t cost you anything and shows that you go above and beyond, but unfortunately no such luck)
- IMPORTANT: BUTLER SERVICE - While the 2 ladies that works in the morning was delightful, unfortunately, the night butlers were terrible. They do not follow the proper standards when addressing guests (“allow me...”, e.g. one guy showed up with a fruit plate and just said “fruits” and hand it to me at the door - why not “good afternoon, allow me to place this fruit plate in your room for your to enjoy”?), nor do they go out of the way to help them (refuse to check in things, tried to refute when i said i didn’t get something). St. Regis should be ashamed to have this kind of people working of them. Working at a legendary place at this should bring absolute pride and joy, which clearly doesn’t show through the actions of these butlers. I mean, how hard is it to check on a laundry? How hard is it to send more water bottles (I asked for 6. I got 3. He said he gave me 6. He didn’t) instead of refuting?

title: Great weekend - quality hotel, location, room, staff and amenities
text: We arrived Friday afternoon and left Sunday morning but in that short visit everything about The St. Regis was exceptional. Every staff member went out of their way to make things better. Great location.

title: Disappointing
text:
We booked a two night stay at the St Regis for the first weekend of December. Upon arrival, the lobby was a complete disaster - packed with guests and at least 50-75 suitcases. It remained this way until we left on Sunday.  
The check in desk is tiny - only two people working. The woman was working hard, but the other person at the desk would disappear for at least five minutes in between helping guests (the check-in line was ~5 people long at 1:30 in the afternoon). Finally got to the front of the line, told our room wouldn't be ready until three. This was expected, as we arrived early. We tried to use our $50 credit at the bar but the line was at least 10 people long, at 2 in the afternoon on a Friday. Little did we know that would end up being the shortest line we'd see at that bar! We left to go get some lunch and almost immediately received a call that our room was ready. We had plans, so didn't get back to the hotel around 5. We waited in another super long line to get our keys, went up to our room...No suitcases. I certainly expected those would have been brought up during the almost three hours between when we got a call that our room was ready and when we returned! Our butler never stopped by our room to introduce herself, we met her the next day when we called for an iron (which was a frustrating experience - call the butler, then wait for them to call you back, then wait for the iron). 
Due to the lines at the bar being so long, we ended up using our $50 "credit" (not really a credit, since they charge you for it) to order drinks from room service. There are no wines by the glass listed in the room service menu and the waiter didn't bring a bill with our drinks, so we had literally no idea how much we had spent.
The room was really large, which was nice, but instead of taking that space to install a functional dresser, for example, the St Regis settled for putting a tiny dresser in the closet, which then meant that you couldn't hang anything long, as it would hit the top of the dresser (the rest of the closet was jammed with folded up chairs). 
The bathroom was what I would expect from a St. Regis (I'm sure it was once the height of luxury, but now it just looks dated to me), which was fine - except that the outlets in the bathroom were extremely loose. The coverings were hanging off the wall and the outlet itself moved dramatically every time I plugged in my hair dryer.
The bed and the blanket on the bed were a highlight - it was really like sleeping in a cloud! Despite that, i wouldn't return. There are way better places to stay in NYC.

title: Fantastic experience
text:
The rooms and service were great. Excellent location. We spent the weekend in NYC dining, shopping and attending Theatre. Close to everything we did. 
The only issue we had was the hotel should consider a priority line for guests to get into The King Cole lounge. We had to wait 20-30 minutes every evening to get in.

title: Spectacular
text: I have never stayed in anything so Luxurious and so amazing with all the experiences from Lifts, to Concierge to Porters to any member of staff so willing to work hard and deliver exemplary service. It was not cheap but the value was without doubt amazing for a very Special occasion. Decor to die for.

title: Excellent stay, great butler!
text: We stayed for our 28th wedding anniversary and we got upgraded to a beatiful one bedroom suite.  When we went  upstairs our butler Olivera was waiting for us in front of our room.  She made sure that our stay was perfect.  She  took care of all details and we felt like we were at home.  We travel a lot and we stay at luxury hotels 50-100 days a year, but we have never experienced this level of service. Thank you Olivera!   The next morning the new butler Emina came to our room and made sure we continued to feel like at home.  This hotel has everything, location, design, gold,excellent gym, Bentlies etc but the most shiny thing it has is its butlers. We plan on stayng there many more times.   We loved it!

title: Rewards stay - underwhelming
text:
As we were passing through New York for one night before embarking QM2 for a transatlantic crossing we decided redeem our Marriott Rewards points for a "special" stay at the St Regis. We arrived at 11.30 AM and, as it was a busy weekend (Veterans Day), our room was not ready. This was fine as were were booked for lunch elsewhere. The check-in associate told us that she would ring us before 2PM to let us know that our room was ready.  By 2.30 PM we had received no call so we went back to the hotel and were told that our room was still not ready. Other people were arriving and being allocated rooms immediately and being escorted to their rooms. Shortly after, however, we were given our room number and told that we had been allocated an upgraded room on the same higher floor as the gym. Having the room number we were able to visit the King Cole Bar to have a drink whilst waiting. After a 20 minute wait we finally obtained a very small table in a corner underneath a very cold air conditioning unit (the temperature outside was 36F so luckily we had our cold weather clothing - the experience was rather like being in an ice bar. The cocktails were just OK, nothing wonderful. Eventually (at 3.50) we received a phone call to let us know that our room was ready. Again other people were being checked in and being escorted to their rooms but we were just handed our key (to a completely different room to that which we had been allocated earlier) and directed to the lift. The room turned out to be on a much lower floor and looked into a internal well, so no view. From the pictures on the website it appears that the room we were allocated was just a standard room, so no upgrade for a Platinum Premier guest, despite the site showing availability of a number of better rooms. After a few minutes a porter arrived with our cases and quickly left - this may or may not have been the "butler" but since we never saw or heard from him again we were left wondering whether the "butler service" is not offered to guests staying on points. 
The next morning we went down to breakfast, luckily we were quickly allocated to a table and the waiter informed us that as a platinum guest we could have the "American Breakfast" as our amenity or another item from the menu up to the same dollar value. We decided on our two items (scrambled egg and eggs Benedict), were given orange juice and, as I have  caffeine allergy, I ordered peppermint tea instead of the coffee. The food was fine but the tea lacked any peppermint taste (it tasted exactly like green tea). I called the waiter who summoned another waiter who lifted the pot lid and sniffed the tea (yes he really did that) and declared that it was peppermint tea. As someone who has drunk peppermint tea every day for more than 30 years (and even blends his own) I know that this was not what it was being presented as, but at St Regis NY it appears the customer is always wrong.
We checked out at 11AM and were surprised to discover that our supposedly complimentary breakfast actually cost us over $30 (plus taxes etc) - the orange juice and (non) peppermint tea were apparently "extras". Also included was a $57 "destination charge", which I expected because of reviews on Trip Advisor - but which was not mentioned anywhere on either my booking document or my confirmation document.
After checking out we received the only piece of truly first class service that we experienced during our stay. As it was Veterans Day and there were numerous road closures, the road outside the hotel was gridlocked and there were no taxis available. We had a lot of luggage but the doormen very kindly walked us to the end of the block (more than 150 yards) and secured a taxi for us. 
Overall, we found our stay at St Regis NY to be very underwhelming, our expectations were far higher than the experience. In the past 12 months we have spent in excess of 100 nights in Starwood properties, including numerous stays at Luxury Collection properties - all of these stays delivered, or exceeded,  our expectations. It may well be that, because we were staying on points rather than cash, our expectations were too high at St Regis - but if this is the case then the hotel should publicise that this is the case so that such guests will not be disappointed.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: If you are looking for a great hotel in a great location with an excellent staff this is the place to be.  This hotel has it all: service, newly renovated rooms and most importantly a well trained, personable staff.

title: Could have been much better
text:
We came to NYC for the first time to celebrate our baby moon and we were very excited to stay at the iconic St Regis New York. 
Arriving from the Four Seasons Miami and Four Seasons Park Lane where they provided a pregnancy pillow for my wife without any problems we requested one thinking that St Regis could also provide one as well. However, they said they could only provide one at an extra cost, so we would need to pay someone from the hotel to purchase one for us. This is quite ridiculous, considering it is after all The St Regis where you pay either over 1000$ a night or the maximum awarded points charged in any Marriott/Starwood hotel.

The hotel room was very well appointed and they provided nice daily fruit, chocolates and waters. 
I would like to leave a commendation to our butlers Dolores, Pawel and Alex. They are great and they provided exceptional and sincere service throughout our stay. 

No upgrade and/or late check out was available even for Gold members. I understand this is subject to availability but if you decline a late check out request because you are at 100% at least block the same room types you are selling on the website. This way your guests don’t see that you are selling rooms for the same day and that the hotel is not expecting to be full.

Because of the daily 50$ plus tax destination fee we used a few times the dining facilities to eat. The service at the bar was disappointing twice; the waiter didn’t ask us for drinks nor did he bring bread to the table. The third time, we were served by Tharek (apologies if it’s not spelled correctly) and he made us realise that the service could actually be very good. He proactively brought water and bread and was always very attentive. Last meal we had in the restaurant was also very good (waiter called Cesario?). This of course should be the standard service for this type of hotel and restaurants where everything is overpriced - but you shouldn’t need to be lucky with your waiter. I would therefore not recommend this restaurant or bar for the amount you would pay. Staff is generally not attentive and not sincere and there is much better value in Michelin Starred restaurants nearby.

We ordered room service once and ordered a lobster roll that was priced at 32$, plus tax, plus 8$ tray charge and 22% gratuity that was “added to my convenience” making the total 50.59$. The roll was ok and came with frozen French fries. Worth 50$? Even 32$? Unfortunately not to me. 

After 5nights staying in the hotel, we received the bill where it states that we have to pay the 50$ plus tax which is 57.38$ making the tax 14.75% which seems to be the % for hotel occupancy tax. How come then we pay accommodation tax on things that we already paid tax (8.875%) such Food and Beverage, Laundry and hair salon. To add to that, shouldn’t internet be tax free as per the Internet Tax Freedom Act? Makes me wonder for what the money collected is actually used.

For the price you pay, I wouldn’t recommend staying or dining in this hotel. The product is good ( and location is as good as it gets) but they are here solely for the purpose of making money and not to provide a proper five star service.

title: Exquisite property and warm staff
text: Just took a girls weekend with my aunt to New York and stayed at the St.Regis for the first time. Everyone was so warm and friendly from the front desk staff (Trang)to the bartenders at the King Cole bar. We were treated to beautiful suites and the butler service was a first class act. Olivera and Julia were gracious and so helpful.We felt like family. I travel a lot with my job so I do appreciate excellent customer service and attention to detail which SPG--to me--did the best! I hope they will continue with that tradition now that they are a Marriott property. I would definitely stay there again!

title: Elegant Iconic NY Hotel
text:
On our recent trip to NY, we extended our stay and booked two nights at the St Regis.

This hotel, one of the “Grand Dames” of New York, is centrally located on 55th Street, between 5th and Madison.  Really couldn’t get much more convenient to everything NY including 5th avenue shopping, Times Square, the Theatre District, Rockefeller Center and more.

When we arrived (early), our room wasn’t available yet but the check in desk offered to call us when it became open.  When that time came, we were pleasantly informed we were upgraded to a suite.  So nice, after our last hotel left a lot to be desired.

The room is very generous, even by “suite” standards.  The design and furnishings are beautiful and functional (more important to me even).  There are numerous power outlets and even USB ports in many locations

The bathroom, with both a large stand-up shower as well as a tub, has two sinks and plenty of space.

Modern lighting systems are a pet peeve of mine, but the switches in the room were intuitive and even though they are electronic and not a traditional switch, were easy to understand and operate.

The king size bed was very comfortable and featured high quality linens.

The room came with a nice fruit bowl, with grapes, oranges, bananas, and several kinds of apples.  A very nice touch.  Also, for those of us less health-conscious, was a bowl filled with dark and milk chocolate squares.

Noise could not be heard from the hallway but some traffic sounds did get in (we were on the 7th floor), but nothing that caused an undue disturbance.

Service, as you’d expect, was exceptional with prompt and courteous service from staff at the front desk, concierge, and “butler”.  Only on one occasion did we have some issue contacting the buyer for coffee in the morning but was eventually resolved.

Breakfast (room service) was nice and efficient and lunch at the “Astor Court” (reviewed separately) was very nice, with excellent food for a reasonable (by NY hotel standards) price.

One gripe I do have is the appearance of a “resort fee” (they call it something else), at the St Regis.  Coming to a whopping $50 per day, it included $50 per day of F&B (not accumulative), laundry credit, local and even international telephone calls, and some other benefits.  If you would normally use these services, it may not be a bad deal, but if you don’t then it’s just another cost.  Personally, I hate these charges.  Put it in the cost of the room and don’t hide it in non-optional programs.  Despite our great stay, I will add this to the cost with no consideration of the benefits, when considering hotels for my stay next month.

Resort fees aside however, our stay at the St Regis was wonderful and real example of what a luxury hotel stay should be.

title: A New York Classic in the heart of midtown
text: The St. Regis is a New York classic, and has been a luxury hotel since its inception in 1904. The rooms are well-appointed, with all the amenities one would want. Service is excellent, from the moment you check in util your check out. Over the years, it has housed some of New York's best restaurants and the King Cole bar is legendary. Since 1965 it has been part of Sheraton Hotels and since 2006, some of the floors have been converted into residences. In 2013, the entire hotel was renovated, including a new restaurant and gym. Catering through the hotel is excellent for meetings.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: I can't say enough great things about this hotel.  Our room (Grand Suite) was beautiful and spacious, service was awesome and the breakfast both days was perfect!  I loved the location, very close to all shops on 5th avenue and Central Park too.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone that wants a beautiful place to stay in the city.

title: Nice, but not worth the money
text: We just spent two nights at the St. Regis. Honestly, everything was fine and I have no real complaints, but for what we spent I would have expected to be completely bowled over. The bathroom is very dated — the tub must date to the ‘60’s and there is virtually no counter space. Also, the molding around the tub has a lot of rot on it. Not the end of the world, but at $1,300+ a night, it was surprising to see. We had a drink at the storied King Cole Bar, where I’d been probably 15 years ago. Back then I’d found it very romantic, but this time around it seemed cramped and touristy. If you want a very central location and don’t mind spending a lot, this is the ticket. If you don’t mind being a little further away from the crowds, try the Ritz at Central Park or the Four Seasons. I’ve stayed at both and can attest that the rooms are more up to date.

title: Great hotel, but not as luxurious as expected
text:
We just completed a two night stay at the St. Regis and this is a very nice hotel, but I can't justify giving them any higher than an average rating because of its price point. It is one of the most expensive hotels in NYC, but I can't say there was anything that could justify its price. The butler service was nice, but not necessary. We expected the hotel entrance to be staffed at all times, especially at this price, but most of the time, we had to turn the doors ourselves. Not a big deal, but we certainly thought it would be staffed at all times. The other issue we had was with room service. We ordered the Fifth Avenue breakfast and according to the menu, it was supposed to have come with mixed berries, but there was no fruit on the plate. Any other hotel, this would not have been a big deal, but truly shocking for a hotel of this class to miss something like that. 

Again, nothing at this hotel was bad, but for this price point and being a St. Regis, we expected more. Perhaps our expectations were too high, but then again, it is a little embarrassing for a hotel of this caliber to mess up our breakfast order. We didn't raise the issue with the hotel because we were in a hurry to check out.

title: AMAZING 5 Star Stay
text: We just returned from a stay at the St. Regis in NYC. We checked in Saturday and we had to wait a lot long than expected. We had booked a standard room but were upgraded to a "Grande Suite" (We are Platinum Premiere Members). The sweet was absolutely amazing. The living room was huge, the bathroom was luxurious. Our butlers were amazing, even throughout the night. The Old King Cole bar was amazing, service was great. I can't say anything negative about our stay. We really enjoyed ourselves and can't wait to return!!

title: Perfect Stay!
text: This property does everything they say they're going to do.  Beautiful rooms, extremely clean, ninja butler service, outstanding bar and restaurant......and service above and beyond!  And a free Bentley!

title: Wonderful, but.......
text:
Probably been her 5 times. As a Starwood Platinum, we have been treated very, very well.  This time the place is packed and we could not get a suite upgrade but the Grand Deluxe room is spacious and wonderful. The staff is professional and congenial.  The breakfasts? Thank goodness I get free breakfast as all items here are very expensive tho the service is top notch, the presentation is wonderful and the setting is wonderful.

But----- needed to print two pages today for personal business. So while I have free internet, I went to the Business Center.  Took forever to sign on, only to discover that use of the hotel computers cost $7 PLUS the per page cost for the printing.  I have traveled the world. I have stayed in some spectacular hotels.  I have NEVER been charged to use the Business Center - EVER.  I guess you can tell that I am incredulous. The room we are in goes for $1350/night.  Yes, I'm on points but no one in the Business Center knew that. And imagine paying that much and being fleeced for $7 measly dollars to use the Business Center.  I consider it shameful.  We'll move to the Chatwal next time - closer to the Broadway shows we come to the city for.  Yes, $90/day to park your car is also crazy but this computer issue upset me even more.

title: Pure class..
text: Oh, such a classy hotel!  Everything one could wish for.  It shines like a new penny from stem to stern.  Ok, so we could have had a better view (we have stayed in a corner suite there facing 5th Avenue), but there was plenty of light and even a small balcony one could have gone out onto.  The rooms are decorated beautifully, the bed and couches are incredibly comfortable and the service is wonderful.  Smiles from everyone.  Breakfast, albeit very expensive, was great (way too much food, however).  My only couple of negatives were that lunch was very expensive and not too good.  My hamburger (at $37 or $39 w/o french fries ($15) was overcooked - I could and should have sent it back and they don't deliver either a newspaper or slippers without calling for them.  However, for a real treat at a great location for high end shopping, the St. Regis can't be beat.  We are hoping that the purchase by Marriott will not turn it into a mediocre hotel.

title: Simply the Best
text: Yes it is expensive, but boy is it worth it. The staff is amazing and the rooms are spectacular. From the King Cole Bar to the fresh flowers in the lobby, I know you will love this place. Endulge and stay here when you are in NYC.

title: Legendary St Regis
text: Been there with my friends to enjoy the oldest St Regis. Everything was perfect!! Staff are always friendly and helpful. Though there’s a queue for checking in and out since there’s just two desk, but they managed it well. Butlers are terrific and Shelomie at front desk impressed us the most!  Thank you all for a great stay! nicely done! we will be back for sure!

title: Unforgetable Trip with a very close friend
text:
The St. Regis New York, is one of the exclusives and nice hotel there. We had great time the weather was fantastic (blue sky) every day and as you know this city is never sleeping and we have seen so many interesting things.

For me it is always nice to be back but this time we stayed in the St. Regis which was a great joice to do.

Further advantege is it is located E2 55West and mostly every is walking distance aas most you know the traffic is very high and busy, but all good to walk.

The New York finest (Police) have been very frankly to us and it gave no single minute where we have been there.

The Butler and the Concierge service have been very supportive at any time even thta the Hotel was fully booked. The rooms are very quite and nice to stay.

I can just recommend this Hotel in the hard of New York.

Wish you all safe travels until nextr time.

Best wishes
Oliver 444

title: Best hotel ever
text:
It is simply the best hotel ever. I travel a lot to NY for pleasure and i always love how people treat you here, i always love to stay hare and never ever stay at another hotel! 
The rooms are the best in NY 
The service is amazing 
Everyone is very helpful
The concierge is the best in the world 
All staff members are always smiling
It has the perfect location 
It smells amazing 
Extremely luxurious

title: Un havre de luxe au coeur de Manhattan
text: Entre une escapade à Central Park, un arrêt chez Tiffany puis du shopping chez Goodman Bergdorf, quel plaisir inégalé que d'y retrouver sa chambre spacieuse  au mobilier d'un classicisme intemporel avant d'aller déguster un cocktail au mythique King Cole Bar. Excellent service de chambre et conciergerie à la hauteur d'un hôtel de cette catégorie.

title: Exceptional Hotel
text:
We stayed at the St Regis for 3 nights on a short break. We’ve stayed in a few hotels in New York before but this has to be the best . We enjoyed our large, beautifully furnished room and the exceptional service that we received throughout our stay from all of the friendly staff. It’s location couldn’t be much better.
Would love to stay here again!

title: First Class and centrally located for easy walking
text:
A first class hotel that is perfectly located for easy walking in each direction to destinations you’ll want to see on your visit. 

Very close on 5th Avenue are the Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Plaza, and the popular Uniglo flagship store for ubiquitous and value priced but stylish puffy jackets. Central Park through which Lincoln Center is within a 25-minute walk from the hotel. And Madison Avenue, with the Frick Collection a similar 25-minute walk away along eye-popping window displays. 

The hotel staff is uniformly pleasant and eager to please, clearly benefitting from outstanding training.  Rooms classic, quiet, with deep tubs of a style typically seen only in European hotels.  May be the most comfortable hotel bed ever encountered. Recommend highly.

title: Amex Platinum: forget it! SPG: forget it!
text:
Sunday check in: arrived 2:00. No avail until 4:00. Went to bar to wait. Stacked full of others waiting. No priority for Platinum.
Got at room at 4:10. Interior and building mechanicals are roaring, $1250/night.
Went to desk: a stern lecture on why no priority checkin or room upgrade: “read the fine print: UPON AVAILABILITY!!!!!”
So rude. Really rude.
Next day after my wife goes to desk for a nicer exchange. Moved to an Astor-Suite. Check the attached photos and decide for yourself. Ridiculous.

title: 5-star Hotel, great location
text:
We usually stay at the St. Regis when visiting New York for pleasure.  The St. Regis is probably the best Starwood property in the city (we've also stayed at many W's, the Westin and Le Parker Meridien.  From the minute you walk in, the hotel "feels" special with attentive doormen and a quaint lobby.  The rooms are spacious and decorated beautifully.  The butler service is great and comes in handy throughout the visit (we had to have him bring an iron to the room as soon as we arrived and he immediately offered to bring some tea or coffee).  The bathrooms have a TV on the mirror and separate enclosed showers and toilets which is convenient.  

Cons:  the Marriott/Starwood hotels apparently now charge (as of 2 months ago) a $50 service fee of sorts.  You can apply that $50 charge to drinks at the hotel bar, food in the hotel, 2 tickets to MOMA.  If you don't apply the $50 charge to anything, you "lose" it.  Also, when we booked the hotel 2 months prior to our stay, we had asked for early check-in (3:00) as we had 5:00 dinner reservations downtown.  We were not able to check in early because they said the hotel had been fully booked the night before and they were still cleaning rooms.  

Pros:  Beautiful rooms, butler service, 3 blocks from Central Park, close to great shopping and restaurants.

title: Thoughts from annual visitors
text:
We have the good fortune (and points) to be able to stay at the St. Regis in New York at least once per year. We actually live close by in CT, but like to do "staycations" in New York as a couple or with our young kids. The St. Regis is great for both given the excellent location and better than average service and room size. Yes, everything in the hotel is priced at a premium ($15 orange juice for breakfast, $25 cocktails at the bar), but this place is an institution and oozes New York elegance and grandeur. If that's what you are looking for, then look no further.

One criticism I've noticed over the last few stays is that all the rooms have a faint smell of cigarette smoke. Last year it was so bad we asked to move rooms. I understand there are a lot of international travelers that stay in the hotel, but it seems pervasive throughout. Maybe something with the ventilation system or that there really are that many international travelers who smoke? Also the mattresses seem to be getting a bit worn in. Time for replacements.

Overall, another great stay. Hope to be back next year.

title: best 5 star hotel in New York
text: I decided to stay here while splurging for a girls weekend, we wanted to stay in this area and I have had not great experiences at the nearby Peninsula and Plaza hotels and wanted to try something different. I can't believe that I ever wasted time and money staying anywhere else. The service at this hotel is incredible. We were treated like family by everyone we encountered. The room was in great condition with very tasteful and comfortable decor. I will definitely be returning. Thanks for a great weekend!

title: Extraordinarily Disappointing
text: Arrived expecting to have a reservation for 2 nights only to find out my assistant only made it for one night. Okay, that's on us. But the front desk staff could not have been ruder in handling it. The first story was "we are sold out, but let me see what we can do and we will contact you." This was 5 pm. No one ever got back to me so I called the front desk at 3 am. Why 3 am? Because I couldn't sleep due to the fact that I was sold a bill of goods at check-in. "Oh sir we have upgraded you to a better room but it has two beds instead of a king." Little did I know the two beds were so small I couldn't sleep in one of them. If they offer you an upgrade make sure it truly is such. Also, the room I was given was connected to a suite and I could hear the casual conversation and the phone ringing next door. When I called the front desk at 3 am asking about the status of the second night, I was told in effect no way we are going to have a room for you and we don't have a clue why the front desk indicated anything but that when you checked in. No offer to help me find an alternative hotel.  Five minutes later they called back and said oh we can get you a room at the Ritz Carlton at $1,300 a night. Gee, thanks for your help. I could do that myself.  I realize the error in the reservation was on my side but a first class hotel should try and help their customers not tell them to go pound sand. At 6:30 am I decided to skip the $41 continental breakfast and go out to a local coffee shop. As I was walking down the hall a housekeeper wanted to know if I was checking out so she could turn the room. No, it's 6:30 am let me at least get a bit of a return on my super expensive, super not okay room. I hit the front desk and asked for a one hour delay to check out (I'm Marriott Gold). That was granted but when I came back to my room at 10 am housekeeping was in the room turning it over, despite the fact I had the privacy light on. The housekeeper was snippy when I asked her to leave. It seemed like the entire game was "get you in and get you out". Forget customer service. Never again will I stay at this so-called luxury hotel.

title: Timeless Elegance
text:
I realize this property has been around for decades.  The walls and staircases have seen it all. 
Yet after all this time this property has to be the standard bearer for elegance, service, hospitality and service.  
Elegant 
Dignified 
Proper service. 
It is classic New York and it is exactly what a luxury property should be.  
In the city that never sleeps, this is the property that never stops serving its guests. 
If you’re going to do it, do it right.  This is New York City and it’s not going to be cheap. Its easy to have sticker shock for breakfast or parking.  Save up for a trip here and it will be beyond your wildest dreams.

title: Wedding Stay
text: One of the most memorable weddings we have attended. The hotel itself remarkable. The rooms are very nice. Set in a somewhat Victorian gilded setting. You always feel a sense of New York class. The surf and turf burger at the bar is incredible.

title: Wonderful!
text: When we arrived at the hotel we were met by Matt, the door man. He was so friendly and a great help to us. We feel he went above and beyond for our stay. The woman who checked us in, Shelomie, was a delight to work with. She was warm and charming and eager to assist with our needs and questions. Both of these employees are a true asset to your hotel.

title: Again, the Gold standard in New York City.
text: Upgraded to Madison Suite. As usual service impeccable. Still our go to hotel in NYC. Again, the Gold standard in New York City. The concierge staff is really helpful with cars, reservations, and anything. Again, the Gold standard in New York City.

title: Besser geht nicht - sehr dezent
text: Für den Connossieur der Luxushoitels ist das St Regis sicherlich unter den Top 10. Es gibt kaum was besseres (das Bel Air Hotel in LA vielleicht). Sehr dezent und zuvorkommendes Personal und Butler Service. Kein Wunsch ist zu ungewöhnlich als das dieser nicht sofort erfüllt werden könnte. Zimmer elegant luxuriös ohne übertriebenen Pomp. Die Lage 55th / 5th ist einfach genial. Fußläufig einige sehr gute Rstaurants. Komme immer wieder gerne hierher, man fühlt sich sehr wohl und immer willkommen.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Me and my friend selected this hotel for its location, the hotel has great location, it locates between fifth avenue and Madison avenue where the highend shops and restaurants locate. The receptionists are highly efficient, the concierge staff are highly knowledgeable and very helpful. We booked rooms with butler service, the rooms are spacious, clean and very elegant. Me and my friend liked this hotel, definitely we will book  this hotel for our next visit to New York.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: I stayed at the St Regis. I used my points so the stay was free.  Like most of the hotels in NYC they charge this “resort” fee.  It’s $50/day but you can use it as a credit.  I used my credits for the bar which was a happening scene. Breakfast should not be missed... good eggs Benedict. The rooms where huge and beautiful view.  You’ll feel very royally in this hotel. Highly recommend it.

title: Superb Weekend at the St. Regis NY
text: Best stay in NY ever. The facility, suite, amenities and most important the staff made it a first class experience. the stay over the weekend was like a dream. the hotel is taking care of you with a butler service, great concierge, superb breakfast, and anything we needed was immediately responded positively with a full service. AMAZING

title: Great historic hotel in a fantastic location
text: Fabulous rooms, great service and the building is an historic landmark.  Our favorite place to stay in the city. Close to the theatre district and located on what is one of the great shopping streets in the world. The restaurant and bar alone are worth a visit!

title: In some ways great, in others.. not so great
text:
We booked the hotel through Amex Fine Hotels & Resorts.  Our room (#538) at $1178 a night (plus $228.54 in taxes and fees PER night), overlooked a wall and electrical cords  that were hanging loosely on a metal grill that covered our windows.   We stay in NYC often and I understand the views can sometimes be bright and exciting and sometimes not as much.  There were no FHR upgrades available BUT I would have hoped that they would have have moved us (even within the room category) but to a room with a better or more open view?

We arrived @ midnight and like many places the menu is limited after midnight and we were appreciative that the kitchen prepared us a steak at that time (even though it went off the menu an hour earlier). The steak we ordered had no seasoning on it (not even salt or pepper... nothing), it was overcooked (beyond well done despite a medium request) and was almost inedible.   Breakfast was standard but they forgot things that they to return to retrieve.

The building, lobby and common areas are lovely (and historic),  the location is fabulous and the staff also was wonderful but, we won't be returning.   We tried the SR-NYC to try something new as we tend to stay at the same places each visit (The Plaza or Mandarin Oriental), it was a nice stay but for the value, we won't be returning to the St Regis NYC.

title: Outstanding Hotel Service, Atrocious F&B Service
text:
We recently spent a Saturday night at the St Regis; this was our first experience with the hotel and also the first with the brand (we usually favor Ritz Carlton's). We were met by a friendly valet and were sent to the lobby to check in.  We were provided with an upgrade to a larger room (not a suite - we are Platinum Elite) and also a certificate for dessert in Astor Court as we were celebrating a milestone anniversary.
