The concierge were phenomenal, providing many suggestions with a friendly smile and had no problem printing our theater tickets. 

As we made our way upstairs, a butler met us at the door to our room and offered to unpack our suitcases (we declined). He also offered to take any items that we might need for pressing.  The St Regis has a $50 daily destination fee that includes: $50 F&B credit, $50 Laundry credit, $25 salon credit and 2 tickets to either MOMA or the Met (which are wonderful for out of state residents).  That was our one and only interaction with our Butler, but he was quite lovely.  

Our room was BEAUTIFUL. Traditional, yet updated. It still held the grandeur of an old, gorgeous NY building, while bringing modern creature comforts. Our room was large by NYC standards and very clean.  The shower, although clean, was tiny (Clark Kent couldn't have changed in this telephone booth).

If not for F&B, I would have given this hotel a glowing 5* review.  But the St Regis falls down in EVERY aspect of F&B.  We returned from a show on Saturday night with the intention of having a lovely nightcap in the King Cole Bar.  There was an available table that hadn't been turned over yet they sat us there and simply removed the old glasses (didn't wipe down the visibly soiled table).  They threw menus at us and returned to take our order.  I did not care for the drink that I had ordered (it was awful) and asked for them to add simple syrup to help combat the bitterness. They complied but didn't ever return to see how the drink was (better, but still not drinkable). We were never offered water and a waiter did not return until he came with the bill - including my drink, that sat there, untouched.  We paid in full, realizing that they weren't going to fix the issue.  I did ask to speak with the manager - he blew me off, not offering to do anything to rectify the situation or offer any type of service recovery.  

The next morning we went back down to Astor Court for breakfast.  We "lucked out" and got a table before a rush of people arrived. Those same people were still waiting for a table 90 minutes later when we finally finished breakfast.  Our waiter came by initially and offered coffee, tea, juice, etc and took our order.  50 minutes later, we received our breakfasts (eggs and pancakes - not souffle). Not once did the waiter come by to refresh coffee, juice or offer any suggestions as to why breakfast was taking so long.  While the food was delicious, the service and timing were simply awful. 

Finally, we returned to Astor Court later that afternoon to order desserts to go.  There were three people in the restaurant.  After waiting for 31 minutes, the hostess asked if we had ordered something.  A moment later, our cheesecakes arrived.  Meanwhile, the same F&B manager who I had spoken with the evening before, stood there the entire time, knowing that a to go order of a prepared dessert was taking much too long.  

F&B is a significant part of any hotel business.  The St Regis does NOT have this part down.  I am so disappointed as I truly believe that this could be our new go to in Manhattan as the hotel service truly is impeccable.  When management sees the issues and overlooks them, and frankly rudely dismisses their guests, then I begin to wonder about the culture of the leadership. Fortunately, I know that my choices in Manhattan are endless and that I don't have to settle for "good enough."

title: Wonderful stay . . . as always
text: The rooms are not huge, but good size.  Very classy, older but not in need of renovation. Butler service is top notch. Amenities are commensurate with price.  Love this place and try to stay here when it's available - so book early.

title: Absollutely Perfect!!!
text:
My husband and I were pampered at the St. Regis, an Absolutely Perfect Hotel.  Abby made sure of that and we thank her so much. Abby is professional, competent and caring.  She is a wonderful manager, the St. Regis is fortunate to have in their employ and we were fortunate to meet. 
Not only is the hotel gorgeous, but our suite was magnificent, super clean, quiet and attention had been made to every detail which provided us a luxurious experience.  We loved the heated marble floors, the large spa showers, the beautiful furnishings and the so comfortable bed.   
 We had two meals at the Astor Court and all the food was well prepared and delicious.  All the staff, especially Craig, the host and our server were attentive, friendly and concerned that everything was to our liking. Our evening meal was a birthday celebration dinner for me and my grandson. It was so special and one we will never forget.  Needless to say, we can't wait to return!!  Thank you for a great visit.

title: Magnificent Hotel in the middle of New York city
text: This perfectly located hotel is magnificent.  From the time your car is taken away by a valet to the time you are walked to your room by a butler, you will be impressed by the luxury and eclat of this hotel. Our room, a suite, was very large and beautifully decorated in Louis XIV.  Everything was perfect! We particularly were impressed by the television in the bathroom mirror. The staff was warm and friendly at the desk and the restaurant.  Thank you for a great weekend.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: WOW! This hotel is packed with amenities and friendly staff that look forward to serving you. The best part is the rooms. Large rooms, sparkling clean, quiet and dark in the morning. Instead of waking up to the sound of horns, sirens, and traffic we woke up to silence. Well rested we made our way to breakfast where we had a red snapper (St. Regis is the birthplace of the Bloody Mary, obviously we had to have one) and two incredible meals. I highly recommend checking out the basement level. They have old artifacts and history about the hotel for you to view. We will definitely be back!

title: Second visit
text: We love this hotel...great location and attentive service.  The rooms are beautiful with a nice bathroom and a great shower.  5th Ave and 55th is a nice central location, not far from Central Park and close to shops and restaurants.  Restaurant dinig room is very good with a nice brunch on Sunday.

title: Nothing short of amazing
text:
The St Regis New York truly deserves to be on any short list of luxury hotels and offered us a fantastic experience.

As a couple we are constantly seeking new experiences that blend luxury with unique settings and a true taste of the local flavor of an area. As such we seek out hotels, restaurants, and activities which enrich the visit rather than simply offering the same old thing in just another town.

The history in this hotel is well preserved however the management has not simply rested on their storied past and continue to push forward to remain updated while maintaining the old world charm and of course offering excellent service.

The hotel is set just two blocks from Central Park tucked into the vibrant city core of our nations largest city.

The hotel itself has its beginnings set in 1901 and may have been one of the first “zoning battles” New York is now famous for. The original 18-story French Beaux-Arts style hotel, sat directly across from several prominent homes on 5th Avenue and was the tallest project of it’s time.  
Immediately upon arrival we were greeted by quick acting classically uniformed doorman and bellmen who efficiently dealt with our arrival. The hotel exterior is beautiful rising gracefully from the street offering a historical ornament to this community.

The lobby transitions seamlessly from entry, to reception, with an intimate setting and a beautiful corridor connecting to the Astor Court restaurant with their old King Cole cocktail lounge hovering behind this area.

Combined these bring back a time when lobbies were for entertaining, conducting business and socializing, rather than the modern plan where they have been reduced to just a way to enter and leave the property. From the time you enter the hotel you feel welcomed and in a world a bit nicer than the outside.

Check in was efficient and personal as one would expect. As we had arrived mid morning we knew it would be several hours before our room was available. The desk arranged storage of our luggage, taking our number to ring us when the room was prepared.

This freed us up to explore the city, enjoy lunch with friends and gain another day of experiences. As expected we received a call inviting us to our room where upon arrival we were greeted by the Butler who was both prompt and professional. Our closet was already arranged for the large number of extra hangers we needed, extra robes, while the butler brought us fresh fruit and offered their services 24 hrs a day. Each morning they brought us coffee and the paper, took out our sundry and arranged to keep my shoes shined.  
We were upgraded to a beautiful 1 bedroom suite that fit our needs, giving us the space to live during our week long stay. The bathroom was well laid out and tastefully complemented the room. Our shower offered great water pressure while the tub was plenty large enough for two to soak.

Located on the 19th floor we had large windows looking out with nice city views.

The bed as expected was very comfortable, the linens crisp and we had plenty of space in the living room for relaxing with morning coffee and some light work. The living room was well appointed with two comfortable chairs and a couch.
 The HVAC was very well balanced keeping our room at the requested temperature day and night overcoming an issue many historical hotels struggle with. Another exemplary feature was the complete absence of street noise which is much appreciated by travelers such as ourselves who wish to be immersed by location in the city experience while still having our refuge in private.
 This trip was for several days giving us a great opportunity to experience housekeeping. Upon arrival the room was perfectly clean, missing nothing and each item was placed with obvious care as to how it would be received by the guest. Our daily service was excellent with the requested four extra bath towels each day. Turn down service was seamless as well. Overall not a single issue was missed during our stay by the butlers or housekeeping.
 We were especially pleased the staff observed our do not disturb request allowing us to sleep in late each day. This easy to coordinate touch, much appreciated by travelers, is often overlooked but not here. Great job.
 The hotel is located in the core of 5th Avenue. Convenient for shopping, dining, and of course recreational activities. While we did not use them the hotel offers on site conference facilities for meetings and a great gym.

Just steps from Central Park and easy distances to literally everything we did. We did take advantage of the car service with the Hotels Bentley once.

From the moment we entered the property we felt welcomed. The Valet and doormen were efficient, the desk cordial, and the butler service spot on.

The front desk as mentioned was efficient and courteous both to be expected. However they exceeded this greeting us with familiarity, expediting us through this business side of the stay. The efforts of the entire desk staff made us feel as if we were family or at least repeat guests even though this was in fact our first visit, but hopefully not our last.
 Internet worked well and as always was free for us as SPG Platinum members. For travelers that are not Platinum the charges would be on a per day basis.

The Bar and restaurant are both run by the hotel and served our needs well. We enjoyed a lite lunch in the Astor Court and some drinks at the old King Cole bar.

Kudos are in order for this fine property. I expected top notch service, rooms, and an escape from the hustle and bustle of Life.

The St Regis New York delivered this and much more with the excellent staff adding so much to this trip. Thanks from us to the management for their efforts to recruit and train staff that is genuinely interested in customer service. As mentioned earlier but worth repeating the entire staff made us feel as if we were long term or at least repeat guests, their personal attention was exemplary.

It's our hope that when we next visit New York we will be able to stay here. With so many stops worldwide each offering unique experiences to sample its not always easy for us to return but this property has made it worth the effort.

title: Another superb stay
text: I took my husband here for the weekend to celebrate his birthday.  Once again, the St. Regis staff made us feel like royalty.  The service is spectacular, the amenities are top notch, and the food is great.  This place is just heavenly....  And, to top it all off, I was assisted by Molly D in the Sales dept.  She is so helpful and delightful!  She really made sure my husband was thrilled to be there, and he absolutely was.  I can’t thank her enough.  I can honestly say that we will return again, and Molly is absolutely one of the reasons why.  Working with someone of her caliber makes such a difference....  Thank you!

title: The only NYC hotel I will stay in from now on
text: Everything is immaculate and the service is impeccable. John quickly became our favorite staff member there and took such good care of us! He was attentive, funny and caring. We loved the look and feel of our room and every visual aspect of the hotel, the food, the housekeeping staff, the staff outside (Matt was amazing to us)... the magic was in the details and not a single one went unnoticed.

title: Up there in the Sky
text:
Finally,  following a long USA Trip, a beautiful perfect Hotel.
I have spent 4 nights with my family. 
Hotel is clean,  personal is well trained. 
I had a private butler for my room.

The thing I appreciated the most is the fact that being late with my room, they offered dinner....and incredibly,  even if not espected and wanted from my side...they paid also the wine.

I will be back each time I go to NY.

title: 素晴らしいバトラーサービス
text: バトラーサービスは申し分なく、毎回、きめ細やかな対応です。スタッフの方も大変フレンドリーです。ニューヨークに早朝着いた時は地下にある美容院で髪を整えてから、お気に入りのレストランで、朝食をします。通常チェックインは四時ですが、今回は、美容院が終わった段階で、１２時前には、早めにチェックインでき助かりました。ニューヨークでゆっくり過ごしたい方には、オススメのホテル。ロケーションも最高です。

title: THE BEST
text: Yes it’s expensive but worth it. The service is beyond compare, the rooms are lovely and comfortable. The location cannot be beat, the food is very good but the highlight is the service. Gracious accommodating every place in the hotel. Only drawback is minimal business service in the business center. Very small nice people but limited capacity.  Wasn’t able to do what I’d hoped for. Will of course come back.

title: Requiem for SPG - I sure will miss it!
text:
We just stayed at the St Regis over the weekend on points.  As we were eating breakfast in the Astor room, I started to get sentimental about SPG and its impending death at the hands of Marriott.

We became SPG members when we bought a Starwood timeshare out in Palm Desert California.  We have never been back to the timeshare, and it is (for me) frighteningly expensive.   But the saleswoman had us with a beautifully produced book that listed all the fancy hotels in the SPG universe - from the Danieli in Venice to the St Regis.

That was all my wife needed - we were hooked.  And the salesperson was pretty much right when she said:  "you'll never pay for a hotel room again".  

It wasn't quite like that, but it was close.  

And now this Starwood era is coming to an end.  RIP.  And good luck to the wonderful St Regis.

title: Gorgeous hotel with fantastic suites and an even better location!
text: The St. Regis has always been my home away from home when in NY and why not, it has a fantastic location and great suites.  Definitely pricey, but after all, it is NYC. The St. Regis also great service and the entire staff makes you feel at home. Well done!

title: Simply the best in NYC
text: This was a special vacation for my family and St. Regis did not disappoint. My experience was awesome from time of arrival to departure. Sue at the front desk was exceptional. She even went above and beyond to tell us about the historic features of the hotel and to try to schedule a tour for us but the person was on vacation. Charles the bellman was always very helpful. Butlers Lynn and George provided great service and was very timely. Harold was always very kind and prompt via email and provided great info and recommendations. We also had chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate a special occasion. Facilities, restaurant, and rooms were elegant and comfortable. This place is truly amazing. I am now looking to visit other St. Regis properties. Would definitely stay here again the next time I am in NYC!

title: True Excellence
text:
Hotel is beautiful— from the fresh flowers in the lobby to the crystal chandeliers in my room. We had an amazing stay. Huge thanks to the housekeeping service and our butler George.
I hope I have the chance to stay at the St. Regis again.

title: Fantastic Hotel at a Great Location
text: We spent 8 nights at the St. Regis New York and had a wonderful time. The hotel and our room were luxurious, and the staff friendly and attentive. Although there were a few issues along the way related to our invoice, they were promptly resolved. Special thanks to Jorge the Housekeeping Manager and his assistant, who went of their way and replaced our USD$150 Apple Airpods which went missing during our stay. Jorge was very courteous and dealt with the matter in a most professional manner. This is what I call above and beyond customer service, which is rare nowadays even at the finest hotels. I highly recommend the St. Regis New York.

title: LOVED!
text: From check-in through check-out, this was a memorable hotel stay!  My favorite was the fabulous butler Patricia Davis who made sure ever need was anticipated - pressing, morning coffee and afternoon tea - all with a delightful demeanor. The front door staff was also wonderful!   Thank you Patricia and St Regis  for a delightful week!

title: Staff gratitude
text:
The service at the St. Regis is impeccable, starting from the bellman, waiters, concierge, receptionist... etc. 
Although the gym could use a larger variety of resistance machines, I found the staff (Jennel and Dorthy) very welcoming and attentive to the needs of the guests.

title: Wonderful Weekend at the St. Regis
text:
My boyfriend and I checked in at the St. Regis late on Friday night, with plans to check out on Sunday. Since our arrival was late (around 10:45pm) I assumed there would be a bare-bones staff there to greet us. I was happily proved wrong when we were greeted by the doorman, bellhop, check-in staff and butler--each more kind and welcoming than the last. We booked the basic "Superior" guest room but were informed upon check-in that we had been upgraded to a "Grand Luxe" room. I personally couldn't tell the difference based on pictures from the website (maybe our room was slightly larger?) but I did appreciate the gesture. 

The room was absolutely gorgeous, although I felt the mattress and pillows left a little to be desired for my taste. Our room was on the 12th floor, with a decent view and absolutely no noise from the street below. The butler was amazing, and brought us coffee each morning and handled the pressing of our garments before our show on Saturday. 

Saturday evening we had drinks in the King Cole Bar. The prices were outrageous, which I had expected. But what I did not expect was the terrible service we received from our waiter. If I'm paying $18 for a Tito's and soda water, I expect to at least be greeted warmly and not have to flag the waiter down every hour to ask for another round.

We were able to utilize the Bentley service, which was fabulous and very convenient.  We were also gifted 2 complimentary desserts in honor of our anniversary weekend. We choose to order those to-go and eat them in our room. Really delicious and a very nice gesture on the part of the St. Regis to offer us that. We also requested and received a 4 p.m. check out on Sunday, which really allowed us to enjoy the city and the hotel for a few more hours!

Overall, we had an incredible stay, mainly due to the staff at the St. Regis. For the most part, they went out of their way to make our weekend memorable and we hope to be back to this historic property!

title: 5th avenue gem!
text:
Awesome hotel, John in room service is awesome been with the hotel 25 years! Everything was awesome, great service and an amazing location! They had at least 5 Clefs d'or, which make finding things to do and reservations a dream.
5th Avenue suite was awesome, housekeeping staff very helpful as well everyone in general.

title: It doesn't get any better
text: If one wants to and can pamper themselves there is nothing more restful that the two bath and one bedroom suite.  Everything is well positioned and the service is impeccable.  Many don't realize in addition to the ice maker in the pantry the butler has brought in clear ice in a silver insulated container, along with glassware kept in the minibar cabinet.  Where else do you have included in the room charge morning coffee served by the butler, clothes pressing upon arrival, fruit baskets replenished daily, use of the Chauffeured Bentley for short trips, shoe shines, and unlimited chocolates.  Like the Peninsula in Hong Kong you have a full electronic control panel, electric shutting drapes, and the ability to record shows on the tv's. The mattresses are firm, the bedding is very high quality, and the blackout curtains work.  The furnishing, while antique, are well maintained by an inhouse carpenter and refinishing staff.  Can't say enough about this wonderful hotel.

title: Best gym in NYC
text: The Reg has my favorite hotel gym in all of Manhattan. It’s always absolutely spotless, and the attendants are the nicest— Jenelle is my favorite. She remembers me and welcomes me warmly every time I have the privilege of staying there. Her smile motivates me to get out of bed for that early morning workout!

title: Good location, good junior suites
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 10 night using Starwood points to get a junior suite (basically includes a second room with a sitting area (couch, two arm chairs, desk/chair and a second half bathroom) but no view.  The location is classic midtown.  The decor is classic and in good condition.  I particularly liked that the heating system didn't blow on us in the night - it's a good system that is quiet and comfortable.  Bathroom was very spacious - separate shower and tub and independent toilet as well as a seated vanity and a separate double sink.  Closet and dresser were about average for hotels I guess but they did bring us lots of extra hangars.  Overall we were very comfortable in the room and happy with our last minute choice.

We stayed here because my husband had back surgery - no one in the hotel seemed to notice or pay us much attention, even after the surgery when he needed a cane to get up and down the entrance stairs.  So don't expect any personal service touches unless you ask for them.  We didn't use the concierge.  The restaurant is offensively expensive and not worth its price tags - there are so many other choices nearby I guess they price it this way so that only the excessively lazy or unaware billionaires will sit down to eat.  This is true at all hours of the day.  But like I said, my husband had had surgery so we actually HAD to eat there a few times - the breakfast salad bowl was tasty, other than that, the rest was unmemorable.  We did spot a very famous celebrity having coffee there one morning which was strange.

One annoyance about this hotel is that the elevators are small and not sufficient for the number of floors - there is not much the hotel can do about this - it's an old hotel that wasn't designed for today's travelers.  If you are a super impatient person and you aren't aiming for a view you might want to request a lower floor and take the stairs because depending on time of day the elevator situation can be annoying.

Overall I would not pay the outrageous cash prices they charge to stay here - there are other places in ny where your money will go farther but I didn't mind using my Starwood points one bit.  In most respects we were very satisfied.

title: Lovely Birthday Weekend for the Mrs.
text:
St. Regis NYC delivered a truly lovely birthday weekend for my wife from start to finish.  

While it took a couple hours and few rounds (why rush?) we did correctly discerned the mural in the King Cole Bar. 
 
We enjoyed a beautiful breakfast, tea in our room (very nice tuxedo styled chocolate covered strawberries), went out walking to the theater for a show, dined in as well as out with superb recommendations/reservations all around.

Felt truly valued, appreciated, as well as blessed, the entire time.

title: Better hotels for the price
text:
We were very disappointed by the St Regis. We had read some great reviews and we are looking for a new go-to hotel in New York that is always reliable good. After reading the NYT's article on the butler service we hoped this could be the one.
Firstly, everyone was exceptionally friendly, all the staff were fabulous. It was mainly the room and the corporate,' don't color outside the lines' operation of the hotel that disappointed. We were greeted on our floor by the butler who was very nice but in a great hurry. When we realised our room was beside the lift, we asked if there was another room available as they are always the noisiest rooms. He rang reception but handed it to me and told me its on hold. I was told they was no other room available. I had to call after the butler and ask if its possible to get a cup of tea. No offer of unpacking etc was offered. The room was fine, quite dark and a bit cluttered. The small windows made it feel slight claustrophobic. Next morning we had complimentary breakfast and this is were we decided the hotel was not for us. I ordered coffee, oj, fruit and toast for 2. The gentleman told me I'd have to pay the difference as that came to $165!! When I suggested that the American breakfast which came with all those things except the fruit but had eggs, bacon, potatoes etc was only $41, he said we had ordered al a carte so it was more expensive. So I said I'd have the American breakfast, he asked how would you like your eggs, i said none thank you. He said well thats not and American breakfast then! At this stage my husband was making signs to bail and I would have but the gentleman was wonderful (he was very polite and gracious with my incredulousness) and really wanted to help. He worked it out that we could get coffee, 1 oj,1 fruit and 1 toast and not go over budget! Its the corporate, I don't have a button for that setup of the hotel that really annoyed me, not all the wonderful servers and staff.

title: This may be the best hotel in NYC
text: One of the most beautiful and iconic hotels in NYC.  Be sure to have some drinks at the King Cole Bar, legendary and historic, with delicious food and drinks.  Staff are very friendly and accommodating, all your needs are anticipated before you even have to ask.

title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Excellent Stay
text: My wife and I stayed at the St Regis for 8 nights in June 2018 as part pleasure part business trip. This was our second time at the hotel and we cannot fault it. The staff were exceptional and made our stay very memorable. The hotel's location made it great to get around the City and the friendliness of the staff made our time there very enjoyable. Janelle in the fitness centre was a particular favourite of ours as she made going to the gym in the mornings a very welcoming and friendly experience. We will definitely stay here upon our return to New York City

title: Exceptional Hotel with impeccable service at all levels
text:
What an experience from doormen, Bellmen, check-in, butler, food & restaurants.
You are charged $50 per day but you get $50 off food daily, $50 off laundry, and $ 25 off salon services.
location is right off Fifth Avenue and across the street from a fantastic restaurant Polo Bar

title: Simply the best
text: When the most beautiful hotels in New York or anywhere. The service is fantastic, the rooms are perfect and the entire experience is spectacular. It is truly a gorgeous, iconic and wonderful experience for business or for families.

title: Understated Elegance off Fifth Avenue
text:
There are few better places to spend Thanksgiving than New York and no better place to stay than the St. Regis. Located on  E. 55th Street just off 5th Avenue it is at once in middle of the shopping district but tucked off the busy promenade. The human scale lobby and other public spaces are elegantly designed and finished with the most beautiful materials. 

The King Cole Bar exudes New York style and features the 1932 Maxfield Parrish painting of the same name. Just be sure to reserve a table or get there early as this one of more popular haunts of Manhattanites. The Bloody Mary drink was invented here, originally named the "Red Snapper" 

The luxurious dining area, Astor Court, is named for John Jacob Astor IV who developed the hotel in 1904. I can't imagine any better place in New York for Thanksgiving dinner. It's a place where you want to dress-up. 

The guest rooms are equally luxurious, whether they be a single room or a corner suite (view down 5th from our suite). In addition there is 24-hour butler service for everything from fresh coffee to pressing clothes. 

The St. Regis concierge service is second to none. Whether it be Hamilton tickets or Per Se reservations, they can get it done, particularly Krista who makes all things possible. 

Bottom line - we've stayed at most of the luxury hotels in New York, but we always return to the St. Regis.

title: Madison Suite is perfect
text:
The Madison Suite is a beautiful and spacious room.  Ours had two full baths with tub and shower, two queen sized beds, and a very spacious parlor room with sofa, table and chairs as well as a well appointed desk for doing work.  The room also came with a butler who helped us get complementary Met tickets and made our coffee as well.  The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very luxurious.  If you are an SPG member they treat you even nicer--I am so I was given a room upgrade because it was available.  That is a nice touch.  The location is excellent too--its on 55th and 5th which is very easy to remember.

I am a Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons kind of person so I have never stayed at a St. Regis and as a testament of how much I loved this hotel, I am staying at the Bal Harbour St. Regis when I go to Miami later this year--all because I stayed at this hotel.

title: Impressed with room and level of service
text: Just came back from four night ( all on SPG points) stay at this beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. The three of us arrived early from a red eye flight and checked in at 8am Saturday morning. The front desk staff ( Hugh I believe ) was kind enough to get us a room asap (even though check in is officially 4 pm) as my 8 year old was literally falling asleep on my wife's lap in the lobby. We found our interactions with all hotel staff to be professional and courteous. Really nice to have French press coffee from butler service every morning! The Hotel was also able to accommodate our late check out request. Highly recommend. We intend on making this our go to hotel when in Manhattan.

title: One of the best hotels in NYC
text:
The St Regis NYC is a standard that I compare all other hotels to. 
From the front desk staff, to the butler who attends to guests with perfection to the excellent Old King Cole bar, the St Regis sets the example for how a luxury hotel should be run. I’ve probably stayed over 50 nights and have never been disappointed. 
Their true recognition of SPG Platinum guests is also appreciated.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
A bit old, but really well maintained. 
The bath is nice. New york hotels generally don’t have great baths/toilets, but St Regis’ has a great one!

Service is really great! 

We arrived early, they provided us keys for the gym and freshen up, the called us just few minutes and our room was ready for us!

Breakfast was amazing! In room dinning was awesome!

Expensive, but a great experience.

title: pricey, but you get what you pay for
text: to say the St. Regis in NYC is budget friendly would be a crude joke, but then again the St. Regis is not made to be budget friendly. This magnificent hotel is absolutely beautiful and will provide us with a great experience.

title: Classic NYC Elegance
text: Love this hotel and frequently stay here when in the city.  It is pricey, but the perfect middle town location coupled with outstanding service and room accommodations makes it well worth the price.  The butler service is over the top . . . they can satisfy almost any need.  The classic restaurant and the Nat King Cole bar (complete with Maxifield Parrish mural) are NYC institutions.

title: Very good 5 night stay
text:
We arrived at the St Regis New York around noon. Room was not ready so we went for a quick dim-sum lunch before the SPG app notified that our room on the 18th floor was ready.  Since it was a five-night stay I had low expectations of a suite upgrade. Sure enough, we had a normal room with hardly any views. Huge bathroom by New York standards though and generous amenities upon request.

We enjoyed tea service by our butler (the service is free up till 12PM) and had our breakfast every morning at Astor Court's table by the window. Platinum benefits entitles you to an American breakfast or equivalent value. There is a beautiful restroom located below Astor Court, accessible down a flight of stairs. Very convenient after meals and before heading out for the day.

Because of the daily USD50 Destination Fee we ordered room service on more than one occasion just to use up the credits. The gym is located on Level 19 and has new TechnoGym equipment. The Cognac Room at the lobby level was nice.

The location was convenient for Central Park and some shopping but we used Uber most of the time anyway. Overall 4 stars from me and 3.5 stars from the wife.

title: The best hotel in NY
text: We come to NY on a regular basis an d for the past 20 years.  This is the BEST hotel in the city.  Luxurious, comfortable and a staff that takes care of any of your needs. We stayed in Suite 1636.  Huge, and wonderful. Obviously one pays for this luxury but i is worth it, IMO.

title: First Rate!
text: An absolute jewel box of a property right in the heart of midtown!  We stayed in a beautifully appointed room, were attended to by their incredibly conscientious staff, and enjoyed a terrific breakfast at the Astor Court.  A perfect romantic NYC weekend getaway.

title: Totally Amazing
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 10 nights at the beginning of May, cannot rate it high enough. Absolutely amazing property with staff who go above and beyond all expectations.
We loved everything about this property.
Can't wait to go back

title: Our heartiest compliments!
text:
We recently visited the St. Regis New York for our daughters 10th birthday.  The concierge service was excellent both prior to, and during our stay.  Jonathan Adler provided service above and beyond - always with a smile - and made this an unforgettable experience for us.

Heartiest compliments to the gym attendant Jenelle Henry as well.  The gym is one of the reasons I will be going back to this property. Jenelle was warm, and the gym was immaculate.

We will be back!  I highly recommend this property.

title: Meh...
text:
Save yourself some stress and stay across the road at the peninsula. 1. Room stank of cigarettes, wait did I say stank. Yeah it was worse than an old bar. Had to be moved to two subsequent rooms 2. Butler service was un predictable, 3 calls for service no response, ended up engaging the front desk. 3. Quality and flawless execution expected of this property far from optimal, really hurts the brand. 4. SPG Platinum considerations such as a late check out not extended, wait they gave me 30 mins.

With a series of black eyes, there were one or two diamonds, the concierge was outstanding and polished, the lobby manager who helped with the smoke situation was sincere and could see/smell the issue from the doorway, that being said a real disappointment unless you like your rooms smelly with bad service, none of these issues should have occurred .

title: Perfection!
text: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights on a recent visit to NYC. We take a train from upstate NY down to NYC a couple times a year. This was our first time at the St Regis. We typically stay at the Westin in Times Square however it was our anniversary and we felt something special would be nice. We had requested a early check in of around 1PM. Sadly that could not be honored, they did however immediately give us a $50 credit at the King Cole Bar. Which I felt was unnecessary but gladly accepted. Previously working in this industry I know that a early check in request is exactly that a REQUEST. The wife and I ordered the Tuna Tartare appetizer to share and we each had a perfectly crafted alcoholic beverage. Everything including service was outstanding. Our room was ready by the time we were done with our meal and drinks. The room was gorgeous, the entire hotel is as well. Old warm charm, but plenty of modern amenities. The large tub and separate walk in shower is great. The TV inside the mirror is cool. someone brought us chocolate covered strawberries soon after arriving in the room. I was not hungry but really could not turn down free chocolate. I have absolutely no idea where this hotel gets there strawberries but they are absolutely amazing. I have hated every strawberry I have had ever since staying at this hotel.... We were meeting friends in the hotel lobby and my friend suggested we start our night at the bar in the hotel. I was not gonna argue as we enjoyed our time there an hour before. More excellent drinks this time as well and our server was awesome. He somehow heard in the distance our friends saying happy anniversary to us and he brought the whole table 2 desserts on the house to try. We got more drinks and left happy and tipped him well. Some how word got to the bellhop in front that it was our anniversary because when we had gone out there to wait for a UBER to haul us off to dinner off property they insisted they take us in the hotels Bentley for our anniversary. I really can’t say enough nice thing about this place. They don’t have a swimming pool however most older NYC hotels don’t. Nothing could have been better with our 3 day stay. We liked the bed and pillows so much I ordered a king mattress and 4 pillows from the St Regis website when I got home... it was not cheap but it was my 10 year wedding anniversary gift to my wife. Oh and they gave us a 4PM check out on the day we left since we had a evening train.... Perfect all around!

title: Luxurious weekend
text:
Stayed here for 2 days. 
The room was simply amazing spacious with stylish decorations. Groovy bathroom and amazing shower.

Attentive staffs, variety of food for breakfast. Great location to sight seeing.

A good place to rest for some amazing day in NYC.

title: Sorry, didn't love it
text:
The decoration of this property is definitely an acquired taste and not for everyone. We honestly found it quite horrendous and disliked the cold light from the chandeliers. We stayed three nights in a Deluxe suite, which was a very spacious and functional room, which are some of our top priorities. 

The service was excellent and the location is very convenient, I just don’t like the way that the staff is ‘hiding’ between the odd old screens on the reception counter. Breakfast was OK, not great. We really enjoyed the gym with a great view and new high-end equipment. 

Our main problem with this property is traffic noise, which definitely was more noticeable compared to other New York hotels we have stayed in. Perhaps due to the age of the building and the rather flimsy window frames. 

We enjoyed our stay but will probably not return.

title: Would certainly consider to visit again...
text: Mostly perfect with some minor flaws.  We've booked an Astor suite and got upgraded to a deluxe suite after some issues at check-in. The corner suite was certainly spacious but with no particular views (we preferrerd the Langhan for views). We've certainly appreciated the double bathroom. We stayed for 8 nights and were able to appreciate the butler service and the concierges.

title: excellent service
text: an oasis of tranquility in the middle of manhattan; butler service was exquisite, good room service, beautiful suite;everyone from the bell boys to the concierge was extremely friendly and helpful, good food at the astor

title: Still the best.
text: Been coming here for years.  Only place in New York we feel at home. Grand yet not pretentious.  GREAT service. Quiet rooms. Still our favorite hotel in New York City. The King Cole bar is cool too. There is always good people watching there. FYI, concierge is terrific.

title: Spectacular Experience
text:
Thank you to the entire hotel, everyone made our 5th wedding anniversary memorable. Our room was mind blowing and everything was spotless. 

All the staff we interacted with went above and beyond. But below few stood out during our stay. Our butler Nestor and his team. Nestor has a great sense of humor and made us laugh as he explained the offerings. Edgar in Astor Court, Julia and Michael from front office. The hotel is truly beautiful and thank you for captivating us during our stay.

title: A Pleasant Time for Tea
text:
As the big birthday travel continues, I jetted off to New York City for a whirlwind two-day fun trip of discovery.
As a belated birthday gift, my sister treated me to afternoon tea at the St. Regis. She ordered the Lady Astor’s Tea among others listed. It is said that Lady Caroline Astor, reigned as the social leader of the 1890’s during what was known as the Gilded Age. If you were lucky enough to be a part of her group, “The 400” also known as “The Patriarchs,” you were considered what she called, “The Old New York.” 
The following are my thoughts of this pleasant experience. 
Pros:
We were seated promptly but it took our server at least ten minutes to acknowledge us prior to taking our order.
The presentation of the meal was pleasing with a sense that there was plenty to eat.
I tried the tropical oolong tea. It’s light fruity flavor did not disappoint.
We were able to substitute the Scottish smoked salmon for more egg salad sandwiches which turned out to be very light and tasty. 
With the raisin and traditional scones, I was delighted to find that double Devonshire cream and lemon curd were served. My sister loved the fruit preserve that accompanied our meal.
Regarding the sweets, my favorites were the Lemon tartelette with toasted meringue and Dark chocolate mousse presented in edible cups.
The harpist added a refined, soft, musical background giving the experience more pleasure.
Cons:
I was disappointed that our server was not more attentive. In most tea rooms that I’ve attended, the hostess would explain the items that are presented on the tray to prepare you for your meal. Our server just placed the items on the table and off he went. Twice he stopped by after long intervals to see if we needed anything. By that time, it was too late because another server, Kenny, had already cared for our needs of more water for the tea and removal of dirty plates. It just felt like our server was there because he had to and couldn’t wait to leave.
The area is one for dining and not just for afternoon tea. Others were having lunch which distracted from the mood of “ the afternoon tea.”
Overall: I would still suggest the St Regis for tea for it’s food. You are sure to leave full and satisfied.

title: Great 60th B'day Visit at the St Regis Hotel
text: My wife surprised me with a visit to one of my favorite hotels, The St Regis, NYC, on my 60th birthday.  We flew in from Detroit and arrived around 8:30pm.  Hugo Hidalgo, the front desk agent, greeted us with a great smile. My wife was checking us in when Hugo asked if we celebrated a special occasion.  When he found out it was my 60th, he said let me see what I can do.  He then informed us that he had a surprise for us and because one of their awesome suites was vacant, he could accommodate us.  When we arrived at the room, we were in shock.  It was the Tiffany Suite, which was amazing!!!  We had such a great time and it was so nice to see that a dedicated employee of the hotel took the time to really make our stay special.  We saw him several times during our stay and couldn't thank him enough.  The St Regis Hotel is lucky to have such a great person working there!!!  Kudos to Hugo and The St Regis hotel!!!

title: Beau, classique, cher, personnel inconstant
text: Hôtel très bien situé, prestations de haut niveau, chambre très belle tout en restant classique voire limite surannée, personnel assez inégal : grande disponibilité pour le personnel de l’étage, partie concierge d’une grande efficacité, réception lente et tatillonne avec des stagiaires limite insolents, quant au personnel en charge de l’accueil, des taxis, des comportements tout simplement inacceptables : arrogants, trop mal habitués à recevoir des pourboires à tire-larigot - en synthèse un hôtel incontestablement haut-de-gamme mais avec un personnel très hétérogène qui ne donne pas vraiment envie de revenir

title: Excellent luxury place.
text:
The hotel is a beautiful, classic place, filled with marvelous furniture, as well as in the hotel as in the rooms.
The staff is super friendly and very helpful, especially the team of the concierge.
Mr Mckinley Winston and Robert Geist did an excellent job in finding us the nicest restaurants, the VIP top seats in the theater, they were guiding us around the city which apparently they know by heart. Balloons were delivered on time for my mom's birthday, in short, a wonderful service by wonderful people.
For sure a place to go and enjoy the city of New York.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Excellent hotel rooms and service at the best location in NYC     The Bar king Cole  was rather busy tonight we stopped in the a night cap.

Fabulous Art Deco decor    The staff is the best.   

Only disappointment is the SPG program is over and there is no Bentley!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: The LOVE AFFAIR with the St Regis Continues!
text: Another magical stay at the St Regis Hotel ! From the moment you arrive at the front door on 55th Street, there are 2 uniformed men to take your luggage and help you into the entrance of the hotel. As you quickly pass the concierge desk, the concierge Harold is sure to wish you a Happy Day and offer his help with any plans you might need. The greetings at the front desk staff is done warmly and welcomingly. They have your room waiting and check if you have any special requests. Upon entering your room, within minutes your personal butler shows up with cold water and asking if you would like coffee or any other amenities!  There is usually already a fruit bowl with a special message also awaiting your arrival. Honestly, where can you ever travel and be treated like royalty as this!  The service at the St Regis continues to be exceptional. Throughout your stay the staff are always asking what they can do help, arrange or make your stay more comfortable. I understand why hotels like the St Regis have many requests from people to actually live on the premises for months at a time. Wish I could !!!!

title: A Truly Underwhelming "High Tea"
text:
**Just to be clear, this lackluster review is specific to my high tea experience in Astor Court at the St. Regis, NOT of the St. Regis itself.**

Yesterday, I treated a dear friend to a high tea at the St. Regis.  We live on separate coasts and only get together once or twice a year, so I was hoping to really deliver since it was my "turn" to plan the day.  Part of my plan for the day was an epic tea service. 

The St. Regis offers two, delightfully-overpriced tea services--Lady Astor's Tea and Caroline's Tea--and rather than share a single service, I elected to splurge and order BOTH tea services.  I was happy to indulge in the experience, having enjoyed high tea services everywhere from The Savoy Hotel London to The BonBonerie in Cincinnati, Ohio (a rare and surprising treat if you get the right server!).  Given the hefty price tag that came along with ordering two, separate tea services, I was ready to be wowed!  

What I was, however, was confused and disappointed.  

Our server brought a single, tiered tea service to the table, said, "enjoy" and walked away.  I was confused to see a single tea service when I'd clearly ordered two, and my friend and I elected not to touch anything until we could get the server's attention for clarification.  In the meanwhile, we used the menu to review what was in front of us on the tea service, and we easily deduced both that there was a combination of tea menu items on the single tier, but there were a number of missing items.  I was truly confused, because I'd ordered two, separate tea services, and expected to receive two, separate (and completed) tiers of food.  Even my stunned friend said, "That is NOT $150 worth of food."

Our server eventually made his way back to our table, I inquired about the single tier, and it wasn't until I really pressed for an explanation that he (finally) explained that portions of both teas WERE on the same tier, and that there WERE, indeed, items missing.  It made absolutely no sense to me that we weren't informed of this when he first put the service on the table, AND that we were essentially waiting for the rest of our service items to come out.  Moreover, it appeared as if we were getting a single tea service with a few additional items on a side plate rather than two separate services.  There just happened to be a table near us with 4 people sharing a single tea service, and I could not help but notice we had the same amount of food.  I was truly confused.  Why didn't we just get the two (and complete), separate services like I'd ordered to eliminate confusion and avoid the appearance of impropriety?

In the end, it was a day out with my girl and I didn't want to ruin the vibe.  I smiled and said thanks when a side plate of missing items didn't arrive until we'd almost finished eating. And I said nothing when our server accidentally delivered our leftovers to a different table where I watched a surprised patron accept my food and put it into his own takeaway bag (the server realized his error as he approached our table WITH THE BILL but WITHOUT my food and had to go back to retrieve leftovers that I no longer wanted, quite frankly).  I even tipped...but poorly.

In all fairness, some of the treats were very tasty, we got some great photos, and the musical selections from the harpist were hilarious/impressive.  If those were the things I'd paid for, I would have been more than satisfied with the experience. I paid for high tea, however, and for the amount of food that was actually present, the way it was ultimately presented, and the service, I can honestly say I was underwhelmed.

If it's ambiance you're looking for, a lot of these reviewers are right, this place offers endless photo ops of old-world glamour.  If, however, you're looking for a decadent, high tea experience that's well worth the money you pay, I would recommend going somewhere else.

title: Disappointing
text:
Stayed at the St Regis for a week. This is not luxury. The courtesy car is a marketing ploy and is never there no matter how long you wait for it. The bell staff/concierge slow, inefficient, and don’t have any alternative practical instant means of luxury transportation. They kept saying they only had one courtesy car. 3 S Classes would done a better job but the Bentley probably sells rooms. 

Unlike proper concierges at hotels in Mayfair or the likes in London, they don’t have any sway with any local restaurants so book yourself and book early.

Food was good, and butler service decent, but bathrooms very old. We had practically no hot water for a week! No formal explanation or apology.

Just another standard hotel sadly still living off of 1904 and memories of old folk who still check in.

title: Exceptional Stay that Sets the Bar for St. Regis Service
text:
Pros:
Butler Service 
House Car (Bentley Mulssane)
Room (Astor Suite)
Concierge Staff
Shower in Bathroom (could use waterfall and shower head at same time)
Bathtub with jets

Cons:
Very very light wear showing in places
Room wasn't ready early

So let me say that I love staying at St. Regis (SR) properties.  This one in NYC has been on my list to get to, but work and personal travel never really took me to NYC.  When the chance came to stay, I jumped on it!  

Best part about my stay was Ameena, the Butler who brought coffee every morning, made sure things were comfortable and checked in on us just enough to make us feel special but not be annoying.  Other than the same Butler I've had down at the Punta Mita Property for years now when I come stay, Ameena was the best!

The house car was a nice touch for quick jaunts around town.  Felt great to step inside the quite comfort of the Mulssane.  I just wish they had one more during peak times so there was more availability.  

The hotel was beautiful in a very classic style that lets you step back in time to the turn of the century with modern amenities (USB outlets, many outlets, cable, good HVAC).

If I had one bone to pick it was that in the shower, there was some paint starting to flake off on the ceiling.  Not a huge deal, and I'm probably the first to bring this up.  

I arrived early, 8AM.  I didn't expect my room to be ready obviously.  But I was hoping they could have given me a time when it would be.  They wouldn't commit to anything other than 4PM which was annoying.  They did call as soon as it became available, but it would have been nice to have some sort of window so I could have planned my day around it.

title: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at
text: From the minute you walk into the lobby you are aware that this is a bucket list hotel. Old school , charming, elegant and luxurious.  A rich history and it does not disappoint.  We got upgraded to a suite that was stunning and had butler service.

title: Special birthday weekend
text:
We have stayed here before, and always enjoy it; which is why we chose it to celebrate our daughter’s 18th birthday. Great location. NYC glamour at its best. 

Our daughter invited several of her friends to stay the weekend with us, and they were graciously upgraded to a lovely two bedroom suite, so they could all be together. The best part was that the actual suite was #1818. Just a funny coincidence, but not lost on us. 

Beautiful accommodations and the staff is fantastic. The St Regis may be considered more of an old world property. But, there is nothing old or outdated about it. The caliber of service and the quality of the amenities exceeds most of its competition at this level. We have stayed at several newer, more contemporary top tier properties in Manhattan. In fairness, some of which are quite excellent. But, the St Regis is still in a league of its own, and very much sets the standard for elegance in NYC. 

Jeanie, at the concierge, is a gem. She took care of all of our dining reservations in advance of our arrival. Some of our requests, were quite challenging, and among the most in demand. She is definitely well connected. Her wealth of knowledge of all things NYC and beyond, is extremely impressive. 

Fantastic weekend overall. We all enjoyed the experience. Most importantly, our daughter and her friends truly had the best time, and loved every minute of their stay. Thank you for making her special birthday, so extra special. The St Regis is still the gold standard for refinement, character and grace in NYC. Truly, truly special.

title: Excellent except for billing issues
text:
This is a lovely hotel, with wonderful rooms, excellent service, etc. However, Marriott has decided to add a $ 50/day room charge to each reservation (not including NY state and city taxes which are unavoidable) as of February 2018. The charge has amenities with it that may or may not be useful, depending on your interest and the length of stay, but the charge and the associated amenities were not revealed to us until check out - which means it was actually just a room rate that was $50 more than quoted when the room was booked. After visiting with the hotel front desk, and American Express (who booked my travel) a few charges were removed but the extra $ 50/day charge remained. If Marriott wants to charge more for the room, then do it from the outset, and not as a hidden check out charge. One item was a $ 50 food and beverage credit, but my bill still had a food charge on it with the credit not applied. 
There was also confusion by the hotel staff, who thought the $ 50 was an American Express charge, which it was not. 
For a 5 star hotel, charge the room rate, supply the expected services and let the consumer choose the rest instead of 'providing' amenities that are actually padding the bill. American Express Travel was very helpful to me in clearing up any discrepancies.
If not for this experience,  I would have given it 5 stars.

title: Un verdadero palacio
text:
Servicio de primera clase, con butler 24hrs. 
Hermoso hotel, la habitación es maravillosa con una enorme cama muy cómoda, tina de hidromasaje en el baño, detalles dorados por toda la habitación que la hacen ver aun mas lujosa, fruta fresca en tu habitación.
El restaurante es delicioso. 
Excelente ubicación a unos pasos de la 5th avenida.

title: NYC in Style!
text:
The St. Regis Hotel is an institution in New York City. Located in the epicenter of Manhattan you will not find a better location to get uptown or downtown from. Luxurious lobby, over the top service, and rooms that are beyond comfortable. You pay for what you get and pay you will do as this property is at the top of the price list when it comes to Hotels in NYC. This is an old school, conservative, establishment but welcoming and friendly at the same time. 

Highly recommend a stay here.

title: Consistent Excellence
text:
We have just moved on from 4 days at the St. Regis.  Our second stay there within a couple of years.  Everything about the property and staff says elegance, class and excellent service.  

We were upgraded (thanks to SPG Suite Nights) to a Deluxe Suite which gave us plenty of room.  The room was well cared for, furnishings nicely done and bedding very comfortable.

Housekeeping was impeccable.  Concierges knowledgeable and helpful.  Got us a reservation at sold out La Masseria next door to Walter Kerr  Theater where we saw Bruce on Broadway.

Breakfast at Astor Court was impeccable 3 mornings out of 4.  Tasty, hot food served promptly and as ordered.  Today (Saturday), it was as if the D Team had been brought in.  Very slow service, items ordered not served or wrong items served.  Our order taken after those who arrived after us.  Staff very apologetic when we brought this to their attention and blamed it on "everybody waking up at the same time."  Maybe but that shouldn't happen here.  

All in all, a very nice stay.  We'll be back.

title: 48 Hours of AWESOMENESS
text:
My wife and I were in town for couple days and taking in a Springsteen concert.

Our first time at this hotel and will not be our last. I told my wife, as we were heading to JFK this morning I don’t think ai can come to NYC and not stay at St. Regis, ever.  

From the time of arrival till departure 5 + STARS.  The Butler service is simply the very best.  Quite and very private rooms; worth every penny. 

If you stay elsewhere in NYC is have not made a wise choice!

title: Perfection
text: Our two night stay was wonderful! The room was gorgeous and exceptionally clean. The bed was very comfortable, and the blackout curtains kept the room completely dark.  The King Cole Bar downstairs was the perfect place to get a drink before a show.

title: Wow!
text: I loved everything about this property! Services were over the top, staff went out of their way, location was excellent, everything was luxurious. I would highly recommend and will definitely stay here again on my next visit!

title: St Regis NY Knows Service
text:
Currently suffering through a below-average experience at the St. Regis Punta Mita longing for the stellar service provided at the St. Regis NY, realizing I never left a review for our trip to the St. Regis NY.  So, a few months late, but here you go.

Let me explain what I mean by stellar service...

Wife and I spent a long weekend at the St. Regis for our anniversary.  I bought her a dress from her favorite designer in NY.  When I called the St. Regis, they not only arranged for a courier to have it delivered, but also held it until our arrival with a promise it would be waiting in our room.  Upon arrival, the front desk realized the bad had not been dropped, told us our room was not ready, and proceeded to walk us directly to the dining room for a complimentary drink.  One drink turned into two (each) and we decided to have a few appetizers.  At some point, I stepped aside to find a restroom and was intercepted by the concierge with a room key and a confirmation the dress was on the bed.  When the bill arrived, the total was $0.  

The rest of the weekend was more of the same.  Every time we returned from an outing, they quickly opened doors, helped with bags, etc.  The staff has a way of being both incredibly helpful AND non-existent.  They know when to step in and when to leave you alone.  I wish I could remember all of their names...they all deserve so much credit for the experience this hotel creates.

title: Beautiful and charming
text: The St Regis NY is a beautiful and "classy" lady that's been around for some time.  Nevertheless, the hotel has done a superb job of keeping the hotel amenities looking sharp and beautiful.  The daily butler service is always a nice touch to treat yourself at this hotel a few blocks south of Central Park in Mid-town.  The King Cole Bar is always a pleasant but beware that the drinks are priced to the location ($25) for a Bloody Mary.  The staff were all on point, friendly and attentive!  Definitely a special place in Mid-town.

title: exactly what life should be like
text: This hotel is absolute, ultimate perfection from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave. Exquisitely elegant, and kind of intimate since its not a very big hotel. The room was fabulous, spacious, perfect temperature. We had a butler assigned that responded immediately to any request. I sent something for dry cleaning and got it back within 12 hours. The high tea was very nice, and breakfast delicious (don't leave without trying their French toast!)

title: True Food/Beverage and Service Excellence and Spectacular Astor Suite Stay at the Original St Regis
text:
After spending more than 2 weeks of work throughout the East Coast, I met my husband in New York at the St Regis New York for a weekend of sheer extravagance.

This was our first stay at the original St Regis since its complete renovation in 2013. To us, the renovation was quite successful in blending the classic Beaux Arts tradition of this legendary hotel with the more modern amenities and style of a contemporary luxury hotel. Still, having been to over a dozen different St. Regis properties throughout the world in recent years, the St. Regis New York still reveals a more formal atmosphere than most of its brand counterparts. We, however, are anything but formal in our manner--and we felt wonderfully comfortable and welcome throughout our stay.

Because we rarely get to New York, I decided to really splurge. I chose this weekend since I was able to get a very good $600 rate for an entry level room, which also made me optimistic for our chances for an upgrade using 2 Suite Night Awards; we were confirmed for the Astor Suite upgrade the Sunday before our Friday arrival.

I also booked Table 55 in the St. Regis' legendary King Cole Bar for our Friday night dinner. The St Regis concierge team booked us famed Eleven Madison Park for our Saturday night dinner with friends, as well as a table at the nearby Rose Bar at the Gramercy Park Hotel for drinks before dinner. All in all, this weekend was to be a total splurge in food and beverage--and it was that and more!

The St. Regis New York is as decadent as its legendary past would suggest. Even after the renovation, the hotel's tradition is obvious in the lobby, while the Astor Court restaurant, King Cole Bar, and even hallways and our Astor Suite truly exuded the combination of classic with modern elegance that showcases the success of the renovation.

Our Astor Suite was spacious, elegant, and extremely comfortable. Despite its 5th floor location, there was plentiful natural light--and the wall mirrors were used to excellent effect to further brighten the rooms and make them feel even more spacious. Only the small shower room was a slight negative to the suite. Water pressure was excellent, and the air con worked wonders, cooling it down to my preferred 65 F without any issue.

The Table 55 experience in the hotel's King Cole Bar was one of the most memorable dining experiences we've ever had. The food/beverage at the Astor Court restaurant were very impressive, especially with breakfast. 

The St Regis New York is one of our all-time best hotel stays in the world, joining other favorites like Amangiri, Amanjiwo, Singita Boulders, St Regis San Francisco, Hotel Imperial Vienna, Gritti Palace Venice, La Residence Franschhoek, etc. Amazing. We can't wait to return.

title: Wonderful experience!
text:
Amazing, memorable, perfect!

Hugo was amazing at st. Regis. He really took great care of us and helped us have such a memorable stay at the always wonderful St. regis! Especially because it was our toddler’s first time their we had a great time.

THANK YOU Hugo and St.Regis!

title: Lovely stay at the St. Regis NYC
text: Stayed at this hotel as part of my wife's birthday celebration. As a spg platinum member, was upgraded to a large/lovely suite and was welcomed with complementary champagne, strawberries and chocolate!  As expected from a hotel class such as the St. Regis - the service was impeccable - our butler warmly greeted us and  brought us coffee when we arrived. The suite was very up-to-date (e.g. USB outlets, automated lightings, lightning cables for IPhones, etc.) while maintaining the glory/details for the original beaux-arts architecture of the hotel.  The Bentley house car was certainly a nice feature/touch. Overall, a lovely and pampered stay at this St. Regis!

title: An Excellent Breakfast
text: The hotel restaurant provided an excellent breakfast experience. My colleagues and I were promptly seated when we arrived. The waiter was very attentative, but not overbearing. He provided the ideal environment for a business breakfast. The menu had several options that met the various dietary needs of our party. The food was exceptional. All of my expectations were exceeded.  I am looking forward to my next early morning meeting at the St. Regis.

title: Superb
text: If you want to visit New York City,this is the hotel where you want to stay and enjoy the excellent service in all departments. Butler service on every floor they're ready to serve you with anything you want to have private meetings,everything is there with excellent service.

title: Everything they write about and more
text: From the Butler service (1 per floor!) to the house Bentley, the St Regis New York did not disappoint. Make sure to see the old memorabilia downstairs by the restaurant. Recognizing the history of the St Regis will accentuate your stay. Also, have an employee tell you the story about the painting in the King Cole Bar. Incredible.

title: ランチ楽しめました
text: 内装がクラシックで楽しくランチできました。エントランスから地下に行きショッピングアーケードも見どころ。内装外装ともに素晴らしいです。

title: Excellent 5* Stay at StR New York
text: We stayed 4 nights at the StR in February and had a wonderful stay. Our last trip we stayed down the street at the Ritz Central Park and the St. Regis stands far above. We were upgraded to one of their Madison Suites due to our status, which was a gracious and much appreciated upgrade. The upgrade was very generous and goes to show how they truly respect SPG recognition which builds brand loyalty. The room was elegant, luxurious and spacious, especially by NY standards. Even though we didn't use much, our butlers throughout were great and accommodating and genuinely wanted to help. We enjoyed breakfast at Astor and enjoyed Jessie's kind service. We enjoyed a King Cole Bar as well. Overall, the stay exceeded our expectations. We will return soon.

title: 410 room
text: She was very good , perfect in cleaning thankyou may , the vew was very nice and perfect thankyou st.regis i engoyed my stay in st. Regis with my friends and my family my vist was for my friends wedding

title: Amazing Wedding Event
text: Wow.  Spectacular. Amazing. Incredible.  I was able to attend a recent wedding at the St Regis for a local NY couple.  The hotel and it's staff did an impeccable job with the entire event. Food, catering, music and venue were top notch.  Front desk, concierge and bellmen were always present and more than willing to assist as needed.  Housekeeping staff was attentive, professionally groomed and always courteous.  Banquet staff was efficient and always available to take care of our needs.  Our friends couldn't stop raving about the wedding and the beautiful bride and groom.

title: NYC top hotel
text: St. Regis NYC never disappoints.  I've stayed at many of the 5 star hotels in NYC and nothing compares to the  service, accommodations and location of The St. Regis NYC!  The location is perfect for restaurants and shopping, and the staff never disappoints with the wonderful service they consistently have.  All hotels in NYC are pricey, but St.  Regis is absolutely worth it!

title: Still the best.
text: Got upgraded to magnificent suite. An 01 with living room and two full bathrooms. Still our favorite hotel in New York City. The King Cole bar is cool too. There is always good people watching there too. FYI, concierge is terrific.

title: Stayed at neighbor hotel, but stopped for lunch
text:
Stopped for lunch one day and was not impressed. 

Staff was more concerned with having a laugh with eachother instead of serving their guests. Does not make you wanna stay here as a guest. 

Hotel itself is very nice and has a gorgeous ceiling.

Maybe i was unlucky, but the lunch experience was not up to the standard the hopefully have.

title: Great, if pricey, hotel.
text:
We live in New Jersey. From time-to-time we make the run into "The City" for dinner, a show, etc.. For many years now, we stay exclusively at the St. Regis.

The primary reason to choose the St. Regis is the location. It's close to all the action--from Rockefeller Center and St. Patricks to the theater district and Times Square, Central Park, and the Trump buildings--but it's just a bit off 5th avenue. As a consequence, it feels more relaxed and secluded than some of the hotels that sit closer to, or in, Times Square. The staff is first-class, as is the facility and attention to detail. The restaurant and room service are excellent, although there are plenty of first-class options within a short walk from the hotel. 

In short, it's everything you'd expect in a very nice, iconic Manhattan address. And you will pay for all that! It is quite expensive, and it will almost never compete strictly on price. If you're coming in from out of town for an extended stay, consider someplace else. If you're celebrating a special occasion, you may want to splurge on the Regis.

title: Super nice - not worth the price
text:
Spent 5 days here recently, certainly not for the value conscience consumer. It is clean, nice, upscale = they have a Bentley which will drive you within 10 blocks of hotel in style.

Doormen were great/attentive and nice. Staff was nice, wasn't sure what to do with the butler service - aside from having coffee show up within minutes of request each morning which was very nice touch. Judging by the number of shoes deposited in the hallway each evening I am guessing they shine your shoes, me - I make sure my shoes are shined before going out of town to attend business meetings.

$27 for a bloody mary that quite frankly wasn't that great - the bar does have a swank upscale atmosphere and was full most nights with no place to sit. Found a nice Irish pub a block away for a beer that was quite nice. Polo Bar across street requires reservations just to get in the front door. 

I really have no complaints other than the value, at these prices I would definitely stay at the Ritz or Trump before staying here again. At this price range I prefer to have a view.

title: Over the top gorgeous
text:
We booked a last minute stay in New York and opted for the St. Regis, which we were pleasantly surprised was available.  We were not disappointed with probably the nicest room we have had anywhere.  We received a room upgrade that was divine.  The hotel was quiet and peaceful.  The linens, towels and bathroom amenities were all top notch.  

I have no recommendations or complaints from a flawless stay.

title: My favorite hotel! A beautiful upgrade & an amazing butler!
text:
My best friend and I had made plans at the St Regis for an event in NYC. The next day there was an issue that forced us to change rooms after we settled in. It was a very busy weekend so I wasn't looking forward to that, but they went above and beyond our expectations to rectify the mix up. Upon being upgraded to a magnificent suite they also gave us a bottle of champagne and a dessert. 

The icing on the cake was our most incredible and sweet Butler, Nestor who was so helpful throughout our busy weekend. I had to get a a couple buttons sewn on a dress and he made it happen on a Saturday even tho the tailor was only working mon-fri. He made sure our clothes were pressed before the events and took pictures for us. The entire staff was so kind and accommodating. The rooms are beautiful.This was my first time staying at the St Regis and I am looking forward to my next stay already!

title: Terribly disappointing
text: Our stay at the St. Regis in NYC was supposed to be a luxurious family getaway.  Instead, it was one of the few disappointments of an otherwise terrific trip.  The rooms weren't ready when promised, the bellman brought up the wrong luggage and then couldn't find ours, and we paid $110 for two grilled cheese sandwiches, some french fries, and a few bottles of water.  The service in the restaurant at breakfast was unfriendly and unwelcoming, despite the fact that breakfast (with NO adult beverages) cost $280 for 5 people.   We waited a very long time to get a drink in the bar area one evening, and finally decided to leave and go around the corner to an alternate watering hole.  All in all, I am a platinum Starwood member because I like the brands and travel a lot, but I booked an alternate high-end hotel in NYC for my next trip and won't return to this property.

title: Fin de semana en nueva york
text: Recien remodelado y siempre mantenido no sin ser una de las mejores ubicaciones para ir caminando a todos lados del Manhattan  su cercania a madison al av americas a muchos restaurantes a central park lo hacen muy comodo , asi como sus habitaciones de muy comodo tamaño. El restaurante delicioso para desayuno o lunch o cena. Un lugar sin duda comodo y bien ubicado

title: Loved this hotel
text: We couldn't have chosen a better place to stay while in NYC!  Great location and staff!  We had several conversations with butler for our floor. Very nice!  Our room was very large compared to most rooms in NYC!  Very close to 5th avenue shopping and Central Park.  Loved the access to the Bentley to take us to the Theater District. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Sweet upgrade
text: For my wife's birthday weekend the St. Regis upgraded is to a suite that seemed larger than any apartment I ever had in NYC. SPG points are ok. But they gave me bonus husband points. The butler was a nice touch too.

title: Lunch in Lobby Lounge
text:
The St. Regis is a top notch hotel on every level. The service was impeccable. The concierge was efficient, polite and remarkably understanding—almost empathetic. The hotel is in New York. Toss out the stereotypes. 

Food and drink were high quality, as expected. 

The spectacular takeaway was the superb service staff. On a bone chilling day, a witty and respectful man lit a fire. A guest spilled a teapot and it was cleaned, replaced and was seamlessly handled so as not to cause a skipped beat in the business discussion. What skill and understanding!

title: Amazing stay at the St. Regis
text: This was our second time staying here. The first time was amazing and somehow this time was even better. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the people that work here. Everyone bent over backwards to make our stay special. We cannot wait until our next visit.

title: 素晴らしいホテル
text:
スタッフの方々は明るく親切。
朝食も大変美味しかった。
夕方ホテルに帰ると、熱くて美味しいホットチョコレートとアップルサイダーがフロント付近に準備されていました。厳寒のニューヨーク 旅行だったので、ありがたかった。
必ずまた泊まりたいです。

title: Classic building, mostly spectacular service, skip the food
text:
We spent 5 nights here in a regular room in December.  

The good:  We loved the building's character, and old NYC charm.  The location can't be beat.  The butlers were overall very helpful, especially Emina.  The car service is lovely, and the driver we had (Robert) was very nice.  The concierges were interacted with (I have forgotten names) were both superb.  Housekeeping was OUTSTANDING after the first night.  Very much appreciated.  The bell staff and doormen were also mostly really great.  We felt very welcomed most of the time we interacted with staff.

The not as good: A few minor misses upon entering room for the first time - there was some debris from prior guests.  One of the butlers didn't provide the same great service as the others.  Nothing to be totally fussed about, but these misses stand out all the more against the otherwise stellar service.  Really the only true disappointment was that we weren't impressed by our Room Service breakfast at all - best to skip.

Overall, we really enjoyed our time here and do recommend if it fits your NYC plans.

title: Environmentally disappointing
text: Although the St Regis is a lovely hotel in a good location we have avoided staying here for the last couple of years because they continue to use bath gel with microbeads. We are here on a business conference and I am disappointed to see they are still using the same product. Marriott corporate needs to pay attention to customers desires and doing more to improve the world environment they profit from!

title: Perfect part of our honeymoon!
text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our multi-city/country honeymoon and it did not disappoint! We had a deluxe suite, Room 507 that faces 55th street. The Christmas holiday season was in full swing, and we were in the midst of it. The entire suite was well appointed with beautiful chandeliers, fabrics, crown molding, and marble surfaces.
