Pros: very quiet room (even though it faced the street), excellent butler service, fresh fruit and bowls of chocolate refreshed daily, spacious rooms, sliding doors to close off the bedroom from the sitting room, in the bathroom: a separate WC and double sinks, delicious full breakfasts (in the restaurant or in-room), a sitting room, powder room and coat closet to help us entertain our guests. The one con: the sitting room had a fireplace, but it was not functioning.

title: Concierge service was awesome!
text: A long weekend in the city to see Billy Joel and explore the city. Frederick at the concierge desk was awesome! So helpful and delightful! He engaged in conversation and was as pleasant as could be! Our room was just perfect!

title: Frequent traveller who loves this hotel!
text: We make FREQUENT trips to NYC for the weekend.  We decided to stay here for our annual December holiday trip-the first weekend of December.  When we arrived there was a line at check-in but we were quickly greeted by someone who checked us in right away.  Our room was beautiful and clean.  I slept very well here-I did not hear the street noise that is typical in NYC.  Bathroom is large-well designed-perfect for a family.  Because it was the first weekend in December things were beginning to get very busy for the holidays.  We were so busy we forgot to make dinner reservations.  It took the concierge a few attempts but he was able to secure us reservations in a delicious restaurant-their service was excellent.  I am sorry to not have noted this concierge's name as he truly deserves to be acknowledged.  I also have to note how welcoming Jessie Jonas was to us in the restaurant!  Our schedule was very tight and she allowed us to sit in the restaurant before it was open for breakfast.  We were able to order our food and make it for the early skate session at Rockefeller Center.  Her service was above and beyond-our food was delicious.  I would definitely stay here again-it is a true please.  Great service-beautiful rooms-helpful staff-quiet-I could go on and on.

title: It lives up to the hype, and more!  great for families.
text: We decided to stay at the St. Regis because of its history and legendary status.  Salvador Dali used to stay/live there, the bloodymary was invented there, etc, etc.  The location is perfect for shopping, the park, and for cultural events like the MoMA.  The rooms are spacious, renovated and with great style.  The shower has great pressure. There is a complimentary Bentley which is very often available to take you around.  we took it 3 times and did not have to reserve or wait long.  What a perk!  The staff is great and the attention to detail unmatched.  They have a great program for families, including picnics at Central park.  Every kid is greeted with a present by the front desk.  What a delight of a stay it was.

title: Sopping wet rug, inadequate response
text:
When we checked into our room, we found large wet areas around the sofa and chair in our room. Not damp, but sopping wet. We called the front desk and eventually spoke with manager Natalie, who told us we couldn't move to another room as the hotel was full. It wasn't that late in the day, so I don't understand why we couldn't move and let them get the room ready for a later check-in. It should never have been put into service. She promised to refund half the points we used for the room (trying to burn points before SPG devalues them again), but refunded less than half. She sent housekeeping supervisor Alex up to look at the wet areas.

Alex assured us the soaking carpet was the result of cleaning them. We hope he was correct and it wasn't some other fluid. He assured us the carpet would be dry when we returned from dinner. It wasn't. Still too wet to walk on without shoes the following day. So, we couldn't really use a good part of our room for 24 hours. He offered to send up a bottle of wine. Nice, except it didn't come. We finally called and asked them to hold it until a certain time as we wanted to nap without disruption. That time came and went, no wine. So we called again. We were finally rewarded with a bottle that probably cost them $10. Wow!

Every day we were there except the day we checked out, housekeeping would ring our bell in the morning and then immediately enter the room without waiting. One day, a second person just came into the room probably one minute after we told the other person to wait until later. No knocking, no ringing, just entered. Our bolt wasn't on because we had just had coffee service. This behavior is not acceptable in a luxury hotel.

So, not a good experience here. BTW, we found the lobby to be dark, cramped and chaotic.

title: A 16th Birthday Epic Stay
text:
Many thanks to the entire staff of the St Regis for making my daughter’s 16th birthday a smashing success. Melanie, Head of Rooms, helped me arrange an amazing suite for the girls. They spent the better part of the afternoon taking Instagram photos and selfies in the suite. 

The hotel has been beautifully refurbished with all the modern day luxuries (electronic lights and iPhone charger next to the bed). The rooms are fantastic and luxurious. 
Butler served us coffee in bed in the morning. 

Special thanks to Abagail at the front desk too. The desserts were delicious when the girls got back from their night out. 

Stay here and you won’t be disappointed. Great location and amazing property!

title: Great Location
text:
We had 2 rooms at the St. Regis. The rooms are beautiful but very small window(s) so basically you have no light.
There is NO lobby and no spa at this hotel which was unpleasant. 
The concierge service was very helpful and excellent. 
Nice hotel but could have been much better for the money they charge.

title: Fancy
text: Stopped in for mimosas and coffee while shopping in 5th Avenue. Where else can you get a Veuve Cliquot Mimosa?? Beautiful, nostalgic, old world.  They also have a Nat King Cole Bar with wonderful history.

title: Some hits, some misses
text:
The rooms are nice---small, but typical for NYC.  Amenities are fairly limited---it's an old building, so don't expect a pool, spa, nice balconies, etc.  Service was inconsistent, and our experience in the restaurant (Astor Court) was abysmal.  

Check-in was smooth.  Limited SPG Platinum recognition, but there rarely is in NYC at peak times.  And they were very kind to our young children.      

Cleaning services were superb.  Twice-a-day and very thorough.

Butlers were mostly good.  Nestor, in particular, was fantastic, and elevated our entire experience with his geniality and attention to detail.  But a few times we called and no one responded or no one came.  On one occasion there was a burst pipe, so the no-show was probably excusable, but other occasions were head-scratchers.  And it's also mostly an excessively complicated method for getting, e.g., some coffee, water, or ice.  (And with weird restrictions---i.e., no coffee after noon.  I'd much rather just have an in-room Nespresso.)

Breakfast in Astor Court was a two-hour ordeal that no one should endure.  We ate downstairs solely to enjoy their famous Bloody Marys.  The Bloody Mary was good (not great), but after getting our drinks, the entire staff vanished.  While delivering our drinks, we tried to order meal, but with a quick, "excuse me," our waitress left to attend to a new table of (VIPs?) nearby.  The new table had their meals before we even saw someone again to take our order.  It took more than an hour to get our food---and the order was wrong.  Waffles with strawberries and cream for our daughter was waffles with raspberries and syrup.  Over-medium eggs were over-easy.  Our juice never came, and the coffee we got with our initial order was never refilled.  And we never saw another person.  After two hours, I took the kids upstairs (who very patiently sat through this nightmare!) and my wife waited for another coffee.  When she finally found someone, she just got the check.  We hoped we could at least get coffee in the room, only to hear that we were now past the noon-limit.  Some policy!  

We stayed at the Park Hyatt the same time last year, and this dramatically underperformed that experience.  It was half the Park Hyatt's price this trip, but if they're comparably priced, it's not close.

title: smile is perfect,but
text:
I have stayed for New Year's Holiday.
I was looking forward to visiting this hotel very very much. 
and I requested to them that I would like a high floor at their web site while reservation. 
as a result,my timeline on arrival day is following.

11:30 arrival at Hotel,and deposit luggage.
         the representative of reception said"We accept your request".
         at this time.
15:45 Challenge for the first check-in.
　　　But the another representative told me that Check-intime start
　　　from 16:00.

          new another representative said
        "the inspection of your room hasn't complete yet. 
         wait for several minute"
         the long line made by waiting check-in people were 
         appeared from this time.

         next another representative said
        "the inspection isn't yet.wait for 5-10min".

the room assigned to me was...the most lowest floor(3rd).
there are 20 floors in this hotel and I had requested higher floor
since 2 month ago,But the answer was the most lowest level.
I was so sad...so sad. the attached picture is the View from this room.

If the assigned floor was 4th floor,I think I was saved from this sadness.
But 3rd...the most lowest floor to the guest who request high floor.

I know this season is very busy.
I don't want to complain more than that.

The hospitality and smile of their staffs were very good.
I'll stay this hotel again.maybe this month.

title: Should have been 5 star, but...
text:
This is one of my favorite hotels in the world. I have stayed several times. This time, my wife and I stayed 4 nights from 12-26 through 12-30. She is a platinum SPG member.

Checkin was horrific! We didn't get a room until almost 6 pm and several people got involved and kept screwing things up further and further. Finally, we were given an Astor suite, which is wonderful, but the process left a lot to be desired. 

The heat in the room was not working for 5 hours one day and it was 59 degrees in the room. A small heater was to be brought up, but it took forever. We decided to go out in 14 degree temperature. When we returned to the room, the little heater was there. However, the hotel had repaired the issue by that time.

Breakfast was an included benefit for our platinum status, which was great! Except they charged us and we had to call and argue before checkout to get it removed. It shouldn't be that difficult.

The manager of rooms called to apologize and offer us some goodwill points for the issues we experienced. I have had to call them because there is a screwup there too.

Everyone is very nice. The bar is my favorite in NYC, but this was a frustrating stay. We were given a voucher for dessert at the restaurant for our frustrations.

title: Well understood luxury in the best possible location in NYC
text:
A piece of the Old World in the very heart of the World capital city. With all the confort and amenities of the most modern hotel, they manage to keep the attentive service of the tradditional great luxury hotels.
Nothing is left to improvisation, starting from breakfast which, rather than joining the overwhelming majority of luxury hotels offering generous self-service plus Cooking corners, stays with a-la-carte presentation, offering haute-cuisine dishes for any possible desire.
Beds and linen provide the best possible rest, for which staying in an upper floor is highly recommendable in the noisy NYC.
The hotel Bentley is another remarkable differentiation element that is offered complimentary for very short rides (10 blocks).
But, above all, service is more than five stars. Looks like every hotel employee has been selected based on his or her customer approach as each of them, without exception makes you feel really welcomed.

title: Thanks Shelome
text: We had such a great time spending New Years Eve here last year we decided to take our friend Sarah and Michael and Rachel with us this year. We were treated to the best of service as usual. We await our next visit. Thanks as well to Molly D and a shout out to Kevin in Room service.

title: Promises Broken with a Smile
text:
Checked in yesterday three rooms, two on miles and one on cash.  Used 4 suite upgrades and was confirmed in Astor Suite and, suite nights deducted from my balance.  Upon check in the suite was not offered and only explained it wasnt availabe, broken promise with a nice smile and that was it.  we argued at the check in for two hours before unwilling accepting the room offered as it was 10 F and we could look for alternatives with kids.  Went to the Standard Rooms offered and the keys didn't work in two of three rooms, very dissappointing.  Went back down and got new keys and tried again and again the doors would not open?  Went back down to the desk and again the new keys were made and once again they didnt work?  Finally security came up and re-programmed the doors.  Once security guard stated the batteries were dead which seemed highly improbable as both doors batteries expired at the same time???  Another story with a smile, yes a plain lie.  The other security guard advised us there was VIP guest that had the doors specially programmed and the special program was not removed, yes another lie.  Even for NY standards this is bull.
I will never stay in this hotel again in fact I am switching some room nights to Hilton Hotel as the SPG program has become a joke "Platinum means nothing, and the St Regis confimed that by saying we have over 50 members in house now, so you have no real advantage anymore you are just another guest to be abused and taken advantage of
GOOD BYE ST REGIS

title: Magical Weekend
text:
I do not typically write reviews for TripAdvisor, but my stay was so magical that I dusted off this account to say thank you for a magical weekend.

We spent my birthday at the St Regis NYC.  We typically travel to a warmer location to celebrate, but had a baby this past May and decided to stay closer.  The moment we walked through the door we were treated like royalty.  We were upgraded to a suite and they brought a beautiful Birthday cake to the room, our butler, the famous Nestor, even sang.  Every member of staff went out of their way to be kind and loving to us.  

The hotel itself is glossy with old world charm and glows with beauty.  To soak it such beauty makes a trip wholesome and soul affirming. We skipped half our plans just to enjoy the ambiance.

We were given onesies for our little one and they went to extra mile to make sure that we got where we needed to go (in a Maybach) on New Years Eve.

Thank you for making my birthday weekend so special :).

title: Not what it used to be,disappointed.
text:
I like traveling to New York at least twice a year,for the holidays and springtime.The St.Regis brings fond memories of my children when they were little,it has of course an unbeatable location and the building itself is beautiful.I also love that the rooms are classically decorated (Recently nicely renovated)the beds are wonderful too,nevertheless I think it has lost it’s true soul.Years ago,service was impeccable.
We stayed many times along the years but about 3 years ago stop coming to this hotel because that last time we were here We did not get our room until after 3 hours,and the service was not what it used to,so the following trips I went to my other 2 favorite hotels nearby.
But this time again nostalgia convince me to come back to the St Regis and so I made the reservation (I was traveling with my two daughters and my son)through my credit card travel service which entitles me for a room upgrade when available,early check in,late checkout etc.
We arrived at 2:30 p.m.,I asked if there was an upgrade available,José at front desk said no unfortunately but offered what he called another type of room for an upgrade at an extra price I declined.Rooms were not ready,no time frame in sight,gave my phone number to be called when ready so we went to the restaurant to wait.The hostess was not particularly nice as we asked to be seated (there were tables available but she was playing to be interesting and made us wait,finally we got a table at The Bar section)One hour,no room.Two hours,no call.I called  at 5:15 pm(by then I was at my tea reservation at The Plaza Hotel,the rooms were still,not ready.I then requested to talk to the manager and I explained her how we still had no room she said there were no rooms available because I had asked for next door rooms which I had not so she said there was one available and she would grant an upgrade on one of the two rooms(the room upgrade that supposedly was not available when we arrived)the second room was there not ready yet,so with no rush we walked back to the hotel,picked up the key to the room that was available at that time,and waited another half an hour for the second room to be ready.
The following is a short tale with my one time encounter with the butler:Some years ago they used to have a lint roller on the closet as I remembered,and my black winter coat had some lint on it,so I looked for it but could not find it,I called the butler to pick up the breakfast and I asked him for it,he said he would look for one to bring me and said something like:”people thought they could take it as a souvenir and it is not meant for that”He then came to pick up the breakfast room service table without the roller and notified me the maid service was out by 3(not planning on staying in the room of course)I did not appreciate his comments as I found them rude rather than informative;he took his time to bring the roller,I was gone by then and found it on my room as we came back.I never saw him again.I did bring the lint roller down to front desk when I checked out,I did tell my story to the lady at the front desk and asked her to please make sure the butler knew it was given to her and no,I was certainly not interested to take it with me.
Neither he or other butler were seen around our rooms,on my children’s room their butler never showed up(not that they were needed,but they are supposed to be one of the “highlights “ at the hotel)
Now a tale on room service:The first night we ordered room service,chicken soup was salty,the cloth was stained with the hot chocolate we ordered,whipped cream was nowhere to be seen.Salad was just ok.
Breakfast was dull,I really don’t understand how scramble eggs can turned to be so bad.I decided I would only order continental.
Showercaps:I was aloud to have one,never to be replaced,coffee table got a stain from a glass,never to be cleaned again during my stay.
There are some employees with big attitudes,like the butler I mentioned earlier the hostess and a waiter at the restaurant,as a guest people come to enjoy the place,create memories with their family and chose this hotel to spend their money,this choice should be appreciated and personal egos should not be a part of this equation.
The St.Regis is such a jewel,service should be again top priority.

title: Not 5 star service
text:
We stayed at the St Regis for our 3rd time. This was our first visit at Christmas. We came to see New York City all decked out for Xmas. The City did its job. Too bad the staff at this 5 star hotel did not do so well.
Whenever we asked a question or had a request for the staff the reply always started with "You have to realize that we are very busy".
Perhaps the hotel was unaware that Xmas is a busy time but that their service needs to be the same for whether they are fully booked or not  booked. They have to add staff to handle the business. At Check In registration we only saw two receptionists on duty.
When we called for ice from our 1 bedroom suite with butler service we only had to wait 1 hour for it to be delivered. "You have to realize we are busy was the response".
We liked our suite which had 1and1/2 bath. The bed was comfortable. The shades kept the room dark in the morning.
Our previous visits were great but not this one. And there will not be another.

title: Wow!
text: This was my first stay at the St Regis and while pricey, all I can say is WOW!  Facility was immaculate and appeared freshly-minted in every regard.  Staff was about as amazing as you could ever ask.  Food was amazing, even room service.  If you have the cash or points, do not miss.

title: The BEST of the BEST in NYC
text:
Rm 735 

Abby and Sarah took care of us and fielded my incessant emails and calls with tremendous patience and kindness. On the busiest day at the hotel this season, they found a solution to our problem and made room for us. We were skeptical at first but soon realized we were very comfortable in our beautiful and cozy room. They, like the staff, took care of us so well we found it very hard to leave. We were missing our dear Daniela Cataldo but she has left guests in expert hands.

Concierges Domenic, Robert and our fav McKinley took expert care of us. They spent time on the phone, prior to arrival, advising us on how best to navigate the holiday traffic and provide the best first Christmas trip for my mom. McKinley lives, breathes and dreams everything New York. Having his guidance was gold. We did everything he advised. In his words, it was  “just the right amount of Christmas” for her. You were so right. Thank you, Ainsley. You are indeed wonderful. 

The St Regis takes service and customer care to a high art. There is nothing that they won’t do to please the guests. Our butlers ( THANK YOU wonderful Dafa!), housekeepers, room service ( John is THE BEST) and fabulous bellmen. You are ALL the best team in the world and we’ve been to quite a few hotels. We applaud how seemless you make it all feel. 

The cherry on top was gifts of our fav champagne and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us when we came back on our last night. Thank you for your thoughtfulness, Sarah and Abby. We were so touched. Our family was totally spoiled and cared for. How could we stay anywhere but at The St Regis when we come to NYC? And how can we be anything but loyal to the Starwood brand? The fantastic extras of being platinum like the late check out and complimentary breakfasts don’t justify staying elsewhere. Membership and loyalty has its advantages. They really do. 

Thank you all at The St. Regis NYC. You made my 75 year old mother’s first dream trip to NYC beyond special and absolutely perfect.

title: Sadly, Not the Brand Standard
text:
Definitely strong elements to this property, but it fell short of "best hotel in New York" and what I'd hope for from the brand flagship. You expect seamless service at this level, and there were a number of "misses" that disappointed; While SPG recognition is very strong, overall value-for-money doesn't get there. If you're staying on points, I'd suggest the Chatwal instead. If not, consider the Peninsula. 

Pros: 

-Location: close to central park, midtown if staying for business, on 5th if you want to shop
-Rooms: Stayed in the Madison Suite, and renovations showed well. Comfortable, somewhat modern while retaining the beaux arts, gilded heritage. Fili D'oro sheets and comfortable bedding. 
-SPG recognition: Granted early check in at noon, a suite upgrade (+ 1), and fresh fruit in the room (although, delivered quite late). 
-Service: Select butlers provided fantastic service, but it depends on who's working that day (see below)

Cons:

-Front Desk: Found the reception short staffed - waited at least 5 minutes for someone to show up several times we needed something. Granted late check out but subsequently received a letter asking us to check out in exchange for 3k points. We obliged, but it felt unprofessional. 
-Valet Parking: They charge by time, not by night -- but they provide no warning as such. Given we showed up early, our parking time exceeded 24 hours, so we were charged the non-prorated $89 for an extra night. I've probably valet'd over 500 hotel nights, and I've never once had that issue. While this may be standard in the city, they should - at minimum - provide a warning. $89 for a few hours puts a bad taste in your mouth walking away. 
-Staff Miscommunication: I had requested a roll-away bed before we arrived, which we confirmed at check in. By 8 pm, the bed had not arrived; we mentioned it to the butler, and after arriving back from dinner, a bed had been placed in the room. Then ten minutes later, hospitality knocked at the door with a second roll-away -- which we turned away. 
-Hit-or-Miss Butlers: In general, I make sparse use of the service. However, at check-in, the butler is meant to take their time to explain the services (e.g., unpacking, coffee, pressing, etc) and ensure you are settled in. Ours whisked us into the room, offered coffee and then, walking out, only mentioned "oh, and we can press your items, if you want."  We then realized only one of the bathrooms had bath salts, and after calling and asking him if they could re-stock it, he put the phone on hold, came back and simply said, "no, sorry we're out." That said, the next two days we were assigned different individuals, and they were noticeably better.
-Technology: I plugged my phone into the bed-side Bose to charge, only to realize the unit turns off with the lights, so my phone was on fumes when I woke up. Also, centralized controls are more limited/antiquated than other StR properties.  
-Views: This is the inheritance of an old New York building, but windows were small and sparse, so natural light was limited. 

Bottom line, it's a beautiful hotel in an old building with a mix of phenomenal and sub-par service. At this price, consistency is key, and this property doesn't hold water.

title: Short, But Lovely Stay
text:
This was our first stay at the St Regis New York, at Two East 55th Street. We have stayed at several St Regis properties, and some, like Aspen, San Francisco, and Washington DC, many times. We’ll be staying at the latter next week, then back at the St Regis San Francisco in a month.

We were informed that at the end of a long, two-continent trip, we needed to attend two formal events in NYC, before returning home. Because of its proximity to the event venues, and the brand, we chose the St Regis New York, and had a very nice, albeit short stay.

First, in our experience, each St Regis property has been unique. There have been some similarities, such as many being in historical, and wonderfully remodeled buildings, excellent service and charming, lovely rooms, have kept us coming back to the brand. The St Regis New York continued in that vein.

As our flight was arriving at EWR at 2:05pm, we were going to have to hurry, to get into Manhattan, check in, unpack and then dress for the first event, at 6:30pm. Since we were traveling, before the side trip to NYC, we had shipped our formal attire to the resort that we were staying at, in the mountains of Tennessee. We swapped clothing, sending much back to Phoenix, and headed to NYC, knowing that we would need some pressing, before we were “presentable.”

We arrived at the entrance to the St Regis, but because everything was behind scaffolding, it was difficult to see the building. The doorman was immediately at the car, and our luggage was secured, while we registered. This was very efficient, and we were assigned a small, but lovely suite, 722. While entering the room, our Valet met us in the hallway, and introduced himself. We explained that we had items, that required some “valet assistance,” and he offered to return immediately, to take care of those. As soon as we had things unpacked, he returned, gathered up the formalwear, and, as promised, had everything back in the room, in plenty of time for our first event. This, for us, was a wonderful service, and we were so very glad that it was available. We would use our Valet a few more times, on this brief stay, though there was a “changing of the guard,” during our stay. Still, both were excellent, and greatly appreciated.

Event 1 behind us, we had breakfast downstairs, at the lovely Astor Court. Later, we dropped into the King Cole Lounge, in the lobby, behind the Astor Court, but mostly for wine. With event 2 down, we had our Valet order breakfast in the room, and everything was perfect, from the timing, to the order.

We attempted to use the Bentley, for our dinner at Le Bernardin, but it was stuck in traffic, and we were likely to miss our reservation, so had the doorman summon a taxi. As we had a late flight the next day, we decided to do lunch at Aldo Sohm, next door to Le Bernardin, and owned by Chef Ripert’s Sommelier. The Bentley was available, so we made our “grand entrance” at the wine bar, beside Le Bernardin. In San Francisco, we have used that St Regis’ Bentley a couple of times, and enjoyed the experience of having such a lovely “house car.”

Our suite was adequately spacious, and very well-appointed. We did not want for a thing, during our stay. The bedroom is separate, from the small living area, but essentially, we had a door between. They were separate rooms, but they felt more like one. Our King bed was very comfortable, and the blackout curtains worked well. Our room was very quiet, and we heard no noise from outside, or within the hotel. The bathroom, while small, had a single sink, with large vanity, so good horizontal storage, a nice soaking tub, and a walk-in shower. The toilet had a spray nozzle, so could function as a bidet. Our sitting area/living room was very comfortable, and had enough space at the little table, for breakfast. By my count, there were 3 TV’s: one each, large flat-screen in the livingroom, and the bedroom, and one built into the mirror in the bathroom. That unit had adequate contrast and brightness, which is often an issue with them. This one was “better than most” we have encountered. We had every amenity, that one would need, in the bathroom, and our Valet offered to get anything, that we might not have brought with us. The closet was adequate, even for our event clothes, but I was glad that we had done a swap in Tennessee, as a full 3 week’s worth of clothing, would not have fit. Also, it had 3 narrow doors, which proved a bit awkward at times. One door covered a drawer unit, plus the safe. The one thing missing from our room was any sort of a view, but on this short stay, with all evenings filled, I have to say that we did not miss one.

We had a mini-bar, but only used a half-bottle of Chardonnay, plus the nice wine stems. I never bothered to check the prices of any of the items.

We also were able to attend the Sabering of the Champagne. We’ve been able to enjoy that, at several properties – though, due to the days of our stays, have always missed it in San Francisco.

Now, interaction with some of the staff, was a bit of a mixed bag. Our reservations agent was excellent, friendly, and quick with a welcome. Both of our Valets were perfect. We dealt with the Concierge, and she was also excellent. The same for all of the staff at the Astor Court, and King Cole Lounge. One doorman was great, while the other seemed to not wish to be bothered, unless one was a known guest. Then, while photographing in the lobby, one reservation agent (I assume, as she came from behind the desk) was quite cold, informing me that photographs were not allowed in the hotel. She demanded to know my name, and whether I was a guest, or not. Though I identified myself, and stated my room number. She raised her voice, and demanded again, to know if I was a guest, or “just off the street... ?” Again, I gave her my room number, name, and showed my key card. She then told me “well, you can’t take any pictures.” So, mostly excellent interactions, with 1.5 exceptions.

When checking in, I identified our Platinum status with Marriott (as our accounts have been merged SPG+Marriott). I was informed that the St Regis was not part of the Marriott program, but fortunately, we also had Platinum status with SPG, though my card indicated Gold – the agent pulled up my SPG account, but only made passing note of the “dual status.” Actually, my wife, and I are each Platinum with SPG, and with Marriott, plus Diamond with Hilton. Now, we did have a nice fruit bowl waiting for us, when we check into our room. That was appreciated.

In all, a very, very good stay, at a most lovely property, with just minor “hiccups.” It appears that we will be back in May. I only hope that for the next stay, all of that scaffolding is gone... but it appeared that most of Manhattan was surrounded by scaffolding.

title: Great Holiday Experience
text: My husband, 6 year old and I checked into the St. Regis to experience all NYC has to offer at Christmas time.  Being a Starwood platinum member, we were upgraded to a 5th Avenue Suite that was truly magnificent.  The accommodations were clean and stately.   The staff was outstanding and was very helpful with everything we needed.  We enjoyed afternoon tea, and a delicious breakfast in the morning.   This was our second year in staying at the St. Regis at Christmas time, and we can’t wait to come back next year!!

title: Over the top!
text: If you are looking for first class amenities and service you need to stay here. You will pay for it but it is a nice splurge. Having a butler might be intimidating but they will make your stay memorable.

title: It Just Gets Better
text: This is our second consecutive Christmas season trip to New York City in which we stayed at the St. Regis. Our experiences this year were even better than last year, and that too was a 5 star event. Because of a problem with our original reservation, upon our arrival, we were upgraded to a luxurious Jr Executive Suite which included a fireplace, living room and second bathroom. At our request, the concierge had secured dinner reservations  at the impossible to get into, Polo Bar. Food and services at the Astor Court Restaurant were significantly improved over last year's experiences.  The wait staff in the restaurant were friendly, gracious and exceptionally accommodating. Our appreciation is extended to Javier, Cesar, Jesse, Jonas and Ella (hostess) for making us feel like celebrities.  Thanks, as well, to Royce for facilitating the champagne and strawberries. All in all, the trip was extraordinary! Thank you. We'll be back again next year.

title: Best Hotel in the City
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the hotel for five nights.   After a long day of travel from California we were very pleased at how welcoming the hotel staff was and the high level of service they offered.    Hugo at the front desk recognized how tired we were and went out of his way to make sure our stay was exceptional.   We stay at nice hotels all over the country and this has been one of our best experiences mostly due to the high level of service from Hugo and the rest of the staff.   The entire week was amazing and we will not stay at any other hotel in the city but at this location.  
~ Jereme

title: Birthday Trip to NYC
text:
We just checked in today and the hotel is as beautiful as everyone says it is!  Doorman very helpful and the porter and butler were both great.

I’m an SPG Platinum member and used my Suite Night Award for an upgrade.  I was assigned a Deluxe Suite although not my first choice, was told no Madison Suites are available. I checked the SPG website prior to arrival and saw availability for at least 2 of those rooms.  Front Desk staff said it must be wrong.  I understand 1 room but 2 rooms...hmmm.  I don’t mind not getting that room but the idea of not being told the truth is what I am put off by.  

Oh well that’s typical with SPG and suite upgrades.  You are often left to feel like you are begging or fighting for something that is clearly stated as a benefit of Platinum Membership.

On another note I received an email last week welcoming me to the hotel and asking if we were celebrating anything special.  I replied we are here for my birthday and in return I got an out of office reply and never heard another peep.  Don’t email if you can’t follow through.

That’s it for now!  Our trip can only get better from here!

title: Best butler ever
text: John Dietz, we loved you. Thank you for being so considerate and accommodating. You and John (John squared) truly heightened our St. Regis experience. We look forward to returning and will hopefully see you again soon.

title: Wife's Birthday, Expectations were high.
text:
I chose the St. Regis to celebrate my wife's birthday as I wanted a very special visit to NYC. As everyone who stays here knows, this is very expensive hotel with a reputation for being the best. I booked our stay through SPG and decided to upgrade to a "Grand Lux Room", with the promise of a bigger room and higher floor. Far from inexpensive but what the heck, you only live once!
 After a 2 hour flight and a 90 minute Uber ride from JFK, we arrived at the hotel around 2PM. The gentleman at the front desk was friendly enough as he explained our room was not ready just yet, fair enough as check-in is not until 4PM. He did double check my phone number and promised to call as soon as the room was ready. I had called ahead and requested the highest floor possible and let the front desk  know this stay was in celebration of my wife's birthday. I thought SPG gold might help getting a better room, sadly I was wrong.  3 o'clock and then 4 o'clock both came and went with no call from the hotel. We were done shopping and ready to unwind in the room. Back to the front desk we went.
 I was greeted by a young woman who explained in a cold and condescending tone that we had requested a high floor and the room wasn't ready yet, even though it was well past check-in time. Somehow, because I had asked for a higher floor, this delay had become our fault. She then offered a Grand Lux on a lower floor. I again mentioned the birthday celebration and asked if it a nice room and she replied "yes, it's an excellent room". Also she said there was NO estimated wait time on the higher floor room, so we decided to accept the lower floor (4th) room. We went to the room and discovered a very nice, spacious mini suite type room....with a interior view of the adjacent building's kitchen and what looked like a employee's lunch room. See attached picture. I returned to the front desk and spoke to the same woman about the horrendous view and was told in an escalated condescending tone we ASKED for this room and it was the only room available.  I requested to speak to a manager, very quickly Susan L. approached me and de-escalated the situation by actually caring about our situation. She promised to make things right by moving us to a better suite tomorrow as none were available today. She also asked if there was anything else she could do to make our stay better. Susan was very kind and truly wanted to help.
I returned to the room and was soon met by the bellman who was delivering someone else's luggage to our room. When we said it wasn't our bags, he actually asked if we were sure!  The correct bags were delivered soon after.
We decided to stay in the 4th floor room as it didn't seem worth it to move for the second night, even though Susan offered to move our belongings for us. Very nice of her.
On check out day, we encountered multiple issues with the "final" bill.  Food requests and charges for in-room massages that we didn't order or get to enjoy were included on our bill. Susan was off and I had to deal with the unfriendly front desk to get this corrected. After a few phone calls and a weak explanation, the charges were removed. The next day we received via email another "final folio" that included charges from the honor bar. We didn't use anything from the honor bar. I called the hotel and was told it wouldn't be reviewed until Monday. That charge was eventually removed.
This is a hotel rich in history and it was on our bucket list for quite awhile. The positives for this trip included the opportunity to stay in Manhattan when the tree is up at Rockefeller Center and the location of the hotel. Our room, minus the view, was very nice. We got the opportunity to use the house Bentley for a ride to dinner, the driver was very friendly and engaging. Unfortunately the misses were too numerous for this level establishment. Susan L. really saved our stay by caring about us and our experience. Too bad some of her fellow associates didn't follow her lead.

title: Best Breakfast in Town
text: We are staying at the St. Regis on 55th and a highlight to our stay is going to the yummy breakfast at Astor Court. Javier was such a friendly and efficient server. What a great way to start our day!🗽

title: Very crowded
text:
Arrival at the hotel was problematic as for the first time there was nobody to pick up luggage. Neither at the car level nor at the reception level. 
There was also a queue at reception which again is unacceptable for the price paid.
I was given a fantastic upgrade to one of the great suites.
The hotel was obviously fully booked and with the holiday season this made also the hotel restaurant an bar to be specially crowded.
Please try to keep the guest standards when full. One can feel a change in the hotel which is not positive.

title: Home far away from Home
text: Always great to stay here with my family. Great location near Central park and Fifth avenue;plus our favorite King Cole Bar where we start or end our night. Everyone is so generous and warm !!!! Butler service is an amazing touch and makes a huge difference. We are so happy to have there butler Olivera she makes it always cozy and personal for us which is so important when you travel with kids. She is impeccable .St. Regis is numberone for us. Marija x

title: Beyond our wildest expectations
text:
We arrived for one night to celebrate my husband's birthday and I coughed up a significant amount of SPG points for a deluxe king room.  Our room was not ready when we arrived at noon (understandably) so we checked into, dropped our bags off, and went for a walk in the city.  Our room was ready by 3pm and we returned to find out that, as platinum members, we had been upgraded to the Grand Suite!!  We were shocked and the woman who gave us our room keys was very sweet.  The room was vast, beautiful and, impeccably maintained.  Our butler arrived within 20 minutes to explain his services and was extremely welcoming.  We ordered coffee and he returned with it very quickly and took our formal wear for pressing and shoes to be shined.  

We relaxed in the amazing living room and then went out to dinner.  When we arrived later, the room had been turned down for the evening (slippers, classical music playing (which we kept on for the rest of our stay), curtains drawn, low lights) and our clothing returned.  The hotel gave us two free birthday desserts in Astor Court, so we went down around 8:30 pm and snagged a table.  

The next morning we received our platinum welcome gift - breakfast for two - by room service.  The food was excellent.  Our entire stay was great and the service was fantastic (we tipped heavily).  We were treated very well despite having reserved our room with points.  I wouldn't hesitate to return.

title: Overpriced, Overrated, we are totally Over the St. Regis!
text:
Wow is this place a huge disappointment!  I have waited for years to stay here.  We splurged and stayed for my birthday. At nearly  $1000 a night, one would expect an awesome, personal, over the top experience. It is just the opposite.

None of the staff are very friendly.  And they do nothing to accommodate you.  As an example, they gave me a free dessert for my birthday. Nice... except that you HAD to eat it in the restaurant.  Can I take it to go or order it for in room? Impossible they said.  Can I get it at 3:00 .... impossible!  We have tea now.  Can I get it after dinner?  Impossible, we are fully booked! So, I never did get dessert.

We get two free drinks in the bar as our SPG gift.... IF we wanted to wait 45 minutes for a table in a crowded loud bar. 

You want to use the infamous Bentley? Impossible....it’s never there.  We even tried to call ahead...impossible.  Then we asked for the bellman to call us a cab instead. Impossible again. You have to come down and wait in the cold instead, then we will flag a cab.

If you want coffee or tea, there is none in the room, you have to ask the butler....but ONLY at certain times. Otherwise, too bad.  It felt like they did everything possible to make your stay more difficult.  After a while we just wanted to leave....we saw our butler exactly twice in 6 days. 

It is a terrible location, not close to a subway station.... the rooms are nice I guess, but small for cost.  There is literally no lobby.  So, you stand around if you need to wait for a car, etc.  Housekeeping, I will say, was superb. 

Wish I had never stayed. What a disappointment after waiting all these years....don’t waste your time or your money on a hotel that truly could care less....

title: Historic, Great location...Don't confuse luxury for memorable stay or wow factor. SR Fail,
text:
This is a long review but this time of year with so many people travelling with family and children I felt it was worth going over all elements of our recent St. Regis NYC stay. Touching on disappointments in general experience due to lack of customer service and attention to detail. As well as lack of children's amenities for those traveling with littles this holiday season.

Surprised my mother and 6 year old daughter with their first trip to NYC to take in all of the Christmas magic the city has to offer. The dates I had to come were not available at SR so we were only able to stay 2 of our 5 nights there. Since it was such a special trip I decided to go big and wanted mom and daughter to have top notch experience so opted for Sr NYC as I had not stayed at this SR before. I wanted everything throughout the stay to be absolutely perfect and make it an unforgettable trip for mom and daughter.

Arrival - Upon check-in, I was struggling to get all of our luggage out of the uber while a few doorman chatted amongst themselves. After I had the bags onto the sidewalk it was 5 minutes before someone walked over and offered to help. For a first impression, it was less than ideal as I had read countless reviews on the top notch customer service and attention to detail. I travel frequently and have stayed at countless hotels on all ends of the spectrum including other SR properties. Wasn’t impressed as a woman carrying 10 bags and suitcases with a child as I’d guess I would have been a prime candidate to offer help to.

Check-in – It was around 4:30pm and we waited about 10 minutes in line behind 5-6 other guests checking in. Once we were up. I should note that it is Christmastime and there was very quiet music faintly playing but it was not holiday themed.

 Experience - While waiting we entered the sugar plum pop up shop. Gal sitting at the register looked at us yet didn’t greet us, offer assistance etc. Simply looked at us and went back to what she was doing.

I should note that I emailed 3 times leading up to our arrival sharing that I was trying to make this a very special, memorable trip and wanted my daughter to feel like she was in a Christmas dream. I emailed the e-butler once and the concierge twice inquiring on what, if any, welcome amenities were available for children. If I could order something special to have in the room waiting for her etc (for example The Peninsula across the street leaves a stuffed bear in room for kids with a candy tray with their name spelled out in candy and a welcome card, and has a candy shop they let the kids go into and select candy from). 

I did NOT receive a single reply back, and still haven’t received a reply a week after my stay.

I asked again at check-in if there were any amenities for children and was given a junky coloring set and a st regist hat. Although I appreciated it, not the caliber you’d expect at a luxury property. Especially during the holidays were families are often travelling with their children in tow.

Once we were in the room and our bags brought up, a gentleman came by and informed us that our butler would be reaching out to introduce themselves and ensure we had everything that we needed. We were thirsty and requested 3 water bottles.  The gentleman told us he doesn’t do water but that he would let our butler who would be by shortly to introduce themselves to us to bring it right away. 1 hour and 45 minutes later no water, no butler had reached out to us. Possibly one of the biggest and most disgusting surprises was the fruit tray left in our room. While I appreciate the gesture of SR leaving us a small fruit tray as a snack. Our apple was visibly bruised and mushy and the grapes on the top (impossible to miss) were literally rotten (see pics below). Not acceptable quality and again, a big miss on attention to detail. Someone either saw the grapes and made the terrible decision to leave them for us anyway, or didn’t see them at all…a quality control issue that needs addressed.

One thing that bothered me is that 3 guests were registered to the room yet when offered turn down service and we took it, there were 3 of us there but they only left 2 bottles of water. Again, a missed detail I wouldn’t expect for the price the hotel goes for. I will add, that I was redeeming points but that is obsolete as I was charged 37,700pts per night and the level of service should be the same regardless. That is a ton of points to be charged to not be greeted, not get water, be left with literally a rotting fruit tray and to not even be contacted by our alleged butler.

Room was fine, beds were fine (not overly confortable but not miserable) did not blow us away but there were 2 pros highlighted below. The bedside light on one of the beds was broken and hanging on the wall. Which I found off-putting since again, for the level of hotel maintenance should be kept up.

The two things we appreciated and the biggest PRO’s of the SR were 1) the room was very quiet and  2) the bathroom and tub are much more spacious than your average NYC hotel. Staying at competitor hotels on the highest floor you can still hear significant noise that was not heard on the 16th floor of the SR.

Ordered coffee from the butler we allegedly had (still hadn’t heard from them by day 2). Requested a hot chocolate for the child in the room. Was told we could only get 1 cup of coffee or tea per person (strange and cheap to announce this to us when we were only attempting to order a drink per person) and that if we wanted anything other than coffee or tea we’d have to order it via room service. Obviously, the hotel has milk (is served with coffee and tea) and chocolate syrup as they offer chocolate milk downstairs.  The idea that they wouldn’t offer a morning amenity for a child when they have all of the tools and ingredients at their disposal is a complete joke. This would be a very simple tweak to offer a child friendly drink as part of  the beverage service. It’s not as if we couldn’t go to a coffee shop and get chocolate milk. the principle, and yet another disappointing experience at a hotel touted for excellence. So far we had seen nothing near excellent that would merit $800-$1500 a night rate or 37.5k points. 

Dining – Dined at Astor Court for lunch one day.  We were seated for 45 minutes and had already had rolls, had placed our lunch entrée order and an appetizer had been dying on the table for 20 minutes before I finally asked for a second time if our empty water glasses could be filled.  I asked 15-20 minutes into lunch as my daughter sat with nothing to drink when I was served my bloody mary. The tuna tartar was bland and swimming in whatever sauce it was served with. So much so that it sat on the table the entire meal. I would’ve shared this had I have been asked how it was. I opted to remain quiet out of sheer surprise that a service staff wouldn’t pick up on the fact that we were obviously displeased. I should add I spent 5 years working in one of the top fine dining restaurants in the city and work in sales interacting with a variety of hospitality and dining venues, high end properties, upscale restaurants and hotels regularly so I am very familiar with expectations, service etiquette, the importance of reading guest satisfaction etc. Salads were both bland with zero flavor of any kind but mom and I ate them because we were starving. Had Bloody Mary & a glass of champagne, both were as expected. The only thing that was good at lunch was daughter’s grilled cheese and the rolls, which were a good variety and served warm with soft butter. A+ on the bread-basket. 
 - Aside from the water situation and the food being underwhelming, our busser and server Tony were attentive.

Room Service – ordered room service for dinner, entrees were cold and we sadly weren’t surprised based on all of the other food we had tasted. 

Concierge – We did not have any major concierge needs as I had already planned our entire itinerary but I did stop at the concierge desk twice with questions and both times the gal with short dark hair was friendly and helpful.

Takeaways – 

-	If travelling with children I absolutely do not recommend staying at St. Regis NYC. Zero amenities for children and their two competitor hotels both very close by, The Peninsular & The Plaza, have numerous darling amenities and packages for purchase for kids that are a total blast. My 6 year old daughter felt like a queen at both competitor properties as they both go out of their way to ensure kids feel included and have fun. I know that not every property aims to attract children and maybe SR just prefers to minimize small guests. That may be the case though the Plaza and Peninsula have both found successful models to capture all audiences both single travelers and those with families and guests and staff seemed genuinely happy/enjoying their time at both of these properties while we were there. There is a lot to be said for having a luxury experience that is also fun for the kids = more families spend time and money on the convenience without compromising quality = more $$$$ for hotel.

-	Do NOT waste your time or money dining at SR. Food is lackluster at the very best.

-	For the price and the points we found it to be absolutely NOT worth it and consider it a SR Fail. The quiet, large bathroom and bread basket were great but the overall attention to detail and customer service need major attention to be competitive with other NYC luxury hotels. I felt completely ripped off on points  and wished I could do it over again and get them back. Wasting almost $400 on food over 2 terrible meals only added insult to injury.  (I have heard Chatwal is great and will stay there next time).

-   I will also add that though it is Christmas time the SR was one of the least Christmassy hotels we visited. This isn't a con for some people just noting it for those seeking a heavy holiday experience, Christmas music being played etc.

-	The fruit tray situation was disturbing mostly because my daughter was eating the grapes before I noticed the rotten ones staring up at me. The thought of her eating moldy grapes is not ideal obviously.

-	Highlight of the hotel was King Cole Bar. Angel was AWESOME as a bartender. On top of service, friendly, engaging even though they were very busy. I can see why there are so many regulars at the bar with Angel behind it. He was one of the only staff we saw smile the entire stay (the other was the concierge gal mentioned above). I will absolutely stop back into King Cole bar for drinks on future visits as I am in NYC about once a month. Stay elsewhere and pop into King Cole for drinks.

title: Wonderful location, Wonderful hotel
text: Again the St Regis never fails to provide excellence in every way! New York is busy in December but we never felt rushed or not important (and we aren't!) at the hotel. The doormen are wonderful greeters and the check in staff are professional but very welcoming. We only stayed 3 days this time but the rooms are beautiful and so relaxing.We had a quick lunch at the King Cole Bar today (check out day) and although packed they were able to get us a table. The gentlemen that bring up the luggage are really sincere and great ambassadors for the hotel.

title: Treat yourself to Luxury
text: I had the pleasure of staying here for 6 days over Thanksgiving...while it is a very busy hotel,  you ALWAYS feel as if you are their only guest.  Elegant and tastefully decorated, fresh fruit on a side table, your room is unobtrusively serviced twice a day.....In the evening you return to mood lighting, soft music playing on the Bose, a bottle of water beside your bed, slippers on the floor.  No matter how hectic your day, you feel a complete sense of relaxation.  I only contacted the Butler once, for coffee at 6:15am.....it arrived promptly and was the perfect start to the day.    Breakfast was wonderful, many selections and prepared exactly to your taste.  The Thanksgiving Dinner was excellent and the Turkey Terrine, served with the traditional meal was a little bit of heave.   I hope to return to this gem!  The nicest stay I've ever had in NYC.

title: Consistently a top performer in all regards
text:
Our annual trip continues to be a highlight of the year.  One of the reasons that it is so special is that The St. Regis New York enhances our trip with first class service, rooms, and location.

55th and 5th is so convenient to everything - the theater district, world class dining and, of course, shopping.

The St. Regis concierge team is wonderful.  Not only do they have their finger on the pulse of what's happening in NY, they also strive to help in any way possible.

And the rooms are always such a joy to return to.  Whether it is the butler service designed to ensure that everything is to your satisfaction or the quality of the bed/sheets/pillows, everything is close to perfection.

One piece of advice is to consider staying off the 55th side of the hotel if noise is an issue for you.

title: Three generations
text: Annual pilgrimage to NYC with three generations. The hotel was fabulous-location, staff, cleanliness and amenities. My daughter felt like a princess with her own little slippers. The coffee in the morning was outstanding. The room was spacious enough for my mom, daughter and I.

title: SPG LIFETIME PLATINUM REVIEW
text:
Hello everyone I am a Lifetime Platinum member of the SPG program with over 505 nights and a member since 1999. To celebrate becoming SPG Platinum for life I booked the iconic St Regis Hotel to celebrate this achievement  I have never stayed at this hotel and was looking forward staying at such a celebrated and iconic NYC hotel.

The location is hard to beat if you want to access shopping and stores. Tiffany's is a 10 second walk away as well as all the other high end brands. Bergdorf Goodman dept store is located right across the street. Central Park,The  Plaza hotel located only 2 blocks away.  If you want to walk to St Patricks Cathedral, go to Rockefeller Center to see the tree its only 5 blocks away.
Great location for all of this.

As we pulled up the bellman took our bags and asked our last name and said dont worry abt the bags well take care of them. (no luggage check) but it was no big deal as I had complete faith my bags would be brought to the room.

I arrived around noon so i was very early for check in.  The hotel was built in 1904 and has a very understated luxury to it. The lobby was not huge but was elegant and showed off the period details. Take a look at the Grandfather clock and mail box that have been at the hotel since 1904. There was no line at check in which I was surprised since it was noon Saturday Dec4th. The hotel was sold out and I was trying to use my Suite Night Award (these are awarded to Platinum members who stay 50 nights a year with SPG) for an upgrade but it did not clear.  I totally understand since it was the holiday season and the hotel was fulled booked and NYC was packed with people.

I came up to the front desk and Hugo Hidalgo, the front desk agent and his partner Shelumie helped me out.
Hugo was EXTREMELY professional and HELPFUL. Hugo welcomed me and thanked me for my loyalty to SPG. As Hugo was looking up my reservation he said the room was not ready but he would take my number and call me when it was serviced by housekeeping. BUT to my SURPRISE he said there was an upgrade available!! I was in complete state of bliss!! Thank you HUGO for looking after a very loyal SPG member and thank you for going the extra mile to see if any upgrades were available without me even asking. I figured the room would be ready by 3pm or so. So my wife and our 2 young nieces decided to explore the hotel and soak in the history. As we made our way to Astor Court (the restaurant) to take a picture by the Christmas tree a waitress came over and asked if we wanted a group photo by the tree. Wow thank you..so far so awesome. Service has been excellent and we haven't even checked into the room yet!

Within 1/2hr I got a call saying our room was ready! This was awesome. As I made my way back to Hugo to check in he said we had been upgraded to the St.Regis Suite. I could of not been more thankful. I did not tell my wife or our nieces about the upgrade and wanted to surprise them. As we made our way to the room the girls were shocked when we walked in. They couldnt believe how nice and spacious the room was.  They were so excited and in awe. As you walked into the room there was a hallway with heated marble floors, to the left was a full bath, again with heated marble floors and the bedroom. There was a closet located just outside this bathroom.  To the right as you walked in was ANOTHER full bath with heated marble floors with a closet located outside of it as well as the living room. Fresh flowers in the bathrooms and TV's both in the living room and bedroom. The lights can be controlled by the Creston system. There is a minibar with 2 comp. bottles of water.

The room was very historic with big chandeliers in the living room and bedroom. There was period molding along the ceiling and the St Regis logo built into the vents. Our bags arrived shortly after we got to the room .There is turn down service and they left a nice fruit bowl in the room for us.We did not a chance to use the St Regis butler service on this trip.  The next morning we had breakfast in Astor Court. It was nice to sit in such a historic dining room with the gold leaf and sky painted ceiling. The service was excellent,food was excellent but it was expensive.. For the 4 of us it was $240 including tip. We were lucky enough to check out the mural at the King Cole Bar next door where a service member allowed us in for pictures and he explained the history of the mural behind the bar (its pretty funny, I wont spoil it).

Overall an excellent stay and its prob. in the top 3 of all my SPG stays and for my wife it was her #1 stay!! Our nieces loved the rain shower with the handheld and couldnt stop saying how it was the best shower they ever had.
The location is great, the hotel is historic and iconic, the room was AWESOME and SPACIOUS but the best part was really the service.  
The servers in Astor Court, the bellman and of course the front desk people, Hugo and Shelumie.  

Thanks again for the upgrade and taking care of ALL of us. It was an awesome stay and we look forward to coming back

title: Absolutely Fantastic! Old NY Charm!
text: My mom and I stayed here back in April when we came into town just to see Bette Midler on Broadway in Hello Dolly! She had stayed at the St Regis plenty of times but I never had and told her I wanted a true New York hotel. I have stayed at the Ritz on Central Park but it was overrated. The St Regis was so welcoming and the hospitality was over the top. Our butler was amazing (I hate I can’t remember his name) and was always there for anything we needed. We even took the complementary Bentley to the show and to dinner one nice which was amazing. The bellmen even remembered our names after the first time of getting a cab. I would stay here every single time I come to NYC if I could! A lot of hotels are overrated and fake. Here it is true old NYC charm and hospitality. You might even see a celebrity!

title: Made our anniversary more special
text: The hotel is wonderful and since we were there for our anniversary, they invited us for dessert at one of the restaurants and upgraded us to a suite. Hugo was very kind and helpful in getting us the upgrade!

title: The best
text: Beautiful hotel. Spacious rooms. Fantastic location. Butler service. What's not to love? The St. Regis New York consistently impresses. When it misses the mark (which isn't often), it recovers quickly and gracefully. A few thoughts: (1) If you're a lobby-lover, this isn't your hotel. The magic here is in the guestrooms. (2) Finishes in the guest bathrooms are a little old-school for my taste (gold fixtures, etc.), but the rooms are well maintained. The shower pressure is remarkably good. (3) Take advantage of your butler. Outstanding service is what the St. Regis is all about.

title: Fantastic luxury
text: My husband and I spent two nights T the Regis over Thanksgiving weekend. It was perfect luxury. The staff are all very helpful and polite. Our room was enormous, clean and looked brand new. There was no outside noise in our bedroom at all. The minibar in the room had a great selection with some really nice high end choices. Very upscale but low key. I would stay there again, no other hotel in NY compares.

title: Beautiful Property but things could have gone a littler better.
text:
I was in room 309 for 4 nights. The property is gorgeous, lots of marble, high ceilings, and real crystal in the chandeliers! It is beautiful in a classical way. The bed is comfy, and there is some free bottled water and fruit! Loved the grapes. There is a Butler on the floor who will shine your shoes and press your dress pants, and bring you more fruit. But, this is the most expensive hotel in NYC. What are you getting for all those extra dollars?
Well, I got some dirty ladies underwear left by the previous occupant. YEAH!!  Gross. They were entwined with the legs of the collapsible suitcase stand. Well, I called for the Butler to show her . . .  and expected her to remove them from the room . . .  which she did NOT!  (She was wearing gloves)  Was I supposed to call housekeeping?  Don't know, if it wasn't in the job title of the Butler to remove dirty knickers then she should have called the knicker-removal-specialists! 

Later in the evening, my husband & I both tried to turn on the TV, but with no luck. We called the Butler. She came in and tried a couple times, no luck. She then removed the back of the remote control and took out the batteries and rubbed the copper ends and installed them back in the remote. YEAH the TV now worked.  But, every time we tried to turn it on, we had to go thru the same battery rubbing operation.  She couldn't just bring us new batteries?  Or a remote that works???  At $1,000 a night for the cheapest room, this is what the Butler is doing for us???

The bathroom was very nice, lots of marble. But my cookie-cutter production home in the suburbs has lots of marble too. There was a nice frosted heavy glass door for the shower - my bathroom as that too. And my bathroom has a larger tub, and radiant heat underneath the marble floor so my tootsies are warm and toastie all the time!  No radiant heat here. The only thing this bath had that mine doesn't is the TV within the mirror.  But mine has a fireplace next to the tub.  What am I getting for my dollars here??

The St. Regis requires all guests to use a card key to activate the elevators. It doesn't work as easily as one might like, and I noticed all the guests waving the card over & over in front of the sensor to get it to work, so it wasn't just me. That's a nice safety precaution. No stranger off the street can just come in and go up to your floor! Makes me feel secure until I see the original marble circular stairs next to the bank of elevators. One could just walk up the stairs to any floor. Which I did - it goes up to the roof. 
Finally, the St. Regis does provide a cool Bentley 4-door for you to use. The first trip is free but only within a 10 block area. We took advantage of this offer and totally enjoyed the ride! It is the most luxurious ride ever. This was a very nice perk to staying at the St. Regis Hotel.

title: Great Thanksgiving!
text: Hotel is bright and beautiful, we loved the Butler service, top notch. Location if perfect especially this time of year a short walk to shopping, churches and events! Concierge was very helpful and professional, we will be back!

title: Unbelievable service !!!
text:
I’ve been a regular visitor of New York for the past several years and my place to stay is always the St. Regis. Over the years I’ve become familiar with the staff and I must say they are a great group of people. The front office staff have been the same people for many years, and they’ve never under delivered in my opinion !!!  

The personalized services and attention to details is what really differentiates this hotel from any other. The traditional hallways and rooms really have a great feel to them. This hotel is old but the upkeep is spectacular. 

I’ve attached a picture of one of the best reasons to visit the St. Regis NYC, the French toast !!! A real treat !!! I can say the best I’ve ever had ...

 Can’t wait till I’m back there again !!!

title: King Cole
text: Had the best time at the King Cole Bar on Thanksgiving Day after the parade. The King Cole is legendary in NY, and so is Michael H, one of its most beloved servers. His Irish accent is infectious, and attention to service/ detail extraordinary. It’s like he knew we wanted refills! Love him, the bar, hotel and its history. Just saw this great documentary on Diana Vreeland (former/ famous editor of Vogue) and she was discovered dancing at the Hotel. Clearly, she had taste.

title: First Time in the City
text:
By a total mistake at work, I was able to stay at the St Regis for my first time in New York. For me, it was over the top. The staff was incredibly friendly to even just a regular Joe like me. They treated me like I totally belonged there, even though I didn't.

So, for the room. As soon as I got off the elevator, I was greeted by my butler. Yes, the butler. He showed me my room which was a little unnecessary.  It was all pretty self explanatory. However, impressive.

The room itself was very nice. The little tablet thing that controls the lights was very helpful. The bathroom was incredible and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. I had read other horror stories about how you could hear traffic and all but I didn't hear a peep. 

But, a couple of issues. I could not make the sound work on the TV. There is a secret yellow button on the remote that you have to push to turn it on. They need to have a sign on the tv that tells you that but I am sure they won't do that. 

Also, I am a very early riser. I woke up at 530 and wanted a cup of coffee. There is no coffee pot in the room. I went downstairs and was told that the restaurant opened at 7 but that I should call my butler to bring me coffee. There is no way on earth I was calling anyone at 530 am to bring me coffee. So I went outside searching for a diner which they say is down the street. Instead, there was a lady in a street cart right across the street selling coffee for $1. 

I would certainly recommend the coffee lady across the street. I did however disturb my butler around 7 for additional coffee which was nice. 

Overall the hotel is extremely nice but just a bit over the top for what I am used to.

title: Twenty-five years of exemplary service
text: We stayed at the St. Regis NYC for a family birthday. We have been coming to this property for 25 years and it never fails to be a wonderful experience. In recognition of being Platinum Elite and my wife's birthday, the front desk upgraded us to a beautiful suite. The rooms was fantastic. As always, the butler service was excellent for tea in the afternoon and coffee in the morning. They had graciously offered us dessert to recognize her birthday, but it came after we went to sleep. They generously offered to give us a credit to a drink at the bar for the previous night. Finally, the concierge was extremely helpful. Overall, this is one of her favorite hotels in the world in a magnificent location with exemplary service.

title: Wedding Dress Shopping
text: In NYC to shop for our daughter’s wedding dress and spent 2 nights at the St Regis. They made this such a special time with a corner suite!  We had tea in Ascort Court before the Klienfeld appt and then champagne after to celebrate “saying yes to the dress”!  This hotel and staff are stellar-  you won’t be disappointed.

title: Expensive with lovely service
text:
Lovely, comfortable & relatively large room.  I was disappointed that my room only had a very tiny window that looked at a cement wall & only a shower, no tub.  While some may like the butler service, I found it inconvenient to page someone for morning coffee, wait several minutes for return call & wait another 10+ minutes for lukewarm coffee.  The butlers I encountered were all very nice & helpful though - as was the entire staff.  

My rating reflects the value for a 5 star hotel -- nothing wowed me so paying $1000/night seemed steep.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Of course it is very beautiful, and from its look you might think that it would be stuffy, but it is not- Very friendly and welcoming staff, and the Head Butler, Nestor, on the 7th floor could not have been a better representative in making us feel at home! Best Hotel in NYC- have stayed in many , luxury and not,in NYC and all over the world. Actually always wanted to stay at the St. Regis, and this did not disappoint!

title: Treated like a Queen
text: Using my SPG  points I was not expected to be treated like a Queen. What a surprise!. From the moment of check in to 7 days later every detail was superb. 15th floor room was exquisite with butler service. Offered either 500 bonus points or breakfast I opted for breakfast which each day was superb . Maid service twice daily, concierge the best and even had use of the Hotel Car.....Could not want anything better in NYC.

title: 5 Star Earned
text: Before we booked we had heard of the excellent reputation.....well earned at this property.  Greeted as a true guest...we were in town to see Hamilton and Beautiful but our stay at the St. Regis was equally impressive.  From the front desk Hugo to the best ‘Bulter’ in NYC, Nester on Floor 7 ...and he is pictured on the City Map, our stay was  a great experience.   Everyone made you feel like we were the most important guest.  It’s nice to feel that way.  Life is made up of special moments...this place helped us create ours.  We have found our home when we stay in NYC...it’s the St Regis.  Mike P

title: Fancy night in NYC
text:
My wife and I planned an overnight in NYC early November.
Check-in - we arrived at 1pm, the room was not ready, they offered a bottle of water and took my mobile to let me know when the room would be ready, or an upgrade would be available (I am a platinum member).
They called me at 5pm that the room is available and if I could skip late checkout they could offer me a nice upgraded room, which we did.

The Room: We received room 1518, which is a two room suite with two bathrooms, tubs, showers and bidet, was fantastic, everything is controlled from a console next to the bed and the different desks around the apartment.

Service: As expected from St Regis, flawless execution with help from the buttler, the front desk or anyone we bounced into, always smiling, always willing to help.

title: Classic Luxury with Peace and Quiet
text:
I've had the privilege of staying at the St. Regis on several occasions and am always pleased by the attention to detail, classic luxury and the peace and quiet I encounter.  It's truly a rare event when one can leave the busyness of NY at the doorstep and enjoy the comfort of actually relaxing and recharging after a night out or all NY has to offer during the day.  Having spent considerable time enjoying France and Italy's 5 star service I've come to expect and accept certain details that make for a more personal, classy and refined experience.  From my arrival, being assisted with luggage, check-in and lunch reservations to the entire stay with a terrific butler who's pager made all the difference, as every request was fulfilled without delay.  I also had  a wonderful room with a team who kept everything in place, while providing great comfort and respecting privacy when requested. 
I've learned over the years and countless accommodations, one of the best and most successful ways to have a memorable and fantastic stay is to be memorable and fantastic before you arrive and once you leave. Hospitality goes both ways!!!!!

title: Creepily Inconvenienced - Not a Fan
text: Stayed at The St. Regis with my husband recently.  The room was spacious and clean but we were disappointed to see there wasn't a coffee pot in the room.  The moment we checked into our room, we were greeted by the butler who explained that we were to call the number provided and they would bring us everything we need.  The next morning, we dial the number to order our coffee but the number was perpetually busy.  Of course, all the other guests are ordering coffee as well which drives home the point that a coffee pot in the room is quite necessary.  At some point, we gave up, as we were scrambling to get to our event.  That evening, we wanted to make a cocktail and hubby grabbed the ice bucket to locate the ice.  He met the butler.  Incidentally, our ice bucket is the size of a large mug.  We joked about dumping the alcohol right in the tiny bucket.  The butler admonished him as she informed us that we must call the number.  We both find it easier to dash out, grab the ice than to have to pick up a telephone and make the call.  Same thing happened the next morning for coffee..... busy signal.   Incidentally, we were told after the second time that we were "supposed" to call the second number which is the front desk if we encounter a busy signal; basically two phone calls for your coffee.  He later goes out to get more ice and the butler loomed over him, "Sir.....you just aren't getting it!"  He explained that he's capable of getting our ice.  Not a big deal.  One evening, we had little time to pick up our things so I suggested we put the "DO NOT DISTURB" light on for the room.  No cleaning.  We know this to be a rule that should be regarded a very serious request....to NOT go in our room with our dirty things laying about.  When we returned our dirty things were picked up and folded on top of the commode.  Wow.  Ewww.  That was the cherry on top.  Some people may find the butler to be a pleasure but it became a creepy inconvenience.  We will not be staying at this hotel....ever again.

title: 5 Issues with a 5 Star Hotel
text:
We were so looking forward to spending our special anniversary night at this exclusive property.  We were very disappointed!  From the moment we arrived and until we left, we had multiple issues.  Our room was not ready until 4:20pm (we requested 2pm check in).
