Our room was elegant except for the grossly stained upholstery on a chair, which I covered with a towel, and a view that overlooked 3 walls.  We couldn't get close to the bar that evening and ended up having to sit by the hotel entrance.  Breakfast, the next morning, did not happen - once again, we couldn't get a seat in the Astor Court  dining room so they sat us by the bar which is a level below.  We were seated at a counter height table and waited and waited and waited for our order to be taken and served.  A group that came 10 minutes after us were seated and served before our food arrived.  Finally a server brought our breakfast and placed it on a tray across the room where it sat for 5 minutes before we got up and left.  As we left the manager offered his apologies  - no fooling!  
We have stayed at other St Regis properties and expect a certain level of service and luxury.  We were not treated well nor did we receive any benefits/amenities for being loyal SPG members.  We were given a gift of a complimentary dessert to celebrate our 40th anniversary (not what I would have expected) which we had no opportunity to use.  Upon leaving, we spoke to the Hotel manager who offered to refund a small portion of the points used to pay for our stay.  I guess that's better than nothing!  This property does not live up to its name.

title: Not as luxurious as it looks in pics
text: My husband and I were surprised by the small reception area. The room looked very old, the wallpaper was starting to lose its color, the carpet as well and there was a musty smell. Overall the room looked pretty much like the ones in the photos posted by the hotel but gloomier. From the window we could see a dirty wall. We had tried several 5 star hotels during the same trip and we thought that the St Regis was not at all worth the price so we checked out early.

title: amazing cocktail
text: I visited the bar with my friends to celebrate my birthday the staff was extremely caring and made our evening very interesting the cocktails were fantastic.i tried their red snapper and it was extremely nice.

title: 3x Sirloin Steak RETURNED - Overcooked, Over Salted, Overcooked + AWKWARD SECURITY CONFRONTATION
text:
I stayed one night on business, actually not even one night I left to the airport at 4 am and arrived on a red eye around 10:00am.

My major issue with the stay was the only meal I had was breakfast time.  I was coming from a red-eye flight and I very, very tired.  

The service was not attentive at first, in fact the coffee I ordered took 12 minutes to come, where the table next to me received their drinks within 2 minutes at most.

The worst issue was 3, YES THREE, sirloin steaks sent back for being over cooked, overly salted and over cooked.  I asked for medium rare that in all industry standards is warm pink center and was told by one of the managers there that their is a variance.  I told him, I don't think so.  Every restaurant I have been too knows the difference.  He also commented the vendor was to blame.  No, the St. Regis is to blame.  Take accountability for your company, don't blame the vendor.  Clients don't care about excuses.

I will say this, the very professional and empathetic Hotel food & beverage manager did come up to me personally and apologized and was very upset with what happened.  The meal was comped, but I was just tired and wish my meal gave me a great start to a short business trip.

Room was just fine, nothing wrong, and everything was spacious well maintained.  Some areas were old and worn, but nothing to bark about.

One more thing.  I was in the "Congac"Room doing business throughout the day with clients.  One of the clients had some money we needed to count.  

I was approached by a security guard and front desk manager, basically hovering over our transaction, leaving little privacy until I asked, how many I help.

It seemed they didn't know how to handle the situation.  What situation?  Nothing really, as when I told him I'm staying here and showed my room card, which they didn't even directly asked, more in lines stared at me and wasn't sure what to ask, the front end manager said they have counting machine if I need it.

I said, okay, well that would haven't been good to know next time...as you never assume that for a hotel.

Rather than making the guest feel like a bad guy, why don't you ask the politely to chat?

I guess I bring this up, because the use of a security guard and a manager without a direct question like "may I speak to you for a second sir"  

Rather than staring me and my client down, lacked the privacy I expected at this hotel.

My client wasn't impressed and that is why I'm bringing it up.

title: Luxury hotel in a fantasic location in midtown
text: roomy, luxurious & classically decorated suites, with evening turn down service.  cannot imagine a better midtown location that is walking distance to Rockefeller center, St. Patricks cathedral, Central Park, Times Square, grand 5th Ave stores, Madison Ave. botiques, University club, metro subway stops

title: Impressive hotel
text: We stayed for 4 nights. Smooth check in. As gold SpR guests we were offered an upgrade which we happily accepted. Beautiful spacious room. Staff very attentive and friendly, very responsive butler service (we mainly used the service for early morning tea and coffee. Very impressed by the Old King Cole bar (who would not be). It is small so If you can't get into the bar itself and just sit outside to have a drink it’s probably a good idea to specify that you would want the ring from the bar King Cole bar and not from the service bar (I noticed a significant difference in my "Mid town spice").

title: Outstanding
text:
Living out of state now , but come in several times a year for family functions.  Hubby & I consider the St. Regis our home away from home.  The hotel is a great example of luxury, elegance & the ultimate in personal service.  
Looking forward to our next visit this November for a family wedding in Brooklyn ( well worth the Taxi ride to & from) it’s the only place we would ever stay.

title: Outstanding service
text: This is a classic luxury hotel. The decor is very luxurious. The bed is very comfortable. They provided a wonderful butler service. Every single staff person we encountered was friendly, attentive, and very service minded. We had a special service need on a matter and they completely satisfied. The bar is small but very unique. The only reason I did not rate as excellent is because we had difficulty getting hot water in the shower each morning. We also had a handicap room which had no shower door and thus too much water sprayed out onto the bathroom floor and no shelf for bath products. The meeting rooms are quite nice and spacious. The location is very near Central Park and 5th Ave shopping.

title: Luxury from top to bottom!
text: We were given the recommendation to stay at the St. Regis, and it met and exceed every expectation!  The location was fantastic in that you are within walking distance to rockefeller center, central park, times square, broadway, and much much more.  They also have a dedicated complimentary car service in a Bentley! for other nearby destinations.  The personnel are all exceptionally trained in putting the customer first clearly.  There was not a single person or moment in that hotel that did not feel like we were catered to.  The doormen even took our photos and welcomed us back by name throughout our stay.  I know there are so many other hotels to explore in NYC, but I would be hard pressed to not stay here again in the future because it was absolutely wonderful!!

title: Sheer elegance
text: Truly a 5 star hotel.  The service couldn't be better.  The rooms are luxuriously decorated.  The location is great and the bar is iconic.  Try to get a room high up facing 5th Avenue.  Also, be sure to ask for a room with a bathtub.  Some of the rooms have showers only, post their renovation.   Personally, I need to luxuriate in a bathtub.  That said, the bathrooms are beautiful.

title: unless your somebody dont waste your time
text: worst experience ever!! Hotel is a disgrace and if you aren't a regular or a someone they treat you like dirt!! to say this hotel is luxury is a joke!! I reserved four rooms and still got treated like a bum off the street. never stay here when so many other hotels to choose from unless you don't mind being treated by idiots!!

title: Great until the end...
text:
I really did enjoy our visit at the St Regis. Was it stuffy? Yes, but the staff was so accommodating it didn't bother me. Our butlers were great, as was concierge.  Check in was a little bumpy, as the room wasn't ready until 4 pm on the dot, even though our arrival time was communicated well in advance.  The Astor Court was nice, but seemed to cater to more the international "jet set" than me and my family.  Room was impeccably clean and over the top opulent.  Although it was loud at night for this Midwestern suburban mom. The curtains were not true "black outs", but I did get used to that. 
Overall,  we loved our stay but the last day kinda ruined it. Apparently Mike Pence was in town. (Gasp..) He had a St Regis speaking engagement.  Anyways, the secret service and lovely police (ha!) Descended on the hotel and made sure to make everyone else's visit less than swell. We waited over 20 minutes to get an elevator because they shut some down for him. When we arrived in the lobby (with our 1 year old and stroller in tow), we went towards the elevator that took us to the street (we had been doing this routine for several days now). However,  the secret service (I think) stopped us and said we couldn't use the elevator.  They then proceeded to say "figure it out" on how we would get out with a baby and stroller through the revolving door and stairs. I was so fired up I didn't even enjoy the musuem we went to afterwards.  On our way back the same day to check out, the entire hotel was blocked off. I went up to a NYPD officer who said no one gets in! I asked her how long...she said "I don't know, you'll just have to wait." (As I think she rolled her eyes at me). After about 25 minutes of standing on the street (still a baby in tow who was getting fussy), we were allowed back in. Upon check out I expressed my concerns.  I told them I realized it was not the hotel but the hotel allowed the event to occur, thus allowing various law enforcement to treat the paying customers like dirt. The response I got was an apology  (thank you) and a "next time you stay we will make your stay is really nice". 
I am not an international traveler. I saved money to be able to stay here. I didn't plan on coming back even before the unfortunate events occurred.  However,  I am not sure that was the best response given the nature of complaint. Hope it's better next time...basically? 
So that's the St Regis nyc.  Nice, but just pray no one "important " is staying there when you are!

title: Elegant suites
text: Comfortable, elegant suites and huge bathrooms, very well located. The service is correct , it is a five star but as in most luxury hotels in NY it lacks warmth. Very close to Saks and Central Park. The city view suite I booked was dark and the living room decor a bit outdated.  There is no coffee machine in the rooms. It s a must have~ ...

title: Stunning Property
text:
Hard product is difficult to fault although service left a lot to be desired on more than one occasion - it was difficult to get served at breakfast even though there were very few other guests seated at the time as an example. The table in front of me and I ended up raising our hands to eventually have someone take our orders it took so long. This is after I tried to make eye contact with staff who looked straight at me and then went to seat new diners without ever coming back to me or alerting someone else I needed assistance.

Things I loved: Beautiful room and bathroom. Package room for convenient place to send mail, car service. 

If the hotel was less expensive and service better I would return. Currently it is something I'm just content to do once.

title: Everything was perfect
text: We stayed at the St. Regis for three nights for an extended weekend. Everything was perfect from the beginning until the end. The personal butler was friendly and attend edto all of our needs. The Bentley was a great way to get to restaurants in the evening. I can’t think of a better place to stay n New York.

title: One of New York’s finest hotels which comes with a price tag to match.
text:
Can’t fault the service and attitude of the staff at the St Regis, New York. Check in was polite and quick. The room was clean and our butler informed us of hotel facilities and arrived promptly, when contacted. There is a Bentley available for use with a driver who will take you anywhere in a 10-block radius. The only caveat is that the car cannot be booked as we attempted to use it three times and missed out as other hotel guests beat us. The hotel gym (located on the top floor) is excellent – it has running machines, free and machine weights, ellipticals, balance boards, and a killer view of the NY skyline.

For those Australian travellers, The St Regis is very expensive – and then some – basic room rates start at $800/night USD. I realise this is NYC luxury accommodation, but the lower Australian dollar exchange rate might make you think about booking here.

title: Amazingly Spectacular Suite
text:
Louis the 15th would be envious of the deluxe “named” suites at this NYC landmark & 1st St. Regis location, opened by John Astor in 1904 as one of NYC’s 1st 5 Star high-rise hotel/residence.  His wife, a socialite/debutante & big fan of the jeweled high-life, helped ensure the hotel’s place in history as one of, if not the most glamorous destinations in NY and, by extension, the country as s whole.

The extraordinarily appointed suites, with incredible marble floors, huge rooms with silk wallpaper, elegant crown moldings & masonry ceiling reliefs showcasing incredible chandeliers all make for a magical experience - all at a price fit for a king though!

title: Luxury stay at great city
text:
Stayed for one week in ST. Regis New York , great location, very good service and history too.
They treat you very well from the moment you step in
Rooms are very specious and very well maintained.
They set standard for good service, I was lucky with an upgrade to residents club suite
This fine hotel is going to be my choice  in next visit to Big Apple.
The breakfast is wonderful and staff go extra miles to please the customer. Dining is also nice and I thank the staff there , Angel, Mike, Christiana and George ,very nice people, passionate about their job and make you feel you are at home

title: Mixed Feelings
text:
I had a bit of a mixed feeling this time (hence the title).  I'll start by saying I"ve stayed here and the Mandarin Oriental each over 50 times, I'm always unsure which I love better.  I used to be friends with the hotel manager (Alexander Kellerman) at the St. Regis, and he was great to me, I got to know him, it made the St. Regis better.  Both can obviously have off days.  This wasn't terrible this time, but just off.   

The good:  It's still of course a gorgeous hotel.  It's immaculate, hotel beautiful, gym is actually nicely upgraded.   Service is generally terrific, rooms and bathrooms incredible.  It still was this time.  Breakfast was incredible this time too.  Bed and blackout shades top notch.  Shower perfect.  

This visit the not-so-good:   Well, I got there at around 12pm, and through the years, I've gotten lucky almost always, or rather they accommodate me very often.  This time, I heard "unfortunately" about 50 times in the next few hours.  Room's not ready.  OK, no problem.  But they said I was getting a "huge upgrade", which is really nice, especially since it's a nice occasion and I'm Starwood Gold and stayed there SO much.  But, they couldn't tell me (rules) what type of room.  Also:  "unfortunately" it wouldn't be ready until after 7pm, people were staying in them late, nothing they could do.  That is, 7pm at the EARLIEST.    Now, I'm staying there for 1 night, leaving 8am in morning.  That's is not a favor to get a huge upgrade but have a room for under 12 hours.  So getting this "huge" upgrade after 8pm?  Sorry but that's ridiculous.  

Next, when could I get a room?  I actually paid (even though I never do this, because I always am luckily given upgrades), I paid for a suite.  They said I could get a downgrade if I wanted a room on time.  I was seriously told this.  They said if I was lucky, and they'd try their absolute best, I could get a suite of any kind by 4pm hopefully.   Then I realized:  "wait, that's not a favor to get the room I paid for at the absolute latest check-in time".  They did realize this and said yes, true.  OK, I'd get the bare minimum room that I paid for at 4pm, no earlier, no upgrades, they'd do their best to do that.  

So I didn't get this upgrade to the Madison Suite (after 8pm for 1 night is so absurd why did they even offer it), and for 1 night it was very hard to get into anything before 4pm even though I begged emailed ahead, did everything.  I could only get a downgrade if I wanted that.  I ended up getting a suite that is no more or no less than what I paid for at 3pm, not on a high floor that I wanted really.  And the hallway smelled like smoke, it had air filtration machines in the hall all day/night to clean it.  I'm allergic to smoke.  There was a guy sitting outside of a suite at the end of the hall, probably security for a high-end guest.  He was shouting on his cell phone all afternoon/night in what sounded like Arabic, kept us up till about 12pm, heard him again at 7am.  

Also when I got my keys, it said the price right on the white key holder, $1250 written right on there in pen so my wife had to see it-  was a gift for her.   

We weren't given a favor by getting the room I paid for on a smokey hallway, loud with a guy shouting all day, at 4pm (though in fairness we finally got in at 3pm).  But I had to plead with someone for a long time at the front desk.  The "upgrade" couldn't happen, supposedly not ready till 8pm.  At 5pm when I asked if I could switch to that suite since our room smelled like smoke and it was loud, at 5pm they said that suite was given away already!    

Sorry-   not a good experience this time.  But I did have a first:  I got offered a downgrade if I wanted to get into a room by 4pm, the absolute latest check-in time.   The whole thing left an awful feeling.  Couldn't just give me any other upgraded suite to placate us?  

I'd stay here again, I usually love it here.  But I drew a bad hand this time somehow.

title: A NYC classic!!
text: This hotel does not disappoint. It has been years since my last stay and the service and beauty of this hotel is still amazing! My husband and I just spent one evening here. They checked us in early knowing we had to get ready for a dinner and a show. The service is just outstanding! Be sure to get a original Bloody Mary in their bar.

title: NEVER MISSES A BEAT!!!
text: Birthday drinks and great times!!!  King Cole Bar at the St Regis is one stop that no one should miss!!  From the 5 star service to the BEST people watching in any city!  Make sure to have one of their amazing martinis as they hit the spot!

title: Simply the best
text: First class hotel from top to bottom. Absolutely a timeless classic. The Doormen ( Jimmy and Pascal) are your first great experience as you enter the hotel. These gentlemen are polite and professional as well as knowledgeable. In addition or butler Oliver's, was simply outstanding. Everything was perfect, like staying in a palace and being treated like royalty.

title: Beautiful hotel close to Central Park
text: My daughter and I stayed her over Labor Day weekend, and we had an amazing experience.  Our room was large, beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was sparkling and had both a large tub and a separate shower.  We stayed in a deluxe double room.  The butler service was fantastic--they would bring us coffee/tea each morning and were always helpful.  We dined in our room each morning, and the food was delicious.  Afternoon tea in the restaurant was both fun and yummy (and quite filling).  We would absolutely stay here again!

title: Christmas at St Regis
text:
Im a bit late writing my review (9 months to be exact) none the less, better late than never :)

We stayed 4 nights over Christmas December 2016 in the Madison suite.  We go to NYC every December and the last couple of times we had horrible experiences at the Plaza.  I was hoping the St Regis would answer all my needs where the Plaza could not.  Upon checkin, my concerns were over.  We were treated exceptional the entire stay!  A TRUE 5 star experience.  Unlike the unfulfilled promises at other 5 star hotels in the area, the St Regis delivered.   The Madison suite was very spacious with his and her bathrooms, large foyer, huge bedroom plus excellent amenities. Butler service was on par with what I would expect.  We utilized the unpacking services and was quite pleased to come back to our room with all our belongings carefully put away.  One morning we took advantage of the complementary Bentley.  Pretty nice to be chauffeured around in a nice fancy car even if its just for a couple of blocks. Location was great, right off 5th avenue and in the heart of all the shopping.  A few blocks away from Central Park as well as my favorite breakfast spot, Sarabeths. All in all, I can say that I will most definitely return to the St Regis this December.  In fact, as I type, I realize I need to make a reservation, 3 months to go, I will see you soon St Regis!

title: Could not have been better .
text: Just spent 3 nites with family, adjoining rooms.  Beautiful.  3 tv's, including 1 in the mirror in the bathroom.  It is the old saying, 'you get what you pay for'.  Service could not have been better.  Fantastic breakfast, although on the high side price wise.  The Titanic omlet was $75.00, which we did not get.  Everyone there completely helpful. The only issue while we were there was on Monday, Labor day.  It seems that the kitchen/wait staff was missing . We had to wait 45 minutes for breakfast.  Other than that, great stay.  Beautiful interior, classic style. built by the Astors.  I do not understand why this hotel is not rated much higher.

title: Another great stay
text: Great location. Always great service.  Some of the bellmen, valets, waiters have been there for 20+ years, a tribute to the hotel. Rooms are large for NYC. We have been coming 3-4 times a year for many years. One complaint for mgmt.....There was always a wonderful, calming smell in the lobby. Whatever they have done has been replaced with an antiseptic type smell. Formerly it was a smell that was pleasant.  Now it seems like they are using the same product as used on an Amtrak train. Definitely not what should be at a hotel as fine as the St. Regis.

title: NICE room and service recovery
text: Stayed 1N. Tiny check in area which was crowded with guests.  Originally upgraded to the  massive Imperial Suite but I voluntarily downgraded tho a deluxe room as I wanted late checkout. Luxurious linen on very comfortable beds.  Nice large bathroom.  As a Platinum, I chose in-room American Breakfast for 2, but only one order arrived.  Waiter was very apologetic and rushed the second order which arrived 10 minutes later albeit with the wrong juice (he came back 2 minutes later with the correct item). During checkout, I was disappointed to see the bell boy stand and simply watch us lug our bags  through the revolving door and down a flight of stairs to street level.

title: Beautiful rooms
text: The St. Regis rooms are lovely. Very large which is rare in NYC, beautifully appointed bathrooms, very courteous Bellmen and Valet. But the reception, concierge, and butler service were terrible. There was very little communication between employees shifts, they offered to send cookies and milk for the kids nightly at 7:30pm; day shift either forgot to tell the night shift or they both forgot because one night we never received them and the next came at 10pm after the kids had gone to sleep and we had called three times. The concierge sent us to a restuarant that was closed. The reception/front desk offered us a room with a king bed (we had requested two queens but was told it would take longer to get ready) with a complimentary rollaway and then charged us $90/night for the rollaway. Multiple times talking to them and calling back and it was never fully resolved. The roll away was removed from the bill itemization  but not from the actual total if you did the math. But all in all, great location, beautiful rooms, awesome health club/spa.

title: Almost great
text: We recently spent 5 nights at this iconic hotel. The team executed at a very high level and recognized my platinum status which is always appreciated. However I have one issue. When I made the reservation I was asked if we were celebrating anything which I explained that it will be our 18th anniversary. When we checked in they mentioned that our anniversary was noted. After three days there was no acknowledgement whether at dinner or breakfast. On the fourth day I asked the concierge and he confirmed it was noted but explained there was a change in policy but that he would make sure we would be taken care of. Two days later and nothing happened. It was a strange miss and definitely stranger more if this really a shift in policy. It's a wonderful hotel and sweating the details is what sets it apart. We hope to visit again.

title: Hugo
text: The front desk agent named Hugo provided incredible service. He is an example of who a professional in the service industry should emulate. Its always a pleasure visiting the St. Regis New York. Thanks for another wonderful stay.

title: Best Bar in the city
text: My husband and I had the BEST experience at the King Cole Bar. Christine was the most amazing bar tender and served us the best cocktails we could imagine! Thank you for hiring people that know what they are doing!

title: Yeah it's incredibly expensive, and yeah it's great!!!!
text:
Just got back with a 2 night stay at St Regis.  A wealthy friend took me and another friend of ours on a trip to NY for the US Open Tennis.  I have no clue how anyone could rate this hotel anything less than a 5.  It was amazing!!  The deluxe suites have a living room with TV, couch, 2 sitting chairs, a desk, multiple table top books, window with a view (from my room 1507, I could see Central Park), fireplace (I don't think it works but I really didn't look at it that closely, and a half bath just off it.  The bedroom was wonderful.  Bed, pillows, linens...all superb.   Bedroom has it's own TV and small dresser.  Master bathroom is exquisite!!  Dual sinks, luxury tub, walk in shower with wonderful water flow and pressure, and a separate room for the commode.  Lighting throughout the room is done with beautiful chandeliers and lamps.  Several setting for brightness in all rooms.  Closet is big with plenty of hangers.  Safe in closet.  Unlike other small, tight, rooms I've stayed in NY, a person could live in this room.  

The whole Butler deal is not my thing but I did use it to receive complimentary coffee (other than tip) in the morning.  Coffee was top notch, served piping hot in a French Press.  I'm an adult so I don't need someone to unpack or pack for me.

Used room service twice.  Once after midnight I got a salad topped with chicken.  The greens were fresh and the large grilled chicken breast was tasty.  The salad was $22.  The chicken breast was extra (I'm guessing it was at least another $20).  As I said, this place isn't cheap.  Breakfast I did a build you own omelette with 3 ingredients for $22.  It came with cold potatoes and toast.  The omelette was very good.  And yes I tried their famous $25 or $30 or whatever it is bloody mary.  It was very average, at best.

The famous bar appeared to be a bit stuffy.  Not my kind of place to drink.  The people who were in there were dressed formally.

Every employee I dealt with here was so kind;  the concierge, front desk, fitness room attendant, butler (Patricia), both men who delivered my room service...everyone!!!

As I stated earlier, a friend treated me to this stay here.  I could not afford it.  But, I would love nothing better than to one day visit NY with my wife and stay with her at The St. Regis Hotel.  If you have the money, DO IT!!!  You won't regret it.

title: US Open 2017
text: Excellent service and friendly staff. If you enjoy Central Park this hotel is in a great location to walk to the park in a matter of a few minutes. Butler service for your room is a wonderful addition to your stay (complimentary morning french press coffee and pressing of articles of clothing). Room was nicely appointed and spacious for my wife and I. Shower leaked out on the floor in the bathroom but was always dried up by housekeeping while we were out and about. Bentley house car was not in service but in its place was a nice S class Mercedes. Was looking forward to a ride to dinner in the Bentley but maybe next time.

title: Wondeful Birthday spent at the St. Regis
text: My husband surprised me with a trip to NYC and a stay at the St. Regis.  The hotel is beautiful and clean.  As a birthday treat we were given an upgrade and two free cocktails in the King Cole Bar.  It was such a nice treat!   The day of my birthday we woke up to great coffee by our butler (we especially loved the Butler Service bringing us coffee in the morning.  That was the hardest to leave behind) walked to the Boat house in Central Park ,a day of shopping on 5th Avenue and the day ended by walking to see Bette Midler in Hello Dolly.  The hotel is in a great location.  If your looking for a nice treat, a great location then book your room at The St. Regis.

title: Incredible
text: We had an absolutely incredible stay at the St. Regis New York! The hotel is beautiful: a perfect mix that highlights its rich history while still retaining a modern and luxurious feel. The rooms are fantastic; they are spacious and very well-appointed. As SPG Platinum, we were treated very well, with one room upgrade to a wonderful deluxe suite and the other room to a grande luxe room. Both rooms were extremely spacious and simply beautiful. The service throughout our stay was near flawless, some of the best we have experienced anywhere. Our butler was readily available and introduced herself within minutes of entering our room. We had drinks at the King Cole Bar which was a great experience, and breakfast in the Astor Court was very nice as well. We were also celebrating a birthday while here, and the hotel brought a personalized note and a sweet treat to recognize the occasion, which was very kind and much appreciated. Special thanks to the wonderful director of rooms, Daniela, for being very kind and helping to make our stay fantastic! We will be back!

title: PHENOMENAL
text:
I stayed at the St Regis for 3 nights and it was really a fantastic stay, the staff was amazing , especially the butler service (shoutout to Dolores) which made me feel right at home and did everything possible to get me whatever i needed. The breakfast at the Astor court was amazing with a lot of food options , i tried the chocolate chip pancakes, the omelette and the waffles along with the pastry basket which were all exceptional. The hotel is situated in a great location 15 min from Times Square and 2-3 minutes from all the high end shops like Gucci , Cartier etc... Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Can't wait to stay here again.

title: Extreme Luxury
text: I was fortunate enough to stay in a luxurious suite, with 2 bathrooms, a large living area, dining area and massive bedroom.  Every detail was luxurious and well thought - especially the butler that was provided, on call for everything from shoe shine, quick pressing of a shirt, delivery of room service and anything else you can imagine.  I have stayed at many Relais & Chateaux hotels across the world, and many high-end 5 star properties as well - this is one of the best, and the prices reflect that (over $30. for a Bloody Mary- which they invented, and a $50. Cheeseburger through Room Service) What impressed me the most though, was the architecture, scale of the rooms and incredible grandeur.

title: How can one compare
text: It was so cold outside and the warmth of this Iconic land mark is just incredible in contrast. The main lobby very busy but the essence of history amongst it all is just overwhelming. There are chandeliers everywhere in the hotel, what a lovely fetish to have - you can never have enough Chandeliers I say. The Concierge team was just out of this world, I have forgotten her name but she was an European Lady that just took over my life and fixed it all in just a moment. Thank you all for a devine time. Shall be back.

title: Lost for words
text: Had booked 2 rooms using points and upgrade vouchers for one room to a suite maybe this influenced our stay?? Whilst not a right I would normally get an upgrade on at least one room but we got what we booked, ok fair enough. What's annoying though we were told upon arrival that via the butler service all coffee and tea was complimentary. Imagine my shock when we were charged  about $155 for 8 espressos (extortion) having complained at checkout I was told that policy was complimentary regular coffe but espresso was extra ,why????anyway they sent me a revised invoice which still showed coffee charge but in addition a minibar bill for $120 which we didn't consume . It's now been over 2 weeks and still not resolved. The st Regis brand generally is a guarantee but New York falls well below expectations in terms of standards . To be fair rooms are nice and the young lady in gym who unfortunately we don't remember her name was exquisite. Whilst New York is expensive they seem to want to be even more expensive, the cheapest glass of wine $19 without service/tip which was haphazard at best.my previous trip to New York was at the Westin Times Square which was better and that's saying something. I think st. Regis New York should take lessons  from Singapore, Bangkok,Bora Bora and others

title: WOW I love the ST REGIS! And I'll tell you why!
text:
An amazing hotel, truly a wonderful experience. I have come here with my family multiple times a year and will do so many many times more! 

The hotel staff are familiar with many languages thus you can expect help no matter what you speak. The hotel staff was so kind and accommodating. If there is a problem do not hesitate to dial 0. The staff will already know your name and be able to help you in a very fast way. I always see everyone working in the hotel smile. No matter what job they do they treat every guest like royalty. 

The restaurant in the hotel is fantastic. They have an amazing breakfast! As a platinum member we were able to enjoy the delicious breakfast free!!! 

The hotel has made our stay truly magical every time! As platinum status gets you great upgrades I have stayed in so many different suites and different occasions!!! The views are amazing and the climate control in each room is just perfect!  The turn down service staff are always soooo friendly. When you return to the room it will look amazing!!

This hotel will always be favorite hotel as it is a legendary part of New York. It's so famous and seen in so many shows and movies. One of the shows I watch called nurse Jackie has scene at the st regis and other movies I have seen as well!! 

Only problem I had with the hotel was the Bentley being gone for almost a year. The Bentley is a signature part!! 
I will edit this review and remove the part about the Bentley as soon as it returns!

From the shore family
ERIC SHORE

title: STAY AWAY
text:
There is no service at this hotel.  From the moment one checks in until departure all of the staff are snotty, stupid, rude, disinterested or tell the guest "it is not my job or department."

The restaurant food is horrendous and so are the prices.

Management is unprofessional, inappropriate and simply not what one would expect at ANY hotel.

Do not waste your money, points, etc. at this hotel.

title: In the heart of Newyork
text:
You feel like entering a palace or a museum! 
It's beautiful and super clean.
The staff are friendly and the service is quick!
The location is prime.
A block away from the Trump Tower if that interests you ;p

title: Atmosfera Retrò (e non solo l'atmosfera)
text:
Rimane sempre un grande albergo storico, rimasto in gran parte come era qualche decennio fa, quando nella sua hall si potevano incontrare personaggi come Salvator Dalì.
La piacevole atmosfera retrò non deve però far dimenticare l'obsolescenza di molte parti dell'hotel, la poca professionalità di (troppi) dipendenti, la insufficienza di servizi hi-tech oggi indispensabili.
Posizione nel cuore di Manhattan, pochi metro off 5th Avenue!

title: Mario - the best hotelier we met so far
text:
I was on a business trip with my team and we just wanted to have a quick look into the St Regis when Mario (Lobby Ambassador) approached us and offered us a tour of the hotel. It was such a nice gesture of Mario to take time to do a show around and tell us the whole story about the hotel and historic happenings.

The Hotel is really stunning and ultra luxury in every detail. Thank you again Mario for your true hospitality!

title: Extraordinary stay
text: Absolute perfection starting from greeting of doorman, early checkin, upgrade on room, delicious late lunch, linens, beautiful bathroom. And room service was excellent. My daughter called at 2 am to say she was  on the way from airport to hotel, 30 min trip. I called room service & they had her dinner at our room at exactly 2:29, she arrived 2 minutes later. Everything was simply perfect. Location cannot be beat, and thus will be my go-to hotel from now on while in the city.

title: Classy but service is below standards
text: I'm staying at the hotel and I'm a Gold SPG member. I received an email afew days asking if I needed anything for my arrival or any requests.  I asked for 2  things : a quiet room and a separate tub and shower.  I receive back an email that my info was sent to front desk.  I sensed from the response that this was just a pass off to someone else rather than a real interest in my request.   Of course when I arrive the room they have me in is not that quiet and the front desk intern admitted that and also didn't have a separate shower.  The line up to check in was also long and slow with only one intern handling the check ins.  The manager was no where to be seen.  I stay at the St Regis for its high standards but it seems they really don't care anymore and just go through the motions now.  Certainly not what you expect from a hotel like this.

title: Overrated, below average service
text:
Overrated hotel, bad service. On top, every invoice you get has something you did not ask for on it. Arrogant attitude, not client orriented. 
Old property, burried in the past, not adapted to nowadays realities.

title: Amazing
text:
My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary this past weekend and spent a night in the City.  I had stayed at the St. Regis several years prior for a friends wedding. Over the years I have told my wife how amazing the entire experience was, she thought I was exaggerating.  
My wife is now a believer, we had an amazing stay from the time we pulled up to the valet service until the time we left.  The front desk service was excellent, the butler service was excellent, the concierge service was excellent.  The night of our anniversary my wife was treated like a princess and I, a prince.  Thank you St. Regis!!!

title: Subpar hotel, great staff
text: Recently stayed at the St. Regis New York.  Got upgraded to a larger room, which ended up being two small rooms (one for sleeping, one for TV).  Decor is very outdated, there are chips along the doors from overuse.  The hotel is beautiful, but plenty of other options for the price in NYC.  Breakfast is expensive.   If included in your rate, they charge the difference in some cases.

title: Unbelievable Hotel and Staff
text:
I used to stay at the St Regis in NY with regularity but had more recently switched to boutique hotels. For a variety of reasons I found myself back there last week and was once again amazed by the hotel and the experience of staying there.  

First off, the staff is great and the butlers for your rooms allow you to achieve strong service very easily.  The rooms themselves are amazingly elegant, quiet and comfortable.  The amenities in the room are top notch, the food from room service was tasty, and the gym is comprehensive.

The bar is not hip or quirky but is very comfortable albeit tends to have an older crowd there.

I could not recommend this place more!

title: Great location, service & room you'd expect of St. Regis
text:
It is definitely an amazing hotel. I feel marginally guilty about marking it down one star but only because may be I come from the part of the world where the service charge is included in the bills. I can't help feeling like a walking ATM totally out of adequate change. I wish there was an easier way to handle tips as we never seem to have enough small notes, and besides who uses cash these days especially when traveling internationally. There is a need to tip at every turn! Laundry charges not sure are on par with other hotels in the area but basically, it is cheaper to buy & replace than to wash at the hotel. We travelled for three weeks at top of the line hotels in Singapore, London, Seattle and this is the first one we thought LONG & HARD about how to justify this dilemma.
I get that you are expected to spend at St. Regis, but this one in New York was a bit too complicated for comfort.

title: Somehow dissapointed but still a grand dame
text:
This was my second stay at the St Regis NY. The hotel has been revamped is much more expensive bit i can't say it has much improved. 
On the bright side: got an upgrade and a very nice room, late checkout, the concierges are knowledgeable and get you in difficult places like the Polo Bar across the street.
downsides: the Ducasse restaurant is gone and hasn't been replaced so you're left with a somewhat lame breakfast/diner lounge. The King Cole must be run trotskyists since i was refused entry before midnight despite identifying myself as an hotel guest. I duly complained and next day was served a deliberate over spicy bloody mary in what felt like retaliation. The hotel as a butler service that packs your stuff on demand. I lost i cherished Lanvin fedora on the process without so much of an excuse. Considering the price you pay you can find better options in NY. By the way i'm an SPG Gold so the upgrades and late check outs come with the status.

title: Classic Hotel
text:
I loved this hotel. It captures a distinctive "golden age" vibe in a very special way. 

On check-in, there was a small disturbance in the lobby due to the behaviour of another guest who was unhappy with her allocated room. The only blip during our stay was that the room we were allocated with an external view was clearly given to this complaining guest. The manager literally took the key from the hands of the lady checking us in as she was giving them to me (and after we had been told what a lovely room we had been allocated)... But the hotel was professional enough to deal with our concern immediately, and we were given a gorgeous external view room facing onto Fifth Avenue and complimentary breakfast and drinks. This rapid commitment to service was indicative of the rest of our stay. 

Otherwise, the whole stay was perfect. The room was elegant. It felt very classic and luxurious, but also had any modern convenience. The King Cole bar was the perfect place to meet friends. The complimentary Bentley was a special touch to drop us to dinner at a perfect concierge recommendation. We loved the atmosphere in the hotel restaurant the next morning for breakfast. 

I would stay here again without hesitation. We felt valued and special.

title: We found our "New York Hotel"
text:
I have been very fortunate enough to travel the world during my life and have stayed is some wonderful hotels and some spectacular locations. However I often find that  so called 5 star hotels often lack any personality and as an ordinary individual make you feel out of place. This is not the case for the St Regis New York.

I have stayed in New York a number of time, from modern hotels in the noisy and chaotic Times square area, just too noisy and very busy. The Plaza Hotel by central park, an overrated, dirty rundown hotel that I would never stay in again even if it was free. The Peninsula Hotel, where the staff were rude and cold on multiple occasions. That said The St Regis made us feel very welcome from the second we exited our taxi from the airport, from the doorman, the bellmen and receptions staff. After check in we experienced our first wow. As we arrived on our floor (18th floor) we were greeted by our butler, yes our butler who escorted us to our room and demonstrated and showed us our room facilities. The room a Grand Luxe Room (1821) was our next wow. A well appointed spectacular, air conditioned room with a full lounge and large bedroom, walk in wardrobe, and delightful bathroom, oh and their base free WiFi was brilliant and reliable. 

Pawel our butler then brought us some water and a tray of fresh coffee and biscuits. Our butler's. chamber maids, room service staff, reception, bellmen and concierge were all very warm and welcoming, and most importantly never made you feel out of place despite our holiday attire (shorts and T shirts) due to above average very hot weather for July.

My only observation is the staff  in the King Cole bar were not as accepting and warm as the rest of the staff. This could have been our attire but we were never made to feel awkward.

We experienced great room service, a lovely meal in the restaurant and coffee in Astor Court. We found our "New York Hotel" a beautiful hotel in the perfect location, midtown on 55th Street, steps away from 5th Avenue. A short walk to Central Park with lots of eateries on your doorstep to suit any budget.

Thank you to all the staff we will look forward to once again experience the pleasures of the St Regis

title: Birthday celebration at Fifth Avenue Suite
text:
It was my first stay at St. Regis New York and it was during my birthday. Upon arrival, the staff at check in counter offered me an upgrade to the Fifth Avenue Suite for this special occasion.

The suite itself was huge - 1,100 sq ft with a separate bedroom, lounge area and two bathrooms. It was just like a classic luxury apartment and I felt like home. I can get a very nice view of the Fifth Avenue from my windows and balcony.

I was given a butler - George who took care of all my needs for my stay, from morning coffee to unpacking my luggage. He was amazing and made me feel very special.

This is definitely an experience you shouldn't miss for a stay in NYC. I will definitely come back again next time.

title: My favorite hotel in the world
text: The St. Regis New York is exceptional in every way.  It has a level of luxury and elegance that you can't find anywhere else.  The staff is warm, caring and professional.  The standard rooms are great, with comfortable beds, furniture that is both attractive and extremely functional, and gorgeous marble bathrooms with high end amenities.  The suites are extremely spacious and decadently luxurious.  The location on Fifth Avenue can't be beat.  Room service is top notch.  Housekeeping is impeccable.  Everyone goes out of their way to make sure that your stay is perfect.

title: Incredible hotel, a new favorite!
text:
I was worried this hotel would be too stuffy for my 3 year old but we received nothing but the best, most accommodating service. One of the women working the front desk during the day was incredible kind and engaging with my son, chasing us down because she found a teddy bear she had promised him. Because of our platinum SPG status we were upgraded to a suite and it has been one of the most beautiful hotel rooms I've stayed in. It truly captured the feel from when Jacob Astor would've opened this grand hotel. I loved the feeling of history. 
We ordered room service for breakfast and absolutely loved our experience. We felt like we were dining at a fancy restaurant but in the comforts of our beautiful room.
The location is also terrific. Close to shopping plus Central Park and the Central Park zoo. 
We have stayed in a lot of different hotels and as of right now I would have to say this is my new favorite!

title: St. Regis
text: Beautiful hotel.  We got a great deal on the Madison Suite.  Upgraded, excellent price.  Great location.  In the heart of the best shopping!!  Highly recommend.  The room wasn't ready on time, but was worth the wait.  Excellent hotel

title: Excellent service
text:
We came for a weekend to celebrate the birthday of a good friend. Room was fantastic. Especially given New York standards. Spacious, comfortable and luxurious as we'd expect from a St. Regis. The staff were very warm and helpful. 
The lobby and elevators are a bit tired feeling and could use a bit updating. The Astor for breakfast was ridiculously priced (even for NYC!). $14 for oatmeal. $28 omelettes. The location was excellent though and we walked to Central Park and other locales.

title: Merry old soul
text:
One of my favourite  hotels in America. 
This place is so personable and unique that  I cannot recommend it highly enough.  
Great suites.
Great service.
Wonderful location. 
The food is fabulous and quite unique. 
A refuge from reality.

title: Exquisite
text: Sorry, I am very late writing this report. We stayed in late September last year and I genuinely find that this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in my life. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they took very, very good care of us, with infite attention to detail. We got a superquiet suite assigned on one of the high floors, as we had requested. Everything feels brand new in the hotel, after a large-scale refurbishment they recently went through. Their restaurant is fantastic, for breakfast and dinner.

title: A very pleasent stay
text: The check in experience was easy and pleasant. Had lunch at the King Cole Bar which was excellent. Also did a night cap there. Best bartenders in NYC. Room was luxurious with a lot of little touches. There is a TV in the mirror in the bathroom. Never saw that before I thought it was cool. They have a free Bentley service with in 10 blocks of the hotel. I wish I knew about it during my stay. It would have been nice to use. If the is 1 knock to the hotel it does not have a signature restaurant. The space that use to house it has sat empty for years. I would like a response from the hotel as why they don't put that space to use.

title: Small and adorable.
text: Nice spacious rooms, good location . The only thing bad about it is that they don't have buffet breakfast and it takes lot of time to get a table and it becomes quite expensive too. 2 of the mornings, I was offered high chairs of bar for breakfast which is not ideal when you pay about 60 dollars for simple omlette, juice and black coffee. But overall very good.

title: Perfection! A true 5 Star property.
text: My wife and I stayed at the St. Regis for a 3 night stay in May of 2017. The bellman that greeted us as we arrived in our Uber was outstanding. I wish I could remember his name because he asked my name once and remembered it the entire stay. He got the hotels Bentley to take us to our restaurant for dinner on 2 of the 3 nights we stayed. I had requested a early check in of 2pm on a Friday. They could not honor that, and bought my wife and I drinks in the bar. Which I felt was above and beyond because I was not upset at all that the room was not ready. The only food we ate at the hotel was in the bar and it was outstanding. Our room had such a comfortable bed and pillows that when my wife and I went home we ordered a king sized bed and 4 pillows from the St Regis store website. The only problem I encountered on our 3 night stay was the pull down shade on one of the windows was broken. I was going to bring it up to the staff but forgot. After 2 days the maid must have reported it to someone to repair it. On our last day at the hotel the shower handle fell apart in my hands. It was difficult to get the water off after that. Even though we had 2 maintenance issues with our room, it is not any sign that the hotel is falling apart. Everything is clean and very well kept up. They just need a little help with the PM.

title: Fabulous hotel
text: Great hotel. The staff is wonderful, always helpful. The property is close to everything. The rooms are spacious. We had a suite and it was fantastic. Beds are very comfortable, with nice pillows. Housekeeping did a great job, checking when we wanted room cleaned.

title: Always Perfect!
text: We try to always stay at the St Regis New York when we are visiting the city. It is in a perfect location and is a gorgeous building. We had an amazing suite and enjoyed the extra space. Having two bathrooms was perfect. We decided to get room service for breakfast everyday just to enjoy the room. Everything at the St Regis is so clean and well cared for. It is a special, historical hotel. Service is always excellent. We love the King Cole Bar and have spent many happy hours there through the years. We can't wait until our next visit.

title: Excellent location
text:
The hotel is very well situated on 5 th ave.
It is an old hotel but very nicely renovated. 
The only drawback is that the breakfast is overpriced and not that good. I was lucky it was included in my rate.

title: Great hotel, great staff, and great experience
text: My recent stay at the St. Regis was excellent. The staff is great, my room was fantastic and the whole overall experience was very pleasurable. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I look forward to coming back. A special thanks to Jose at the front desk who has remembered me from previous stays and always inquires about my family. Touches like those make the St. Regis New York into the great property that it is.

title: Understated luxury
text: We were upgraded to a suite, so we had a spacious room by NY standards. We didn't take advantage of the butler, but the service was wonderful. Quiet, luxurious room in a true Old New York institution.

title: Disappointment
text: Went for 'Afternoon Tea' here in February and I still get frustrated just thinking about how terrible the service was and how poor the selection of food was! I must say what a beautiful hotel which is kept in immaculate condition and the King Cole bar was fantastic but it was just the main restaurant which lacked any kind of atmosphere. I work in a very high end 5* hotel in Mayfair, London so I understand how it all works. One major thing that irritated me was the fact that me and my fiancé do not eat fish, so we told the waiter (who was miserable, lifeless and rude) so instead of replacing the fish sandwich with an alternative they simply removed it from the plate to which there was still evidence of that on the plate! $70 each, includes a glass of brut champagne, a few sandwiches, scone and pastries. Extremely disappointed, especially as we were on holiday from London, celebrating both of our birthdays.

title: The most humiliating hotel experience
text:
On my most recent work trip to NYC, I chose to stay at the St Regis vs my usual (The Peninsula).  Never again will I go back. 

After a long day of client meetings, I decided to grab a light dinner and drink at the hotel lobby bar (King Cole Bar).  I travel quite a bit for work and my one rule of thumb is to avoid being holed up in a room with room service. I headed straight to the bar after getting back to the hotel and intentionally grabbed a small table in the far corner as I knew I'd need to get some work in to clear all my emails from the day.  

Literally within 15 seconds of powering on my laptop, one of the servers bolted over to me and asked if I was aware that they had a "No Laptop Policy" after 4pm.  Seriously??  I had to ask myself, was I really staying at a 5-star business property?  I politely pushed back and said I was a guest at the hotel and had to get some work done and would be out of there quickly after my meal.  He looked annoyed but then retreated.

Fast forward 15-20 minutes...my food and wine arrives and I'm not even halfway through.  That's when the F&B manager then approaches me.  He actually had the audacity to ask how much longer will I be on my laptop as I am being disruptive.  Again, to set the context, I am sitting in the far corner next to a pillar and had my laptop screen dimmed to the lowest setting.  I am not engaging with anyone yet I'm being disruptive??  One would think an F&B manager would have some business and common sense and decency to recognize that you don't go and ask a paying guest at the hotel to get up in the middle of a meal because they are working on their laptop.  When I told him I didn't understand their policy and why he was enforcing it, he said I was not "fitting in" to the bar scene.  Unbelievable.  He then tells me he'd be happy to have my food and wine moved outside the bar where I could freely work.  I am at this point just dumbfounded.  It was like being asked to move to the back of the bus or get off the bus for that matter.  Most humiliating and distasteful experience ever and never ever would I have imagined it would be on a work trip at what's supposed to be an upstanding hotel.  

And just to be clear, on the many occasions I've had to power up my laptop at the bar at The Peninsula to get some work done, not once did anyone ask me to turn off my laptop or leave.  Crystal clear for me now...

title: Un monumento all'ospitalità senza tempo!
text:
Trovo che questo hotel sia uno dei migliori di NYc, per la sua storia, per la sua bellezza e il suo fascino senza tempo!
Servizi impeccabili, interni mozzafiato, location impagabile. Prezzi nella norma per questa tipologia di hotel. Se ce lo si può permettere, almeno una volta nella vita, bisogna provarlo!!!

title: Best NYC Hotel
text: I have been staying in the St-Regis New York for the last 18 years. The quality of service and comfort cannot be matched anywhere in NYC. During my latest stay was no exception, this hotel continues to be my benchmark of big city hotels. Thank you St-Regis for always making my stay enjoyable.

title: Perfect Memorial Day Weekend at The St. Regis
text: We were in NYC last year and walked through the St.Regis while shopping on 5th Ave. We were greeted so warmly even though we weren't guests that I told my husband next time we are staying here. This gorgeous hotel was everything we wanted and more for our little getaway. We were upgraded and shown to our beautiful suite. Our butler Mamady came and whisked away my husbands wrinkled shirts and took his shoes for polishing. This posh room was immaculate the entire stay. Very comfy beds and luxe bath that is well appointed. The King Cole Bar is a must visit if you are staying here or not. Hands down the best cocktials ever with fantastic attentive service-we felt right at home. Delicious snacks/nuts are served as well. We ate breakfast on our last morning and I highly recommend you don't leave here without treating yourself to thier famous french toast! The concierge service is phenomanal thank you Robert! I can't say enough about this hotel and its perfect location, its that old saying you totally get what you pay for! We can't wait to return this will be our place in NYC from now on!

title: Sad this was just one night stay
text:
Of course, the one time I am booked in the city for one night, is the first time I was booked here. I checked in early and Jose was already able to find me a room. Miguel stopped me in the hall and made sure I was all set. 
When I got to 18th floor, Alex was waiting for me. Alex the butler. He took my jacket to dryclean and got me a pot of tea. 
I was going to head to office...but why. I stayed put and worked from here. 
Bathroom was stately. Ring holder on counter!  TV in the mirror. 
Fruit was in room. And chocolates. Bose radio. Hair dryer was surprisingly basic, just like at other SPG properties. 
Nice gym. With cold water and towels. Headphones available. Headphones - not ear buds. Helpful bellmen too.

title: Favorite Spot in NYC
text: I have stayed other places in NYC, this is my first choice every time. The service is first rate. The rooms are decorated well, but are somewhat dated. It is just the best in NYC- house car is typically readily available for quick transport. Staff is very attentive. Best in NYC.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text:
This is just pure class and you feel special whilst either visiting or staying -great bar and great staff.

You can book a suite and throw a party for friends to ensure value for your money. 

Great for people watching.

title: Absolutely the best
text:
Stayed here for a weekend with my sister and had the BEST experience.  Beautiful, quiet room,  decadent bathrooms with wonderful bath amenities.
My favorite was the turn down service and complimetary coffee and tea with butler service.
Felt like a queen the entire time!

title: Simply the Best
text:
The hotel, the rooms, the service, the friendly staff, the food: just fabulous.  Sure, it costs a little more than other hotels but you get what you pay for and,  for my wife and I, we will gladly return again and again.  It MAKES our stay in NYC!  We love it.

Other factors?  The location.  Near shopping, Central Park, great restaurants, museums, convenient public transportation, etc. etc.  Yet the hotel is very quiet and almost seems a little bit off the beaten path (it's not).  Lastly, no matter what time we leave for the airport the staff manages to have a cab waiting for us within, literally, seconds.

You should stay here.

title: Not what it used to be
text: Classic, classy interior design replaced with tacky, cheap imitation. Some of the same wonderful staff, but overall different and very disappointing vibe. Especially disappointing with the increased pricing-more cost, less quality...time to go elsewhere. Will miss the deep bathtubs.

title: Simply Fabulous
text: This was our second stay at the St. Regis, and this time we booked through American Express Platinum concierge. As part of their fine hotel's program, we booked for 2 days and the third night was comped. It also included $100.00 towards meals and complete breakfast for 2. Upon checking in, Hugo acknowledged me as a Platinum SPG guest and upgraded us to the Madison Suite! Every room comes with a butler, who will bring you complimentary tea or coffee service. There's a house Bentley which is available on a first come,first served basis. The food is extremely good in their restaurant and the King Cole bar is internationally famous.

title: Pure Class in a great location
text:
Fabulous hotel fabulous staff and service. Gorgeously appointed room with stunning libel, towels and amenities for everyone's needs. Butler Service impeccable and this location puts all of New York a walk away including Central
park, shops, restaurants. Other places a short Iber ride away. A beautiful hotel worthy of a special sat for two.

title: Mr jarel Portman
text:
I haven't stayed in the st regis is years. I had heard they've upgraded not only the rooms but the internet and I room movies. Which I love on a 20 hour fast and furious business trip with bankers. 

I must say the room was delightful , service impeccable and nice. I was truly impressed. 

If you're in NYC , and want a great hotel but don't want to pay insane prices i.e. Carlyle , 4seasons , Park Hyatt and Peninsula ( who I am quite fond of , 2,300 $ on a Monday night is ridiculous. That and I am a recurring guest with an American Express Centurian Card. I never understood hotels who would rather a room stand empty than rent it for someone arriving at 9pm - checking out 8 am. That part of the industry needs to use common sense. 

Overall , St Regis , while a grande old dame was excellent. Great bed. Great shower pressure and HOT , so watch out. Staff was lovely. I highly suggest anyone going to NYC to stay here. On a side note it's directly across from Ralph Lauren's new restaurant Bar. Plan in advance as it looks fabulous. I didn't plan , but was able to get in at the sherry netherland's Harry's Bar which was outstanding. Another reason to stay at the St Regis. The greatest restaurants are all within walking distance. 
My father designed and devolved the Marriott Marquis and as fabulous as the design is , I feel claustrophobic in such large hotels.  

Stay here. It's so worth it.

title: Impressive in Every Way
text: We arrived on a Saturday around 10am, leaving our car and luggage with the hotel while we enjoyed the city.  This was our first stay at this property and we were duly impressed with the impeccable service, the quality of the property, and professionalism of the staff.  Every single staff member we encountered on the property was always gracious and accommodating. They recognized we were there  to celebrate a birthday, and the front staff and the butler were all aware and made note of it, including leaving chocolate covered strawberries with a note to help commemorate the event.  The rooms were stunning in every way.  Being SPG Platinum has been extremely rewarding for us, and in this case it resulted in both rooms being upgraded, one to a large suite, which was absolutely fantastic.  The historical significance of the hotel is well noted with mementos and photographs throughout the property which really made us appreciate staying there.  I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. They made us feel special in every way, the property is stunning and in a great location, and the staff is exemplary.  Thank you St. Regis New York!

title: 1st class Long Weekend
text: My partner and I enjoyed 3 nights at the renovated St. Regis. Dspite  a cold, rainy spring weekend in NYC,,, we appreciated the lovely accommodations in conveniently located and lovely appointed facilities. Our only complaint was difficulty in getting a cab from the hotel.

title: Gorgeous hotel - rude staff ruined experience
text:
We stopped by this hotel for an early breakfast before a business meeting. The restaurant staff were fantastic and real characters. We had no idea that the bloody Mary was invented here. Although it was nice, it was not my best.

We had an absolute feast. All the food was delicious and the surroundings are beautiful. 

All was going perfectly until my colleague and I went to the washrooms. As we walked out I was about to blow my nose so I grabbed a disposable hand towel from the side. After taking this towel I heard an almighty tut followed by a disgusting look from the maid who was cleaning the bathrooms. I turned round to my colleague in shock. The maid then looked at us, shouted in an unknown language and barged past us to leave the rooms.

Word of advise - if you don't want people using the towels, don't put them out!

After spending nearly £340 dollars on breakfast for two people I naturally felt disappointed and disheartened.

title: The epitome of glitz and glamour
text: Built in 1904, The St. Regis has a long history to live up to, and in my opinion, they're doing a great job. The service is first rate, of course, but where this hotel really excels is in design. The renovation in 2013 was really genius. They simply took the "old" out of "old world glamour" and replaced it with something that is the most creative mix of traditional elegance with a touch of whimsy. We had several meals and drinks the King Cole Bar and everything was excellent. The Suites are another feature that set The St. Regis apart. If you stay, don't miss the hardback book on the cocktail table, it details the Suites including The Royal, The Imperial, The Bentley, The Dior, The Tiffany and of course, The Presidential. You can peruse it after your butler brings the morning coffee and papers. I was wowed! :)

title: Turkey Ciabatta
text: A business meeting preceded by a very quick lunch was everything it could have been and more. Fantastic service from Jessie who understood the time sensitive nature of my sandwich before my business contact arrived even freshening up my drinks at to make it look like I just got here! The turkey ciabatta and iced coffee were amazing, the blue cheese in the sandwich giving it a very different and pleasant  taste.  surroundings very relaxed and conducive to a great meeting.

title: Great Mother's Day Weekend!
