title: Luxury hotel but missing the mark.
text:
We stayed at the St Regis for a long weekend in April and while we can't hold them responsible for the weather, we can for the outrageous prices and so-so service. 

We checked in very late having had rotten luck with flying from Toronto to NY in very poor spring weather. I called the hotel and reminded them of our booking and that if possible and as we had booked through the Centurion travel service that we would like a quiet room with the customary upgrade offered through AMEX. The hotel was full when we arrived and we were given a very nice room on a lower floor with an offer to upgrade us the following day. I have no problem with this but don't waste my time with an upgrade if the room you are moving us to is NO BETTER than the one we had! we spent the afternoon coming back to our room, moving at 6pm which was just prior to our guests arriving for a drink, just to find our new room had a bigger entrance hall...yes that was it, smaller bathroom, higher floor and a few extra metres but all in a place that was unusable. 

My major issue with this hotel is that there is no lobby to sit around in and do a little waiting and NYC people watching (think Mandarin Oriental, The Plaza) and the truly outrageous prices in the very small and unimpressive restaurant where breakfast is served. Sorry guys but $15 plus taxes (USD for a Canadian) for juice and $12 for toast (how many loaves of bread is that?) is just extortion. Add to that the coffee being equivalent to the quality you would get in a diner. We sent it back three times and then were charged for the more expensive coffee that we only ordered due to the other being of such poor quality. 

Anyone who reads my reviews knows that while I put myself in the category of "luxury traveller" (#gratefulformylife) I have earned my own money so the money i spend has to be rewarded with value. I do not feel that the St Regis provides value for money for anyone but the very wealthy who don't care about what they are spending. 

I think there are much nicer hotels to stay at in NYC having stayed in the past few years at the Plaza (loved it), Mandarin Oriental (read my review), The London (in the days before I was on trip advisor but loved it), The Pierre (loved it) The Four Seasons (ditto), The Westin, The Belvedere years ago with my daughter....so have tasted my fair share of NY hotels. This one will not get a return visit from us.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: We arrived on a red eye and had requested an early check in on a Tuesday! I'm a Starwood gold. Unfortunately we ended up having to wait for a room much of the day - but along last- it was worth the wait. We had a great upgrade - and enjoyed our lovely room the rest of our stay. We also enjoyed the butler tea service each day! Great spot in the city to stay. Was not our first visit here won't be our last. The Bloody Mary excellent a must try - red hook I think. And the cheese tray amazing. The waiter in the bar had a great personality. Living high on the hog for a college tour visit - but hey mom has to have some fun too.

title: Hotel
text: I named it is a 6 stars hotel. I stayed here for 3 nights. I had a personal 24 hours housekeeper for my room. The room was well clean and looked wonderful any time no matter how mess I made. Very professional and good service.

title: Conforto
text: Confortável, espaçoso, café maravilhoso, perto de tudo. Pegamos uma nevasca mas foi algo muito bom pois não esperávamos. Atendimento muito bom do hotel e o próprio é uma obra de arte e da arquitetura da cidade.

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC
text:
The best hotel in the city for accommodations & service.  The doormen Pasquale, Patrick & Lenny greet you like you are a very special royal guest.

At the front desk Schelome, Christina & Hugo welcome you like you are family come to your second home.

title: A wonderful stay
text: From morning french press coffee and paper delivered by our butler to evening turn down service, our stay was wonderful.  The staff was attentive and welcoming.  We were in a Grand Luxe room on the inside, no view (just a roof) but the trade off was a very quiet room (no street noise).  The room was beautiful and the bathroom was large, but the best part was the gushing waterfall shower head...we're from Ca, home of the low flow showerheads.  It was amazing!

title: El hotel precioso y el servicio fantástico!
text:
Pasamos noche vieja en el hotel y debo decir que todo fue perfecto, particularmente gracias a la mayordomo española que nos tocó, lamentablemente no recuerdo el nombre, pero de verdad es "genial". Fue encantadora en todo momento e incluso cuando supo que eramos españoles nos trajo 2 paquetes de uvas para celebrar la noche vieja durante la cena (ya que eso no se estila), detalles que hacen la diferencia entre una estancia correcta, a una maravillosa. 
Todos los servicios muy bien, incluso hicimos el desayuno en la habitación, estaba todo muy bueno.
La habitación completamente renovada, amplia y muy cómoda, con vistas a la 5a. y Central Park, no nos molestó ni un ruido y eso que la zona estuvo llena todo el tiempo. 
Un placer habernos quedado aquí, repetiremos sin duda.

title: Comfortable, Elegant Accomodations
text:
I stayed in a double room and it was so comfortable and spacious. The room was nicely appointed. Fresh fruit and water bottles awaited me. The bed and bedding were very comfortable and I was able to get a wonderful nights rest. It was very convenient to control the lighting from just about anywhere too. 
The staff members were delightful and the complimentary Bentley ride was helpful especially in the rain. 
The one downside was that our view was terrible so we just kept the sheers closed. The only other negative was that I could not find any English speaking channels on the TV in the bathroom mirror. Overall, I highly recommend the St. Regis.

title: Runs throug its paces but would not be a first choice hotel; food is inconsistent and overpriced
text: I wanted to celebrate my 50th birthday in a historical place so I chose a night at the St. Regis hotel. We got a deluxe grand room; no upgrade due to 100% occupancy. The room was quite nice and roomy and is elegantly decorated, but felt warm at night even though the thermostat was set at 68 degrees. There was a birthday card with some chocolate strawberries. The hotel doesn't have many facilities other than a decent gym on a top floor. I heard the spa is being renovated. We had dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant in the atrium. I found the space crowded both meals and the hotel definitely needs more fine dining space. Food here is inconsistent and deserves detailed review: Dinner was decent but not great -- the signature risotto dish was awful, tasted like a bunch of rice and cream. Desserts and the salad were very good; fish entree was OK but a piece of fish on a plate with some salad on the side for $48 ought to be better. No petite fours and the bread plate was just OK and different tables got different items. Breakfast was OK but not great -- pastry dish was tired, the cream of wheat was awful and had to be sent back as it had sat and hardened (can't believe they tried to serve it). Breakfast prices are ridiculous -- $15 for a juice and $17 for a pastry dish served cold and boring. Our breakfast waiter had a problem with English and it took him several attempts till he got us what we wanted. You are paying top dollar here and you are almost elbow to elbow with other diners and some of the food was just poor. It may also have been a bad day at the hotel; the lobby restaurant seemed overwhelmed at 100% occupancy. Nevertheless, there are many better places you could go in this city for food and lodging. As a flagship for St. Regis this hotel runs through its paces but there is just no wow at all to it and the property doesn't have amenities that make it a first choice. For instance, when we got to our room there were some St. Regis bedside-type chocolates and some fruit which was nice to have but it was plain vanilla stuff that had no wow to it where they could have made some kind of impression. There are some service issues too -- check-in was slow for both me and my wife who arrived separately, and there was no communication between the butler and housekeeping. The butler came to see us for no reason and we told him they could send turndown in 15 minutes when we'd go to dinner and 2 minutes later the turndown person shows up. When we checked in, we were standing in line and someone asked if I wanted water or a drink. Actually, I wanted someone to go to an empty station at the front desk and check me in. You could get a lot more facilities across the street at the Peninsula, for instance. I found that hotel also to be disappointing, but there are others in NY that are good. I can certainly vouch for Asiate restaurant at the Mandarin Oriental. Both dinner and breakfast there are excellent and there are plenty of on-site amenities for health and fitness. Columbus Circle is also a better point to get to lots of subways than 55th and 5th Avenue and you have the whole Time Warner center right downstairs.

title: Best Hotel and Concierge Staff
text:
I was in New York staying at my favorite hotel in the U. S.., The St. Regis. It is hands down the best hotel not only in NYC, but in all of the continental U.S.. The recent renovation highlights the beauty of the building, but the service is what distinguishes this hotel from all others. If you need a button sewn on or a reservation for a great meal, all you need to do is ask, and voila, it is done. 

The concierge team lead by Maria Wittorp and Harald Mootz is absolutely the best. They are beyond kind and so willing to give the best recommendations for everything from restaurants and theater to shopping and arranging for the most beautiful flowers to be delivered to the room. I can't say enough fantastic things about them. If you are looking for the best, then head to 55th and 5th in New York and you won't be disappointed.

Also want to give a shout out to the doormen and to the drivers of the hotel's house car. They go above and beyond just like the rest of the staff. Can't wait to go back to my second home in NYC!

title: Excellent
text: Room was amazing.  We got an upgrade through Amex FHR/SPG gold. The service was superb.  From the bar, the restaurant, the front desk, valets, cleaning service. Everything was right on point. Breakfast, bar food and drinks were all very good. We will definitely be staying here again.

title: Exceptional in Every Way
text:
We stayed at the St Regis to celebrate my daughters 25th birthday.   From the moment we walked in the door we were met by staff who were friendly and professional. As we checked in Christine acknowledged that we were celebrating a birthday and if there was anything we needed to please let them know. And since the room we reserved was not available we got an amazing upgrade. 
Our butler greeted us we exited the elevator, showed us to our room and then she unpacked so we could enjoy our stay immediately. 

The bar in the lobby is lively, but small. Cozy. Nice mix of cocktails and wine. 

We arranged for dinner to be served in our room for my daughters birthday and the staff made sure it was perfect.  The servers were the best as was the food.  Could not have asked for a better experience.

title: Still nothing like it ; the best of the best
text: The best hotel in the most perfect and convenient location in the best city in the world.  Everything is always perfect at the St. Regis.  The service is second to none.  The rooms are perfect.  The Butler service is a huge benefit.  Rooms service, room deliveries, concierge services and the restaurant all exceeded expectations.  George (server) in the King Cole Bar was wonderful and made our stay extra special.  The St. Regis New York City receives my highest recommendation and is a must stay for business or pleasure or personal or a weekend getaway.

title: Simply the Best
text:
I stayed at this property in December 2015 and was blown away by the level of service, and attention to every detail. In fact, it inspired me to seek out the brand for future vacations. I've since been to Punta de Mita, Abu Dhabi, and Saadyiat Island. Next up is DC and Bal Harbour. 

From the moment you arrive, everything is taken care of, and you walk into a charming and elegant experience. The building has been restored and it feels like you are walking back into time, in the best of all ways, stately excellence. 

The check-in area is quaint, the staff are attentive and welcome you upon arrival. My room was not ready at the time of check-in, and was lucky to be upgraded to the Dior Suite. What a treat! 

I was looking for the same experience from a year and a half ago, and it's still the same. Breathtaking views, excellent care of rooms and facilitates, elegant decor, while maintaining an initimate atmosphere. 

The only difference: I found the mattress to be less inspiring. I remember more of a pillow-top in the past, like laying on the clouds. The mattress this time was more firm, not bad, I still got a great night's sleep, just different. (And of course, this varies with one's preference.)

This is a place where my expectations are always met, and frankly, surpassed. The St. Regis is without a doubt, the best address in NYC.

text: we decided to not go straight through to Bermuda from New Zealand so stopped off at the St Regis for a few days. As usual perfection-check in,housekeeping were so effortless.We were staying on the 7th floor and we had the nicest butler and i apologise for forgetting his name. The King Cole bar was uber busy but we managed to get 2 bar seats. title: Lots of changes since the 1970s
text: New York City's St. Regis Hotel has undergone several renovations and has experienced several different owners in the last 50 years. My wife and I spent three days at the St. Regis after we were married in the late 1970s. On our most recent visit, we hardly recognized the place. My fondest memory of our first visit was being awakened at 6 o'clock on a Sunday morning by the sound of a fife and drum, then looking out the window onto Fifth Avenue and seeing three men marching up the street in Revolutionary War costumes, one with a drum, one with a fife and one carrying an American flag. Welcome to New York City, I said to myself. John Jacob Astor IV opened the St. Regis in 1904. In 1932, the iconic "Old King Cole" painting by Maxfield Parish, which had been created for Astor's defunct Knickerbocker Hotel, was moved to the St. Regis and made the centerpiece of a new bar, the King Cole Bar, which has remained a New York institution ever since. In 1934, the year after Prohibition ended, bartender Fernand Petiot invented a drink he called the "Red Snapper," which since has become known as the "Bloody Mary." In 1998, Starwood Hotel bought the St. Regis from Sheraton and made it the flagship of a new line of St. Regis Hotels and Resorts. Today, the St. Regis is a Forbes 5-star and AAA 5-Diamond hotel with 20 floors, 171 rooms, 67 suites and two restaurants. In 2006, the 8th, 9th, 10th and 11th floors were converted to private residences. In 2013, the entire hotel was renovated for $90 million. You can still get a grand view of Fifth Avenue and the Midtown Manhattan area. Our 450-square-foot DeLuxe Guest Room with a king-sized bed, Italian marble bathroom with double sinks, fully stocked mini-bar, complimentary high speed Internet access, 24-hour butler service, 24-hour room service and a fresh fruit basket was what you'd expect from one of the world's finest hotels.

title: 最棒的紐約酒店
text: 这家酒店为那些寻求完美的旅行体验的人提供无与伦比的豪华。假日帶家人小歇片刻, 酒店相當優雅寧靜, 接待團隊和前台服務太出色了, 服務也很貼心。客房內果盤每日都會更新，管家先生也是隨時隨叫隨到，客房內早餐出品質量也是令人相當驚喜。

title: Amazing Stay!
text: We love this landmark hotel. The hotel staff is one of the best. Everyone at this property goes out of their way to exceed expectations. On this particular stay, the VIP service all started immediately at the front desk when we checked in. Liubov Bragg was amazing and truly rolled out the red carpet for our family. The concierges were all on it with the suggestions from beginning to end. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Can't wait to come back again!

title: Fathers 80th Birthday, what a great time
text:
"One of the greatest weekends of my life", my father said to me.  That's all I needed to hear.

My goal was to give my father an unbelievable experience for his 80th birthday, one where he would be treated like a king for a weekend.  There was really only one option, the St Regis New York.

We spent a Saturday night in rooms 501 and 601 with my parents and aunt in the 5th Ave suite in 601 and my wife and I in 501.  Service and attention by Butlers and staff, from bellman to the reservation manager who made our stay extremely memorable were fantastic as always, and I can't tell you how much I enjoy the coffee service in the mornings.

Now if I had one complaint, it would be about breakfast.  Astor court was great, and I look forward to it every stay, but I feel they should put some more attention to the fine details so the experience isn't soured by something small being off or going wrong.  At this level, everything should be perfect.

Overall however the St Regis New York is a magical place, and truly is the standard bearer for all other St Regis properties.  I can't wait for our visit next year for my wife's birthday :)

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Six nights ensconced in a deluxe suite at the St. Regis - pure heaven!  Attentive staff, great service, wonderful food!   Color, cut, and mani/pedi at the salon  - Gianni is the best!  Don't miss afternoon tea at the Astor Court.  Would have moved in if we could.

title: it was an ok experience

title: Great location for midtown
text: Beautiful lobby and first floor--love the King Cole Bar--decent sized room--no real view from our room--staff was always friendly--our room came with butler service, which was great (coffee in the morning, pants pressed, etc.)--the midtown location on 5th Ave. is wonderful.  The men out front were always very helpful--getting cabs, providing directions and of course with large pieces of luggage.  Too often that first experience as one arrives is overlooked at other properties---here, it immediately starts you off with a pleasant experience, and every time you leave or arrive, that positive vibe continues--I greatly appreciated it.

title: The Best Till Last.
text:
As the taxi parked under the Hotel Canopy You just know it's going to be a different nights sleep. 
Thomas greeted us by opening the Taxi door and welcoming us to The St Regis. We even got a hand shake. 
He organised the removal of the luggage and directed us into the Hotel and Up the stairs to Check In. That's your luggage taken care of, we will deliver it to your room. 
We checked In after a severely delayed flight. Your Never at your best after "One of Those". But we were made to feel we had arrived home.
We were Professionally and Politely checked in by a Charming Young Lady ( regrettably I am not going to try and spell her name I had to ask it 4 times) but I know you will know who that person was. She even wished me a Happy Birthday. "Thank You 😊" It went a Long Long Way.
We were given a Brief that provided us with Our Personal Information and our Key:Cards. We were on the 14th floor and directed to the lifts-The formalities over She came from behind the desk and made contact with us. We chose to see ourselves Up but was asked. On finding our room and opening the door it was beautiful. The fresh smell of Pressed Linen and Cotton towels. It's so comforting to know "We'd Arrived". The Rooms are more than "Very Comfortable" to Use. The chamber Maid is a credit to St Regis. Our personal items were tidied and cables rolled up. 
I know this can sound cleche-I don't do this type of Hoteling Normally, however It was a real Treat for us both at the end of a 14day Tour of America And Worth Doing-Even if You Only Do It Once. The Treat Was and Is Worth The Funds Paid. 
We had a New York friend who came to visit us that night of arrival, he's lived in New York for 40+years and used to use the St Regis 30 years ago. 
He's put St Regis back on his to visit list. That's because of the ease of the "right amount of friendliness" The Astor Lounge he's fallen in love with. A Wonderful Menue and so must say Fabulous Food-Unfailtable. St Regis having the very knowledgable servers make You Want To Return. 
For Me and My Partner It Worked. Just keep on Doing What Your Doing. 
Thank You 😊

title: Amazing hotel, superb service
text:
Absolutely fantastic and u forgettable experience: Christmas and new year in Manhattan, in this fabulous hotel!
Staff is really helpful, the king cole's bar is a historic place. 
St Regis service quality is on another level compared to other hotels!

title: Disappointing
text:
Overall, a very disappointing experience.  I've stayed at this property multiple times in the past with very mixed results, ranging from great (upgraded to a suite with a platter of fruit in the room on arrival) to the opposite of great (tried checking in at 5pm and had to wait until almost 9pm until a room was ready?!).    This stay solidified my opinion to not return.

There wasn't a single major problem in this case but more of an accumulation of several small annoyances that when taken together, add up to a very negative opinion.

For starters, I was booked into a 1-night stay but had a last minute travel change that required me being in NYC for 2 nights.  I called the property to inquire about adding an extra night and was told they were "sold out" and could not accommodate.  However, all third party travel sites (Kayak, Hotels.com, etc etc) showed availability, their own website showed availability and when I called SPG's reservation center they also confirmed that not only was there still availability but that at least three different room types were available.  

Next, upon check-in, I was told I would not receive any Platinum benefits because I was booked on a corporate rate.   I average close to 200 nights across hotel brands (giving me the highest tier status in 3 different major loyalty programs) and have never had a single property anywhere else in the world at any of these brands deny benefits because of a corporate rate.

After checking out, I realized I had left something in the room and called the property to ask if they could check the room for the item.  The first time I called I was told someone would check and call me back.  30 minutes later and no call, I called again and was told by the person I was speaking with that they were on their way to the room as we were talking and I'd receive a call back in 5 minutes.  Another 20 minutes and no call, I called a 3rd time and was told no one had checked and they weren't sure who I had spoken with the previous two times as they didn't have record of a request.

At this price point, you can stay anywhere in NYC and that's exactly what I'd recommend - stay at ANY of them over this place.

title: Best Bloody Marys
text: Tthe home of the Bloody Marys. Amazing service and the staff was fantastic. Best place in Manhattan for cocktails and drinks.. Loved the Zacapa Rum. food was great too. The Bar Manager is very knowledgeable and talented.

title: Excellence in NYC
text: This hotel offers unparalleled luxury for those seeking the perfect travel experience. My wife and I have just returned from a very special stay at this wonderful hotel where we celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary. From the front desk to the concierge to the butler, the team could not have been more accommodating! The only question that remains....why should we celebrate our anniversary anywhere else?

title: Classic luxury
text: I hadn't been back in a few years and my stay was spectacular. Doormen top notch as was the in room dining. Best dinner in room I've had in years. Great renovation and charming international staff. Look forward to returning

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: We spent 4 nights for a theatre weekend in early March 2017.  Everything, from check-in to luggage delivery, to meeting our butler to check-out went very smoothly.  Each floor has the St. Regis Butler Service.  Shoe shining, shirt pressing, coffee service at check-in and each morning is just a phone call away.  Our butler was fast, efficient and very friendly.  The house car is a Bentley, which we didn't get to experience because it was in the shop.  A Mercedes took it's place and it was always away when we wanted to get a ride.  It would be helpful if you could schedule a ride in advance.  Even in the winter the central location made walking everywhere easy to do.  If you are using points, as we did, remember you can get your 5th night free on any Cat 3 and above hotel.  The St. Regis NY is a Cat. 7.  Had I know that we'd have taken advantage of it.  Overall, a great experience.

title: For sure one of the ten top Adress in the world
text:
It's hard to give only five stars for this hotel. This is not only a hotel, this is an institution. 
The service is on the highest level I ever saw. 

The Consierge desk, Mr. Alexandre, Mrs. Krista Sorrentino, Mr. Mootz, Mr. Robert D Geist, Mr. McKinley.... if I have forgotten someone, please be don't mad with me. But these guys know everything. They arrange everything, in a such so professional way, that words can't explain. 

The complete stuff is so professional and polite, I never saw that. From doormen to luggage porter, from front desk to butler service over house keeping. They see details I never saw. 

The hotel is more then clean, the rooms are big. 
The restaurant and the bar is amazing. 

When in nyc then st Regis. It's not only a hotel, it's a place where you feel at home. 

Thank you guys.

title: Hands Down This is the Finest Hotel in NY
text: We were absolutely wowed by our four-night stay in late February, beginning the night the hotel bar served its one millionth bloody mary. The hotel is epic - the epitome of what one would hope a historic NY luxury hotel would be. The service of the St Regis is extraordinary - and I don't say that lightly. It began the moment our bellman offered to unpack our luggage and continued through our entire stay.  Our butler consistently came through (unlike other luxury properties we've been to where the butler comes to our room at the beginning, yet is never around when we request him/her). The lobby, room service, and housekeeping personnel were top notch and "old world" in the best sense - all seem to have spent their careers at the hotel. As far as accommodations, my husband and I were upgraded to a suite which was massive, lovely, updated and quiet. We booked two other rooms for family members and our daughter's grand deluxe room was large and lovely. Our family's  entire experience at the St. Regis was perfection. We travel quite a bit and are fortunate to stay in top luxury hotels. I give the St. Regis my highest recommendation. I personally believe it is the finest hotel in the US - with service markedly better than the top rated ones in travel magazines.

title: Definitely one of the best on earth
text: Absolutely breathless stay. My business turned into a pleasure ! Great tradition of New York hospitality blended with 21st century luxury. Perfect service from arrival to departure, butler T was a magician, restaurant stunning with the best service and well designed a la carte   Bar is my favorite and would recommend it even if you are staying somewhere else ! Love it   Thank you !

title: Everything & more
text:
From the time you arrive -till its time to catch the plane home-like being in a fantastic movie.
Nothing is left to chance-the staff at the hotel make sure of this.The front door concierge is that good-he told us his he just arrived back from a Mediterranean cruse that a regular guest gave him.
Rooms are wonderful

title: Fantastico hotel di lusso
text: Bellissimo Hotel localizzato in una posizione perfetta. Le camere sono fantastiche e di gran classe. Offre tutti i servizi degni di un vero hotel di lusso. Volendo è possibile avere un maggiordomo personale disponibile 24 ore su 24. Che dire, Fantastico.

title: Uno dei migliori in città
text:
L'hotel non necessità di troppe presentazioni. Camere fantastiche, servizio ottimo, colazione ricchissima.
Camere ampie e curatissime con frutta fresca ogni mattina.
Il prezzo ovviamente è altino ma siamo pur al st regis e nel cuore di Manhattan.

title: Luxe, calme et vie trépidante !
text:
Très bien situé. Le bruit, la vie de folie s'arrête dès que vous passez les portes. 
Un grand hôtel de luxe qui assume ce rôle et ses responsabilités !!
Tout est fait pour vous simplifier votre séjour. 
Très belle chambre, spacieuse, classique.
Aucune vue ce qui fait que nous vivons avec les rideaux tirés et donc l'atmosphère est assez sombre.
Excellent bar et service en chambre

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Amazing hotel just of 5th avenue, 2 blocks from central park. The whole hotel keeps all of its historic value and features whilst also providing every modern amenity you could want to thenhdighest level. The rooms are spacious and extremely comfortable with beautiful bathrooms. The service by all staff from the front door attendants to the exceptionally friendly and helpful front desk and concierge to the private butler and room service staff is the best i have experienced anywhere in the world.Breakfast in the restaurant is fantastic with a huge choice and the restaurant itself is comfortable and has a great ambience, as does the very stylish king cole bar. Absolutely first class hotel in every respect.

title: Still Love
text:
Still love this amazing property.  Stayed for two nights this past week and were upgraded to a suite due to status which was a nice touch since we were celebrating our wedding anniversary.  Everything here is 5 star, from their first greeting, to the room, to housekeeping, to room service.  Two bones to pick- we love the King Cole Bar and decided to stop in at midnight after dinner on Friday.  Bartop was a mess and many tables were marked "reserved."  We stood around waiting for someone to clean up the bar, but when it looked like that was not happening, we took a seat at a table marked "reserved" because it was the only open table.  We were told to move from there by the waiter because the section was closed and to move to the bar.  We pointed out to the waiter that the bar needed to be cleaned off.  He proceeded to do so, only to be chastised by the bartender that the bar area was closed.  So here we are patrons and guests of the hotel, there are other customers seated both at the bar and at tables, and we are standing around while the waiters and bartenders discuss which areas are closed.  We finally sat at the bar but only to hear commentary from the bartenders that the door should be closed and no one else allowed in.  This was at midnight and the bar supposedly closed at 1.  It was bizarre.  Also, as far as the bulters assigned to the rooms- I'm still not sure what their function is.  We called for an ironing board and iron so we could quickly press some pants as we had no time to send them out and we had dinner reservations and it took 45 minutes to come up.  

Still love the St. Regis though.

title: Sabor nostálgico de otra época.
text:
Magnífico hotel que te traslada en el tiempo al Nueva York de otro siglo. Muy buen trato del personal.
Por otro lado: lobby muy pequeño, check-in muy pequeño (aglomeraciones) habitaciones restauradas siguiendo el estilo de época, pero algunas un poco claustrofóbicas (aunque sean grandes, algunas sólo tienen un minúsculo ventanuco a un oscuro patio interior. Bonito para rodar películas, no para alojarse.

title: Madison Suite
text: We arrived late, and were quickly escorted to our room, and introduced to our butler, Lawrence. The room was gorgeous!! Huge bedroom, with even bigger sitting room across the hall. Two full gold accented bathrooms as well. We had a great time.

title: Fantsastic Hotel and Staff
text: From the moment my wife and I stepped out of the cab, we were impressed with the incredible customer service. Someone opened the door for us while another person took our luggage and brought it to the front desk, while yet another person welcomed us and asked if there was anything extra that we needed for our stay. The hotel is gorgeous. The staff were friendly, accommodating and did everything they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible. We stayed in the Deluxe room and it is stunning. One of the most comfortable beds we have slept on in a hotel, large couch and sitting area, beautiful bathroom with separate bath and shower. They had everything you could think of in the room and if there was something you needed that they did not have open arrival, one quick buzz to the butler and we had what we needed in minutes. The location is also excellent. And even though the hotel is located on a busy NYC street, there is virtually no noise coming from outside. I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here any chance that I get.

title: Simply Beautiful!
text: Excellent service from the time you walk thru the entrance door to time you check out!  Superb location!!!  We had a beautiful room w small sitting area - beautiful decor.  Shower water pressure is the best I have ever experienced in NYC hotels.  We enjoyed having complimentary breakfast in our room and late check-out due to being SPG Platinum.  We had drinks at King Cole Bar twice - very lively and fun - prices are expensive as you would anticipate in NYC.   King Cole was very busy - I called 15 minutes before our arrival and helpful staff member was able to secure a table - so our party did not have to wait.  Butler service is always a plus even if we used perk minimally.

title: Dropped into the St Regis Bar - Instant Awesome
text: Dropped into the NYC St Regis Cocktail bar.. What a perfect place to drop in to just chill out at the bar. Loved the service of the staff.. Top shelf... When you walk into the lobby and ease into the bar  you experience walking into a past history of elegance and great people watching . Loved It . ! and Great drinks

title: Pure Paradise at the St. Regis
text: My husband and I went to the St. Regis, in Manhattan, for a Saturday night stay for the weekend after Valentine's Day. We had a full schedule of a matinee - 'Dear Evan Hansen' and dinner after at the Bar Room at the Modern. I booked the Milano Suite and it was sheer decadence! We had welcome champagne, canapes and some sweets and a fruit bowl to start us off. The living room sofas were modern leather and the bedroom comfortable and serene in grays and aubergine. With one and a half baths and the main bath an oasis of luxury....one wouldn't want to leave the suite. We were fortunate to have late check out after a shopping trip to Saks.

title: Exceptional customer service amid mixed feelings
text:
This was our first weekend away from our little ones to celebrate our anniversary, and we wanted an extraordinary experience, so we picked the St Regis. First impressions were great. The concierge surprised us by giving us "Platinum for a day" guest status, which meant free breakfast in practice. Although we were still given a standard room, it was on the top floor, which is considered an upgrade of sorts, although I already have Gold status anyway. The room is quite large for Manhattan, with a lovely sitting area across from the gigantic bed. Our butler quickly introduced herself, bringing us coffee and tea service, even offering our friends who were visiting us for a couple hours. For dinner, we headed out to Le Bernadin, which the concierge helped us secure. Unfortunately, the Bentley was taken (not surprising), so we walked a couple blocks instead. 

On returning, we noticed a huge refill of chocolates, with proper turndown service, and the most comfortable bedding I have ever experienced at a hotel. It was truly delightful. The shower pressure was strong, and I liked the European feel of the shower setup. 

I do have mixed feelings though, considering the caliber of the hotel as a flagship. I was expecting separate shower and bathtub, as well as WC, but it was a conventional bathroom setup, albeit with double sinks. The TV in the bathroom did not work. The bedroom was clean, but some of the furniture was a little beat up. And the design was walking the fine line between bold and gaudy. I would say it was still on the side of bold, but I didn't find it very elegant. 

The biggest disappointment was with breakfast, where we waited a long time to be seated, and an even longer time to be served. The entire dining room seemed to be in disarray, although it was clear something was backed up in the kitchen, as there were plenty of servers. When the breakfast finally did come out, it was fine, nothing out of the ordinary. Now, I understand how a kitchen may be backed up at 10AM, but I do think the servers could have made things better by providing pastries and coffee/tea service to those waiting, instead of rushing in and out of the kitchen while diners were left frustrated. 

I brought this up to the front desk when checking out, and they apologized profusely, and offered me a truly generous number of SPG points as an apology. This was an appropriate gesture that I appreciated and accepted. 

So the front desk and housekeeping/butler service was outstanding. I couldn't have been more pleased. But the physical plant was not impressive by ultra luxury standards, even a tad disappointing, and breakfast service was a disaster. And that's why I have mixed feelings.

title: Excellent Stay!
text:
My wife and I recently spent the weekend at the St Regis New York.  This is a great historic property with a lot of character and amazing architecture.  The marble stairwells are amazing to see.

Check in was very quick and efficient on a Friday evening.  We were greeted promptly and given all the information we needed to know to make the most of our stay.

Based on our SPG Platinum status, we were upgraded to a Deluxe Suite with Butler.  The room was very nice.  Separate living room with fireplace, large bathroom with separate tub and shower and plenty of room to relax and rest after spending a day walking around NYC.

The butler service is very much worth it.  They greet you as soon as you get to your room.  They explain all the operational aspects of the room and take care of any needs you have.  Excellent service all weekend from the butlers!!

The hotel is pretty well located.  Easy walk to Metro Subway, many restaurants, all the shopping along 5th Avenue and Times Square.

I would highly recommend this property and we will definitely be staying again on our next trip to NYC.

Great Job St Regis Team!!

title: Westminster Dog Show
text: My wife and I spent five nights here for the third year in a row over the period of the Westminster Dog Show. As always, the staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Our room was impeccably appointed, and the attendant butler service and timely maid service, daily and nightly, made for a very comfortable stay. We look forward to our return visit next year, if not sooner.

title: Sehr schönes Hotel mit kleinen Schwächen
text: Das St. Regis in New York ist ein sehr traditionsreiches und schönes Hotel mitten im Herzen von Manhattan. Dies Suiten sind sehr komfortabel, luxuriös und großzügig. Der Butler Service ist wie in anderen St. Regis Hotels ebenfalls hervorragend. Die Hotelbar ist nett, verfügt aber nur über ein überschaubares Angebot an Cocktails und Getränken. Der Service in der Bar ist verbesserungswürdig. Auch auf die sagenumworbene Bloody Mary kann man verzichten. Alles in allem ein sehr zu empfehlendes Hotel auf gutem Niveau.

title: Great service and well maintained
text: Some older historic hotels start to look like old hotels, but the St Regis is modern yet still has the historic feel.  The staff was great and the room was very comfortable.  There was a horrible cigarette smoke smell in our hallway at night, and soon after mentioning it to the front desk, someone was spraying the hallway to try to get rid of the smell.  In fact, the hotel proactively gave us some SPG points to help make it better as well.  We were impressed how quickly they tried to fix a small negative situation.  The only real problem with our stay was that we were so busy during our time in New York that we felt we never got to really enjoy the room.

title: The original and crown jewel that set the standard for St. Regis service around the world
text: A couple years ago I got my first taste of a St. Regis in Bangkok, Thailand. The service was absolutely impeccable. I chalked it up to the Thai staff and culture which is truly wonderful. Last night we stayed at the original St. Regis in New York City and I now realize service is part of their DNA. We were warmly welcomed from the moment we stepped into the lobby, asked politely if there was a special reason for our visit (there wasn't), and given a rundown of the wonderful amenities: incredible butler service, top notch concierge, etc. We had a beautiful room facing north, with a sliver of Central Park peeking through. We enjoyed a cocktail in the King Cole Bar and enjoyed a room service breakfast that was delicious. We called on the butler only once for ice, but he made it clear he was available day or night for any request we might have. This is the type of hotel that would probably accommodate even the strangest ask or bend over backwards to aid in a pinch. It's not a cheap hotel, but because it's part of the Starwood chain, you can use points. But even off the rack, the price is more than worth it.

title: Elegant and welcoming hotel
text:
The reviewers stating that the employees of this hotel were aloof, condescending, or snobbish are way off.  We experienced nothing of the kind in our interactions with check-in (she was terrific, but I didn't catch her name), our super responsive butler (Luba), the very helpful concierge (Krista), the awesome Angel at Old King Cole Bar, our terrific waiter at breakfast...  Also, just the staff we encountered walking through the hotel and curbside were very warm and welcoming. 
The hotel itself is so elegant and our room was amazing.  We used an SPG suite night award and were upgraded to a Madison Avenue suite.  Wow, such luxury and so much space!  This was a tremendously good value as well.  
This was our first stay at the St. Regis in New York, and we will definitely be back.  It is by far our favorite hotel in New York City now.

title: Penultimate luxury, penultimate service. Best in the nation.
text:
"SHUT UP!"  I exclaimed when I stepped into room 401. I could not believe my eyes! Was I in Buckingham Palace? Nope: The St Regis New York, Park Avenue Suite, and I was feelin' like royalty. 

First, the finish of the suite is unparalleled. I stay 100+ nights/year in hotels, and many St Regis, Waldorf, Ritz properties, and the SRNY takes the prize.  Marble floors (heated to the perfect 74 degrees), 2 highest-end Carrera bathrooms (one with HUGE jetted/bubble tub, Koehler bidet, Koehler toilet, sink), (the other with double marble vanities, brilliant mirror with integrated tv, walk in shower w/ multiple heads, and Koehler toilet). So many huge, perfect white, SR monogrammed bath sheets, and more Remedy bath products than I know how to use, and linen AND terry towel options, and SR robes, and scale, and crystal glassware, and, and, and...

The CLOSET was phenomenal. Think custom California Closet, just for you. Glass-front drawers, mirrors, cubbies, padded hangars, SR umbrella, shoe horn, suit brush, and if you need an iron, ring the BUTLER who cheerfully presses 2 items each day and also shines your shoes (both within 1 hour). 

The BEDROOM was royal. Red silk walls, mega-molding, Waterford chandelier, personal bedside + reading lights, all of which you control with an intuitive bedside iPhone-type remote. Oh and the BED is surreal with 1000 thread count sheets, crisp down duvets, plump pillows and ottomans galore. 

LIVING ROOM was oversized, with multiple velvet couches and chairs, bright down-stuffed pillows, ornate black/gold desk, and updated/dapper art. I swear, you feel like prince Harry as you use the remote to open the heavy curtains to look over 5th Avenue. Unreal. 

I'm sure I'm forgetting something, like the  manager who greets you by name, and sends your butler to deliver a comped bottle of wine with personal note, or bath soaps that smell like heaven, or personal SR slippers beside my bed at turndown, or a bowl of SR milk-and dark- chocolates, wrapped with the gold SR logo. 

Again, I've stayed in a few hotels, and the SRNY rocks the house. It's the best, best, best for old world, updated, timeless, luxury and a staff who make it their PLEASURE to help you anyway possible (like arranging the hotel Bentley to drive you and your spouse to dinner). I mean come on, is it even possible to exceed this experience? 

I can't think of a way to do so. 
Where's the 7 star button? Really.

title: It doesn't get better than this!
text:
We stayed at the St. Regis New York using Starwood points exclusively in what was a memorable, over-the-top decadent New York getaway. Having just had a disappointing experience at another St. Regis property (in Washington D.C.), we were hoping for the best but didn't want to get our hopes too high before arrival. 

We were blown away. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to a room on the 14th floor which exceeded our expectations. The room was recently renovated, clean, spacious, and elegant. We wanted our two nights away to really make us feel AWAY, and this hotel was the perfect escape from it all: beautiful, excellent service, perfect location (and surprisingly quiet). 

New York City done right! We're dying to get back soon. Many thanks to Octavia and all who made this adults only mom + dad getaway so memorable. We'll never stay anywhere else when in town!

title: El number one!
text:
Si hay uno en la ciudad que visitamos y cuando podemos, tratamos de alojarnos en el St. Regis. El de NY, al ser el primero, crea mucha expectativa. Debo reconocer que este SR supera cualquier expectativa. El servicio es impecable, la habitacion que tuvimos, en esquina, a todo lujo y atendiendo el menor detalle. Cuando llegamos nos recibieron con tanta cordialidad, con un regalo para nuestro hijo, tragos de cortesia y un upgrade a suite que hicieron de nuestro primer viaje a NYC una gran experiencia.
Durante la estancia tuvimos un problema con el desague del baño, pero al reclamar lo solucionaron en diez minutos. 
Luego del check out durante el viaje encontre una incongruencia en las cuentas, pero al reclamarlo me hicieron un contracredito en pocos dias. Esas cosas pueden suceder donde los humanos trabajamos, pero lo bueno es que la respuesta a algun reclamo sea veloz y efectiva. 
A nuestro regreso a NY nos alojamos en "El otro hotel mitico de NY" y hasta ahora lamento no haber repetido el SR New York. Felicitaciones por el excelente trabajo, sin el cual el lujo no vale nada.!

title: This is the way you travel
text:
What an amazing experience! Me and my wife arrived at about 8 pm and our luggage was courteously taken directly to our room for us.

At check-in we were upgraded to the Grand Luxe room.

All rooms at this hotel come with a complimentary 24 hour butler (Awesome) and you are treated like royalty all the way through

title: Awesome hotel, but expensive.
text: St. Regis is a classic old hotel with great rooms, close to everything in midtown. Beautiful lobby. Very friendly staff. I also enjoyed the King Cole Bar on the main floor with its amusing mural. A bit pricey, but worth it.

title: The most comfortable hotel bed I've every slept in!
text:
We stayed here in October just for one night on a quick stopover in NYC. 
I have to say it was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever stayed in. 
The room was fantastic, the butler service second to none and check in and out was flawless. 
We had a few drinks and nibbles in the king cole bar which was beautiful. 
I also had a jacket dry cleaned by the hotel and this was super quick and very reasonable. 
The location for fifth avenue shopping is second to none. 
We also made use of the complimentary chauffeur service which was very convenient. 
Will definitely be returning again very soon.

title: Luxury at its finest
text:
We are usually ones to stay at the Four Seasons anywhere in the world. With that being said, this is my first time staying at a St. Regis brand hotel, and it will not be my last. I will admit, I came into this hotel with low expectations, thinking places like this were pretentious and had snobby people, but boy was I mistaken. 

From the moment we pulled up to the hotel, 2 porters opened our doors, took our luggage, and greeted us by name (I noticed he read the luggage tags, but very good and observant).

At check in, we were greeted by 2 friendly staff members: Christina and Sam. They were very welcoming, and Sam even gave us a small tour of the hotel.

Our room was a normal sized room but tastefully decorated. Water and chocolates were left in the room every single day. The bathroom was pretty big, and the amenities were great.

Breakfast at the hotel restaurant were delicious and probably the best breakfasts I have ever had at any 5 star hotel.

I was travelling with my Uncle and it was his first time to New York, and per his words "This trip was special, because it's the first time I've ever been treated like a king. If that tells you anything on what to expect when staying at this wonderful place.

Will definitely be back soon, and would probably make this our go-to hotel when in the city.

Thanks for everything!

title: The BEST NY trip I've ever had!!!!
text: Let me first say I travel VERY often!! Secondly, I have NEVER had a more amazing stay than I did this past December! The entire staff, the hotel the butlers, the door men and especially the front desk night manager (Atef) made my trip (my 50th birthday) PHENOMENAL!!!!! I do NOT have a single complaint!!! This was a trip myself & my family will NEVER forget!!! If I knew a word that meant more than EXCEPTIONAL, I'd be using that!!!! I can NOT wait to go back!!!

title: Simply Outstanding
text: This is a great, old and elegant hotel in an excellent Midtown location. Service was unfailingly helpful and friendly. The restaurant is very good, and my room was truly spectacular-large, comfortable and well laid out.

title: Not a great stay for a hotel of this caliber - uncomfortably strong smell, plastic in the room service, unfriendly staff
text:
We recently moved back to NYC and we decided to stay at the St. Regis for a few weeks while we waited for our more long-term apartment to be available.  But we ended up leaving after just three days.  There were many reasons, but the main reason was that I ended up having a major allergic reaction to their sheets.  I broke out in a rash all over the first morning we were there and went to the hospital.  I got steroid pills and a steroid shot which was supposed to calm everything down.  But it only got worse.  So we switched hotels after three days and thank goodness the hives started going away.  I suspect it's all the chemicals they spray everywhere.  The very first time we stepped into the lobby I thought some old lady sprayed on too much perfume but as time went on I realized they spray something to make it smell like that.  

As I wasn't feeling great, we ordered a lot of room service.  One morning, I ordered some congee and I was really enjoying it when I chewed on a piece of plastic, and a sizable one at that.  It was about 2 inches long or so.  We immediately called someone to take it away as I had lost my appetite.  To be fair they did comp the entire breakfast and I am assuming one of the managers called and left a message apologizing and they also sent us a bottle of wine with some fruit.  All nice gestures, but the fact is this should never even have happened.  

The last thing that was disappointing about this hotel was that there was never really anyone accommodating people in the lobby and when there was, they were really unfriendly.  We would often comment on how there is nobody pushing the revolving doors which is not a big deal but surprising for a four star hotel.  And I've encountered someone (not sure what their job was) but they would just stand in the middle of the lobby and they would just have this sour look on their face.  I thought for a second they were a guest at the hotel but they had a uniform on.  Are people not trained at this hotel to greet the guests, even with a simple hello or a smile?  

With no shortage of luxurious hotels in the city, I think it's a pity that this one relies too much on their name.

title: Classic, but uninspiring.  Over rated.
text:
I stayed in a huge two-room suite here, and I just don't understand the appeal.  Perhaps my tastes are just not, ahem, refined enough, but I found the hotel to be a bit stuffy and uninspiring.  This was the 3rd or 4th St. Regis that I've stayed at, and I finally realized that the brand just isn't for me.  I guess I prefer more modern or unique hotels.  It wasn't a bad experience, and the separate living room would be helpful for entertaining a certain type of client, but I wouldn't stay here alone and I wouldn't stay here for a romantic trip.

The service was spectacular in the suite, and included a private butler.  That said, I don't really need a private butler when I stay in a hotel.  The front desk workers were friendly if not downright charming.  

The hotel lobby is small and, for my tastes, uninteresting.  It lacks the wow factor.  The concierge was very good, but seemed to sigh when he realized I had such pedestrian questions such as what new broadway shows might be worth seeing (I've been to NYC more than 30 times, but I always ask the basics).

For the money, I'd pick the Waldorf Astoria or the Gramercy Park hotel for its warm, sumptuous colors and textures (in the larger rooms); or even the Mandarin Oriental.

Note - I stayed in this hotel in 2014.

title: Resting Comfortably on Past Glory
text:
Stayed here to catch NYC at Christmas and were excited to stay in a legendary hotel. We have stayed at the St. Regis in Mexico City, Singapore and others, and were expecting the same level of excellence. 

We truly wanted to love this hotel, but instead, left feeling grateful we used points, and not cash, for our stay. Sad to say, we would not return. 

The good and the bad - 

The Good - Rooms are beautifully appointed, location can't be beat and some of the staff were outstanding. 

The Bad - Attention to detail has been lost. Some examples - long lines to check in and out. Yes, we realize it was high season, but staffing should be commensurate with the expected flow of guests. Next, after the bellhop delivered our bags, we asked for a bucket of ice. It never arrived and we had to get it ourselves. Breakfast took even longer than the ice. Small, but telling, details. 

Left feeling like the St. Regis NYC relies on its reputation to pull in the crowds, its service certainly doesn't warrant a pricey stay.

title: Can there be a 10!
text:
I love the St Regis (generally speaking but especially the New York). I've stayed here 12 times over the last 4 years or so. It just seems to get better each time. Tire's a great new feature which is the Rooms control Manager (Molly) emailing me ahead of time to see when we would be arriving. My SPG upgrade available when we arrived at about 1015AM which is rare these days. 
Then there is the front desk staff - they are all wonderful but I want to call out Shelomie and Hugo who know Ryne and I by name and immediately make us feel at home. 
How about that concierge desk - again all are great but today I'll call out Krista and McKinley. I emailed while on the plane about getting in to the Salon for Mani and a shave. Our appointments were made and ready for when we arrived. 
Our Butler this trip was Marianna. She is awesome and gave us the utmost service during our stay. 
Finally Kevin and Juan our In Room dining attendants - just as perfect as can be. 
I named names because this is what this place is about. Consistent and friendly staff that makes The St Regis our home away form home. We really love it.

title: Engagement trip!!!!
text: The reception entrance is beautiful very grand but I felt it was very over priced for example over $100 for a couple croissant's and English tea plus tip. We had no view which was a shame since our hotel looked over Central Park. But the bathroom was divine ad the bed was so comfortable a real good nice sleep. Staff was incredibly professional.

title: Classic
text: Stayed there 3 times last year - so obviously it's good enough.  The location is fantastic.  The rooms are updated, but the hotel itself is very old (but clean).  It felt like the classic Ritz Carltons.  I'd stay there again.

title: profitez ambiance du bar a aperitif
text:
Souvent bondé aux h apero, l ambiance y est sympa et les cocktails de qualité.
Belle clientèle de hotel ou affaires du secteur qui profite des fins de soirée..

on peut même y déguster des huîtres a l'apero...

title: The BEST experience!
text:
I went to NY with my boyfriend for the Holidays, and this hotel made our experience something that you just cant forget! 
He propose at the hotel and they helped him to create the perfect magic for it! 
Its a beautiful hotel with amazing luxuries and the staff is unbelievable!  We surely wont be able to forget this experience EVER! Thanks St. Regis! I will never forget you! 😍💍

title: Grand hotel
text:
Très bel hôtel , nous y sommes allés pour le Tea Time et un petit déjeuner le 1er janvier 
Un moment de calme bien apprécié dans New York , ambiance raffinée et luxueuse .
Petit déjeuner continental avec jus de fruit frais excellant , très bonne viennoiserie avec un service impeccable pour un prix correct

title: Fabulous Accommodations
text:
The St. Regis New York is a fabulous high-end hotel located right off of 5th Ave in New York City. Upon arrival the staff was very helpful in unloading my vehicle and placing everything on a cart. I was early for my checkin, which was fine. The hotel was able to hold my luggage until the room was ready. Of course, when the room was ready, the bags were delivered to my room and I was ready to enjoy my week in NYC. I was very satisfied with my room and the attention to detail put into all of the furnishings.

However, I must note in hope management views these reviews that I express some concern regarding the hotel restaurant (Not Old King Cole).  Before the room was ready a friend and I decided to dine in the restaurant at the hotel. The food at lunch was lovely however the time that it took just to receive drinks and food was astronomical. Thankfully we did not have anywhere to be that afternoon. I also want to mention that the waiter we received in the restaurant was terrible as he was extremely unhelpful in terms of responding to questions about the menu. He seemed very disinterested or unhappy to be working which unfortunately was reflected in his tip. I certainly hope management takes note and fixes this issue with wait times and the staffs attitude in the restaurant. However that is the only complaint I had during my stay. 

The King Cole Bar was super fun in the evening and since I stayed for a week I was able to become familiar with the really nice bar staff. Overall I plan on staying again! Well done.

title: Trumpeted at night - otherwise great .
text: i stayed here on vacation for a few nights in early December ; I have been here before, and it is a class act. Its pricey, but so is everything in NYC. the staff at this hotel are on a par with Claridges, and although the public rooms, restaurant and bar aren't as good, that has  more to do with space issues than anything else.the one downside is that the hotel is v close to Trump Tower so i was kept awake almost all night by the demonstrators against his future rule. Not the fault of the hotel of course, which will now become my regular joint when in the Big Apple. Bring a stuffed wallet though ; espresso is US 12!!

title: Disappointed Frequent Traveler
text:
Overall level of disappointment is high within 5 hours of being here at the St Regis - New York.  Arrived early and fully understood that check in is 4pm.  Inquired about an estimated time of room availability.  Was provided a very scripted response, with a scolding tone of "our check in is at 4". No soft tone of "we were fully committed last night and we hope to contact you shortly but I cannot promised anything...we really appreciate your patience..."

Arrived back at 6ish.  Room ready.  Bags come up within 10 minutes...great.  The bags were wheeled in.  Pushed to side of the wall, attendant then left promptly after collecting generous tip. Didn't lift a finger to place on the luggage valet...didn't go to the closet to pull out and assist at all.  Didnt' offer ONE suggestion or explanation of anything hotel amenity.  Terrible.  If we could have pulled the gratuity back we would have.

We are frequent travelers that generally stay at Four Seasons/Ritz and other 5 Star.  Very disappointed. Hotel should be ashamed as these individuals are the Face of their Hotel.

title: Still hitting on all cylinders; the perfect location and perfect hotel during the perfect time
text: Once again, the property provided an absolutely incredible experience to the guest.  The hotel at the time of the holidays looked beautiful and the service as always was absolutely perfect.  We were upgraded to a massive double sided room with multiple bathrooms and showers.  The butler service was flawless and expedient.  There is almost no room for any improvement at this hotel.

title: Why Write a Review (It Was Perfect)?
text:
Every once in awhile, one stumbles into a business where the execution is so close to perfect, one struggles to find a single flaw.  This was one of those times.  For sure, it's expensive, it's subtly ostentatious, even a bit snobby, but in such a way that you know that it DESERVES to be so, has always been so and has been so far a very long time.  This is the Grande Dame hotel of New York and it shouts it from the corner of 55th Ave. and Fifth all day and all night, all the days of the year.

The King Cole bar is an addiction.  The room product is pure art in its details.  The service level is at level that can only be delivered by people with decades in hospitality.  And by traditional standards, the location is the best.

The only small smear on this (overbearing) page of compliments is that the security surrounding the nearby Trump Tower contributes to even more congestion than there would otherwise be.

The Plaza - at close to the same price?  No comparison.

Enjoy New York!

title: Enchanting rooms and wonderfully friendly staff
text: Had the pleasure of spending one night here the week before Christmas to do some Christmas sightseeing and see a show.  From the moment we stopped our car in front of the hotel to the time the door was closed on that same car the next day, everyone we met at the hotel was truly delightful.  I prefer the quieter, more intimate lobby experience like the St Regis over something like the Plaza or the Waldorf.  The location is absolutely terrific for accessing everything in midtown.  The room itself was elegant without being stuffy.  The bathroom was sizable and extremely clean -- my wife enjoyed the large soaking tub.  Upon returning to our room, the robes and slippers were waiting and the bed itself was a delightful cloud of comfort.  We had afternoon cocktails in the King Cole Bar which was fun although service was a little too absent.  We look forward to staying at this same hotel at the same time next year -- thank you to everyone at the St Regis for making us feel so welcome.

title: Family Overnight in NYC
text: My husband, 5 year old daughter and I stayed here the night of December 21st, and we had a wonderful time.  When we arrived we were greeted promptly and even offered an upgrade.   Our room was clean and well maintained and the butler service was excellent.    The location is central to the tree, central park, etc....The complimentary Bentley service was an added perk that we utilized. The only one issue we had was when we were checking out.  We were billed for some pressing that was complimentary. Once we pointed it out, it was promptly removed.   We enjoyed our brief time that we plan to make it an annual Christmas tradition.  Next year we plan on staying for two nights......

title: Excellent high end hotel
text: This is a very nice hotel in NYC. The only drawback is it is close to Trump Tower and the added security can make getting to the hotel difficult. Other than the security the location is perfect as it is close to everything in midtown that you would want to see around the holidays.

title: リッチなアフタヌーンティー
text: アフタヌーンティーに行きました。少し暗めですがトラディショナルで落ち着いた感じの内装です。出てくるアフタヌーンティーのメニューもトラディショナル、お好きなものをお好きなだけ注文でき、シャンパン藻楽しめて優雅なひと時を過ごせます。

title: Christmas Day dinner Astor Court
text:
A really disappointing experience, booked this in advance for Christmas Day dinner.She has made a request in the reservation for gluten free on my behalf. This was not passed to the chef or the waiters. Service was incredibly slow and poor with only 3 waiters serving all the tables. 
When the food arrived it was very basic - I had the chicken for a main which was dry, really unexciting. For a 5 star hotel within such a renowned group it was incredibly disappointing.
But it got worse, we were given Xmas gifts of 2 slabs of chocolate wrapped in cellophane. Mine had 2 bites taken out of it and teeth marks on 2 sides. Clearly been tried by a previous guest and left behind.
Not what I would expect for over 350 dollars - and they wondered why there was no tip left!!!!

title: Vacaciones de ensueño
text:
Definitivamente un hotel de ensueño! el personal es muy muy amable, desde la puerta. Me asignaron una habitación bastante amplia y cómoda, con tina y una maravillosa vista, encantada con las instalaciones, la comida es deliciosa y el room service eficiente al 100% 

La ubicación es muy buena, lo recomiendo muchísimo, el próximo año regresaremos!! I love it

title: King Cole  Bar
text:
Had the misfortune of having drinks at this world renowned bar. The bar tender was incredibly rude. After making an old fashioned totally wrong and throwing it across the bar he had the nerve to say he's been bar tending for years and too bad if we don't like it. All I can say is I'm sorry that you are working Xmas day and obviously don't enjoy your job . 
The manager was very nice about trying to correct our experience but probably would not go back.
I love a good hotel bar and if like me you enjoy that experience. , skip the St Regis

title: Elegance
text: We loved it here.  The entire property is elegant, from the lobby to the rooms.  Our room was a standard room and was very large.  our butler michael did everything he could to make us feel at home.  Loved the lobby bar as well.  Hotel is in a great location.

title: Excellent, 5 Star Hotel and Perfect Stay
text:
I came here for a yearly 4 day visit to NYC, I alternate between the Mandarin Oriental and the St. Regis.  I prefer the location of the St. Regis, and probably the rooms as well.  I suppose views are the big thing at the Mandarin.   Anyway, my stay-

I checked in, and to be fair I did email Octavia (manager) ahead of time, because I was checking in late, and it was a special occasion.  I didn't really specify in the email, just said if a special room was available, then great.  Well, the front desk woman was AMAZING, so warm and nice, gracious, accommodating, absolutely perfect.  In the past, I've had some surly, cold check-in people (as many others have occasionally commented on-  though i think it's just an air of being almost too professional, and getting beaten down by people asking for upgrades all day).  Anyway, we got a big upgrade, we had a 2 room suite, and it was absolutely amazing, perfect, beautiful.  Service incredible all around-  from the housekeepers/cleaning people, the staff working the hallways, just perfect.  Of course the upgrade helped me feel totally happy, and the 2 coupons for drinks- but still, they went above and beyond.   This was the trip I decided they are just better than the Mandarin Oriental-  it's just a fact.  Mandarin has a few things, like checking to see your room key all the time (St. Regis just remembers you I think), they always charge you a set amount for little upgrades, etc.   The St. Regis was just plain better.

Specifics:  the bed was incredible, the thermostat totally perfect- drops way down in temp for sleeping immediately, the room is perfectly dark, soundproof, and really gorgeous.  There was a hot chocolate bar in the afternoons, a reasonable gym, and wonderful amenities.  

A slight negative (so slight it's still 5+++ stars):  The house car:  This is basically non existent and maybe shouldn't even be advertised.  The guys at the front just stare at you blankly and tell you it's not available.  I've stayed there many times before, I know the car with the St. Regis license plate is the house car.  They don't tell you where or when it'll be back, if you could take it later, or whatever, just "no."   Maybe something like it's out now, perhaps back in 10 minutes... or something like that.  The two annoying things are a flat out "No", no information about when you may be able to take the house car, and it's sitting right there in front of you, and when I got refused, we stayed and saw it sitting there for 20 minutes.   An odd inconsistency   

Otherwise a spectacular stay.  Octavia:  you did a spectacular job, the hotel is amazing.  Our experience was superb, far better than the Mandarin this time.  Total 5 Stars, Luxury all the way.

title: Perfect Holiday Getaway
text: The St Regis is exquisite at any time of year, but during the Christmas season, it is spectacular in all of its finery.  The fact that it snowed during our stay, only added to the festive ambience.  We booked through American Express Platinum  and despite our late arrival, and the fact that the hotel was at capacity, we were upgraded to a lovely room on the 16th floor. The room was equipped with meticulously maintained antique furniture, marble clad bathroom, crystal chandelier, and sumptuous bed. The hotel's location on 5th Ave. afforded us easy access to most shopping and tourist experiences. The King Cole Bar was literally overflowing with revelers  each day, beginning about noon.  Fortunately, because we were guests of the hotel,  we were provided with comfortable seating within the confines of the bar, and not required to stand in line like other patrons attempting to access the bar. Each staff member in all capacities was exceedingly courteous and accommodating. In fact, my husband and I decided to explore the lower level of the hotel, where we unexpectedly met Octavia Marginean, the hotel manager, who gave us  a personal review of the hotel's historical artifacts and provided us with a verbal history of the St. Regis. If we needed to be critical, the only aspect of this experience that could use improvement,  is the Astor Court restaurant, but I will rate that experience independent of this review. Overall, staying at the St Regis is costly, and the cost may be prohibitive to some.  However, considering the exquisite décor, the outstanding level of service, and the prime location of the facility, the money it costs is well spent.

title: Great venue
text: Stopped in to visit bar and work out the painting as recommended by receptionist at front desk and of course try a Bloody Mary.  Omg.  Best one I've ever tasted well worth the cost delicious would definitely go again

title: St Regis stay - December 2016
text:
What can I say about this hotel?  Rather a mixed experience and not the magical one we were expecting.  

I'll try to be honest and balanced in this review as I still love the hotel and we will be giving it another chance next year.

My wife an I are regular visitors to NYC.  We tend to book our hotels well in advance.  We stayed in the Langham Place last year and decided this year to try the St Regis - I am a SPG Gold Member.  We booked a "Deluxe" category room.  Overall the hotel is a lovely "classic" New York property.

Negatives

Check in was handled disappointingly by a rather officious counter clerk.  Whilst one can never count on this, we have always been previously upgraded whilst staying in Starwood properties.  This was the first time <ever> that we haven't been.  Upon asking we were told that the property was full (the fact that we even had to ask speaks volumes - it should have been explained on check in).  We were offered use of the gym whilst room was being prepared (rather odd given that we had just come off a plane from London UK)  - the amenity offered - one drink or 250 SPG points seemed rather feeble in the circumstances (Jumeirah hotels offer a drink every night for example).  

We opted to wonder down 5th Ave and the hotel assured us that they would call us when a room was ready.  They didn't.  We came back around 3:45 pm and the room was made available (we were given two choices - one "external" facing room on 3rd fl, and one "internal" facing room on 7th fl.)  We chose the 3rd floor room.

I guess it was our problem (as we selected the room) but the third floor room was very noisy facing 55th street.  We were woken most nights by garbage collection trucks and construction work starting very early in the morning.  One night there was a drunken argument outside our hotel room door, lots of shouting and people falling over in the corridor.

The marvellous King Cole bar (one of the reasons we booked the hotel) was very busy and initially we found it very difficult to get in (the hotel does not prioritise guests staying in the property over walk in customers) - although to be fair we managed it later on during our stay.    I think the admission policy of the bar needs to be amended to reflect the very considerable investment guests are making in staying at the property.

Again, not the problem of the hotel, but the chaos caused by the President-Elect (Trump Tower is on the next block on 5th) meant that invariably there were traffic jams around the hotel.

The Positives

The hotel is beautiful, location generally is spot on

The room (apart from the occasional noise issues) was beautiful, bed very comfortable.

King Cole Bar is my favourite bar in NYC

Our butler was wonderfully attentive - service generally was fantastic

We were given a generous late check out with no quibbles.

The doormen were great at sourcing taxis in very difficult circumstances (given the chaos caused by Mr Trump). 

The check-out clerk (Hugo) was very professional and sympathetic to our concerns.

On balance (and on this occasion) the hotel did not offer particularly good value for money (given the very competitive choice at the super-lux end in NYC) and when compared with the Langham - however I can see that it would be much better in quieter times. As I said, we will be back next year to give it another chance.

title: 럭셔리의 세인트레지스
text: 맨해턴 내 위치한 다양한 SPG 호텔 중 세인트레지스는 단연 최고의 럭셔리 호텔입니다. 프런트에는 한국인 직원이 상주하고 있어 영어가 불편하신 분들 또한 세인트레지스만의 특별한 맞춤 컨시어지 서비스를 사용하는데 큰 어려움이 없을 것입니다.

title: A good point after a bad experience thanks to Ms D. Cataldo
text:
We have to state that the Food and Beverages Dept is a catastrophe, in the Restaurant and also in the Room Service you don't get what you order, and you have to wait for a hamburger for 45 minutes... and you get it cold ! But, thanks to Ms Daniela Cataldo, after a clear explanation she recognize the problems, and tried to solve in a very fine and professional way. Thanks Daniela you saved our stay in New York. 
I have to say that without Daniela, this hotel don't deserve more than 3/4 stars. And please by checking ask for a room upper 15th floor, because lower you don't have daylight.   Again Daniel many thanks for your kindness and support, you are great !

title: What a gem!
text: Perfect executions on every level! Great location and fantastic service. My room was roomy and classy. A little glitch while checking in but they made it up with free breakfast during my stay. Hope to be back again!!!

title: Astor Court Tea Time
text:
After spending the afternoon for lunch at Tavern on The Green
We had some time to kill before our broadway show, after visiting Trump Tower we entered this hotel and I asked if the hotel offered High Tea

The employees were very very nice all smiling when I walked in
Not a stuffy place at all. We shopped downstairs and bought art books and a scarf. 

We had tea time me my mom and Aunt with a saucy server named Craig, you wouldn't think that an upper echelon 5 star hotel would have such friendly down to earth employees but our host was so funny, we ordered 3 types of teas, 
The sandwiches were a bit eclectic than I'm used to but the macaroons are better than I've ever had at Bouchon or in Paris! 

The macaroons are a must!!!! 
I can't say enough about those macaroons, I think of them all the time!!! 

I wasn't a guest here, but am planning on staying here in the near future. 
With service and first impressions like this, it was amazing. 
We saw actress Sandra Bullock walking through the lobby 

The last time I was here years ago, Morrissey was a guest at this hotel, and I waited outside. I was 21, and bellman and doorman never chased me and my friend away, they smiled graciously. 
They allowed us to get photos and autographs with him before he boarded his tour bus it was great.
It was such a nice feeling to see why the likes of Morrissey a world renowned Songwriter and musician would choose such a classy place 

Thank you Craig for making us laugh and feel comfortable, your suggestions were wonderful. 

Will return when I'm in town

title: Wonderful stay
text:
We really enjoyed our 6 nights at the St. Regis.  The rooms are very nice and well appointed.  The amenities are great.  The hotel location is AWESOME (however you should note it's close to Trump Tower--so security on Fifth Avenue was super tight north of the hotel on one side of the street.)  The butler service with morning coffee is great.  The hot chocolate bar by the elevators in the evening is a cute touch.  This is an older hotel, but has lots of style.  The rooms don't look old at all though.  The breakfasts are incredible--the best part of mornings in New York.  They have a nice workout room too....  The King Cole Bar is always packed and fun.  The staff at the bar, however, was quite attentive to hotel guests and getting them seated quickly.  We appreciated that.
Thanks for a nice getaway St. Regis!

title: How can it be best hotel in New York?
text:
That's what some people say...we wonder if they've stayed in other good hotels in New York?  This is an old, dated, once grand hotel, where the business model of commercializing the original opulent and spacious common areas until there are only tiny common areas left is very evident.  

There are many hotels in New York that actually have a lobby you can sit in, that have updated elevators, that may be older buildings, but feel up to date.  We enjoy grand old opulence, and we booked this hotel anticipating a five star experience, but we will not be back.
