The only positive was the breakfast...the remainder of the experience was substandard...plus it is very near to the Trump traffic zoo, making moving around complicated.

title: OOOOOHHH, LA, LA.
text: The St. Regis has the feel of a Russian palace with it's opulent architecture, art and chandeliers. I love this kind of opulence in a hotel and there are fewer and fewer of them as modern simplicity takes over.  I felt that the service was second to none, from the friendly doorman to the front desk and room service, all were superb!  It's crazy trying to pick a place to stay in NY so staying here felt like a little retreat from all the craziness and business just steps outside the hotel! The room was beautiful and again felt like a step back to a time of grandeur. I wish I had more time to enjoy it but with a million things to see and do in NY.....The location is great and I walked about 10 minutes to St Patricks Cathedral.  All the shopping along 5th Ave was just around the corner! I think the main thing to figure out in NY is what you are planning to see and do and pick your hotel based on that.  I did take the subway, but I'm not crazy about it as I come from a small town.  Taxi's aren't my thing either and they seemed to be hard to flag down, so I always rely on what I can see and do on foot around the hotel.  Travel is always such a personal thing.

title: Rooms B-, Check-in/Out *very slow*, Service B
text:
I have stayed here several times before and have always had an excellent experience.  Unfortunately, this time was quite different.  Check-in took almost 45 minutes and there were still rooms not ready after 7pm.   Hotel explained that many of their guests are Starwood Gold/Platinum (so am I) and that most take the late 4p check-out. However, I think it is pretty basic to expect your room ready before you leave for dinner.   The room while nicely decorated was very noisy (right next to a service elevator.)  This made sleeping impossible as the elevator shook the room sporadically throughout the night.   The hotel did respond by reducing the room rate but not sleeping pretty much destroyed the trip.    Restaurants, butlers, and house keeping were all excellent.

I am unsure if I would stay here again (Four Seasons, Ritz are similarly priced and might be safer for special occasions).

title: Terrible Hospitality from a Luxury Hotel
text: December 5th at 5:30pm, prime time to visit the King Cole Bar for a glass of holiday bubbles.  The 2 male bartenders had scowls on their faces, were annoyed I asked for a wine menu and never came back to take our order.  So we left and spent our money at the lovely and hospitality rich bar, at the Peninsula Hotel, 1 block down.  Why if we are in the hospitality industry are they so snobby and unwelcoming at the King Cole Bar?  I did speak with the manager, he was very polite and apologetic but I will find another bar to spend $36/glass of wine.

title: High Tea at the St Regis
text: On my wifes bucket list to have High Tea in NYC. We picked the St Regis and were not dissapointed. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation. We did but showed up an hour early. They took us no problem.  Staff was very pleasant. Tea choices we abundant. Food was good..to be honest, it didn't look like alot, but we were quite full when we were done. No as costly as places like the Plaza..But am sure it was just as good. I would highly recommend this place.

title: Excelente trato number one in ny city
text: Tres noches en el hotel y el servicio en todos los aspectos supera con creces lo que uno espera. Los desayunos geniales, la habitación y el room service excelentes y , el servicio de mayordomo insuperable, Por lo tanto, no lamento ni un centimo de mi estancia en el hotel Mi mas grande felicitacion a todo el equipo del hotel

title: Un scandale
text:
Pour un 5 étoiles voici les photos depuis la chambre au 5e étage.  Pour 1180 $ + taxes c'est inadmissible. Ensuite 45 minutes au restaurant de l'hôtel pour être servi.. Et en plus froid. . Cet hôtel n'est pas managé et ne mérite aucune étoile. Pire encore ils ne savent pas traiter les complaintes et en plus ils refont les mêmes erreurs.. 
Une CATASTROPHE C'EST MÊME DU VOL

title: Best Hotel in New York
text: Service was outstanding from the valet, bellman, front desk to the butler.  Everyone is top notch.  The location is great, a few blocks from Central Park and shopping.  The rooms have great decor and the right size.

title: Fantastic Staff, excellent room, spectacular experience
text: This is the first time that I wrote a review before I even checked out of the hotel. I happened to be at this hotel a few times in the last couple of months and each time my experience has been great. From the doorman to the front desk to the rooms everything has been top notch. I am a Starwood platinum 50 and they have treated me accordingly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. A special thanks to Jose at the front desk who remembered my name from previous visits which made me feel at home.

title: Great old school 5 star property, a couple of minor gripes.
text:
I stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday. Overall the stay was good. The staff was friendly and helpful; and my room was up to date and in great shape.

The hotel also handled the holiday crowd with ease.

The reasons I give my stay a "very good" and not an "excellent" are admittedly a bit silly, but at such a premier property commanding a premium price such gripes come with the territory.

I enjoy coffee. I even like it in the afternoon, especially when arriving from a long trip. This St. Regis does not provide an in room coffee make, even on request. 

Guest can get coffee served by their butler complimentary once each morning and on arrial, but if you want a cup of coffee at 4 pm on your second day you have to pay room services prices or leave the room.

I have never stayed anywhere from Ritz Carlton to Mandarin Oriental and everything below that had such an arbitrary policy.

The St Regis i stay at in Singapore (if memory serves) lets the butler bring you complementary coffee all day long. In Singapore they even give a card stating what services the butler can provide (helpful for those of us that are unsure and embarrassed to ask).

I did complain to the front desk. They said they'd let a manager know. It was never followed up. I dropped it given that all else was good, it was the holidays, and in the end it's just coffee. But Really??

title: A Nice Break
text: I stopped at The St. Regis for a nice break from the crazy 5th Avenue police enforced shopping experience.  It was absolutely lovely.  Carlos waited on me...a long time St. Regis employee.  When I told him a good friend of mine was a big fan of the hotel...he gave me a bag of St. Regis swag...so nice and thoughtful!

title: An unforgetable experience to spend Thanksgiving 2016 in an one of a kind luxury world class place!
text:
Our son made the arrangement for us to stay here for one night after a short staying in another SPG hotel. We were not too sure whether it would be worth the move for an one night stay?!  My husband was just recently out of the hospital, and still uses a walker.  We thought of the problems with the holiday traffic on the Fifth Ave, getting in and out of the car, and walk up the steps/stairs.....

In stead of walking up the steps, we used the elevator located inside the "King Cole Bar and Salon" next door. Once we stepped into the lobby of St. Rigis, our worries went off the chimney!  There seemed to be a special flowery cent in the air as you walked on the shiniest marble designed floors of the hotel. We sat comfortably awaiting for the checking-in. Due to the upgrade to a room with two doubles, we had to wait for a while which was perfectly fine. After a short wait, we were thoughtfully offered to wait in another room to rest until our room was ready. The idea that the management would do that for us has won us over!

St. Regis is an "one of a kind" classy hotel with the old world class charm and beauty. Once inside the room, we were impressed with the modern update using the computer technology, among them: the TV screen fit right into the bathroom mirror would earn a "wow" factor; the 4 types of lightening controls located both near the bed and the entrance of the room was a plus in convenience; and lacquer-like Chinese cabinet under the TV to hind the refrigerator and bar was a combo of beauty and convenience. The huge multi-plated mirrors which occupied the entire wall, and the crystals hanging on the chandelier were practically spotless, so were the intricate moldings around the ceiling and the chandelier. The decoration of the room has a luxury feel yet they are just as practical and comfortable as solid every day furniture. 

The shower which is a separate unit has great water pressure. The tub equipped with the "hang-over rack" was a perfect way for a relax soak after long walks at the Macy's parade. The marble/stone bath room is spacious and modern which again is a pleasant surprise found in an old hotel. 

Among those who came to stay and walked those hallways beyond the glass entrance doors on each floor were Eva Gardiner and Salvador Dali, so we were told when first were lead into our room. I must say that we felt just as welcome as any entertainers and/or artists when we were greeted by the staff. As we walked out of the room, as we got in or out of the car, we were greeted politely and warmly. People who stay here for a day or a week are lucky to enjoy the world class luxury, and those who are associated with this first rate elegant hotel appear to be happy and proud to be part of this perfect corporation.

title: First-rate Manhattan hotel
text: In town for a weekend wedding. Beautiful (old) hotel, nice room and amenities. Very well located in mid-town, rooms quiet enough to sleep. Entire Staff uniformly friendly, helpful, caring, and competent. Excellent bar and restaurant. Expensive, but worth it (IMO). We had a minor wardrobe emergency; concierge staff sprang into action and solved problem smoothly and quickly (actually as expected, but still a great job!)

title: Calm in the Chaos
text:
My family and I stayed at the St. Regis the weekend after the Presidential Election. Being a block and half from Trump Tower gave us some concerns. The St. Regis delivered above our expectations. From the moment we checked in, Christina at the front desk took care of us. She arranged a beautiful room for us and continually checked on us when we were in the lobby. She does a wonderful job making the stay very personal. The hotel dealt with the chaos masterfully. Lenny and his teammates at the front door were fully informed and were able to arrange transportation, adjust to the changing traffic patterns and give advice on the best ways to navigate around some closures. While things have normalized around there since then, the hotel was very prepared. They are very professional group. We really had a sanctuary just feet from 5th Avenue. 

It was also my youngest son's birthday and they sent him a little cake and made him feel special on his birthday. The St. Regis finest hotel in NY. They get it right. The personal service is second to none. They know their guests and they go the extra mile to make sure they feel comfortable and welcomed with each trip. We're returning in a few weeks to enjoy NY at Christmas time and can't imagine staying anywhere else. Keep up the good work.

title: Charm and Elegance Is Just The Start
text:
Enjoyed a relaxed and lavish night at the St. Regis NYC on our travels back from Thanksgiving holiday.

We our in our mid forties and have stayed in many luxury hotels, but I would rank the St. Regis New York at the top.  The hotel is tucked right off 5th Ave close to an array of shopping, museums and Central Park.  

From valet, concierge, room attendants and dining the hotel has everything.  I won't give up all the exceptional little treats that come with your stay, but highly recommend experiencing this gem during a visit to New York.

title: Excelente hotel y localizacion en NY
text:
En NY hay bastantes hoteles buenos. Pero suelen ser bastante impersonales. Muy grandes, con mucho tráfico, y donde es difícil recibir una atencion personalizada, salvo que vayas a algunos boutique hotels algo mas pequeños en el Upper East Side. En el resto , el ambiente duro de la ciudad devora la personalidad del negocio.

St. Regis es in excelente hotel, donde todavía queda algo de esa sensacion de que saben quien eres. Reservé dos habitaciones en Noviembre del 16, justo despues de las elecciones USA, y el tono general en NY no era bueno con el nuevo Presidente. Pero el trato dentro del hotel era, casi inmejorable. 

Algun pequeño fallo a la llegada ( habia pedido dos habitaciones con 2 queen beds y me dieron una con 2 queen y una con una kingbed). Las habitaciones tampoco eran conectadas, como habia pedido. Pero soy de la opinion de que cuando se viaja hay que ir con mentalidad positiva, y este tipo de cosas no deben de empañar una estancia.

Precioso bar King Cole para tomar un Bloddy Mary por la noche, bebida que fue inventada en este hotel.

Mayordomos en las habitaciones y servicio perfecto de habitaciones. 

Wifi gratis y late check out sin problemas. Cuando no me dan estas dos cosas en un hotel de lujo, sencillamente, no vuelvo.

Precios caros, como os podeis figurar. Pero no engañan a nadie.

title: 4 sublime days
text: The location, the property, the room, the staff--everyone was over the top.  Pricey, but worth every penny.  Having a private butler and complementary pressing made the trip that much more easy.  Can hardly wait to return.

title: Wonderful experience at the St. Regis Hotel
text: Quality of this hotel is exceptional.  Arguably the best service and quality of room, restaurants and bar that we have ever experienced. The restaurant for breakfast was great and the bar at cocktail time was typical of a New York happy hour, loud and happy.

title: Una colazione fantastica.
text: Hotel bellissimo situato in una posizione invidiabile,appena entri respiri un aria di eleganza e stile ma siamo rimasti molto soddisfatti dal bar alto lo standard del servizio supervisionato dal manager che abbiamo scoperto essere italiano infatti abbiamo riscontrato una grande eleganza puntualità e cura dei dettagli.grazie

title: This is what luxury is
text: This hotel almost makes me feel like I'm a king. When I address any issues, they get it fix right away. The location of this hotel is perfect. Concierge is very helpful. You can't go wrong with this hotel for sure

title: Mario To The Rescue
text:
I was about to check in to a function in the Grand Ballroom at the St. Regis and found myself without at necktie for an occasion that clearly required one.

Mario, who was tending to the guest's needs in the main lobby, overheard my frustration about not being able to find what I wanted in the gift shop and saved the day by removing his beautiful necktie and offering it to me to wear.  It was a perfect match!

Thank you Mario for going beyond the call of duty and helping me out in my moment of need!

Mark

title: First Class and Luxurious
text:
The St. Regis Hotel is best described as "old world glamor and luxury."  From being welcomed in by the doorman and a quick check in we were escorted to our beautiful room and assigned our personal butler.  The public areas are beautiful with paintings on the ceilings and a luxurious décor.  Service was to perfection.  The concierge was friendly and helpful with all of our needs.

The location is perfect situated in midtown and the amenities at the hotel were first class.  We enjoyed the King Cole Bar that comes with much history and intrigue.  The St. Regis is at the top of the list of favorite hotels and look forward to our next return.

title: Super Front Desk Staff!
text: This was my second stay at The St. Regis New York - New York City. I called 2.5 hours prior to the standard check-in time to check for early room availability. Sue from the front desk answered my call and she was very, very helpful and she informed me that a room would be available prior to the 4PM check-in time. When I arrived at the front desk, Sue was there to greet me and she completed the check-in incredibly fast and efficient. The entire stay at The St. Regis New York - New York City was fantastic.

title: Perfection
text: Truly enjoyed my stay here. Everything from the concierge to the bell boys was simply the best service I have ever experienced. Although definitely pricier than staying in another hotel if you truly want to treat yourself this is the way to go.

title: Very luxurious property, but expensive...
text:
We booked a Grand Luxe room for 5 nights using points. As an SPG Gold member, I was a bit disappointed upon arrival that no upgrade was provided, especially as when I asked about it they said it couldn't be done but I could pay for an upgrade to the next room category!

Our Grand Luxe room was quite spacious and the decor was very opulent. It had a classic design but it had been redone recently so everything felt very new. The bathroom was similarly opulent with gold taps and even gold drainage pipes under the sinks! I liked their electrics, all lights were dimmable and could be controlled from a digital console near the bed. The room had a few USB ports as well. Bottled water, fruits and a bowl of chocolates in the room were replenished daily.

We tried out breakfast downstairs one day, and found the atmosphere was a bit stuffy. Portions were generous, and the food was decent. The bill came to around $150 including service. The famous King Cole bar is tiny and was rammed on a Friday afternoon. Service was slow and the atmosphere felt a bit chaotic. It wasn’t at all what I expected.

Concierge were extremely helpful in pre-trip correspondence. In contrast, staff onsite were a bit mixed. Some showed genuine hospitality while others seemed a bit snooty. It didn’t really stack up to the Four Seasons we stayed at a few days earlier.

Laundry prices were over the top - for example, $8 for a pair of socks. My wife actually went out and bought new ones instead! It was a similar story for room service – it’s one thing to include a 22% service charge, but is it really necessary to add on another $8 per person tray charge on top of that? Combining the two, a food order for $100 would end up with 38% worth of service charges! This seemed quite excessive, even if considering the calibre of the hotel. 

Their house car distance allowance of 10 blocks (around 1 mile) is fairly modest. This may suit some business travellers, but as tourists spending our days sightseeing, we found that hardly anything was within house car distance, and for those that were it actually made more sense to walk it. On the one occasion we did request the house car, it wasn't available but I did notice they were using a Merc rather than the widely advertised Bentley.

There was no hot water on our last evening as well as the morning we departed due to emergency external repairs (the entire street was affected). We received an apology email a few hours after checking out, and they offered to comp a room service breakfast plus they threw in some SPG points. This was a nice gesture I thought, given that the hotel wasn’t at fault for this incident.

Overall, we did enjoy our stay here. The highlight was the room, which was truly luxurious. Staff were generally very good, although a bit stuck up at times. However, I didn’t like the feeling that you were being fleeced on incidentals. This was a stay on points, but I’d have to think twice if I was paying the cash rate of $1.4k/night quoted for my dates. This is at least twice as high as comparable hotels in London (or numerous other major cities I’ve visited). Perhaps I’m just not used to New York hotel prices! On the plus side, from an SPG points to USD saved ratio, this was the best deal I’ve ever come across in many years in the program.

title: Perfection
text:
We spent one night here to celebrate our anniversary.  Our wonderful stay began at the front door, when the bellhop offered to valet park our car.  We'd arrived a little early and the hotel was very busy, so we understood when our room wasn't ready.  The man doing check in suggested we have a drink at the bar and seated us there.  The bar was also full and it took a long time for anyone to give us a small bowl of nuts and take our drink orders, but the drinks were amazing (I love the Astor Midnight) and the chairs were comfortable, and no one hovered over our shoulders wanting us to leave even though we were dressed for travel and not for sitting in a fancy bar.

When we went back to check on our room the lobby was even more crowded, but we found that we'd been upgraded and our new room was ready.  It was gorgeous--maybe the most beautiful hotel room I've ever seen.  The room was impeccable, our butler sent up some wonderful coffee, and we settled in.  Everything was perfect.  The room was so nice and so comfortable that we almost cancelled our plans for the evening. We had a great night's sleep, a delicious breakfast in our room in the morning, and then, unfortunately, we had to leave.  This was our third stay at this hotel and we'll be back.

title: El restaurante excelente
text: Excelente la comida ,me recomendaron la hamburguesa y la verdad es la mejor que he probado en mi vida,es perfecta,también me encanto un gazpacho que hacen con langosta está buenísimo y el sitio es precioso,sueño con volver y esta vez alojarme también en el hotel ,que por lo poco que vi es muy elegante y bonito .

title: Beautiful surroundings
text: A very grand hotel.  Steeped in history which the staff are exceptionally keen to inform you of.  The personal butler is a nice touch which makes it that extra bit special. Home of the "bloody mary" cocktail it is worth trying one at the in house bar.  The location is perfect.  Definitely one of my favourite locations.

title: You will not find a finer hotel experience anywhere
text:
My wife and I have just returned from New York where spend 4 nights at the St Regis at 5th and 55th.  This is the finest hotel experience we've ever had - anywhere in the world - and we're used to staying in the top properties in each city we visit.

The staff is exceptional - nothing is a problem.  Every single person you bump into you feel is just looking for a way to make your visit even more exceptional.  The butlers and wonderful and are looking for ways to meet your every need or request.

The rooms are luxuriously appointed, the beds the most comfortable, they are quiet and even though its New York,, you look for reasons to go back to your room and just hang out.

Oh - and the St. Regus is the originating home of the Bloody Mary.  Could you ask for anything more?

Have fun!

title: The perfect New York Hotel
text:
The St Regis is such a glamorous and wonderful place to stay.. ask for the rooms overlooking the street as some you feel like you are in an alley.. 
the King Cole Bar is a place to hang out and watch the people come and go.. from tourists to locals, it is a tradition..

title: For the price the service could be better
text: The location of the hotel is absolutely convenient for shopping. The house car only does drop off and only within ten blocks. However, the doorman today gave much better service then yesterday and the day before. I didn't get their names but service was not friendly nor efficient. The concierge are all very good at their jobs and they get things done. The amenities at the hotel are luxurious and up to par. However, we did notice holes in the bedding, but didn't bother to call housekeeping to change it. Compared to service at the four season we like four seasons much better.

title: Un sueño
text:
Uno de los muchos sueños de mi esposo era hospedarse en el st regis Ny 
Cuando llegamos nos dieron upgrade a una suite por ser nuestro aniversario 
La suite es enorme tiene sala baño de visitas y además una habitación muy grande con baño con Tina y regadera aparte, con calefacción en el piso, las camas deliciosas como en todos los st regis... walking closet 
Definitivamente regresaremos! 
Love it

title: Tiffany Suite
text: 全てTiffany仕様となっている。玄関が広く花のセンスもさすが。朝食をキッチンで取ったがボーイの給仕もシャンデリアもエレガントで満足。ゆったりとしたリビングからの景色も良く調度品のTiffanyも素晴らしい。ベッドルームのTiffany blueの壁のインテリアも独特で美術館の様だった

title: WOW!
text: In my opinion, this is the best hotel on the planet!  I have stayed here three times, three different years, and the level of service has never wavered.  The staff is the best; the hotel grounds are simply impeccable.  I would recommend staying at this fine establishment over any other in the city!

title: Original Excellence!
text: This hotel, in my opinion is the Original luxury Hotel!  Overall my stay was an awesome stay and I plan on staying again!  As a SPG Platinum Member I was treated Very Very well!  I was given a HUGE suite and overall it was great!  The chef made me an Excellent Vegan Breakfast and it was sent to the room and I can tell you it was extra special and i felt as if though i was a King!  I was only there this time for one day, but I was treated very special and the hotel is top notch.  There was one small hiccup which is OK, but there was a HUGE hairball in the guest bathroom shower.  I only found it when I was taking pictures of everything.  I called the butler and it was immediately removed, he grabbed it with bare hands against my wishes (I wanted him to at least use napkin or something) and whisked it out of the room with apologized and the manager soon called to apologize as well, which was more than enough I am sure this was a rare incident in a hotel like this and it was dealt with immediately and appropriately!  This hotel is on my short list of best hotels in the world, for sure!

title: The ultimate NYC experince!
text: My husband and I celebrated my birthday at the St. Regis this past week and it was beyond words amazing!  They upgraded to us to the most beautiful suite, absolute decadence with the tradition glamour you would expect at this hotel.  They also sent up chocolate covered strawberries and champers...the perfect addition to a celebrative stay. The service was top notch from start to finish, and a true pleasure to experince in my fave city.   I travel to New York often, but this was my first time at the St.Regis, I can't wait to return.  5 stars with loud effects :))))

title: Excellent hotel
text: What a place. Brought the wife for a business trip and she and I both loved it.  Great location and the staff treat to your every needs. Excellent in every way. NYC has a lot of offer in hotels this is one of the best.

title: Ups and downs
text: As always very useful and friendly butler service and beautiful room. Three negatives in order of increasing annoyance... checking in at 03:00pm room was not ready and had to wait... even if only 5 minutes that is not proper. Shower is a tub not a walk in, ok for a three star not for a five star hotel. Last one is amazing. Breakfast 45 minutes late. No sincere apology despite three increasingly frantic calls. As I tell the gentleman doing the delivery to vacate immediately as I have two minutes left to wolf down my breakfast he does not even wait for the door to close to start mumbling an extremely rude comment. Unacceptable anywhere... clearly somebody in management needs to remind the staff that we have a choice and we the customers pay the bills...

title: Our family enjoyed our stay!
text: The room was about 450 sq ft and pretty large, by NYC standards.  We loved being in the heart of midtown -- just a few blocks away from Central Park, Times Square etc.  We could walk to almost everything and spend less time on the subway.   We felt very comfortable and safe at this hotel, and even saw a movie star while we were there!

title: 5 Star Luxury
text:
We visited the city overnight on the way to Italy.  It was built in 1904 and was the first luxury hotel in NYC. It was also where the Bloody Mary was invented in 1934. 

We had a stunning room with butler service.  We had a great view of 5th Avenue. 

When we arrived, our Butler came to meet us within moments of arriving in our room.  He had arranged for Magnolia Cupcakes to be set up in our room (a gift to me from my husband for our anniversary - my favorite).  The room was stunning.  

They sent us Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries as an anniversary gift (from Hugo at the front desk and from Jose, our butler).  

Hugo also arranged for complimentary breakfast which was served in our room. 

We had turn down service, they pressed our clothes (2 garments per person, per day - complimentary) and so much more!  Let me not forget the complimentary beverage service and French pressed coffee).  

Our stay was topped off by a special delivery.  We went to Gucci on 5th avenue and I looked at a bag I liked but didn't buy it.  My husband emailed the butler and arranged with the hotel for them to go buy it and deliver it to the room.  I was surprised and impressed all at one time.  

This is luxury and he service was beyond our expectations.

title: Super fancy - upgraded to a suite
text: This is where you want to stay in New York if you can afford it.  We got upgraded to a suite and the room has two bathrooms plus a bar and living room.  Super nice.  The staff is very helpful and the room is one of the best I've ever stayed in.  Luxury, luxury!  You could live in this room!!

title: MAGNIFICENT ATTENTION TO DETAIL
text:
We hadn't visited the St. Regis Hotel in New York before, and I'll admit to having been a little wary.  There are certain Grande Dame hotels in the Starwood portfolio that are a little past their shelf life, and looking a bit beaten up and in need of TLC.  Not so the incredibly beautiful and fastidiously maintained St. Regis New York.  This is a hotel that literally glistens with fresh paint, fresh scrubbing, fresh upholstery, sparkling crystal, and obsessive attention paid to every detail down to the weight of the stationery and the bulbs in the light fixtures.  The desk staff was immediately friendly and accommodating.  We asked for an SPG upgrade and were prepared for the usual few added square feet or better view.  What we were given was the Fifth Avenue Suite, a truly grand and beautiful collection of rooms, palatial by Manhattan apartment standards, with a view of Fifth Avenue below.  Like the rest of the hotel, the room was spotless, freshly refurbished, and offered two bathrooms, a generous walk-in closet, a fridge, and a host of creature comforts.  Couldn't have asked for better.

The Concierge staff were on their game and steered us to some terrific smaller restaurants we hadn't visited before.  Every phone call to room service, the front desk, and housekeeping was met with a thoughtful, friendly, and always helpful voice at the other end.  This is one of those hotels that reflects well on its demanding management and training standards, and every employee we met was professional and incredibly helpful and friendly.  And every last one seemed aware and proud of the hotel's origins, history, and ambition to be the best at what it does.

Minor gripes: Certain rooms in the hotel offer "Butler Service," a tradition and pride of the St. Regis since its opening in 1904.  We found the service a little awkward to use.  When you phone the Butler, you hear a tone then a shrill whistle on the phone similar to reaching a fax machine.  We weren't sure what this was about, so we phoned the hotel operator who said this was the paging system for the butlers, but she'd make sure our request for coffee service got through.  A short while later, the Butler did arrive with coffee, and was very helpful with a few other requests.  But we're not sure he'd have shown if not for the operator, because the next day we put in two calls, and after waiting for over an hour for any response, we just gave up and used other services.  

We also found, that for a hotel that paid such attention to detail in other areas, the door staff was not its strong suit.  At great hotels, the doormen are part of the guest's first impression, with a greeting, an opened door, and an offer of help.  The staff, at least on our visit, were often sort of just standing around, in one case watching us lug a heavy bag up the stairs before finally offering some help with the second. No one greeted us or opened a door on our several trips in and out, and we were just a little surprised at this minor lapse in an otherwise fantastic experience.

The King Cole bar is cozy, classically New York, and historic-feeling.  The Astor Court restaurant is beautiful and relaxed; the food a little hit-and-miss.  Likewise, the Private Dining options vary from delicious to just okay.  

Again, these are relatively minor complaints and smallish pieces of what was, overall, perhaps the best hotel experience we've had in the U.S. or Europe.  Congratulations to everyone at the St. Regis for maintaining this fantastic and important heritage property.

title: Still our favourite in NYC
text:
We stayed here about 18mths ago and were very impressed. 
This time it has been confirmed as our favourite NYC hotel. 

Close to good shopping, excellent hotel bar, great service, quiet rooms. 
just perfect!

title: Using Starwood Points
text: We had a reservation to stay at an SPG  NYC Aloft hotel which used 20,000 points a night.  When we realized that we could stay at the 5 Star St Regis Hotel for 30,000 points ( we have a lot of points...) we quickly changed our plans!  The St Regis is a gorgeous hotel, with the most luxurious rooms and incredible service that we have ever seen.  Needless to say, we will be

title: History and luxury.
text:
Rare books and the original Bloody Mary greet you on the main floor.  When you find your room; after enjoying everything Fifth Avenue and NYC has to offer, you will be enchanted by chandeliers, fruit and the finest bedding.
You must stay at the St. Regis to experience history and life.

title: Beautiful property and fantastic staff
text: I recently stayed at the St. Regis New York and I can't say enough great things about it.  It is a top shelf, 5-star, midtown hotel.  The rooms and common areas are immaculate. The location is perfect.  However, what really stood out for me was the staff.  I had a medical issue that gave me some challenges when traveling.  I notified the front desk manager, Paulina, in advance of my stay to see if the hotel could provide some help with the situation.  She really went out of her way to help me.  She communicated with me via email and telephone in advance to discuss options. The solution that she provided was perfect!  She, and all of her staff were friendly,  gracious and helpful.  They really made what could have been a very difficult stay, a wonderful one.  It was much appreciated.

title: This hotel is my definition of a great NY hotel
text: I love the location, the staff, the restaurants, THE BAR, the rooms and all of the extra services that are offered here where staff remember so many little details about previous trips that each return is like an extended day from the last stay.

title: Underwhelming
text:
Checking in was the worst part of my experience. As I was standing in line to check in,  there was one person in front of me who was being assisted and two other guests in line behind me also waiting to check in with only one front desk employee. I was in line for 7 minutes and never did the lady at the front desk make eye contact with me or signal her customer to hold on while she got some other employees to assist her. It was rude, unprofessional and totally unacceptable from any hotel of thus caliber. 2 minutes is the maximum amount of time you should wait before being acknowledged. Clearly the staff needs better training. 

That frustration aside, at approximately 6pm I ran into a friend from back home who was waiting for her room. She arrived at 4 and had been relegated to wait at the bar because there were no rooms available to honor her reservation. She had theater tickets and needed her room, so at her behest I inquired to the manager about its status. The manager was apologetic but couldn't guarantee when the room would become available. In the end it all worked out, but the my being neglected at check-in and her room not being ready are two things that you should never experience at a hotel like the St. Regis. 

Yes the rooms are nice, yes the hotel is well maintained, but the service is for me the most important, and the service that I experienced was slightly below average.

title: Great location - strange room
text:
This hotel is the original St. Regis. Upon check in the staff repeatedly points this out with pride. It has a great location on 5th Ave and 55th street. 
The room I received in the Superior category (no.416) was a very strange and basically windowless room. Furniture is elegant, as in the entire hotel, and the room spacious but it is pitch dark even during the day if the lights are not on. There is a very small window next to the bed and the " view" is an unattractive inner court with fire  escapes. I do not understand why such a room is even given to a guest. 

There was a large group in the hotel, partially blocking the lobby on Saturday Oct.15  early evening, and it was not easy to reach the exit door. The staff is friendly, but I cannot understand the rave comments about the service on the Internet - there was nothing extraordinary in the attentiveness of the staff However, the Bellmen are very efficient and do deserve a praise.
The  famous King Cole Bar does not have much space and it was also basically occupied by large groups.

title: Hotels in Manhattan are expensive . . . this one is worth it!
text:
My wife and I had a wedding to attend in the city. Our son used the opportunity to join us and see friends. We had stayed at the St Regis on numerous prior occasions and were never disappointed. This trip was no exception. We had an "upgraded" room on the 5th floor. The room was compact (which is a step up from "small"), but nicely adapted to the addition of a rollaway bed for our son. The room was tasteful, large enough and comfortable.

While a nice room is important, I've always found the defining difference between a nice room and a great hotel is the staff. On this score, the St Regis always comes through. From the front desk to the floor butler to the bar tender to the doormen (and especially the doormen!), the staff always makes us feel welcome and comfortable.

title: Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location
text:
We hadn't  stayed at the St. Regis for many years. We decided to try it again for a 2 night stay to celebrate our anniversary. We were upgraded to a larger suite than we had reserved. It was a beautifully appointed room with all the modern amenities. It was a smart room that had all the controls for the lighting and draperies from either room.
We had a beautiful view of 5th avenue from our living room. The room came with butler service which was a great amenity.
The best part of the St. Regis besides the wonderful rooms is definitely the location. You step out of the hotel and you're in the middle of a shopper's paradise. Every designer store is at your doorstep. So if you want to shop till you drop it's a great location. You're also steps away from Central Park and all the wonderful museums we have in New York City.
The St. Regis has it all, great service, beautiful rooms and a perfect location. Looking to return soon to enjoy being in the city!

title: Fantastic hotel
text: The St Regis in NYC is a wonderful hotel.  The rooms are comfortable and quiet.  Great location.  We will definitely be back.  You can use Starwood point and they give you great rooms.  Favorite hotel in NYC.

title: One-night Incredible Stay
text:
My husband and I had an incredible one-night stay at the St. Regis to celebrate a birthday. We booked a basic room on points, but were still treated incredibly well. The front desk staff was very friendly (the two women and Jose) and remembered our names even though we were only staying one night. The room was very spacious, clean, comfortable, and grand. We had a fruit basket waiting for us and later in the evening received chocolate covered strawberries and a personal note from Octavia, the manager. We also received a letter informing us about a parade the next evening so that we could plan our itinerary accordingly. These special touches were so appreciated!

The personal butler service was incredible--we had French press coffee and complimentary shoe shining at the press of a button. We hear that the unpacking/packing service is also incredible. When we needed to find our Uber in rainy parade traffic to go the airport, Matt walked a block over with our luggage to help us find our way! We had such a delightful time and can't wait to be back!

title: Birthday
text: We had one night to spend in NYC before our two week vaca to France and Italy so we chose to use Starwood points for the St Regis. We arrived at 10:30am and they stored our bags and said if we could wait for a later check in we would gat a nice upgrade for our Starwood status and for using our Starwood credit card. Our room was ready at 3pm and we were upgrade 5 levels. The room was enormous: two front doors, large foyer, living room with small dining area, two full baths, bar area and a huge bedroom. A bottle of wine with chocolate covered strawberries and other fruits were waiting for us in the room. Thank you St Regis NYC for a great birthday vaca send-off to Europe.

title: Best hotel ever! Outstanding
text: I stayed for 21 days in this hotel. The location is the best in the town. On the 5th ave 55th street where you can find the best brands and shops. The service is outstanding and the breakfast is delicious . The pancake is a must have. The concierge service is one of the best.

title: An afternoon treat in the King Cole bar
text:
We took a break from shopping and treated ourselves to a cocktail in the famous King Cole bar at the St Regis. Great experience, it was fairly quiet and we were able to enjoy our drinks and have a chat with Mathias - who made our visit a fun experience.
Can certainly recommend and will try to return before we head back to England!

title: Elegance Personified
text:
We stayed over one night for our anniversary. I would venture to say that our Suite (Room 301) was larger than most NYC apartments (1 BD plus TWO baths!!).  Everything, but absolutely everything was exquisite, and for once, I can honestly say that there was not a single thing amiss.  

Not only was our suite impeccable but the front desk was incredibly accommodating and eager to please.  Sadly, we could only stay one night so I cannot comment on the butler service, but I'm sure like everything at this hotel, it was exceptional!

title: Disappointed
text: I've read a lot of great reviews of this hotel and perhaps it just wasn't the right fit for me, personally, but I was very underwhelmed.  On the whole, the hotel felt very old-fashioned and a bit stuffy and tired.  I can see how the old-fashioned vibe appeals to some, and I can appreciate it in some hotels if it's done the right way, but I didn't care for it here.  The lobby and restaurant are small, the elevators are cramped and the service was uneven.  Certain people were great and very friendly but others weren't.  The servers in the restaurant were particularly unfriendly. I will say that I got a nice upgrade and the room was very big (although the view wasn't great) but the general feeling of the hotel really didn't appeal to me and I actually ended up checking out early.  Maybe this just isn't the right place for me but I think there are much better options in New York city.

title: Amazing
text: This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at, I will come back after such an amazing experience. Everything is over the top - so come with high expectations and you'll leave very happy. They also have a great bar/lounge area which is a great place to spend some time if you're not staying here.

title: Is that all there is?
text: For around a thousand bucks per night for a standard (albeit very nice) room, I think I can be a bit picky.  That's not to say there weren't wonderful things about the hotel.  The staff are well-trained and for the most part do not have that "I'm working at a nice hotel so I'm better than you" attitude that workers at other (less luxurious) hotels (Yes W hotels I'm talking about you) have.  I always felt welcomed if not pampered.  Check in was problematic with the hotel front desk telling me they'd call me when my room was ready.  I was more than fine with that as I was early.  The problem was: they never called me when the room was ready.  I had to chase them down to find out (well after 5pm) that the room had in fact been ready for some time.  Again, not a huge deal but certainly not 5 star hotel service.  The butler service was nice and our evening butler (never met the daytime butler) was extremely friendly and provided prompt service.  Then again, I didn't need much service.  The hotel gym is embarrassing for a 5 star hotel.  Extremely small.  Co-ed locker room with few amenities.  No steam room.  Again, quite embarrassing for a 5 star hotel.  My standard room was very large and you could definitely feel the the ghosts of a different era (in a good way) despite the room being completely upgraded.  Whether or not the style (which walks right up to gaudy without crossing the line) is your taste depends on what you like.  Many of the guest rooms have minimal to no view which adds a feel of seclusion from the city.  Again this may be a pro or a con depending on your level of love for NYC.  The famous on site bar had impeccable service although I was always there at "off" times when few people were there.  But in the end, it's a small bar with a great painting serving the same drinks you could get at a fraction of the price elsewhere.  Like the hotel, I'm glad I went but was left thinking: is that all there is?  The hotel restaurant feels very open and is not the greatest of places for a romantic meal.  The afternoon tea was (for this hotel) bargain priced but the scones were a bit dry and the sandwiches lacking in flavor. The Bentley car service was a definite plus if you need a luxury ride within a few blocks of the hotel and have your own means of transportation back to the hotel (sorry no return service).  Perhaps I'm a less stuffy hotel lover or perhaps the kind of amenities this luxury property had just didn't meet my needs.  I'd rather have a great gym than a Bentley.  I'd rather have a great view than a butler.  In the end, I can see why others may love the St. Regis NYC but she and I weren't a perfect match.

title: Exceptional Hotel
text: Stayed for 5 nights while visiting New York to attend plays and go to opera at New York Met. Hotel conveniently located midway between Theatre District and Lincoln Center. Room - Grande Lux - was great, large and spacious and quiet. Service was excellent from Sue at checkin to Jose at checkout. Samantha in lobby was very helpful. One of our chambermaids, Lydia, was excellent. Ate breakfast in Cole Restaurant and one dinner. All the meals were great and ours waiters in the morning, Messrs. Javier, Cesar, and Sayeed were friendly and gave excellent service. This was our second visit to hotel and cannot wait to visit again.it was wonderful to recognize staff from our previous visit.

title: Perfect Service, Perfect Room
text: This is a well-run hotel.  The staff was fantastic, the service warm and genuine.  Housekeeping flawless.  I am incredibly picky about hotels and service, but for the life of me, I cannot provide a "but...."  teh St. Regis is low-key, traditional elegance.  And the public areas are not overflowing with tourists and sightseers.  As we were visitors ourselves, it felt more like coming home as you slip through the lobby, not tripping over thousands of people, and retreating to your room.  If you want a little St. Regis action, shoehorn yourself into the King Cole Bar where it is loud, local and lively.  We will be back.

title: Consistently very good
text:
I have stayed here several times thro work and it has always offered a very high standard in all areas. 
From the very stylish rooms and a bed so soft, you sink into a deep sleep. 
It's Staff are very helpful and food is delicious.

title: 全紐約的最佳選擇
text: 喜達屋集團旗下的傳奇酒店。本以為會是傳統古典的歐式裝修風格，結果走進房間完全眼前一亮，房間維護的相當棒！！客房內果盤每日都會更新，管家先生也是隨時隨叫隨到，客房內早餐出品質量也是令人相當驚喜。加之酒店本身位於曼哈頓島中心地段，絕對是每次來紐約的絕佳選擇！！

title: Weekend away from it all
text:
i am in NYC often. I have stayed at numerous 5 star hotels. St. Regis is my favorite. 
Just came home from a weekend there.the st. Regis is more like home than any other NYC hotel I have stayed at. Old world charm with fresh new rooms. Great bed. Great service. I already booked another visit for next month.

title: St Regis Stay 9/15/16-9/16/16
text: My husband and I stayed at the St Regis NYC the weekend of September 15, 2016. We are often in NYC and stay at many lovely hotels. The St Regis stands out for it's attention to detail, and the staff. The hotel was completely full on our weekend, and yet, every staff member we ran into, greeting us by name. We were always asked if we needed anything, and if we were enjoying our stay. Special touches, thinking of things you may need before you even ask is what makes the St Regis stand above others. We were in town to see Electric Light Orchestra at Radio City. Coming back the room to strawberries dipped in the absolute best chocolate (and I mean best, and I am super picky) was a great way to end a glorious evening. Molly Deutscher was so accomodating before we even got to town. I cannot thank her and the team at St Regis (and that turkish coffee was wonderful!). This staff should be commended for providing genuine and best in class customer service. They 'get it'. We will be back! Sharon and Nick Havrilak

title: Perfection!
text:
Because of a wonderful manager, we moved our loyalty from The Four Seasons NY to The St Regis NY.. Daniela Cataldo made us fall in love with impeccable customer service when she was at The St. Regis SF. She started us on our SPG platinum quest years ago and we have been so loyal to the Starwood brand. Since we were in town for Hamilton and the UN General Assembly, we had to pay Daniela a visit and try out the property she'd been telling us about.

Daniela greeted us warmly and walked us to our rooms and introduced us to our efficient butler, Dolores. Everything we wanted or ever needed would appear just as we hung up the phone! 

Every staff member we passed in the hallway or we encountered was friendly, professional and courteous. Not one showed any hint of an attitude. Loved that. 

Our upgraded suite was breathtaking. It was sparkly, glamorous and huge. Not a thing out of place. A perfect bowl of fruit, an addictive bowl of chocolate, classical music playing, and all the chandeliers turned on welcomed us to our perfect home for the next few days. We couldn't be happier. We were in room 507. Not even the barely-noticeable street noise could dampen our mood! We loved our gorgeous room. 

Our bathroom was sparkly and glamorous too. It was filled with all the lovely Remede spa products I adore. The tub, which my daughter enjoyed, came with a book stand, a special pouch filled with crystals and salts to drop in the bath, a beautiful back brush and soap. I personally loved the shower stall. Water pressure was perfect. 

Our second favorite person, after dear Daniela, had to be McKinley Winston. He's the concierge extraordinaire. If you needed anything, he could make magic happen. His knowledge of everything (!) astounded my daughter and me. He's interesting just shooting the breeze with.  Thank you, McKinley!

Despite us staying during the busiest time and the hotel being home to some UN delegates, the hotel had extra staff that managed everything. We ALWAYS felt safe and so well taken care of. 

The complimentary SPG breakfast wasn't anything to sneeze at. It wasn't a cheap affair like at some places. This was a carefully prepared meal from FRESH juices, teas/coffees to eggs to meats, potatoes, breads, etc.. All cooked to order. Room service breakfast we had was always fast and efficient. Items would arrive hot. No complaints! The people that brought our breakfast were perfectly dressed, courteous and chirpy in the morning. 

There is NO WAY to improve on the place or the people. This is perfection. We had the perfect weekend with our daughter and are looking forward to returning with my mom from Singapore this time. 

Thank you for incredible hospitality, Daniela! You have a great team that you have to be so proud of. Thank you, as always, for turning my husband into the number 1 SPG fan!

title: Poor value for money
text: Rooms are nice. Stuff is not polite and is inefficient: you wait up to an hour to get your breakfasr served without excuses, calls are not returned in due time by concierge although offered, after noon tea reservations are forgotten although confirmed in orfer to name only few short comings.It seems that tourists are considered no to be taken seriously as long as they pay quietly and accept being bosses around...definitely NOT in tune witj St Regis Hotels around the world...

title: Wow, what a great property
text:
We stayed at the St. Regis for our 45 th wedding anniversary.  The hotel staff was fantastic. From the minute we check in Liubov  at the front desk took great care of us! 
There was a little mix up and the room was not ready and would not be ready for a while! The hotel offered us dinner on them!   The room we did get was beautiful. Everything in the room was immaculate, beautifully furnished and the colors were soft and very well done. We have stayed in many hotels and this was  a 10! This is one of the classic hotels in the world. Our new home when visiting NY!

title: Great to be back at this 6 star classic
text: Perfection all around including the spacious rooms, impeccable service, wonderful butlers, and number one location in New York City. From the moment of check in until checkout, the staff pampers, looks after and caters to the guests' every whim. The King Cole Bar remains a top destination and serves as a top spot for cocktails during business meetings or a romantic finish to the perfect evening. The perfect hotel in the perfect city.

title: Wonderful trip
text: My husband and I had a fabulous 4 night experience at the St Regis over Labor Day weekend.  Upon check in, we were upgraded to a Madison suite-a beautiful corner unit.  The accommodations were as expected and the staff was extremely courteous.  We would definitely recommend.

title: Best Staycation Ever
text:
This legendary hotel has such a special meaning to travelers all around the world and all the fans of Starwood. Thanks to St. Regis New York, I get my first precious opportunity to experience the wonderful Tiffany Suite. This noble designer suite has a large dining room, a beautiful living room, a cosily decorated bedroom and an elegant spacious bathroom. Tiffany blue color is found everywhere in the room and Tiffany spirit is fully embed in the ornament and detail of furniture. There was a moment I just found that history was told by this furnished room, and the design intelligence is integrated perfectly with those new facilities. I just love it so much and I feel it so hard to expect anything better for this stay.  From the corner of my room, I can actually tell this hotel occupies such an unbeaten location,  most luxury brand stores on 5th Avenue are just nearby. through the window, I also get an amazing view of Central Park.

I would say the service of this hotel is just as good as its location. The warm welcome I received from the front desk is undoubtedly a St Regis standard. The front desk agent did a good job by making me feel that I am indeed a valued member here. The butler service makes me feel that I am always cared without awkward. 

I think I will always keep the precious memory of this weekend, and hopefully I can visit back to this gorgeous St Regis very soon.

title: Exzellentes Grand Hotel
text: Ich denke über dieses Hotel ist schon alles geschrieben worden. Perfekte Location auf 5th Avenue und nicht weit vom Central Park und Rockefeller Center. Der Empfang ist freundlich und verbindlich. Alle Concierges zeichnen sich durch gutes Netzwerk und exzellentes Wissen über die Stadt und deren Möglichkeiten aus. Der Butler ist bei Bedarf sofort zur Stelle. In einem Hotel dieser Kategorie sollte das auch alles so sein. Der Barkeeper in der sehr angenehmen King Cole Bar hatte mittags um 4pm wohl einen Durchhänger, er präsentierte sich als ein typisch knurriger New Yorker. Das muss in einem solchen Etablisment nicht sein. Die Suiten sind maximal gepflegt und überzeugen durch eine für New Yorker Verhältnisse wirklich gute Geräusch-Reduktion. Alles in allem ein wirkliches Grand Hotel, dass sich allerdings gegenüber dem Peninsulla auf der anderen Strassenseite manchmal in für den Gast wichtigen Details etwas schwer tut.

title: Unbeatable location for shopping
text: My wife and I recently completed a 3-night stay in a deluxe suite and loved every minute of our visit. Shopping was a big part of our agenda, and I'm not sure you can find a better location relative to shopping on 5th Ave. Convenient to both Bergdorf Goodman and Saks Fifth Ave and to nearly every major designer you can think of. Service was good but we didn't really have any over the top requests. The bedding was fantastic and we loved how dark the room got. We both slept until 10:30 one morning, which is something we haven't done maybe since the 1990's. Concierge was very helpful leading up to our trip as well. Housekeeping was like clockwork in the morning and the evening. We will definitely return next time we are in the City.

title: Luxury Experience
text:
I have stayed at the St Regis three times this year now and each stay exceeds the last. My latest stay in this hotel was in August this year. Upon my arrival, I was very pleased to hear that I had been upgraded to a suite. During check in, the receptionist was extremely helpful. I have stayed in many other hotels in New York but none of them have the classic, elegant feel and flair that the St Regis does. 
The rooms are decorated tastefully and are very spacious. The butler service was excellent and the butler was always on call and available when needed. 
The concierge are always helpful and always have excellent restaurant recommendations for me. 
The location is excellent, right off 5th avenue and not too far from Central Park. 
We also went for drinks at the King Cole Bar and there is a lovely old school feel about it. 
I would like to thank all the staff at the hotel who helped make my stay such a pleasurable one. Thanks to the team at the St Regis, New York is beginning to feel like a second home for me.

title: Close but not quite
text: JJ Astor would still be proud of his hotel, but until Marriott takes it over, it suffers from Starwood mediocrity. You spend all the money and you want the experience and it comes close, but like all tier 2 hotel chains Starwood people just don't measure up to Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton or Mandarin or Peninsula properties. St. Regis suites were beautiful and the butler is helpful, but why can't I have coffee in my suite, with service optional instead of required? Doormen were great, especially Patrick. Front desk staff are very comfortable saying "no" to guests and they didn't offer the walk up to the room. So what was wrong- it was just a tea cup short of a full place setting.

title: Always sophisticated and elegant.
text: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the years and I have never been disappointed. Friendly, attentive staff, beautifully decorated hotel, luxurious, comfortable rooms and excellent dining options. Wonderful location in the city.

title: Absolutely luxury experience
text:
Being in several St. Regis but no compare with the original in NYC.
Extremely comfort reception and quick direct to the room. 
Room atmosphere and decoration is one of the best I have ever known. Silk on the walls, gold on the metal artifacts and with a taste and decor that really makes a truly lovely experience.
The butler service was impecable and immediate ate our service, bringing a beautiful te experience on the room.
All the technology that we were expecting was on there but inside the most delightful classical decor, 
Bathroom also clear and well illuminated.
In general one of the best hotel we have ever being.

title: Luxury Holiday Living in NYC
text:
We cannot say enough about the St Regis Residences in the St Regis Hotel, NYC.  We have stayed here on family holidays with our children, on couples trips with friends, and solo for a quick getaway together. In every case, our experience has been first-rate and exceptional.

The accommodations are richly designed and imperial in taste, as well as updated, clean and  supremely comfortable.  Our personal butlers have all been timely, friendly, and overly accommodating to our needs.  McKinley, one of the concierge staff, has been wonderful to deal with (very friendly and fun!).  Our housekeeping staff have been wonderful ladies (Roxanne and Mare especially come to mind) and have done a terrific job of keeping us organized and stocked with fresh towels.  When I asked one of them if we had to leave a card for daily linen changing, she replied "No ma'am, here at the St Regis we change the linens every day all the time"  The beds are amazingly comfortable -- even our children have commented on how comfy they were the last time they were here! 

The extra touches of fancy themed chocolates (ie. tennis ball and racket for US Open time) and fresh fruit daily do not go unnoticed and help us feel like we are coming home at the end of each day in the city.

We are happy to be members of the St Regis/Phoenician Residence club and are always thrilled to be visiting the St Regis Residences in NYC!  Every two bedroom, two bathroom suite that we have enjoyed exceeded our expectations and the staff at the St Regis are marvelous at every level! (even our doormen (Pete) and the gentleman who delivered breakfast (John) were engaging and friendly while they helped us).

Here's to another luxurious visit!

title: Incredible Experience
text:
My wife and I stayed here one night when we got married in the City. This was by far the finest hotel experience we've ever had. From beginning to end, the staff were absolutely professional, friendly, and helpful. Upon checking in, the front desk ensured that we received a Deluxe room, even though I booked a Superior and arrived much earlier than normal check-in. (I'm an SPG gold member, but this doesn't always guarantee a room category upgrade.)

The room itself was spotless; this was the cleanest hotel room I've ever stayed in. Our butler appeared within minutes of our arrival, offering us complimentary French press coffee and tea, and explaining the mechanics of the butler service. We paged the butler several other times during our stay, and they were always there after a short moment, even apologizing for a 5-minute delay.

The bouquet they prepared for my wife was incredible, with the roses looking brand new even several days later. One of the hotel staff helpfully pinned the corsage to my suit as we walked out. Although we were going outside of the the normal radius, they made sure we got the hotel Bentley and drove us to the church.

After dinner, we came back to our room, where the lights were dimmed. There were orange rose petals in the shape of a heart on the bed and soft music was playing. They gave us a card and chocolate covered strawberries, wishing congratulations. This was all completely unprompted and we were very surprised.

Upon leaving, the gentleman helping us with the luggage gave me a hearty handshake and genuine smile upon learning of the wedding. I've stayed in many fine hotels, but this experience was unforgettable and we'll certainly return.

title: Wonderful classy hotel
text: Beautiful historic hotel in great location in New York, the staff were friendly and helpful, we were treated nicely by the front desk lady and the guest relation manager Mario who was always helpful in his suggestions, we were upgraded to a larger suite that was beautifully designed with two large marble bathrooms, whatever we asked was delivered promptly including Nespresso machine. The breakfast was good but not outstanding. The bar is nice and has great service, the concierge and the Buttlers were very helpful for arranging all our need.

title: FLAGSHIP ST REGIS AND THAT'S IT
text:
Below my expectations in all aspects. You have to train your waiters and bartenders the art of Hospitality and not live just in the past. Perception is reality and King Cole used to be a friendly bar with bartenders that made guests, residents and visitors fell like home. No more. No doorman helping the visitors and guests. Children at the bar, shouting. The rate is around US800 and the service and experience was below my expectations. I'm a very loyal St Regis Brand client, so will be nice you see and experience again the best service ,facilities and experience at this Hotel. Maybe in the future, we will see.
You need to improve many things.

title: Iconic big city hotel mostly worth high price tag
text:
Just stayed at ideally located st Regis right in midtown at 55th and 5th for a wedding near by.  Hotel has great old character touches and sense of history.  The King Cole bar is also a must see for its great big city vibe and beautiful mural and great service.  Also of course for the home of the original Bloody Mary or snapper I think they call it.  
Also, the service levels are top notch and the butler service is a nice touch. In addition, the concierge service was very attentive; they went out of the way to recommend some great Brooklyn spots and whiskey bars.  
Only minor quibbles is that for rooms of that price and class bathrooms are a bit small and didn't have much of a view.  One other thing they could use is a true destination restaurant to go with that great bar.  Overall, great stay and top flight service.

title: A 10 in every way!
text: Where to begin?  The rooms are beautifully appointed, lush and spotless - absolutely perfect.  But the service is where they truly shine.  Everyone - and I mean everyone, is smiling, says hello and good morning, wishes you a good day, and is just SO nice! I surprised my mom and took her there to celebrate a special birthday.  The room supervisor, Molly, went out of her way to assist me with special requests and then added her own AMAZING extras that were above and beyond my wildest dreams to make my mom's birthday weekend a dream come true for her.  And for the whole weekend where ever my mom was - whether walking in the hall from her room, or getting off the elevator, someone was wishing her a happy birthday - even from behind the front desk.  I cannot thank that staff enough.  She will never forget this weekend!  Nor will I ever forget Molly who is surely spun from gold :)

title: Reliable quality in great mid-town location
text: The hotel has been updated.  The rooms are fresh and there is a new gym.  You always get the best slip and fantastic linens, pillows, mattresses, etc.  Bring your wallet though.  A glass of white wine and a beer in the bar was $46!

title: Afternoon delight
text: I didn't actually stay at the hotel but I attended afternoon tea with my friend with cookies and cakes. The decoration is stunning, the service is the best of the best, and the things we ate were so pretty and delicate. Hoping to go back soon! The best hotel in NYC by far!

title: Amazing hotel
text: Amazing hotel, great service . They make you feel like you are their main concern .  The rooms are amazing very clean, and equipped with every thing. It's my forth time here and I'm sure I will be back here again. The hotel experience is part of what makes the trip :)

title: Exceptional service in the best hotel in the City
text: This is my favorite hotel in New York City. Located just off 5th avenue in a historic newly renovated building it has all the qualities of a top hotel in New York: spacious elegant rooms, great spa, top of the line fitness equipment, impressive restaurant, legendary bar and many more. However, it is the service that make it exceptional and unmatched in the industry, especially in the Gotham City. On my last trip, my suitcase was out of the Uber even before I exited, a very courteous bellman escorted me to reception where I was greeted by a very attentive young woman who had considered all the room options requested in my reservation: I needed a quiet room on 14th floor. I was upgraded into an amazing suite on 14th floor that was spacious, quiet and had a nice view. When I arrived in the elevator on 14th, a butler opened the door and took care of my immediate needs: after a long flight I needed to get my suit and shirts pressed and shoes polished. The butler took my suit and shoes and came back with a complimentary cup of tea. There was no need to fill out any forms or to wait for 40 minutes for someone to come. After I came back from dinner, my suit and shirt and shoes were waiting for me in the room. The hotel lobby and the rooms have undergone a recent renovation and are in an excellent shape.

title: The "Wow" Factor
text:
This hotel offers so much "wow" factor that it would be extremely difficult for anyone to find anything about this hotel and the service that is offered here to be less than perfect.

First of all, if I had to pick the one most outstanding feature of the St. Regis New York, it would have to be the flawless service. Upon arrival, you feel as though you are royalty (waited on hand and foot). From the doorman, to the bellhop, to the concierge, to the personal butler service, each offered service with a smile (at all times I might add!) At the door inside the lobby, Arturo was a delight to talk with each day. Extra thanks must be given to Jonathan Adler, the concierge who helped us with all of our local transportation needs weeks in advance. Kudos to both Jonathan Adler and McKinley Winston for their superb restaurant recommendations as well. Finally, regarding the top-of-the-line service, there is always more than one person working at the concierge desk. We never experienced any kind of wait or a line to speak with anyone at the concierge desk at any time of the day or night.

As one reviewer mentioned, the high vaulted fresco painted ceilings give the lobby a feel of old Europe. There are gorgeous chandeliers at every turn. Much attention to detail has been given to the lobby, the restaurant, the hallways, and of course, the guestrooms.

Our guestroom included the comfiest beds we've ever slept on. Everything in our room appeared to be newly refurbished (television in the bathroom mirror). Even though our room was an "inside" room with no view, we heard no hallway noise or street noise. We were also very close to an elevator and never heard any sound from it whatsoever.

The location of the hotel couldn't have been any more convenient to shopping, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, the MOMA, and it was close enough to Broadway without it being in all of the tourist frenzy.

We had a magnificent five-night stay at the St. Regis New York. We were even fortunate enough to ride in the Bentley provided by the hotel on our last evening there. This was the trip-of-a-lifetime for us. If we are fortunate enough to go back to NYC again, you can be sure that we will be staying at the St. Regis New York for all of the "wow" factor it has to offer.

title: Gran Hotel Clásico renovado
text:
Se trata de un edificio clásico pegado a la 5 avenida, frente al hotel Península.
Con una renovación en sus instalaciones y habitaciones pero manteniendo mobiliario y decoración clásica.
Perfectamente atendido por su personal.
Muy agradable.

title: Amazing stay experience and St Regis attention...
text:
This is my 3rd stay at the St Regis, NYC, for a 5-night stay (on SPG points). Outright, probably my best stay experience for a NYC hotel.

Firstly, on check-in, although the room wasn't ready, but they treated us to wait at their restaurant and to enjoy their menu at their compliments, which I thought was great. Then, they gave us a super upgrade to their Madison suite, which was even better and unexpected on my part (but I was awarded this because I have SPG Platinum benefits) - but I expected their 1-up upgrade only. A spacious room (with living room, almost 1000 sqft) makes a huge difference to the comfort and peace of a frenetic and intense city such as NY. 

Morning breakfast service - as you wake up, you can request for morning coffee from their butler service. Then, you could have breakfast provided for in-room also, at no further charge. I wish other luxury hotels will take this initiative also. 

In terms of 'value', this was amongst the best deliveries I have received from SPG over the years. The attention to detail in their rooms is simply amazing - I could probably compare this to the Ritz Carlton properties. Each day I return from town, it's so peaceful. It is so centrally located, in NYC (just off 5th Ave).

Ultimately, this brand/property defends it's reputation very well. If there were 6* rating to offer, they deserve it.

title: City Break
text: Stayed here for two nights and had a great time. This hotel has the best redemption for SPG points value, and we took advantage to pamper ourselves. It was really very nice, though one mishap occurred when we were billed for something in the bar that we didn't order. The reception cleared it for us right away without the hassle we may of experienced at some other hotel. We didn't receive the 5th Ave view we were hoping for, but that's only fair when using points. Would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect location & old school glamour.
text: Having recently stayed at The Plaza and Mandarin Oriental, I wanted to try another of the top New York hotels. The St. Regis did not disappoint. I asked for a quiet room (mainly because of New York car horns!) - and was allocated a room on the 14th floor overlooking the interior. The room was so quiet - I slept like a baby! St. Regis hotels are known for their butler service - and they really do work so hard. I was given a full tour of my room (by the way I was upgraded to a Grand Luxe room) - and also brought some green tea. They bring tea/coffee and biscuits daily with your wakeup call if that's what you want. I had a breakfast inclusive rate, and there was a fantastic selection to choose from. I enjoyed a cocktail at the legendary  King Cole bar downstairs - and the atmosphere was great. A fantastic stay, and I can't wait to return. A special thanks to Jeanne Delgado and Jenny Levina who helped me plan the perfect stay at the hotel.

title: Beyond Expectations!
text: From the moment we arrived the staff made us feel like we were the only people staying at this hotel. Being our wedding anniversary, we felt so special from the time we pulled up to the hotel until the moment we left.

title: Not a hotel to go with young kids
text:
I have SPG gold and am a frequent SPG user. So I wanted to try St. Regis. I used my SPG points and they upgraded my room. However compared to Park Hyatt, this hotel room is small and did not offer any kids bathroom amenities. The extrabed was not delivered until almost 9pm. Butler service was ok but our butler never explained that coffee was complimentary in AM. In fact he never really explained anything. 
The front desk staffs were friendly and very welcoming though.
For the location and price, Park Hyatt NY is so much better! And they have a huge swimming pool and spa.

title: Très belle chambre
text:
L'hôtel est très bien situé et la chambre était particulièrement agréable et spacieuse. Petit bémol sur le service au petit-déjeuner qui est approximatif. L'équipe de la conciergerie est très bien quant à elle.
En résumé : très bel hôtel et emplacement ! Je ne pense pas que l'on puisse se tromper en y séjournant. Très bon choix pour NYC.

title: A dreamed, chic hotel...perfect "Hub" for a fantastic NY GASTROTOUR !
text:
The St Regis Hotel 

A dreamed, very chic hotel. Our perfect hub for a fantastic NY Gastroutour...

After a non expected and disappointing experience at the London NYC hotel as our "hub-hotel" for a long time planned and cherished NY Gastroutour we decided to call AMEX PLATINUM SERVICES to reserve a nice room -nearby to our location- at non other than chic-classic Saint Regis hotel 
I'm not going to enter in details of our shortness stay at the London as all details are in my review for that property 
We haven't been in NY for over 5 years so- ahead of us- we had lots of fun in our ahead of time reserved restaurants; Daniel, Atera, Bouley, Gabriel Kreuther, Jean Georges, Eleven Madison Park and Le Bernardin...it was crystal clear that we were not in the mood to spoil those fantastic ( to be) evening with an unsatisfactory hotel stay 

Before going on some details of our fantastic experience there, I'm obliged to note that being a Hotel Developer and Owner, being professional Architect specialized in Resorts and Hotels designs and being a "high end" traveler all my life with clear, supported, understanding on hotel management and meanings of their offerings and designs...
In can reassert that "Saint Regis" hotel has what a all great hotel needs; certain style in its design, distinction, warmth and intimacy in the architecture and its deco design which is not boxed into standards, offering a great theme in hospitality, from guest-rooms to all facilities- making every single stay in it- a fantastic experience.
Those are qualities of paramount importance to be defined as - Saint Regis is-a "Grand Hotel"- Five Stars Hotel, lets look out it: 

Its Location in the very heart of Manhattan neighborhood is great:
# 2, 55 th street, just next to "archifamous" 5th Ave and all others prime NY City areas like; Central Park, MOMA Museum, Broadway etc 
That great location was perfect not only for our Gastrotour evenings, but for touristing NY bests as well !   
Great Exterior image, same as other olde style hotels in NY and those in Europe; it is some-kind of unpretentious, but chic and the dane time 
Reception is simple, small but simple beautiful...rather "chic" -as well- and perfectly designed for that kind of upper class hotel that-certainly- doesn't look after "lower-endish" type of guests nor to those low end package groups. That is not unusual in NY olde style properties and in other European cities 
Guests Facilities. Those areas are perfect to be qualified as a luxurious high end Hotel; Independent way in to its public facilities like its beautifully classic 
(high vaulted- "fresco" painted ceilings) timeless designed small Restaurant & Bar, perfect for small bites and drinks at any time 
Rooms. Here was one of our biggest satisfaction; our room was perfect, not too large, but large enough for us and VERY COMFORTABLE, favorable comparable to any other great Hotels with its multiple details, fantastic beddings, in-room details, bathroom design...and fine Buttler service. 
Our room had a great partial view over Manhattan landmark areas 
Service. All their staff- from top to bottom- was fantastic; Front desk, restaurant, in-room personnel, Concierge service etc...always, fantastic and helpful.
