I don't have their name handy, but those who took care of us were rather beyond-great helping with lots personalized details in our even greater 6 days stay there. 
Special mention to Front Desk Staff and those who take great care...
driving us- in their Hotel-Bentley car- to our great dinner evening at EMP ! 
Thanks to all staff for giving us such a fantastic time there, we will see you soon, as part of our next Gastroutour in that great city...
That certainly....NEVER SLEEPS !

title: St Regis Experience, New York
text:
My visit was October 14, 2014
The staff made my wife and I feel like a King and Queen.
I have visited many hotels and at least half of them were 5 star. None of them, except St Regis, made me feel like a VIP. 
I would call this "The St Regis Experience". 
Even staff that did not directly provide a service for me, greeted me with a friendly smile in the hallway when ever we passed. 

My wife called the St Regis "Old World Beauty". The lobby by itself is a work of art. I can't wait for our next stay at The St Regis NYC.
5th Avenue Shopping (wife's favorite pastime) is just steps away from the St Regis

title: Truly a Pleasure
text: Fantastic experience! Wonderful staff, especially Christina & Hugo at the front desk and Peter the concierge, took great care of me during my stay. Huge, luxurious bedroom and bathroom. Very comfortable beds and all the amenities you could want. The personal butler service and Bentley car service were also a special treat and a lot of fun.

title: Night of luxury
text: We stood here on s splurge weekend in the city. The service and amount of respect they show their guests here is second to none. The hotel is very expensive but I believe you get what you pay for. The staff at the St. Regis goes above and beyond what is expected.

title: Wonderful stay and service
text: We stayed for one night while we were having work done in our apt in NYC. We booked a small suite but we were upgraded to a large and lovely one bedroom 5th Avenue suite. I suppose because we're SPG members or just because they were feeling generous?! Either way it was MUCH appreciated! In addition they gave our 2 year old a couple of small toys upon arrival and even a little gift certificate to pick out a treat in the hotel boutique. She obviously loved that! The butler came to greet us a little after checking in. The only thing we asked her for during our stay was extra bottled water, but it was actually really helpful since we were there during a heat wave! The room was very upscale and nicely decorated. There was a tasty fruit plate left for our arrival. We didn't go out for dinner and we were in the room for turndown service. The cleaning staff was very polite and unobtrusive as they worked. All in all a wonderful stay made extra special by our upgrade. It's the first hotel I'd go back to if I ever needed to stay in town again!

title: What a wonderful hotel and staff
text: We stay an average of five weeks a year and have never been disappointed by the accommodations, staff, and service.  Never change.  The butler is very helpful, as are the doormen.  If you want a thrill stay during United Nations week to see all of the resident delegations.

title: Big room and well maintained
text:
The biggest draw for me is the size of the room. Even the smallest room is big enough to impress. This is especially rare in New York where most hotel rooms are tiny. 

The hotel is beautifully decorated if you like the old-school style. The room is well maintained with high tech control panel for lights and AC. The service is ok. I like the free ironing for two pieces of clothing. The only downside is that they never deliver the clothes on time in the morning... 

I would highly recommend the hotel if you want a big room in ever shrinking rooms in New York!

title: And what a GREAT place to stay in in NYC....
text:
My husband stays here regularly on business and I tag along from time to time. The location is so perfect in mid town, just off Fifth.
The staff is exceptionally helpful and kind. You always get a warm welcome. The rooms are very very lovely, in an old world European type of way( but with terrific bathrooms!).  Elegant and do very comfortable.The food used to be my one complaint , but I duly note it was temarkably good when I was last there, so I suspect their is a new chef in the kitchen . The gym is excellent.  I really have to say it really does not get better in Midtown if that is where you like to stay.

title: Flawless
text:
Four night stay seamlessly turned into a five night stay after Delta Airlines computer went down. The front desk extended our stay, linked the reservations so we stayed in the same room and made things effortless and fast.  For anyone experiencing airline issues, effortless is a prized experience. 

Room was large, beautiful and spotlessly clean with fruit delivered daily. Furnishings, flooring, and fixtures were highly upgraded and appeared newly refurbished. Privacy/Room make up buttons, in addition to standard locks and signs added to the room, as did upgraded lighting controls. A very comfortable  stay. 

Moreover, every single person whom with we interacted showed impeccable service, friendliness, and genuine interest in making our stay the best. Doormen, bell services, front desk, butlers, housekeeping, room service, et al are at the top of their game and obviously well recruited. 

Rates and services are high, as expected with this brand and location, but they do just about everything possible to make you happily pay it. 

Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Nice Location
text:
We had a pleassant stay for 5 days.
Great hotel,clean and comfortable.
Really friendly and proffecional staff!
The location is perfect for shopping and near to central park where you can hunt many pokemons :)

title: Summer vacation
text: It was a nice stay in this hotel in 5th street which is a best place for shopping .. The hotel was nice but they don't have spa .. The food was very good .. What I don't like is the view because it was no view .. The services were so good and very helpful .. It was good for business trip more than vacation ..

title: Disappointed and feeling slightly ripped off.
text: I just spent 2 nights in a room which cost $1500+ a night, for that exorbitant price there are certain expectations, particularly with service which should be impeccable... we found that almost every interaction with the hotel staff was disappointing, from not being helped with luggage to turndown service not happening [and then having a knock on the door at 9pm when we were already in bed...] we didn't receive newspapers in the morning when we saw other rooms all did, we didn't get anything from our butler [the welcome tea service? we didn't even know about it until reading about it on our last day], when we called for our butler on day 2, inexplicably it was a different butler. These all seem like minor complaints but one after the other over an expensive stay it makes you wonder why you are paying so much for a room that is also a bit worn around the edges. I wouldn't spend the money to stay here again. The icing on the cake was our breakfast in the hotel restaurant, as soon as we sat down we were poured fresh orange juice by the waiter which we thought was lovely and assumed was complimentary since we didn't order it and everyone else had it on their tables --we later saw we were charged $30 for it.... I'm not sure that is even legal?! why not just hand out bowls of caviar and add $600 for those too.

title: Very nice hotel
text: We just stayed here for my daughters 18th birthday. I was pleasantly surprised.  We usually stay at the Starwood hotels in nyc but hadnt stayed at the st Regis since they renovated it. It was very nice. Rooms and hallways are renovated and very nice. Beautiful furnishings and linens.  We were limited in room choice which would be my only negative as we needed two double beds and only one regular room met that need. Our room came with a butler which we didn't know. She was pleasant and offered us complimentary coffee upon arrival and in the morning and free pressing of two items of clothes. Other than check in we never saw her again. Hotel was very convenient to shopping, the theater and Central Park.  We were able to walk everywhere and never took a cab. Would definately stay here again!

title: Fabulous!
text: I had the opportunity to luckily stay in the St Regis twice in the past 6 months. The first time everything went smoothly. We had a beautiful room, an upgrade and really felt as though we were so incredibly fortunate to stay in such a special, beautiful, old fashion  hotel. It was beautiful, elegant and so much attention to detail. Both times the concierges were lovely and helpful. However, our 2nd visit, the room wasn't as nice and while the hotel cannot control other guests, there were numerous stains on the antique furniture so it didn't have the same appeal. Also, we were debating whether or not to go to a tried and true breakfast spot or try something new. The hotel recommended and convinced us to go to another diner which was the most touristy, greasy, horrible restaurant. But, again we had a great trip!

title: Amazed again after all
text:
So this is my third time to St. Regis , although I use to go with a big entourage for royalties and enjoy the customer service and care .. 
Now I'm with my fiancée visiting and I met a lobby ambassador ( Samuel) who is only 2 months in this hotel !! He made everything possible and enjoyable more then when I was with the Royalties .. 
Such a personality that makes you love the place ❤️ I am really glad for that moment in the elevator with him ...! 
In my opinion a person with this character should be managing a hotel .... 
Amazing stay with the right moment and right ambassador .... !

title: Hotel excelente e bem localizado
text:
O hotel é muito bonito, desde a recepção até os quartos.
Excelente atendimento e um dos melhores cafés da manhã que já tivemos oportunidade de provar.
A localização também é excelente, bem pertinho do Central Park.
Os funcionários do concierge são muito educados e nos deram ótimas indicações de restaurantes, shows e passeios.
Ótima opção de hotel em NY.

title: WOW
text:
my third visit to NYC but never at St Regis, i can confirm that i will not be staying anywhere else whilst i am in New York, what a wonderful hotel, amazing staff.
beautiful spacious rooms.
i stayed in the 5th avenue suite and it was everything you imagine it to be.
and the location is fantastic, cannot wait to come back.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
Thank you ST Regis for another amazing stay.  My family and I spent 2 nights in a suite.  The service, the valet to the butler was excellent.  I would like to thank Hugo at the front desk for his amazing service. He went above and beyond. 
Also, Nestor the butler was very personable and helpful. My kids loved him. 
The service in the lounge area outside the bar was slow and unfriendly....both times we visited. Those guys need some work.   Everyone else was in the hotel was perfect.

title: Classic style and service
text:
Attention to detail was incredible at one of New York City's finest hotels.

Our suite was beautiful, and despite being worried about traffic noise, we were surprised to have had a very restful night.  

We used travel points to book our room, and were very impressed to have been upgraded to a better room - this is excellent service and excellent recognition that people who travel all the time rarely cash in their points, but when they do ... it leaves a lasting impression and a very much increased likelihood that we will return and also highly recommend.

Well done!

title: Outstanding
text:
We are just back from our stay in New York. I have been many times in New York and also lived there, but never stayed at St Regis. From now it will be hard to stay anywhere else.

Everything was just perfect. We stayed with our two children, and in the warm July weather the hotel was like an oase.

- large and beautiful room
- perfect location 
- family friendly in all ways - our daughters were treated like princesses 
- beautiful decor 
- the people working there are so friendly and the service level for the staff are very high compered to other 5* hotels we have stayed at - both in Europe, Asia, Africa and USA. 
- the butler service is very good and thats not an granted - often the butler service will just be "too much" and not make you feel comfortable. 
- the concierge helped us with everything and had a very fast service
- we celebrated my birthday at the hotel. It was just an ordinary birthday but the extra service this day made me feel like it was a special occasion 

We just want to say thank you to all the staff at St Regis for making our stay perfect : the doorman Jimmy for his very good service and for making my family feel so good during our stay, the front desk, the concierge for making my perfect birthday, the staff at the room service, the butler.... Sorry for not remembering all names. 

All to be recommended for them who wants a good stay in New York.

title: 全てが完璧
text:
あるバンケットのため宿泊となりました。ホテル前で車を降りた瞬間から全てが完璧です。
レセプションから部屋、ボールルームもラウンジも、どこも落ち着いた雰囲気で、安心して滞在を楽しめました。特にスタッフは優秀で、ハウスキーピングも素晴らしいです。
また、買い物にも便利な立地なので時間を有効に使え、タイトなスケジュールの中でセントラルパークでの散歩を可能にしてくれました。
次回は是非プライベートで宿泊したいと思います。

title: How to feel like royalty...
text:
Want to feel special?

Simply check in to the St Regis.

Amazing staff and super courteous. 

Will be back for sure. My girlfriend and I can not wiat to be back there for a second trip.

With kindest regards.

title: An iconic hotel with a perfect location
text:
ST Regis NY - as I write this review I feel like I am writing a love letter. 
The St Regis Hotel is an iconic hotel with a perfect location
The elegance of this hotel never loses it’s exclusive atmosphere
The rooms are spacious with beautiful and elaborate chandeliers. You enter into a foyer area with a spacious closet  The bathroom is all marble with his-and-her sinks. Ours had a soaking tub, separate shower, toilet room. There is a lighted shaving mirror attached to the wall which is always a plus.  There is a television in the main bathroom mirror which personally I don’t understand - it’s exactly where I would prefer looking in the mirror but that is no big deal. 
The main room has plenty of seating including a couch and 2 chairs.
There is also a large desk and chair.
We were glad they moved the TV from the foot of the bed where it used to come up by remote control. Now it is out on a dresser along the wall on a swivel.
The fresh fruit was replenished daily along with free bottled water. Of course, Internet is fast.     You do need to remind housekeeping when you want turn down service. Turning on the request light outside your room was not reliable for us.
The King Cole Bar is worth at least one visit since it is considered legendary. According to legend, it was the first place in the country to serve a Bloody Mary, here called the Red Snapper. You will actually enjoy it enough to warrant the charge of  $25 .The bar is intimate and does also serve some food items. We visited twice and both times it was rather busy but we were lucky enough to get a table. The large mural behind the bar is by Maxfield Parrish supposed to be Old King Cole. The story we were told on our visit was that John Jacob Astor IV requested Mayfield Parrish for the painting although they did not really get along very well. The face of the King is said to be the sour likeness of Astor himself, and his courtiers, suppressing laughter all around him, have just heard him fart. Sadly, Astor drown in the Titanic disaster but this story lives on along with his magnificent St Regis. (Interesting facts about him … He was the richest passenger aboard the Titanic and was thought to be among the richest people in the world at that time, with a net worth of nearly $87 million when he died - he was a great-grandson of the immensely wealthy fur-trader John Jacob Astor)

title: First Class
text: We had the pleasure of staying at the St Regis New York for 2 nights in mid July. The sparkling reviews of this hotel are true. It is located conveniently close to many of the attractions of this great city. The hotel lobby is beautiful. Our check in experience was excellent due to the brilliant service offered by Jose on the front desk. Our room was amazing; very large and well decorated. The St Regis butler service is also unmatched at any other hotel. This is "the" hotel in NYC due to its location, staff and fittings. Do not stay elsewhere or you would be settling for second best.

title: Old world, good location
text:
We had a beautiful room at The St Regis. A living room with a fireplace, new traditional furniture, a comfy bed and pillows and a beautiful newly refurbished bathroom. 
It was a very nice stay, but The St Regis isn't really our style. Once downstairs it felt a little corporate. We will stick to our other favourite.

title: As good as it gets
text: Very very impressive property. This hotels exudes class and its staff are very well trained in dealing with all types of clientele from world leaders to punters like me! Excellent location only 50mtrs from all the great shops on 5th Ave and walking distance to Central Park, Broadway and Times Sq. Rooms are classic design with loads of space. Did not eat on site but had a drink in King Cole which is classic NYC bar.  Well worth the visit if you are in town and they even offer a Bentleigh chauffeur drive to a radius of 10 blocks complimentary - my wife did enjoy being dropped off at Macys in a Bentleigh!!!

title: Always magnificent
text:
To spend a few days away from home ends always in a perfect experience when we stay a the St Regis.
With a privileged location, The St Regis New York is simply the perfect place to stay in the city. 
Friendly staff, excellent services and a great restaurant. 
The High Tea Service is as traditional and wonderful as any other good one in London.
We were upgraded to a suite and that gesture allowed us to meet family member and friends in our room instead of the lobby.
This old fashion St Regis is a true landmark of comfort in the heart of one of the most interesting cities of the world.

title: Great service/tiny rooms
text: The St Regis is located in a prime spot close to 5th Avenue. Love the location!! Love the  butler service.... But the rooms are incredibly tiny. Nice bar area,  I recommend going over to the Peninsula and checking out the rooftop bar there. It's fantastic!

title: The Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed In NYC!
text:
In the words of Shirley Bassey: "Where do I begin?" Jajaja. 

Well the rooms are sumptuous and big! Especially by NYC standards and compared to hotels of the same category. The service is amazing; you feel pampered all throughout your stay. 
The food unfortunately is not up to the standard of the hotel. This doesn't mean it's bad at all, yet nothing spectacular. 
And last but not least the best part is that it has the best location!

title: Fathers Day Weekend
text: Just an amazing place. You are treated like a king all the time. This place has ruined me for all other hotels. I am going again this weekend and cannot wait. Maria Christine Duhon and Liubov were amazing. They took care of everything and made sure my wife and I were happy. I highly recommend the St Regis.

title: Gran hotel y localizacion
text: El hotel fisicamente es muy NY lo que esperas antiguo elegante fino.. Decorado  conservador con las comodidades modernas.. Y ademas el  precio es justo no abusan con sus ínfulas de otros que dan igual o menos pero  caro.   Las personas sin educadas y amables y la comida si es cara  pero bien presentada... Sabanas y camas deliciosas... Sin duda me fasino.. Me quedare mas dias!!!

title: Very nice hotel in Midtown
text: I very much enjoyed my stay at the St. Regis.  I stayed for three nights using SPG points and was treated by each staff member as though I was paying premium dollar.  The rooms are beautifully decorated and the hotel has held up very well.  The lobby space is small, but everyone is helpful and attentive.  The best part of my trip was the concierge staff.  McKinley and the other concierges were incredibly helpful, patient, and all of their suggestions were just perfect.  They were also able to get me into great restaurants at the last minute.  The only "negative" I would say is that the closets are very small in the rooms.  Otherwise, it was a great stay and I would definitely return.

title: A first class experience.
text:
Le St.-Régis est incroyable. What a gorgeous hotel and what an upscale experience you will live by staying there. 
It was a dream come true. And if it wasn't enough, I bumped into Kate Mara in the elevator. I tried to act cool but totally failed. 
The rooms are perfect. The staff is perfect. Every square inch is clean and every detail was taken care of. I was lucky enough to have dinner in La Salle de Bal. It was fantastic. Thank you to the FPA for everything

title: Once again a gold standard experience
text: As usual, the St Regis brand exceeds expectations.  We could not have been happier. We stayed here in June for my birthday. A delicious cake was waiting on arrival, and we were upgraded to a truly outstanding room. Bed was typically amazing, as were bathroom facilities and lounge area along with fresh fruit, chocolates and a delicious breakfast. The Bentley service was wonderful -- ferried us in style to our dinner at Daniel. The staff were friendly, courteous and attentive, from doormen, desk staff, concierge to room service staff. Excellent service and food at the King Cole bar. Location can't be beat -- we forayed out to the park, museums, galleries and to shop and could pop back to rest/drop things off at our hotel oasis between events. Can recommend to anyone. We'll be back!

title: Excellent Excellent Excellent
text: As you can see from my heading everything about this hotel stay was excellent! The staff was great and accommodating, our suite was beautiful and spacious, and our butler Tamara was outstanding.  I strongly recommend this hotel. I am looking forward to coming back.

title: “超級友善的服務”
text: 假日帶家人小歇片刻, 酒店相當優雅寧靜, 接待團隊和前台服務太出色了, 服務也很貼心, 熱情且十分細緻, 感受特別深, 再一次感謝, 太值得推薦了.

title: One of the Finest Hotels in the St. Regis Family
text: I have had the privilege of staying at several St. Regis hotels all around the world, but the St. Regis hotel in Manhattan is one of the finest.  The service (particularly the butler service) is superb, the on-site restaurant is excellent, the decor is elegant, and the location is perfect.  The on-site hair salon is worth a special trip to New York.  This hotel is, without question, my favorite place to stay in New York.

title: As impressive as always
text:
The St. Regis continues to impress. We recently stayed there for my wife's birthday. We hadn't been there in a couple of months and it was as if we'd never left. We were greeted by name when we arrived and felt as if we lived at the hotel. The gentlemen at the valet and the bellmen take great pride in what they do. Also, Christina at the front desk did an amazing job making all of the room arrangements. She acknowledged our SPG Platinum status and promptly upgraded our room. She has checked us in before and her professionalism is unmatched. She welcomed us to the hotel, asked about our children, who were not with us this time, and guided us to our room. This type of personal service is uncommon today and it is very much appreciated by me and my family. This is why the St. Regis is our only choice in New York City. 

Once again, great job St. Regis you make us never want to leave.

title: Simply the best!
text: Fantastic location. History. Beauty. Pampered. This is my favorite hotel in New York. Yes, The Penninsula and Baccarrat are great, but the St. Regis is the first among equals.  Love this place. Some really fantastic restaurants are within walking distance in close proximity.

title: Worth using all our SPG Points
text: A trip without our kids meant we were going to splurge on the hotel. After a couple of hiccups with checking in - the hotel was really lovely. The decor felt luxurious, the bed was super comfortable. I loved that there was a TV in every room, and you could just relax. I would stay here again, for sure.

title: The St. Regis is Someting Special
text: Everyone will agree it is easy to be spoiled when you travel whether it is a great meal, amazing shopping or a truly fine hotel.  IMHO the St. Regis group sets the standard for hotels in personal relationships.  We returned to the New York hotel and were once again treated like royalty.  We were upgraded to a beautiful suite that meets my standard for ultimate luxury at a hotel stay...2 bathrooms with showers.  Hugo, at the front desk expeditiously got us into our room as we had just had a harrowing car ride from Conneticut and were late for dinner reservations.  Because it was a celebration for my wife's birthday, he managed to get us into a suite and gave us a couple of cards for  a free drink in the bar.  He was beyond nice and we were most appreciative.  There are many, many expensive fine hotels in New York city but none are more gorgeous and accomodating than the St. Regis.  Like I said, easy to get spoiled.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Fabulous Staff
text: We have stayed at other St Regis hotels and their NYC location did not disappoint us.  The hotel has recently been renovated and both the public and guest rooms are beautiful and elegant.  The beds are so comfortable and the comforters are luxurious, in fact I plan to find out where I can get a comforter for my house.  The King Cole Bar is dark and cozy and the drinks are generous.  We had breakfast there only once during our five night stay.  It was good but expensive.  The staff is friendly and very helpful.  I can't wait to go back the next time I am in NYC.

title: Service service service
text:
Despite the beatiful location, extremely well maintened hotel and most impress a guest is Service. Eventually they are kind enough to ask their private limo to take you to your favorite restaurant.
Upon arrival the reception desk is always very helpufull.
Butler is the best they can offer. Whatever you need you can call your buttler.
Coffee,  newspaper, room service is always at your disposal.
Rooms are nicely decorated, old world style. And the bathrooms are breathtaking

title: Outstanding service and product
text: Just returned from 2 lovely days at the St Regis New York. One of my two favorite hotel brands. Beautiful property. Lavish furnishings. Service impeccable. The onsite bar is the King Cole. Beautiful Maxfield Parrish mural behind bar. Told it is about to be enclosed in plexiglass glad we saw it before that happens.

title: Exemplifies Luxury
text: I always try and stay at the St. Regis when I visit NYC. The rooms are large, location great and the service is impeccable. Once again, the hotel met and exceeded my expectations. The room was magnificent. Every single person at the St Regis, from front desk, Concierge, butlers, housekeeping staff, food service, bar service -- all were friendly, accommodating and welcoming. From handling bags, opening doors, providing information, suggestions for eateries, sights etc. -- a glorious experience and one that keeps bringing us back! Everyone made me feel comfortable. Overall, the great getaway.

title: Smokers in the next room to us
text:
We spent three nights at the hotel to celebrate my partner's birthday. Overall this stay was nice, but things could have been a lot better. The staff tried very hard to make the guests happy but for many reasons this did not measure up to our Four Seasons/Peninsula Hotel experiences.  

Overall, check in wasn't that great an experience.  Our room location preferences our travel agent had previously sent to the hotel were not received.  We asked for a higher floor away from the elevator.  They had us booked into the lowest floor. After some discussion that was verging on stressful, we did get a lovely room and a substantial upgrade. We would have been happier with our original category, in a quiet location, and a lot less hassle.   

Check in was right at 4 p.m. and not any sooner, which was tiring after a day of travel. And there is no place to wait for the room in the hotel except two small chairs weirdly positioned in the small lobby area. For that reason, the lobby isn't inviting and we feel this is a big detriment to the hotel. We sat in the cafe area for about an hour, and not one staff member came to ask if we wanted drinks or service. 

Astor Court breakfasts/lunches were not very good. Incorrect eggs, warm breakfast smoothies, day old muffins, overcooked shrimp salad for $40.00.  I don't mind spending money if you get quality, but this felt like the opposite of that. The service was great and personable, and the staff mostly handled the very small dining area well.  Astor court is too small to accommodate many breakfast guests and most mornings we had a bit of a wait, but since we were on vacation we weren't too worried by it.  

The room was really lovely with two washrooms, and a nice upgrade from our original category of room we had reserved. The room had super comfortable bed/linens, lovely towels, etc. No recognition of my partner's birthday, which was surprising given we had mentioned it during our reservation and check in.  My birthday the previous month we spent at a hotel a third the price and they recognized it with several things including a bottle of champagne. What turned out to be a curse for this room upgrade was two things: 1) there was a smoker in the room next to us 2) the service elevator for the hotel staff was directly across the hall. 

The service elevator noise was present 24/7 and was always a little constant rumbling noise in the background that was irritating to say the least.  The smoking neighbor was really unpleasant.  The first night the smoke started to pour into our room at around 11 p.m. Fortunately the guests checked out the next afternoon, however, in my opinion, the hotel staff, including the general manager, truly take a "this isn't our fault" approach to the smoking situation.  I disagree on that point.  They could remind people upon check in of the penalties for smoking, and when someone calls and complains they can investigate and ask the people to stop.  They were reluctant to bother the smokers late at night, and instead put an air purifier outside our room.  Since the smoke was coming from the bathroom vent area, this didn't really do much.  In the morning we moved the purifier into our room and it helped.  By the end of the day the smell was almost completely gone, and then the next morning the housekeeping staff sprayed the most toxic smelling room deodorizer which took another day to dissipate. You can’t open the windows and the room is carpeted.  For someone with asthma or allergies, I wouldn't recommend this hotel.  The smoke smell was noticed in the hallways throughout our stay, fortunately coming from other areas on our floor.  To give them acknowledgment, they did give us a credit for a half night’s stay. But, I think they generally take a light approach to smokers, and I’m sure I will be contradicted by the hotel staff in their reply to my review but this was our experience. 

To summarize, great staff, lovely rooms. Smoking policy is weak at best, and Astor court is busy and below average food experience.  Would we return? Probably not.  Our travel agent convinced us of this hotel explaining they had a good relationship with this location. Considering no recognition of birthday or room preferences, we will try another hotel for our next visit to NYC.

title: Ok...here we go again..... :)
text:
Ok,,,i have reviewed this place before... It is still the same 'Exceptional".
 I was there to celebrate my Anniv with my Fiancee. As always i reached out to Joseph Boctor and he reached out to Jose Fernandez and together they arranged an amazing suite that my fiancee flipped over. I have lifetime Platinum status with SPG so i generally get a nice upgrade but they outdid themselves this time.....Service is as always stellar ..Butlers were on their "A" game... front desk was quick and efficient like a well oiled machine (seriously).. Concierge has NEVER ever let me down in over 10yrs....but i am trying still to trip them up...ok,,,cant say any more than i have said in any of my other reviews over the years about this place... to this day still and always will be my FAVORITE SPG property in the world.  Thanks again to all of you.... and as always Happy Travels   Michael

p.s. yes i know a very short review by my usual standards but i honestly cannot think of anything else good to say that i haven't said 100x's ...anything more and i will look like i am shilling which everyone knows by now i don't ever do.... this place is TOP NOTCH.

title: I Want to Live There
text: OMG what an incredible hotel. The accommodations are beautiful. Luxury at its best. We were celebrating our 50th Wedding Anniversary. It was my dream to stay at the St. Regis. The service was incredible! The Butlers were always kind, considerate and helpful. For instance, I forgot my hair curling iron. So on a lark I called the butler to see if the hotel just might have one. They did but we're in use. So they went out and bought me one, no charge. The room service was quick and food kept warm. We got tons of fruit and bottled water. On our first day we also got a very expensive bottle of champagne, which we kept for a few days to share with our best friends who were coming into the city to go out to dinner with us. They upgraded us to a larger suite when I told them I was unhappy with our view on the 19th floor overlooking air conditioning units on ugly roof tops. They moved us to another suite with a more pleasant view. The costs are comparable to the Ritz or the Plaza but the service is over the top. Oh we also were driven to our dinners reservation in The Bentley!!!

title: The Standard for Excellence in Every Respect
text:
Just finished a four night stay at the St. Regis and it exceeded our expectations in every way.  First, I have to take exception to the L.A. reviewer who found the furnishings less than superb.  At what hotel were you staying?  Certainly not the St. Regis because physically, the hotel is unparalleled and old word class and charm never go out of style.

But the best part of the St. Regis experience are the people who work there.  Everyone from the doorman to reception to the butlers have a genuine devotion to providing the highest quality service.  I can smell attitude and phoniness from a mile away and these people were warm, helpful and friendly.  Special recognition goes to Israel and Tamara. 

Oh, did I mention that we were using Starwood points for this visit?  You wouldn't know by our treatment that we were not paying cash.  Next time we will be paying guests and I can bet that our experience will be the same.  I've had the pleasure of staying at some great hotels like the original Mandarin in Hong Kong and the Danieli in Venice and the St. Regis ranks right up there at the top.

title: Going beyond our expectations
text: Our stay was less then 24 hours but it left us wishing for more. The front desk was incredibly accommodating and professional. Our butler Israel saved the day by helping us quickly get a stain removed from my husbands sweater before an international trip. Thank you Israel! Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and can't wait for our next visit to the St. Regis.

title: Father's Day Weekend
text:
Father's Day weekend was superb thanks to the staff at the St. Regis NYC. We had two rooms...one or us and another for our son, wife, and our grandson. From the moment we arrived, it was a perfect weekend. The rooms were luxury at its best and the bedding was luxurious. The service was perfect....doorman, bellman, maids, the butler, the room service staff. 
We babysat our grandson Saturday night and had room service for dinner. The food was great. Sunday morning we all got together in our suite for Father's Day breakfast. Not only was it delivered exactly on time, but each request was handled to perfection. Awesome hotel and staff= wonderful experience!! It's our home away from home.

title: A super warm welcome
text: The service at the St. Regis New York is unparalleled. Every employee we encountered was so knowledgeable and helpful. A special shout out to Hugo who made my 8 year old daughter feel super welcome. All of the concierge know the best restaurants and tours.

title: Service for a King and a Queen
text: My wife and myself came to the St. Regis right after our wedding night. I was really looking forward to taking my bride there as she always loved the beauty of the hotel and I was crossing my fingers that it would live up to her expectations. From the moment we got there, we were greated by very bell-service and the front desk was a delight and couldn't stop congradulating us on our very recent marriage. It was great! But the best was yet to come, we were told that we were being super upgraded, and got to a massive corner suite with a master bedroom and a living room fit with two massive closets and two massive bathrooms which were completely in marble. The design of the bedroom and the living room were classic with tall ceilings and beautiful sconces, molding, and crystal chandeliers but still all had the modern touches. We were met in the suite by a lovely bottle of champagne waiting on ice and a personalized and hand-written letter from the manager of the hotel, Octavia Marginean. From the second we checked-in to when we unfortunatetly checked-out, we had outstanding service and miss being there. Everyone who we met, including Hugo Hidalgo at the front desk, and the management staff who was always pleasant and happy to help, made for an excellent experience. I highly recommend staying at the St. Regis for any NY trip!

title: Breakfast Meeting
text:
Always an unparalleled experience with white glove service and extensive culinary choices for breakfast!  Ask for Caesar who delivers outstanding service with a wonderful smile!
I highly recommend the fresh squeezed juices and the Manhattan breakfast!

title: Outstanding service but needs a serious refresh
text: The service level of the staff is outstanding on all levels. But this hotel is like going to my great grandmother's house as if it had never been updated. The hotel is elegant but in a very old world way. Also, much of the furniture and decor hasn't been updated forever. I guess it all depends on your tastes as to whether this hotel is for you or not.

title: Elegant
text: The St Regis is a lovely and elegant hotel is NYC. All your needs are looked after, the rooms are spotless and beautiful and the service is exceptional. We did find that, because our room had an adjoining door we could hear our neighbours loud arguments quite clearly, unfortunately late into the evening.

title: Quiet Elegance
text:
When you think of Manhattan you imagine wealth and high end. The St Regis is all that.
We were fortunate enough to stay and be upgraded to their Master Suite (pays to be
a gold Starwood member). Beautiful crowne moldings, upscale marble baths and sumptuous bedding is what you should expect. A lovely fruit plate and chocolates greet you in your suite. Ring your butler for a complimentary French pressed coffee in the morning. The shower with its gold plated faucets and shower head are the best. A TV in your bathroom mirror? Of course. Enjoy!
We certainly did.

title: Home of the Bloody Mary!
text: This is, in my opinion, the finest hotel in NYC.  Butler service, romantic and a great place to spend an anniversary year with your significant other.  You can even pop out the front door and over to Tiffany to commemorate the occasion (I did it and will never regret it).  Beautiful rooms, service and location!

title: A Luxury Hotel in NYC
text:
No question about it - the St Regis is right up there as one of the best hotels in NYC. Nestled between 54th and 55th Streets and 5th and 6th Avenues, the St Regis is probably located in the prime spot for shopping in midtown New York City. Rooms are opulent and spotlessly clean, staff are polite, welcoming and attentive. The bar is somewhat small for a hotel of this size, but there are tables with waiter service. The bar offers a reasonable menu of light meals. My group had a sampling of different foods, and all were very well prepared and reasonably priced. I also ate breakfast at the St Regis, which was a bit chaotic I must say and service was not particularly impressive, owing to the fact the restaurant was packed. In fact, I had a hard time finding a table and had to wait a good 15 minutes before I was seated. It seems the St Regis is a good breakfast place for local business people. My advice is to book a table the night before. I organized a business meeting at the hotel and was afforded every kind of help, especially with the technical set-up. For the meeting, we ordered hors d'oeuvres and an open bar, all of which were managed, operated and served with exceptional professionalism.  (I had forgotten my Apple adapter, and the staff found one for me to borrow.) 
If you are looking for sheer luxury from a hotel and staff that really understands what that means, then the St Regis is for you. Highly recommended.

title: An Hotel of Merit
text: This is simply the best of the New York City hotels. We enjoyed our recent stay immensely, and will return at the next opportunity. We were given a double room upgrade into an incredibly spacious two room suite with 1 ½ baths, and greeted by our butler with a platter of the most delicious chocolate covered strawberries. Beds are incredibly comfortable, rooms immaculately clean and service personal and gentle. The restaurant breakfasts are innovative and delicious and the evening bar scene was exciting without being intimidating. It could not have been more accommodating!

title: The ONLY address you will ever need in Midtown Manhattan! Wish I could give it 6 stars!
text:
My wife and I recently returned from a week-long trip to NYC to celebrate our 2nd wedding anniversary and "babymoon" and were so fortunate to be able to call The St. Regis New York our "home away from home." This property is a true gem in the heart of the concrete jungle of Manhattan and offers unpretentious luxury and refinement in a boutique setting. The service was beyond amazing and all started with email correspondence from the extraordinarily personable and engaging Molly Deutscher, Rooms Control Manager, who was relentless in her genuine desire to make our stay a memorable one. As this would likely be our last vacation before our son arrives, Molly understood the importance of her team delivering a WOW experience for us, a boy did they ever! Molly found the perfect suite for us on the 18th floor with amazing views of 5th Avenue from the living room, and the serenity of an interior-facing bedroom. It was so incredibly quiet at times that we had to remind ourselves we were staying in the middle of Manhattan! Our butlers and housekeepers made sure we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay and we could not have asked for more perfect accommodations. The bed was so inviting and enveloping that we found ourselves sleeping-in late every morning (the automated drapes and black-out shades help keep the room very dark). The gorgeous marble bathroom had every amenity one could ever wish for from the magnifying shaving mirror to a TV in the vanity mirror, and even a radiant heat floor!    

Molly and the entire St. Regis team did a spectacular job making us feel like family and with every personal encounter, we were left more and more impressed by how passionate they were to serve their guests. I would also like to recognize a few other staff members for their concerted efforts to make our stay so memorable.  It starts with the very affable doormen who were the first to greet us when we arrived - they were always helpful with directions and procuring transportation. Speaking of transportation, the house Bentley was readily available and provided on-demand transportation within 10 blocks of the hotel (Mo and Michael, the drivers, were very nice guys to get to know). Gus, the gentleman at the front desk who checked us in, took the time to get to know us while we were waiting for our room. After learning we were there to celebrate an anniversary and babymoon, he showed us pictures of his young son and offered some great advice to this soon-to-be first-time Dad. For the remainder of our stay, Gus would always engage us by name and was quick to ask if we needed anything. These personalized touches made us feel like we were the only guests in the entire hotel! We also appreciated the staff members (like Alexandre) who would engage guests as they stepped out of the elevator or re-entered the hotel. This ensured you never had to wait in-line to have a question answered or make a service request - the entire team was always happy to oblige.  

Shelomie, another member of the front desk staff came to my wife's rescue one late-night. At around 3AM, my wife was suffering from pregnancy-induced heartburn and could not sleep. She was in search of milk to help counter her discomfort and went down to the front desk hoping to be pointed to the nearest Duane Reade 24-hour pharmacy/convenience store. As soon as Shelomie saw the baby bump, she told my wife to have a seat and she personally went to the restaurant kitchen and brought my wife a tall glass of cold milk - this is just one of many examples of the remarkable staff of The St. Regis going above and beyond to take care of their guests.

To commemorate our anniversary, Molly and her team at The St. Regis surprised my wife with chocolate-covered strawberries and a rose pedal turndown service that covered the bed and extended to the large jacuzzi tub - again, these are just the small gestures that made this stay so memorable for us, and will definitely have us returning!

I obviously cannot say enough about The St. Regis New York - their culture of service is clearly evident and they most certainly set the bar for other high-end properties in NYC. Kudos to the team for delivering exemplary service and having us feel like our permanent address was 2 East 55th Street...sadly, it is not our address, though we look forward to returning soon!

title: Nueva York con estilo
text: Muy buen hotel en una zona estupenda. La decoracion, las habitaciones, el servici, todo sin mancha. Eramos una familia de 6 personas y nunca pudimos desayunar en el restaurante "oficial" pues es muy pequeño y nunca habia mesas libres y aunque las hubiera habido, no habrian tenido una mesa tan grande. No me parece correcto que un hotel de ese precio y categoria no pueda atender grupos no tan numerosos, por eso no le doy los 5 puntos.

title: The very best NYC has to offer. Classic Luxury.
text:
I have stayed at the St Regis twice now and every time I stay there, I never want to leave. I have been lucky enough to stay in one of their 2 bedroom apartments both times and the rooms are fantastic. Over 1200 sq ft of prime Manhattan apartment in one of the most glamorous and luxurious hotels in the world. 

With the hotel's own Bentley Mulsanne at your disposal, you'll always turn up to your destination in style. 

Located on the corner of 55th & 5th, the location is unbeatable if you want to be mid-town. Walking distance to every major store you can think of and of course central park.

A cheap hotel it is not.... worth every penny? Yes!

title: Expensive and worth it
text: Steeped in New York history with a harpist accompanying afternoon tea, this centrally located hotel is a great respite from city bustle. The King Cole bar is always busy and boasts fabulous cocktails, enjoy the enormous Maxfield Parish behind the bar.

title: Regal
text: What could be better then a spring wedding at the St. Regis? Everything here is exceptional - from the service to the Bentley to the food. The wedding was stunning - stellar food, decor, flowers and music.  I could expound on the hors d'oeuvres for hours as the lamb was pure perfection and the raw bar was amazing. The entire wedding was magnificent. The brunch the next morning in The Vault was top notch as well. The pictures are of the brunch.

title: 5+ star stay
text: Everything about our recent stay at the st Regis was amazing. The room, our fabulous butlers, the French pressed coffee and the amazing King Cole bar and bartenders. Even the newer gym was one of the best we've seen in NYC. And the service of everyone who works there was impeccable.  Recommend highly to all.

title: A+ in all respects
text:
I stayed here for a few nights recently.  The hotel is located a on 5th avenue a few short blocks from the park.  The hotel is superb in all respects - room, service, conference facilities, bar, restaurant, gym.  

I recommend and would stay here again.

title: Great Service and Amazing Location
text: The hotel is really nice, with very comfortable beds and great staff, who are super helpful ! The location is really near central park, and close to shops and great food ! We had a suite and a connecting room, which was very convenient and ample space for all our stuff for 6 day stay ! Its really a great place to stay in new york ! The only problem we had was the shower mixer broke down on the second last night, and we didn't have cold water to shower and it could only be fixed in the day.

title: Enjoyable experiece
text: The property was nice and the service was excellent.  The butler service was great.  It's nice to arrive and be offered fresh fruit, tea and other snacks.  The concierge was helpful.  He directed us to an understated French Restaurant for a late meal.  We enjoyed the stay.

title: High expectations, delivered
text: This hotel is top notch, as expected. Rarely does reality meet expectations, but this one exceeded. The concierge staff particularly Winston McKinley and Jon, are exemplary stewards of their craft. Helpful, unobtrusive, anticipate every need. Know the city. The rooms are great, can't ask for more. Worth it. Enjoy.

title: delicious snack before the evening play
text:
I stayed at Ritz-Carlton Hotel during my last visit.
However, St. Regis is located right on the 5th avenue where I dropped by twice.

Once  for a afternoon tea at Astor Court,  after a long busy day.  Varieties of  sandwiches and scones were nicely served, just like they do at Ritz, London,   I skipped dinner on that evening.

The next evening I dropped by to have light snack before evening play. The club sandwich was a simple menu but the most delicious I have had. The over all service is excellent.

I would definitely stay at this hotel if it situated near the Central Park, like Ritz-Carlton.

title: Great New York Location
text:
We stayed at the St. Regis for two nights.  The location could not be better on Fifth Avenue in mid town New York.  The room we had was newly refurbished with all the state of the art electronics and tastefully decorated  - only we had such a tiny and hidden window that you had to look for it when you entered the room. We had to keep the window closed as when we opened it in the middle of the night the noise was deafening from the huge a/c machinery at the side of the hotel. The best part was the bathroom - which was well planned out and even had a TV hidden behind the bathroom mirror.
We found the hotel lobby quite antiquated and too small.  There is hardly any seating area if you need to wait for some one.  The breakfasts were okay - service needs to be improved.  Overall a nice stay but VERY expensive.

title: Beautiful experience
text: We enjoyed our lunch at the St. Regis.  From the service to the food and drink, everything was impeccable.  The setting is classic and polished, comfortable and beautiful.  It was our first time at the St. Regis and we will return.  Highly recommended.

title: Dreams come true
text:
If you have extra money and want to be pamper this is the place. Great employees, even a butler for help unload the luggage. A classic, old school hotel. 
Great location, in the best part of Manhattan.

title: A good stay spoiled.
text:
I love St. Regis hotels. They do everything right from service to beautiful accommodations. And the locations, this on in particular, are perfectly situated, whether it be close to a big city's many attractions or on a gorgeous beach in a foreign land.
   That said, I had a bad experience when I stayed there for two nights recently. I wasn't lucky enough to get an upgrade through my SPG gold status so I was placed on a lower floor with a room with no view. No biggie, since I was in Manhattan and had no delusions that I'd be doing much of anything in room except sleeping and showering. But, unfortunately for me and almost everyone else on our floor, there was a serious smoking problem. The whole hallway reeked and it was even worse in my room since the smoke was going right from the hallway returns to the register in my room. It literally felt like I was rooming in a NYC bar circa 1930's. The smell was awful, and I'll give the staff credit for doing there best by putting an air filter in the hallway, but it was pointless. 
   So, I guess if you luck out with a great room on a floor where there isn't any smoking 3 packs a day in their rooms, this is a great hotel. I wasn't lucky, and wished I had chosen another hotel, so I can't really give the experience any more than 3 stars.

title: 立地＆部屋　最高！！
text:
女子２人で　５日間滞在でした。
　お部屋は、２人がスーツケースを広げても　くつろいでも～
必ず広い空間があります。（クローゼットも広い）（天井も高い）
　一日一回は　バトラーさんに『コーヒー』を持ってきていただき（チップは必須）
靴を磨いてもらったりしました。
さすがに荷物の荷ほどき＆パッキングは遠慮しましたが、　
試してみても良かったかなと思います。
　シャワーブースあり＆湯船は足を延ばせて深さも　湯の温度、タイミング最高。
洗面台も２つ並んで　女性２人が快適に過ごせる造りになっています。
　朝は　歩いて３分で＜セントラルパーク　への散歩。
向いには　ペニンシュラホテル。近所にはプラザホテル。リッツカールトン。
　ですので、ウォーキング兼ねて　朝食は代わる代わる他のホテルにも行けます。
あらゆる＜良いホテル＞今まで　お世話になりましたが　ダントツの私の中の
ナンバーワンです。
　また　セントレジスに帰りたい。そう思える素晴らしいホテルでした。

title: Good location historical hotel
text:
Stayed St.Regis New York one night.

First if you haven't stay any SPG hotel in Manhattan.
You should better not expect same St.Regis standard as Asian region.

Room is old but well maintained.

In New York most of hotel does not provide teeth brush so should better bring own one.

For Breakfast SPG member need to use welcome amenity, they provide American breakfast from the menu.
If you don't like breakfast like egg bacon potato,
Should better accept 500point.

title: Great every time
text: I've been taking my wife here for her birthday for the past 5 years. We stay either 5 or 6 days. Great location, great service. The desk staff are always helpful. Usually we get to take the Bentley for a ride to the Frick or another museum. That's a special treat for me. Last year they put us in a temporary room so we could take a nap until our reserved room was ready, then they upgraded us to a suite which was OMG. I couldn't believe how nice they were. We start every morning with the butler service coffee and something my wife packs for us. We are already looking forward to our stay in December 2016 and we just got tickets to The Comet to complement our stay. Oh, I forgot to mention it's an easy walk to Broadway and 5th Avenue shopping. I tried booking for December 2017 but it's still too early but I will book as soon as they let me.

title: Great hotel
text: Regal and in a great location- you can't go wrong at the St Regis. Service is top notch- clean, regal - anything you want they will make happen. I like staying here for business as its close to Madison Ave and upper east side. And personally a morning jog thru Central Park is a great start to any day in the city.

title: Hotel di gran classe
text:
Storico hotel di NY, una vera e propria istituzione. 
Albertoni gran classe con attenzioni degne del livello/categoria.
Super: camere, reception è concierge. 
Top: il bar sia per aperitivi, sia dopo cena
Da rivedere: servizio facchinaggio non efficientissimo, benché molto cordiale e servizio colazione lento. Per altro la sala colazioni ha spazi misurati che talvolta non sono sufficienti per servire tutti i clienti dell'hotel, costringendo alcuni ospiti a fare colazione sugli sgabelli della zona bar (questo onestamente può essere scocciante).

title: Soft spot for the St. Regis NYC
text: This is my third year staying at the St. Regis NYC and I come back because the St. Regis staff are the best.  At the end of the day it's the people that set this hotel apart from its competition.  Everyone from the doorman, to Robert the concierge, to Mohamed in the Astor Court, who remembered me from my last two stays exceeded my expectations.  They made me feel like a valued Platinum SPG member.  For a memorable stay in a memorable city it has to be the St. Regis NYC.

title: Terrible unprofessional
text:
Terrible service at the king cole!!
Arrogant service....ordered sliders....gave me open/used ketchup .....even mustard had been used before....mgr would not give me his name.....gave me generic card!
When I asked about giving me spg points.....,would not look up my acct....what a waist of money for lousy service....if u like 2nd hand service.  This is the place...,bad.  Bad.  Bad!!!!
Never will I go to this Starwood flagship!!!

title: Tea Time!
text:
This is my favorite place in New York for High Tea! Its splendid! Its fancy, There's a harp playing, the room is glorious, and you nibble on tea sandwiches, and scones, and delicious sweets. You can have champagne with your tea. Its a divas dream! 
The hotel is just beautiful. You can go shopping for the afternoon, and stop here and really feel quite fancy! Go ahead.. Spoil yourself a little!

title: Nice
text: St Regis are always very nice. Clean, good service, nice rooms. I have to say this is the one of the least favorite St Regis' I have stayed in only b/c it is an older hotel and the room to expand the hotel is not possible. The room is not old. Had to be re-done in the last 3 years. Top notch quality. Great location.

title: Simply superb
text:
Being an SPG Platinum member, this hotel is the highest rating among Starwood hotels in NYC, so we were so looking forward to stay at this hotel after reading marvellous reviews from fellow SPG Platinum members.

We apply for the suite nigth award, which was cleared 5 days prior to check in, which increase our excitement!

We were staying at the Andaz 5th Ave the night before so we called in mid morning (on the 18th April) to ask what time our room will be available. Our call was answered by a gentleman from the front desk (if I remember it correctly, his name is Alexander)
He mentioned that the suite guests were not checked out yet, so he cannot advise what time exactly it'd be available and cannot let me know what type of suites we will be in.
We requested a nice suite over the phone and he assured us it will be taken care of.

Upon check in around 3pm, this gentleman was not at the front office. Instead, we were greeted by a pretty Korean lady, Sarah who informed us that we have been upgraded to a very nice suite. Ilona, the guest service supervisor was also present and provided my baby girl with a little teddy bear and St. Regis onesie.
She then escorted us to our floor and introduced us to our butler, Irmice.

From then on, the service is pretty much the same high standard.
Everyone we encounter with at the hotel provided outstanding services making everything just so memorable, from the Door Men (Matt and his colleagues) and porters, to the Bentley house car driver - top notch services!

We had to go to Boston the next day but came back to New York and the St. Regis the following week (we originally booked the Park Hyatt but my husband and I decided to cancel PH, as we have to stay at St. Regis again!!)

Ilona made sure that our return reservations were looked after even better. This time around, the suite is a tad smaller but has a super nice feature window seating area, where my baby girl can play at. Still a very very nice suite!

Thank you so much once again for everything, St. Regis NY. 
Will definitely stay here again when we visit NY in the next year or so.

title: Nostalgic Hotel
text: My husband and I spent the weekend at The St. Regis New York. We loved the beauty and nostalgia of the hotel, and felt like royalty while staying there. We also felt a little out of place there. If you enjoy the finest that money has to offer, then this is your place! It was a little over the top for our tastes. :-)

title: Wedding day at St Regis!
text:
I booked 2 nights at St Regis. 
One night before my wedding and stayed another night after the ceremony. 
St Regis staff was amazing!!
First they upgraded us 2 steps up and gave us the grand deluxe room. 
At the morning we got ready to go to our wedding ceremony in Central Park and they provided us the Bentley car service. 
On our wedding night we got complimentary champagne and not only that... They invited us to attend complimentary afternoon tea for two that was amazingly delicious!
St Regis staff helped to make our most special day a day to remember and cherish. 
Thank you St Regis staff, keep up the good work!!

title: Our Favorite Place!
text:
We had stayed here about 8 years ago and could not wait to get back!  We took the redeye in and arrived around 10am and we pleased when they informed us our room was ready.  The room was great and they had a crib in the room for our 1 year old and a sofa our 5 year old could sleep on.

The property is located just a few blocks from Central Park and some of the best shopping in the world!  

The staff always goes above and beyond.  The only issues we encountered during our 4 night stay was the breakfast seems to be a little understaffed and would take a little longer than we would like.  Additionally it was a little rough using getting around with a stroller but not the end of the world.  

We will definitely be back soon!  This is the only place we will stay when visiting NYC!

title: 34th Wedding Anniversary
text: One of the nicest Hotel I've ever stayed in, The experience was a beautiful one, Above all the entire staff were very friendly and helpful as well as making our 34th Anniversary a memorable one, Thank You guys, from Door men, Front Desk, Butler services, maid service, etc. it was a pleasure meeting all of you.. Thank you we have to come back, also being in the heart of NYC was excellent..

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
We have been staying in this outstanding hotel for years. Nothing compares. The service, rooms, location and of course the King Cole Bar and Astor Court are all fabulous. The spa is great as well. We will be back this Summer! 
Our room was lovely, room service was wonderful and the hotel is very quiet! Service can't be beat. The door man could not do enough to get us a private car every time we went out in the evening. During the day everyone was helpful. 
The weather was very cold and rainy so we spent quite a bit of time in King Cole Bar. George was wonderful. We enjoyed two lunches there while we waited for the freezing rain to stop. 
I can't thank everyone in the hotel enough for making our stay so wonderful as usual!
Can't wait until next time!

title: A Truly Elagent Hotel
text: This is a classic New York hotel in every sense.  The lobby, relatively small by today's standards, is beautiful marble and always has a wonderful aroma from the copious amounts of flowers or burning candles (or both).  The bellmen and reception staff were very friendly and helpful.  Riding the elevators confirms that you are in a century old hotel.  The hallways to the room were nicer, cleaner and better appointed than some other hotels rooms where I have previously stayed.  This only increased the anticipation for the room itself.  It did not disappoint.  The rooms are beautiful and quite large, especially by New York standards.  I would recommend an upper floor room facing outward.  The room had a small couch, chairs and coffee table with the rear wall completely mirrored.  The bed was incredibly soft and relaxing, which was appreciated after full days of sightseeing.  The bathroom was large and comfortable.  It was nice being able to watch the television in the mirror while taking a shower.  We had room service and ate in the restaurant and both times the food was very good.  You cannot stay in the St. Regis without visiting the King Cole Bar.  It was a great place to unwind after a long day of site-seeing and/or shopping or for a drink prior to dinner and a show.  Each time we visited, it was extremely crowded.  However, the staff was always able to find us a table.  It was not until after a few visits that we realized that the staff knew that we were guests and always made room for us.  The drinks are top-notch, but the bar itself is worth the visit.  The mural is extremely captivating.  As it is within walking distance of Times Square, Broadway shows, Central Park, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and Bergdorf Goodman, the hotel location on East 55th street is ideal.  All around, the St. Regis was an incredible experience for which I cannot more highly recommend.

title: hotel excelente!
text:
muy buen hotel histórico en una ubicación central
el conserje era muy servicial y amable - que me dio muchas buenas recomendaciones
Me quedaré aquí de nuevo durante mi próximo viaje
el bar sobre el techo era genial

title: Elegant and well located
text:
Wonderful friendly staff, fabulous rooms with butler and above all the most comfortable bed !  
Their bar was small but had a real buzz and atmosphere.
I would also recommend their high tea....a real highlight of our stay.
Was lucky enough to be able to use their complimentary Bentley on a couple of occasions.  What a luxurious experience.
The hotel is very central for shopping restaurants and Central Park a 5 minute walk away.
Would highly recommend St Regis .

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Classic design, very spacious rooms!  Amazing bathroom - even a TV imbeded in the main bathroom mirror.  There is a personal butler service for every room.  Check in is fast and efficient.  Front desk people are very professional and friendly.  If you can afford it, I would highly recommend staying at least once in the St Regis NYC.  it is really a treat!

title: Amazing after the renovation and face lift
text: Excellence and beauty all in one. The staff, the location, the facilities and the grander of the hotel is perfection. I could only stay one night, but the hotel was all that it was supposed to be and more. I will stay here again when I am visiting NYC, across the street from my usually hotel and now a firm favourite.

title: Great location, old style luxury
text:
We stayed at the St. Regis on a recent weekend trip to New York using SPG points. We were very happy with the stay, considering it was points not cash, but were we paying the stated rates I would probably have been a bit concerned about the value for what you pay. 

Pros of staying there:
- Location is great - within blocks of some of the greatest shopping in the country, and walkable to other areas (Central Park, Times Square if you are in comfortable shoes, etc.). Reasonably easy subway access as well.
- Service was excellent, and in-room amenities were what you would expect for the SR (toiletries, bottled water, etc.).
- King Cole Bar is a classic destination and we enjoyed many delicious cocktails and snacks there (recommend the sliders!).

Cons of staying there:
- The hotel lobby is old fashioned (part of its charm) but it lacks the "wow" factor of the Mandarin Oriental or others in the same price class.
- There is no noteworthy dining here...Astor Court is fine for breakfast, but not worth spending the money for dinner. Other hotels in this class have a restaurant in house that is much more memorable and there is an advantage to staying there w.r.t. getting access to that restaurant.
- We reached out to the concierge in advance to see if they could help us get dinner reservations, and they did respond with a reservation, but they did not offer any options of what they would recommend / could get us, and what they booked for us was something easily bookable via OpenTable (one of those restaurants that has every timeslot available). We ended up booking something more special via OT ourselves, but definitely did not benefit from any special "in" the concierge in theory might have.
- Our room was pretty small -- maybe it was because we were there on points, but again I would have been disappointed if I had paid full freight and ended up with such a small space.

Net, net -- great if you can stay there on points, probably only good if you are paying yourselves.

title: Absolute choice for NY accom with ambiance and style
text: Gorgeous hotel in New York near 5th Ave. Beautifully appointed rooms, amazing beds and great service. We had a room with butler service and nothing was a problem at any time. Helpful concierge service that willingly provided support and advice. Breakfast was fabulous and great choices available. The bar was beautifully appointed but the cocktails were ordinary..... The only thing I was not happy with the whole stay. So stay, enjoy but go elsewhere for that special cocktail.

title: My favorite hotel in Manhattan!
text: Stayed two nights in this beautiful hotel. The room was clean, comfortable, spacious and well maintained.  This is my idea of a classic Manhattan hotel.  Service was exceptional.  Close to shops, restaurants, theatre, Central Park.  Highly recommend it!

title: Stunning
text: This hotel is stunning and the entire stay was just mind blowing from beginning to end. The staff are so kind and look after you all the time. You think you are the only one there also it is a large hotel. There are not many like this and I recommend everyone to try this one when in the big apple.

title: Could be so much better
text: I have stayed here on 4-5 occasions as it is close to my office in NYC.  The hotel is beautiful and in a fantastic location.  The rooms are very well designed and spacious for New York.  The bar is great.  The letdown comes with the service, particularly the inexperienced people at the front desk.  They have a hard time checking you in during afternoon times and do not carry themselves as professionals.  It can take an hour for the bags that you hand off when checking in to make it to your room.  A pretty hotel, but I expect more for the rates that are charged here.

title: Stunning Property and Out of this World Experience.
text:
We spent one-night in the St Regis hotel and I wish we had stayed for longer.  There are not enough words to explain how good the service, rooms, hotel and experience was.  

Upon arrival we were greeted by a professional and courteous staff in a beautiful lobby - and offered a bottle of water.  The staff immediately picked up on my husband's 50th birthday and even though we had to wait a little they upgraded us to a designer suite - the Bentley Suite.  This was a stunning room, with some of the best interior design I've ever seen.  It was spotless, enormous and with a great view of central park - which I wasn't expecting.  

The butler was helpful and prompt, the turn-down service immaculate and the check out a pleasurable experience.  All in all  - we'll be back again.  Up there with one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had.

title: Friendly and efficient
text:
It's always good to arrive somewhere and feel welcomed and the check-in staff here have got that right.  We were shown swiftly to our room on the 4th floor and it was charming.  My reputation within my family is that I seldom accept the first room shown to me, and they're right.  I honestly believe that a huge number of hoteliers still try and shift their worst rooms first and, having spent aeons staying in places round the world, I know that to be the case. Still, on this occasion, the St Regis were totally without fault.  We had a spacious and delightfully decorated room with a very good bathroom and lots of excellent lighting.  

Starwood, the owners of this brand, have a rather curious arrangement and refer to the Room Service operatives as 'Butlers' and they, men and women alike, are tricked out as if they've just come off the set of Downton Abbey in waistcoats, tails etc.  Bit odd.  The restaurant was fine but when in New York why eat in a hotel?  There are so many varied and great places to eat that are more interesting.  Having stayed in quite a few places in this city on the Upper East Side and further down town, we found the location of the St Regis pretty good.  It's right on 5th Avenue and an easy walk uptown to the Frick and Central Park.  MOMA, Times Square and the Lincoln Center are a spit away, and the newly-minted St Patrick's Cathedral is round the corner.  We'll be back.

title: Amazing Beds!
text: You cannot complain about the most comfortable beds ever. We did complain about our first room given however. While beyond spacious it only really had one window that looked at the parking garage and was quite dark. It felt like a jewel box in a basement. Plus it had some ugly wires hanging from the bathroom sink. To top it off the molding in front of the busiest seat in the room (if you get my drift) had the worst patch repair job ever. Just a huge glob of really bad caulking that was about 1.5" high. Just a cheesy cheap repair job. Between the wiring and the caulking we did not feel like we were in a 5 star hotel. The next day our room was changed and while smaller, it was brighter and there were no wires or nasty molding repair. This room was also along the street, and we were not bothered by any traffic noise whatsoever. We saw the butler once when my hubby requested coffee. So really can't comment on service. The check in area was always quite crowded as there's only 2 people right in the middle of things, which isn't the most convenient. But all-in-all we had a great stay.

title: Outstanding as ALWAYS
text: It is since many years my home from home when in NYC. I rather would postpone my visit if I couldn't get a room, having been disappointed too many times in other NYC hotels. I am in love with this hotel, beautiful rooms and suites, great bathrooms and products complimented by outstanding service. No request is to big or small, Concierge on of the best in the world. I spend most of my life in hotels, this is amongst the top 3! Keep up this outstanding work.

title: Just the place to come back to after exploring the city
text:
There are numerous options when looking for a hotel in Manhattan. We have tried many of them over the years. This visit we decided to stay at the St Regis. We are very glad we did. The welcome was warm and very accommodating by the front door and reception staff. Shortly after arriving in our room we were greeted by our butler who quickly gauged our preferences and offered available services. Since it was a rather slushy day in NY the shoe shining came in handy as did a hot cup of tea delivered to the room in short order. 

The room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable; the kind of comfortable you don't want to get out of in the morning. 

The hotel has a very busy bar area. Each evening we started with a drink there. I especially enjoyed the front lounge area near the window. Server was attentive even though it was busy. 

My only complaint is a rather picky one, I don't care for the toiletries that St Regis provides in the bath. The scent is not to my liking. So when staying at a St Regis I know to bring my own shampoo and soap. 

We would definitely stay there again. The location is excellent and every member of the staff provided excellent service.

title: Incredible hotel, near perfect service
text: We stayed here for two nights and were upgraded to a suite. From the time you enter the hotel until the time you leave, the staff anticipates and meets every conceivable need (with their signature phrase, "allow me") without feeling in your face or showy.   The room was so plush, comfortable and just gorgeous (one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in).  We had breakfast each morning in restaurant - everything was delicious.  The only downside is that you can hear a lot of the noise from outside.  We were on the 3rd floor. I know this is common in NYC hotels - but better noise proofing is the ONLY thing I could think of to complain about (and I'm not really complaining).

title: Lovely.
text: The St. Regis is the epitome of elegance.  Truly a beautiful venue with the most superb service.  Take a few minutes and soak in the lobby - find the "irises"...beautiful.  Every single employee encountered was helpful and gracious.

title: IMPECCABLE service!
text: I have never been so impressed with the customer service of a hotel. Every single staff member went above-and-beyond to make us feel like we were the most important guests in the hotel. I have traveled all over the world, and have never been more impressed with the level of hospitality provided at the St. Regis in NYC.

title: The True Gold Standard
text:
I just returned from a 5 night stay.  This was my 4th visit to this hotel but the last time was about 4 years ago.  New York has many great hotels including the Peninsula, Pierre, Trump, Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons and Mandarin Oriental.  I have stayed at all but the Mandarin, and ever since completing itsremodel, the St. Regis is my hands down favorite.  

While each of the hotels above offers certain pros and cons, the location at 5th Ave and 55th, the newly designed rooms,the large size of rooms, the butler service and the fantastic breakfast (and dining room), and bar make it my preferred choice.  Its unique and interesting history is also part of the flavor, which the hotel keeps very much alive. 

I am a Platinum SPG member, and they treated me accordingly by upgrading me to a suite that was plush and huge.  This suite (the Madison Suite) alone would motivate me to return.  

My teenage son wants to go into the hotel business, and when Paulina (a manager) learned of this she offered to tour my son through the hotel's designer suites.  Though we ended up not having a spare 30 minutes to do so, I will long remember that meaningful gesture.  

It goes without saying that the concierges were great.  A very cool and unique feature that the hotel has is a complimentary chauffeur driven Bentley for any guest traveling within 10 blocks of the hotel.  My only complaint is that in the dozen times we asked the doorman for the car, it was never available, and he made no gesture to ever try and procure it for us.  At the risk of sounding crass, I have a RR so it's not a big deal that it didn't happen but it would have been cool if that service could have ever been made good upon.

If you are in the mood for impeccable service, amazing design,large rooms, great food, elegance and class, and a good dose of aristocratic history, the St. Regis is a sure thing.  Definitely reach out to the concierge team to help plan your trip as they are full of great tips, ideas and "ins".

Lastly, I just proof read my review and realize that it sounds like a plant from an insider (not that the St. Regis would ever do that.)  In any event and for what it is worth, please know that this is a 100% genuine review.  It just sounds a bit fake only because the St. Regis is that good.

title: Favourite Hotel in NYC
text:
Stayed for a long weekend in an Astor suite.  The suite is excellent, with a separate sitting area, bedroom and very well equipped bathroom.

Room facilities were great.  Very comfortable.  Service was really good and the breakfast was incredible
