Had a very good meal in the restaurant on one of the evenings

Location is great, 5th Avenue and Central Park right on the doorstep.  We went to phantom of the opera at the Majestic and were favoured by dry weather - so it was an enjoyable stroll from the hotel

Is it expensive?  - Yes
Is it good value?  - Most definitely

title: Exceptional Service
text:
I recently return to the St Regis New York after staying here 2 years ago and again was not disappointed. The service at this hotel is the first thing that makes it stand out from the rest, there is always someone on hand whenever you need them, especially as each room comes with a personal butler service, offering services such as packing and unpacking, tea and coffee delivered to the room each morning and clothes pressing/shoe shining. With New York being such an exhausting trip, this hotel really offers a relaxing experience from as soon as you wake up to as you re-enter the hotel each evening.

The hotel itself is beautiful, with a very traditional/classic decor- this wouldn’t usually be my style (usually opting for a more modern looking hotel), however the St Regis provides such a high class atmosphere you cannot help but fall in love with it. This visit I stayed in a Madison Suite with my sister and we truly felt like princesses, from the TWO opulent marble bathrooms, high quality products to the ultra fluffy beds, we experienced an extremely luxurious stay.

As we only stayed 2 nights and had a very busy city schedule we didn’t dine in the restaurant, however this looked popular and the menu exciting. 

One other quirky benefit, additionally making you feel royally treated, was the complimentary Bentley journeys available. This is on a first come first served basis and will take you up to 10 blocks from the hotel, which isn’t massively far, but very useful if it’s cold/raining, or just for a bit of fun!

I loved this hotel on both occasions and will defiantly return next time I am in New York.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
I still think this is the best hotel in Manhattan although it is pricey. the service is beyond reproach. the rooms are clean, spacious and well appointed. From the time you check in the doormen, Patrick, Pasquale, Jimmy & Lenny welcome you like family. The front desk staff make you feel like you are home away from home and want you to feel as thought they can take care of your every need. Be sure to sign up for the Starwood Preferred Guest program if you are not already a member, it is well worth it.
The head concierge Maria is terrific and her staff Harold, Robert, McCinnlley, Anna and all the others are fabulous & will handle all your reservations and outside needs with a smile.

title: Excellent service!
text: We were upgraded to a suite upon arrival-beautifully appointed room-spotless!  The customer service in this hotel is unbelievable-every single person we encountered from the front desk to the housekeeper was unfailingly helpful and friendly.  I don't think I have ever had a hotel visit anywhere where every single staff member was so perfect Kudos to the manager of this property-you are doing an amazing job-could not even find one little thing that was less than perfect. This hotel is not cheap but I felt that it definitely was worth the rate-made out visit to NYC absolutely wonderful!

title: Excellent service and beautiful hotel
text: We booked two nights at this hotel to celebrate our 20th Anniversary and were very happy with our choice. The hotel is in a prime location steps away from many attractions including Central Park. The service is remarkable for warmth and hospitality upon arrival. I was welcome by the wonderful Alexandre Rojon, lobby ambassador, who helped me try to locate my misplaced spouse and then escorted me to our room. Throughout our stay, Alexandre made us feel welcome and special including with the gift of chocolate covered strawberries when he found out that we were celebrating a milestone anniversary.  Our room was lovely and superbly comfortable and spacious. The butler service is very convenient for morning coffee. The gym was particularly well equipped and welcoming. Excellent bar. We did not try the restaurants however.

title: Always outstanding
text: I have been coming to the St. Regis for the past 23 years.  It is always outstanding.  The rooms are truly beautiful and spacious for NYC.   What stands out about the St. Regis is the service.  This goes for the front desk, concierge, management, restaurant, butler service and rest of the staff.   On this trip, both Hugo and Atef were more than accommodating and able to upgrade us to a beautiful room as a starwood preferred guest.   Staying at the St. Regis makes my NYC visits truly special.

title: Favorite in New York City
text:
We've been staying at the St.Regis for special occasions for years, and love the service and quiet elegance. It has a special place in our heart as my parents spent part of their anniversary here years ago. 
The butler service in the suites is especially amazing, they can bring you almost anything you could ever want for a special evening.

title: Lovely
text: This is my favorite hotel in NYC for adult weekends. The staff is impeccable, the rooms are decorated in comfortable luxury, and the bar and restaurant are both delicious. One of the best burgers I have ever enjoyed was late one evening in the bar. A true retreat in a way that so few hotels can be, especially with such an amazing location. Love love.

title: Greatest place ever!
text: What a beautiful place. The lobby is gorgeous. Gentlemen at front desk upgraded us to a suite. Supersize room with jetted tub, spa showers, push button everything in the rooms! Heated floors. Butler service with coffee and chocolate covered strawberries. Walking distance to everything on 5th avenue.

title: The Best
text: I travel with my elderly mother and she requires a lot of attention. We stayed in one of the residence. The St. Regis Hotel in NYC is second to none. The services was prompt and impeccable. The service staff was very kind and helpful. The residence was large and comfortable accommodated my mother, her helper and myself. We had the two bathroom unit. The residence was recently renovated to include larger beautiful bathrooms with heated floors, a kitchenette and bright well lit rooms. We had the perfect time and we will be back!

title: Beautiful and Classic
text: From entering into the lobby, decor is tasteful and classic. As part of our visit, We attended a wedding reception held on the 20th floor. Elegance abounded. Service was superb, each course of food was excellent,and the ambience created the most elegant atmosphere and romantic setting for the celebration. The experience was about as perfect as one might imagine. All staff members were outstanding and the facility was immaculate. Truly a pleasure to have been at the St. Regis.

title: Afternoon Tea at the St Regis Hotel
text:
For an informal business meeting with few distractions, tea at the St Regis Hotel fit the bill. The sandwiches and desserts were great, the staff was adequate and non-intrusive, and the Astor Room represented old classy New York. It's an experience that everyone should have at least once
in their lifetime while in Manhattan.

title: Amazing Stay
text: From the moment your car pulls up to the second you checkout this property treats you like royalty. Personalized checkin, service as good as anywhere you will travel and accommodations to die for. Jonathan Adler at the concierge planned our meals and itinerary, reception greeted us like VIP guest and staff brought morning coffee and NY Times like clockwork. Very hard to leave but will certainly return.

title: Everything you hope the St Regis NYC would be --- and more
text: The St Regis NYC once again lives up to its reputation and stature as THE place in New York.  The food is some of the best hotel food I have had in a LONG time. The service is beyond compare in New York as the staff seems truly inspired these days. The hard product is first class and the bed/sheets some of the best in the world.  GM Hermann Elger clearly turned the Titanic around and restored the STR to its rightful place at the top of NYC's challenging hotel market.

title: great value in the centre of NY
text: We were very pleased with this choice of hotel. the rooms were spacious, the service excellent. This was very central to all parts of NY and the food for dinner was above par. This hotel is Highly recommended.

title: Beautiful hotel.
text: I went to a meeting in the hotel and had the opportunity to visit many of the rooms, suites and the lounge.  The rooms had recently been renovated in variety of styles but all in keeping with the history of the hotel and all stunning.

title: Exquisite staff
text:
I stayed two nights for my birthday and the ambiance is  mesmerizing. The employees are the soul and engine of the hotel. Everyone made me feel like home and Elena went above and beyond to help me find a camera man to tape a last minute audition.The breakfast(Astor Court)  was delicious and Caesar and Javier provided an excellent service trough their knowledge, hospitabillity and genuine interest. The butler service it is unique and  Mamady was very friendly and efficient.  
I slept like a baby in the king size bed and woke up extremely relaxed.
Thank you everyone for your fantastic, personable service and I will definitely return here.

title: Beautiful Hotel, great Staff
text:
Stayed in the Madison Ave suite at the St. Regis NYC for one night in March.  You couldn't ask for a nicer room and the staff was amazing.  Hugo Hidalgo at the front desk and Alberto the butler were so helpful and made the stay even more enjoyable.
Unforgettable trip to NYC..don't forget to try the Red Snapper.

title: Excellent Service
text:
A great hotel conveniently located just off 5th Ave with absolutely unrivalled service.

The rooms are traditionally styled and very luxurious and large for midtown Manhattan hotels.

The butler service is second to none - absolutely nothing is too much trouble. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

title: Service exceeds all expectations!
text: My second stay at the St Regis confirms that this is going to be my #1 choice for business in NYC and a new tradition for our anniversary weekend get away; the location and level of luxury are perfect for both!   The staff is exceptional and displays a professionalism and pride in service that one rarely sees anywhere anymore.  Hugo at the front desk and Angel make me feel like royalty and like at old friend at the same time.  The appointments in the rooms do the same and tuck you away from the city for the best rest I have ever experienced while traveling!

title: In a CLASS of its own.
text: Just got back from our third stay at the St Regis in Manhattan, and - just like the first two - it did not disappoint!  Location is prime, just a few blocks by foot to Saks, Rockerfeller Center, Radio City and then some.  Service is outstanding in every single way, from the moment you pull up to the valet, to the doormen, the concierge, the front desk and all staff especially the Butler service for literally any and all requests you might have.  They'll even shine your shoes while you sleep - just like old world luxury!  The amenities in the room are fitting of the luxury throughout the rest of the hotel - excellent 'Remede' products, plush towels and bathrobes (they even brought kids ones), back scrubbers in the bath, quality water bottles, etc.  I mean they don't miss a thing.  Turn-down service is of the same high level with relaxing music left on the Bose system, delicious chocolates in the room, and extra water bottles and glasses.  Butler service was impeccable and I'd like to give a special mention to Ness.  We stayed in a beautiful suite (Rm. 735) with two bathrooms and a separate living room.  The decor in every room is the epitome of opulence, and if you have any special occasion to celebrate - especially something like an anniversary or romantic getaway - this is the place to stay.  The St Regis just gets it right in every way and you will feel like royalty when staying with them.  Special thanks to Shelomi at the front desk for tending to all our needs, and all of the other staff.  Looking forward to our next stay!

title: Luxuriate in NYC
text: This was my first experience at a St Regis property, so obviously I was blown away at the level of service - the butler service really takes the cake.  Everything they do is absolutely immaculate, from the welcome to the morning coffee service.  Most importantly, I've stayed in many nice and expensive hotels in NYC over the years, but the worsening noise problem led to never having a good night's sleep.  The St Regis was so quiet, it was unlike anywhere I'd ever stayed in NYC.  I booked our weekend on SPG points, which is the best deal using points I could ever imagine.  This is the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed at!

title: In a class by itself
text:
My family and I stayed at the St. Regis in New York just before Christmas and had a wonderful time. Christina at the front desk acknowledged our SPG Platinum status and promptly upgraded our room.  We had a wonderful time and started a new family tradition that will continue for years to come. The entire staff makes you feel like you've been a member of the hotel family for years. This starts the moment you arrive at the valet, to the bellmen, and then the front desk staff. The service is unmatched. 

We returned to hotel for President's weekend to celebrate my oldest son's birthday. Both Christina and Atef made amazing arrangements for our 3 night stay. Their service and attention to my family was fantastic. The butlers even sent a cake to room. After being away from the hotel for 2 months, we were greeted as if we had been living there. Most of the staff remembered us and greeted us by name. The family feeling at the hotel makes it impossible for us to stay anywhere else. 

We love it at the St. Regis. This hotel is unmatched in everything that's important about a hotel stay. Keep up the good work.

title: Business or Fun - the best hotel in the City
text:
I have been staying at the St. Regis, at this location, for many years.  I have never been disappointed but in many cases, I was surprised and thrilled.  For business I would stay there alone but we also enjoyed many weekends as a couple going to the Theatre or for a variety of events.  We always were given the same room type - King Bed and a nice seating area to enjoy our morning coffee or last call beverage and tea.

I think it's good to note that we are not rich but we both make decent salaries.   There are many nice places to stay in the city for the same or more expensive price points.  Yet we always go back to the St. Regis.  It's something that anyone can sense as soon as one walks to their front doors - an effortless elegance.  

We haven't been back for a number of years as I had some health issues that kept me from traveling.  We are going next week for a birthday weekend and will be staying in the Astor Suite.  I can't wait to enjoy this beautiful room for the first time!

OH, one last thing.  My husband surprised me a number of years ago with a surprise birthday party at the hotel.  It was an amazing event, with only a small number of close family and I will never forget it.  If anyone wants more info on the party, do email me and let me know!  

Since my review is more of a broad range perspective I'll use our last stay for the rest of this survey!

title: Luxus pur!
text:
rascher Check in und Check out. Zimmer sehr sauber. Hotel liegt direkt an der 5th Avenue, Central Park zu Fuß in 5 Minuten zu erreichen. Einkaufsmöglichkeiten und Restaurants in der Nähe (24h Supermarkt).
Hotel hat leider keine Lobby.

title: Pretty Much the perfect hotel
text: I had to spend two nights in NYC.  I always check the rates at the St. Regis because it's just about my favorite hotel.  I was lucky and the rates for Monday night were good and Tuesday they had the $275/15,000 point option available.  So I booked it.  I am a platinum SPG member and got a great upgrade to a Madison Suite (1736).  It was wonderful.  I cannot say enough about this hotel.  The decor is perfect.  The rooms are wonderful.  The bed is comfortable.  The staff is efficient, friendly and knowledgable.  The location is perfect.  My stay was great, as have been all of my many stays there.

title: very dissapointing
text: Being a platinum Starwood preferred guest I would hope to be treated better then I was at this property. They put me on the lowest floor without an upgrade, although they did have a suite available but wanted to charge me an upcharge for it. I recently stayed at a sister St Regis in Houston and the service there was excellent. Maybe they should take a trip out there and see how it is run because my experiences between staying at the 2 properties were night and day. I stayed at 4 hotels in the last month and 3 of the experiences were so good that thinking back to this one leaves me very disappointed, considering my status as platinum and I am a repeat guest at this property. Hopefully next time will be a much better experience.

title: The Best!
text: Our absolute favorite hotel in New York. This hotel is pure decadence, from the gorgeous rooms to the impeccable service. The bedding was so heavenly that we ordered the down comforter, pillows and sheets as soon as we got home! The location is also perfection.

title: Excellent hotel
text: I adore this hotel- location, beauty, staff, ding.  The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are beautifully decorated. The staff is consistently friendly and helpful. I highly recommend staying here.

title: Excellent
text: My favourite hotel in NYC.. Been staying in this hotel since 1995 and the service only gets better... Excellent breakfast served in the cafe after the lobby. HIGHLY recommend this hotel you will not be dissapointed.

title: Loved everything about it!
text: Wonderful place to stay! The location is simply amazing. The amenities and service are 5 star. Staff is over the top in excellence! They aim to please in every aspect of your stay! Ralph's coffee is right across the street!

title: Very nice hotel in midtown
text:
We stayed here In February and the hotel was very nice.  The rooms are large by NY standards and the architecture is amazing.  The ceiling in our room was more than ten feet tall, and we actually had a large bathroom.

Of course, the hotel is very expensive, but we would come back.

Breakfast in the morning was excellent.

title: Un Hotel Excelente
text:
El Hotel es excelente, al igual que el personal de servicio a la habitación.
El Hotel tiene una ubicación excelente, por lo cual tienes acceso inmediato a New York City.
El desayuno es excelente, los baños todo bien.

title: Truly Elegant Oasis
text:
We had two adjoining rooms to form a "suite".  One of the rooms had a New York style kitchen with only a microwave.  When we needed a blender all we had to do was call our butler and poof there it was.  The entire staff was beyond attentive (for example, the housekeeping staff found a stuffed animal that "escaped" and had it waiting on my daughter's pillow when we returned from our day's activities).  The concierge was extremely helpful, at one point calling around and getting a restaurant to squeeze us in for a Christmas Eve meal.  You could not ask for a better location!  In the heart of everything you want to do, but removed just enough to not feel like you are in the hustle bustle...so relaxing to have an escape to recharge for the next day.

On a side note - the Christmas decorations were breathtaking!

title: Best Breakfast in Town
text: Breakfast at The St Regis NY was an amazing experience, great option before walking around the city. You can't miss the french toast and the greek yogurt with fruits. They have a special buffet session on exclusive food restriction: lactose free, glutem free and regional specialties  such as mediteranean and asiatic food.

title: Always again!
text: Best classic hotel experience in New York - was just waiting for the ghost of JJAstor to appear. Great service in all areas, specially McKinley at the Concierge was a delight - addressing guest by name he never saw before! Great functional interior just no USB charger port on beside - buts that's maybe a good thing to switch off from this world every now and then. Breakfast was superb - fine but a bit slow service when it comes to hot dishes. Try to sit in the atrium as the window tables are a bit cold in winter! Enjoy your stay - I did w mine.

title: Wonderful Experience at the St Regis New York.
text:
I can't say enough about my stay at the St. Regis New York City.

The staff was remarkable. The room was very clean, nicely appointed, very quiet and digitally smart. The Butler Service is always such a nice feature of the St. Regis.

My one and only complaint about the St. Regis NYC is that their food was very underwhelming. However, you are in New York City and there are amazing food establishments right outside the hotel door.

If you are considering staying at this property, I would highly recommend it.

title: Great hotel for the holidays in NY
text: We've stayed in the hotel several times, a very strong luxury contender in NY.  We are starwood 100, and our "upgrade" wasn't very impressive.  A slightly larger room that stared into an office building on the backside of the hotel.  Butler service was good, but we didn't use it much for this trip.  One of our favorite traditions with this hotel is visiting the King Cole bar, since we were there in December, it was quite busy.  The manager helping to control seating was downright rude.  I think he needed to keep in mind some of us were guests of the hotel.  Overall, a very good stay.  Can't beat this location!

title: the attention at the front desk and the pre-visit phone call was more than you could ask for.
text:
Even though this visit gave us an interior room, the room itself was outstanding in (but we did miss the petite fours - especially considering it was Valintine's Day weekend).

The one slip was brunch (about 11AM). The service was ragged, they ran out of bialys (if you are not a native New Yorker, you wouldn't know from) for the "Manhattan", which in itself was served cold (scrambled eggs with salmon). It just may have been an off day, but one would think for Valentine's Day the restaurant at the King Cole bar would have risen to the occasion as it doesn't fall on Sundays that often. In general, the St. Regis is a great and romantic hotel in a prime location. But, if you are not satisfied with your assigned room, ask for the room you want. At their room rates and SPG points, you shouldn't have to settle. To be clear, my wife and I were happy to have an interior room in NYC as it is quieter. However, as an SPG member, with life-time gold status, I would have expected a higher floor, if not a better room. But life is too short at times. It was fine.

title: Extremely accommodating and helpful staff!
text: I usually stay at St Regis whenever I travel to New York for work. This time my wife was visiting me for the long valentine's day weekend and the staff promptly moved me to a suite. My wife just loved it! The service is unparalleled compared to any other hotel in the country. Only one complaint that the bed is so good I have a hard time getting up in the morning!

title: Between Very good and excellent.
text:
The front desk staff were smiling, warm and welcoming. The butlers were great and very helpful. The Astor suite was comfy and immaculate. The bathroom was small but sufficiently large for two people to be able to get ready at the same time -- an important comfort feature for me. The bed was divine -- just like home. Best of all this glorious comfort was located on a floor that was blessedly silent. Not banging doors, no noise at all. It’s what I expect of rooms at my 5 star hotels. The bar was comfortable and mercifully had no television in it. I just don’t get the TV thing in high end bars. I’m there to enjoy the drink and talk with friends. Unfortunately some things were not up to the same standards as say, my favorite Ritz Carlton in Moscow. For example, we came back from the theater and a short distance from our suite there were what looked like two roll away beds in the hallway which stayed there until the next afternoon. Seriously? This would not happen at the RC.  Aside from the aesthetics, they blocked the corridor, and that could not have been safe. Also, I was less than thrilled at the service at breakfast. The maitre d was pretentious and cold. Fellow, don’t look down your nose at me. I’m the guest here. The staff was plentiful but not well trained. Example? The entree I ordered had toasted bread that needed a sharp knife to cut. They knew this feature of the bread, as the waiter apologized and said he should have gotten one for me without my having to ask. Then it took him 7 minutes to get the knife. Repeated again the next morning. Had to ask for a sharp knife again. Twice. 
These kinds of details make this a lovely option. Not sure whether we will be going back to the Peninsula or coming back here again though.

title: Faultless!!
text: I was thoroughly delighted with all aspects of my stay at the St Regis. It is an historical hotel, that preserves history and combines this with all modern amenities.  The rooms are beautifully presented, with comfortable seating areas, practical working desk and televisions in the room and the bathroom.  The butler service was excellent and you can enjoy being served tea or coffee as well as packing and pressing. The fitness centre on 19 floor was excellent and open 24 hours. Room service was immaculately presented and timely. Breakfast at the restaurant was delightful and had a wide range of choices. The cheese and charcuterie platter was especially impressive. Service was impeccable. A thoroughly enjoyable stay!

title: The royal treatment
text: This is probably the tenth time I've visited the St. Regis NY in the past 5-6 years and it is always a great experience. The "At Your Service" butler service included in every stay is exquisite. We have gotten to know some of the staff members over the years so that they know us by name even before we check in and that always make us feel welcomed and appreciated. When it is available we usually receive a generous room upgrade as we are Starwood Preferred Guest members. The butler service includes coffee service each morning - on fine china and in a french press. We are treated like royalty when we visit and can't wait to return - we have already reserved for a weekend in June and another in September.

title: Amazing
text: This old hotel has been updated but since keeps the old NY charm & class. I felt like I was transported backed into old New York but with today's amenities. The staff is fantastic. And, because it is a older hotel the rooms in general tend to be bigger. We stayed 2x this year,  November & December. The first time was a spacious 2 bed one but was big enough for sofa, coffee table, desk, nightstand & dresser. The 2nd time, WOW. we stayed in a one bedroom king suite with full living room, 2 full baths & a large entryway. It was incredible. AMAZING!

title: As in St. Regis in Osaka, yet uniquely in New York
text:
As in St. Regis in Osaka, yet uniquely in New York is more the expression or vale proposition of this luxurious five star hotel. 

Everything is uniquely St. Regis and New York right in the center of Manhattan. The staff and rooms are fabulous in every way. 

If you have a chance, its underground floor has small exhibitions of its long history, making your trip even more unique in history.

title: Fantastic in Every Way
text: Everything was amazing - from the first smile we received when walking in the door, to the stunning room, to the bar. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Their dedication to customer service is incredible!

title: The bar!
text: Loved the bar went for a few cocktails while waiting for our reservation at the polo bar. Friendly bartender with a great list of drinks. The spicy nuts they give you are hard not to eat. Will go back for sure. High end. Not a place for cheap drinks but also not what I was looking for.

title: Perfection with a Butler
text: Each room is provided a butler who brings you your coffee each morning complimentary.  In the winter afternoons, there is hot chocolate or hot cider offered in the lobby to guests.  The room furnishings are sumptuous, and the restaurant serves a luxurious breakfast.  Service overall is impeccable.

title: Business trip stay
text: While I think many of the guests at this palatial treasure stay for a luxury base to explore Manhattan, I was here on business for a photo shoot. I was checked in by Hugo who was kind, attentive and unpretentious. He was able to offer tidbits relevant to me to make my stay that particular time amazing. My room was upgraded and when I stepped in, I was blown away by how much character it had. So charming! The quaint hotel bar is worth checking out as it has quite a bit of history.

title: "There's no better luxury hotel than St. Regis"
text: My wife and I would like to thank the front desk staff for their kindness and sincerity. They make us feel as if we were part of the family not just as "customers." We stayed in "5th avenue suite," it was awesomely luxurious, super clean, and romantic view. The butler prepared amazing cookies and coffee each morning. It was an amazing experience for our first anniversary that will never be able to forget.

title: Extraordinary care during the NYC Blizzard of 2016!
text:
I want to thank you so much for the beautiful way your colleagues and staff made my family's visit absolutely perfect during this past weekend's blizzard. Each January I hold a special dinner in NYC for a precious group of friends, followed by a night at the theatre, to celebrate my son and daughter-in-law's and my January birthdays. This year we decided to bring their 5-year-old and 7-year-old children and spend the night at the St. Regis, where my WWII-era Mother and Father got engaged and where my son and his wife also became engaged 8 years ago. Anne, in the Front Hall greeted my two grandchildren with such a warm, happy welcome, and your brilliant Shelomie [--] at the Front Desk checked us into our adjoining rooms easily. Our wonderful butler, Delores Romero surprised the children with cookies and milk, so of course, they fell in love with her immediately. 

Our visit was made even more memorable by the blizzard, and we are so grateful to Shelomie for finding a way for us to stay an extra night in our beautiful rooms! The weather must have created great hardship for the entire staff, but you would never know it. Service remained exquisite and the food, especially the healthy and clean options on the breakfast, lunch, and dinner menus were outstanding. Our waiters, especially Javier and Kenny and Isimat, were so kind and made the children feel very special. A hero's medal needs to go to Head Doorman Patrick and his crew who worked 24/7 to keep the sidewalks clear during the 24+ hours of the blizzard. I will treasure forever the sight of my son and his wife and their two children walking down an empty Fifth Avenue at the height of the blizzard and also their delight at our extravagant afternoon tea! Regardless of the blizzard, the chef and kitchen crew prepared everything beautifully. Our afternoon tea was right out of a fairy tale and the children were enchanted. 

Also I must thank the indoor door attendants, the two Michaels and Rick and also a huge thank you goes to Desiree and Lydia who cleaned our rooms and turned down our beds. Special thanks too to the wonderful concierges McKinley and Maria who were so helpful to us. Stacey and Maria, the massage therapists, made my and my daughter-in-law's snowed-in day even more perfect. They are fantastic! I am so grateful to the St. Regis for giving my 3-generation family the best and most fun trip we have ever had as a family. We will see you again in January 2017 if not before. Thank you to everyone! When the valet service brought our car around Sunday morning it was very hard to say goodbye!

title: New York City At Its Best
text: Everyone who works there feels they are members of the family rather than "just an employee". We love being included in the best family in the world when we stay there. The smallest request is handled efficiently, and with a smile. The waiters remember you, and what you like--we had breakfast there every day during our four night stay.January was cold, And it was lovely knowing hot chocolate, coffee and broth was waiting in the lobby to waRm us up. Gym equipment is great. Location cannot be better. Beds and bedding are the best, and the rooms are immaculate. The concierges gave us great advice every time. This trip was a bit different for us because the Cabadian dollar costs us right now around $1.50 to get one US $, so we were looking for medium priced meals that were as fabulous as the more advertised, and expensive restaurants: we were thrilled with every suggestion. Check in was quick, and every request was met. I could continue with the compliments, but I think you understand that we absolutely love everything at the hotel.

title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in
text: This was our second stay at the St Regis New York, and it was an incredible stay, once again. Hugo checked us in and took great care of us. The rooms are gorgeous and spacious. The staff was so accommodating. Every time you turn around, there is someone there to help you - with your bags, with the elevators, with some refreshments. They're everywhere! We love this hotel and will definitely be back again soon.

title: Супер!
text: Нам очень понравился отель. Он очень красивый снаружи, внутри он еще красивее. Прекрасное обслуживание. Отличные просторные номера, красивый вид. Иногда правда было шумно, но улица прекрасно. Очень понравилось питание. Отличная выпечка, кофе. Удобное расположение. Советую этот отличный отель!

title: The Best Bloody Mary's!
text: Amazing bar, quite small but luxurious. The bar staff are very friendly, and the bloody Mary's are out of this world. I will definitely be visiting again. I would recommend reserving a table, although we propped up at the bar and had a great laugh with the bar staff.

title: 5 Star Palace in NY
text:
This is our home in NY.

If you want 5 star service in the best location in midtown with butler service this is the hotel for you. Note that the clientele isn't that young and the rooms aren't modern. 

I would chose this hotel for its excellent service/room service and location

title: Trapped in luxury!
text:
My wife and I were in New York both to celebrate a birthday and to attend business meetings when the Great Blizzard descended upon the City, effectively "trapping" us in the hotel during the travel ban...but, what a pleasurable experience!

The entire staff was instantly transformed into a wonderful winterland community, at once concerned, helpful and so very willing to go the extra distance to make our stay a pleasurable haven from the storm. Our butler even went so far as to share stories about how appreciative the staff was that they received personal notes from the Manager, thanking them for their extraordinary service during the storm. Clearly the management is doing everything right at the St. Regis, and the results benefit the guests!

Thank you, St. Regis...we hope we have another reason to be "stuck" with you!

title: Very good hotel
text: So you enter the st regis and your pampered from the get go. The decor is very nice, staff is very friendly, rooms are big and the location is top notch. I recommend taking a high floor so you don't hear the noise on the street.

title: Great location, spacious rooms
text: Walking distance to shopping, park and museums. Great cocktail lounge--apparently the birthplace of the Bloody Mary. The breakfast choices are vast and all of them, particularly the Shakshuka are amazing. The butler service can be a bit slow at times, it seems there aren't enough of them, but french press coffee brought to you very quickly in the morning through this service was really nice. The gym has excellent equipment and plenty of it, including foam rollers and pilates gear.

title: All-time favorite Hotel
text: Have visited this hotel many times in the past few years and it seems to get better with each visit.  A multimillion dollar renovation has restored this jewel to its former glory.  Service is impeccable and butler service is always a treat.  Everyone in the hotel is a true professional, greeting you by name and offering a friendly welcome.  King Cole Bar is always fun, but don't go at happy hour or you won't find a seat.  Rooms are plush, bedding is the most comfortable I've found anywhere.  We've traveled far and wide love the St. Regis brand, but this hotel is in a class by itself.

title: Beautiful Property
text:
It's hard to visit the St Regis New York and not come away at least somewhat impressed.  The property is just beautiful.  They have done a great job of capturing the historical significance while also incorporating the latest creature comforts.

Location could not be better.  You are right on 5th avenue and only a short walk to Times Square.  Never had to wait more than a few minutes for an uber when needed.

Our room was upgraded to an Astor Suite which was simply magnificent.  A half-bathroom in the foyer with a grand, full-bathroom attached to the bedroom.  Pocket doors separate the bedroom and the large living room.  There was no real view from our room although the view inside more than made up for it.

At first the details and the scale are almost overwhelming.  The chandeliers and the expansive crown molding seem almost unreasonable.  The wall coverings are silk.  The TV's -like all the technology- is completely updated.

I also have to mention the shower which was one of the more invigorating showers I have used.  It just puts out a LOT of water.

We were celebrating my birthday and were surprised with a note from the manager and some chocolate covered strawberries one evening.  

The reason I am docking one star is because the house Bentley's were not available during our stay.  That was THE reason we booked here and not other places.  It was on my bucket list to ride around NYC in a Bentley so we chose the St Regis to check that off the list.  They even advertised the Bentley's on Twitter a day or two before we came.  No real reason was given.  One person said they heard the leases were up.  Another said they were being detailed.  Either way we didn't get to enjoy the one thing I was most excited about staying here for.  I felt a little "bait-and-switch"ed since they had got my hopes up even more with the advertising.

Another thing to point out is that the beds are a little on the firm side.  That may be your preference but I enjoy more of a pillowy soft bed.

title: Spacious rooms in a great location
text: St. Regis is a beautiful old hotel with a great cocktail bar for evenings. The breakfast menu is the most extensive--they even had Shashuka, which was very good. The rooms are spacious and clean and they provide french press coffee in the mornings. The butlers are spread a little thin though as they didn't always respond to a page. The beds are a little stiff feeling. The location is the best. You can walk to the park, shopping, museums and nice restaurants from this area. My husband held business meetings there and was pleased with the staff and rooms.

title: An outstanding wedding venue
text: Not only is this a fabulous hotel in a perfect part of central Manhattan, the wedding staff excelled themselves in every way and could not have done better. The wedding was arranged from abroad so the help in advance was vital. There was co-operation between the staff of the hotel and our wonderful jazz musicians Chris Conte and Darren Litzie who gave such a fine performance at the reception, having first visited the venue, seen the rooms, and even chosen which of the hotel's two grand pianos (the Steinway) they would play at the wedding. Thank you all, wedding manager Molly especially!

title: L'hotel Perfetto
text: Quando Passo da NY soggiorno sempre in questo hotel, perché mi ricorda tanto il vecchio e oramai estinto Mayfair, le attenzioni della accettazione sono accurate e ti fanno sentire come se fossi quasi l'unico cliente in Hotel, le camere anche alcune piccole, sono decorate in maniera ineccepibile, servizio Butler uno dei migliori, ottimo servizio in camera, insomma un hotel perfetto, spero di ritornare presto a New York al St. Regis.

title: Perfect locaction
text:
Spacious and very nicely appointed rooms. Great bathroom, excellent bed and top quality linen. Feels just right, almost a home away from home. 

The bar is a must! 

Excellent restaurants in walking distance. Room Service prices - outch...

title: Worst Reception Ever! Sarah Sucks!  Hotel is a mess!  Management needs replacing!
text: I have been a Starwood Gold member for decades. We have travelled to over 100+ countries since 1970. Don't ever stay here as they treat you like trash!  Such a New York attitude it was so upsetting.  Ruined our Anniversary!  They lost food in the freezer!  They held us captive upon departure and almost missed our flight!  They were horrific and ST Regis & Starwood never even took the time or courtesy to reply to us!  We are done with Starwood beads altogether!

title: DECENT, VERY CLEAN, BUT NOT EARTHSHATTERING!
text: Staff was polite and kind, rooms were ok (partly quirky) and very clean but other than the location, I found nothing worth considering a repeat-just a semi-upscale ho-hum kind of place.  Had a regular room, perhaps the fancy suites might be a bit more memorable.

title: Wow, I wish other St Regis where like this
text: I have had many bad experiences at St Regis, but this one was wonderful. Across the board it was great. The service is usually lacking at most sts, but not here. The butler service worked amazing and all the small perks like free coffee and cloths pressing were great.  Staff was very well trained and all had great attitudes, job well done.

title: Subsequent Review ...
text:
In May I submitted a less than laudatory review of the St. Regis.  We returned this past weekend and were very pleased. While the staff at the restaurant looked very familiar, their attentiveness and professionalism was markedly improved over our past couple of visits. 

For those who are Starwood Platinum members, the breakfast arrangement has been solved in a very reasonable way achieving an important improvement for those of us who enjoy this brand.  

While this was just a three day stay, we were very happy with the service and hotel and plan to make the St. Regis our first choice in New York.

title: Amazing Hotel and Top Notch Staff!
text: We booked a 2 bedroom suite room for my daughter's birthday trip in August.  Our room was not ready upon arrival and they upgraded us to the Presidential Suite....  Yes, the one where royalty and rock stars stay!!!  It was absolutely over the top amazing.  To add to our amazing trip, the staff made my daughter's birthday unforgettable.  They filled the living room with pink balloons, made a custom cake for her and got her an American Girl doll horse as a gift.  I cannot thank the amazing staff for a trip of a lifetime for my little girl (and the entire family!).  We travel to many 5 star properties all over the world and St. Regis NYC and its staff is now in my top list for sure!!!!

title: A luxury at home
text:
I thin i summarised everything in those few words luxury at home! We were booked into the Astor Suite for 4 nights right before Christmas. Upon arrival they upgraded us to the Fifth Ave suite. Humongous! We had  private +butler who got us from tea to even a nail clipper! They never minded going twice to the kitchen just to get your marshmallows for the hot chocolate or mint leaves for the tea. Such extra care. We had breakfast a la carte (buffet not available) from there every morning which kind of turned monotonous but not their fault. 
+ Amazing decor for Christmas
+ the location is awesome! A few blocks to Rockefeller centre, Empire state building, central park, Bergdorf Goodman, 
+ good choice for breakfast!
+ complimentary ride with a Bentley 2-3 blocks anywhere LIKE A BOSS!

Love this hotel and will only come back here to stay!

title: The lap of luxury at its finest
text: The St. Regis is the lap of luxury.  The rooms have the finest details of luxury from the linens to the soaps.  Many are staffed with a butler.  They bring a fresh fruit bowl each evening with the juiciest fruits.  You find chocolates on your bed each evening.  This is simply the finest hotel.

title: A Grand Hotel
text: Beautiful and elegant hotel.  Great location and attention to detail.  Our room was large and gorgeous!  We ordered room service and the food was exceptional and the service amazing.  The lobby is so glamorous.  It is my favorite place to stay in NYC!  A must stay for sure!

title: Wonderful location - just falls short of expectations
text: We wanted a special stay in New York for Christmas. We had decided to give this hotel a second chance after a bad experience last year. Must say it started well but as the week went on we felt the service dropped. The room service on all occasions was terrible and overpriced. Such a shame as I have said earlier an amazing location and beautiful property. 1 positive was the hotel car and driver.

title: Extravagantly Grand
text: Unfortunately I only got to spend 1 delightful evening getting to experience this old world charm, however, the experience couldn't have been more well done! This truly exceeds the luxury level. The old world charm of opulence and supreme service keep this place a New York icon. Due to having SPG status, I was fortunate enough to receive an upgrade to a corner suite, but I can imagine all of the rooms are equally as decadent. The chandeliers everywhere are stunning, the beds are softer than a cloud and the bathrooms are fit for a queen! Having the butler unpack your items and be so friendly are very uncommon, yet very much welcomed and an excellent touch! It was intriguing to ask staff members about the history of the hotel and they were all able to identify and tell their stories. However, if you want a great story, than I recommend paying Bill the attender at King Coles a visit! ;) This hotel is in a prime location and conveniently located across from the Polo Bar!

title: Prachtig luxueus hotel
text: Toplocatie voor dit hotel. De ontvangst door het vriendelijke personeel valt op. U voelt hoe de gast hier op de xhanden gedragen wordt. Maar drie nachten aanwezigheid was fantastisch (hier voor een klein seminar en voorlezing). De kamers zijn luxueus ingericht en zeer ruim alsook de badkamer. Het ontbijt is superieur. Het diner in het restaurant is verzorgd en een aanrader. Super vriendelijk personeel laat je de topgerechten smaken met verse ingredienten en lekkere wijnen. Een aanrader van jewelste......

title: Birthday Celebration
text: My husband and I stayed at the St. Regis in NY. Prior to us arriving, I spoke with Isabel at the front desk and explained the occasion and that the stay was going to be a surprise for my husband's 40th birthday. Isabel was so lovely and so helpful. We arrived, checked in and Isabel had stayed later, past her shift, to say hello and make sure that we were accommodated! Our room was an incredible suite and we had the most romantic and wonderful stay. The hotel is magnificent, luxurious, and every person is there to make your stay as wonderful as possible. I can't wait for another occasion to go back!

title: Elegant atmosphere, outstanding service (except for the receptionists), incredible food
text: Four of us reserved a table for "afternoon tea" at the St. Regis. The vast, incredible selection of teas (or coffee if you prefer), the mouth-watering scones with clotted cream and jam, the champagne, the tasty little assorted beef, salmon, and cucumber sandwiches, the quiche, the scrumptious desserts.... And willing servers who are happy to provide more of whatever you want, so there is no need to fight over the last fresh raspberry tartlet or chocolate éclair! This all started with Concierge Robert Geist, a true gentleman who went out of his way to accommodate our reservation needs, since we were arriving from outside the U.S. and our entrances were somewhat staggered. He was a sharp contrast to the young women receptionists, who were cold and haughty. Just ignore them, be seated at your table, and enjoy everything else. While you are there, be sure to walk into the adjoining King Cole Bar to see the famous Maxfield Parrish mural, which was commissioned by John Jacob Astor.

title: Luxury, but far too expensive
text:
We stayed 2 nights at this hotel in a Grand Deluxe Room during our NY trip in Dec 2015. 

Positive:
- Wonderful hotel interior and also wonderful room designs - perfect to enjoy and expect luxury
- Very clean - nothing to complain
- Perfect location directly on 5th Av
- Breakfast was included in our room rate in general, which grants you a certain credit for the a la cart breakfast (there is no buffet). It was delicious, but only a few set meals were actually included, anything else you would have to pay the difference
- early check-in, as well as late check-out plus a drink in the King Cole Bar were granted for being a Gold member in their loayalty program
- free Bentley shuttle within 10 blockes if a car is available - this is a great service!

Negative:
- King Cole Bar is so crowded by external people that it is impossible to grap a seat... We decided to stay just outside of the bar to have a drink - "thanks" to St Regis at this point, as they granted a free drink even to my wife due to this fact even though having only 1 voucher as loyalty member...
- Butler service: Nice to have, but not really helpful. They won't answer the phone directly, but they will see your number on their screen and call you back (after a few seconds or some minutes... you never know). They will serve you some tea or coffee at arrival and in the morning - but they won't do it throughout the day, which really is a pitty as you don't have any tea or coffee making facilities in your room. The butler will offer you to order soem tea or coffee from inroom dinding service at charge. This really is anoying and other St. Regis hotels definitely have a different understanding of service
- bathtub: yes, in the Grand Deluxe Room you will have one - but you won't have any bath salt or bath essence to use it. Quite poor for a luxury hotel, we asked the butler to bring some more sower gel and we used this instead
- airport transfer: tremendously overpriced! We organized a limousine car by ourselves and paid less than half of the price St. Regis would have charged

It was a very luxury stay, but for "normal" people it really is overpriced, especially as nearly all tiny wishes you might have will cause additional charges. It was a nice experience but we wouldn't come back in future.

title: An exquisite stay ...
text:
We just returned from our stay at the St. Regis NYC for NYE weekend ... Should have stayed for a week! Truly an elegant hotel ... our butler (Sanela N.) was amazing and Maria Wittorp-DeJonge, chef concierge truly went out of her way to make our experience unforgettable. The rooms were AMAZING, the linens were delicious to sleep on and the bathroom was heaven ... We stayed in the Imperial Suite, must I say more ... Truly Luxury at its best!
I can't wait to go back!

title: Poor service from start to finish
text:
Stayed 1 night as an SPG Gold member through the Amex Platinum Fine Hotels & Resorts program. The hard product at the property is good but let down by extraordinarily bad service - hands down the worst received at any 5* luxury hotel.

- On reserving, the hotel insisted that as a couple with a young child, we must book a rollaway bed at an extra charge and we could not share one king bed "for health and safety reasons". Accepting the higher rate charge, on arrival, there was no rollaway provided. Luckily we didn't want one but they were extremely insistent on this fact when booking.

- No welcome amenity offered as SPG Gold member.

- Check-in experience went from cold and marginally polite to confrontational. Hotel would not honor the contractual "one-category if available" upgrade of the Amex FHR program. The hotel's own website defines these room categories for sale: superior, deluxe, grand luxe rooms, then 1 bedroom suites. Within the 1 bedroom suite category, the room types are Astor, Deluxe, Madison. Having booked a grand luxe room, at checkin their website showed availability for Deluxe and Madison suites. The agent insisted their obligation was only a one-room type upgrade, and not a category upgrade (which means any room type in that category). Therefore as no Astor suite was available, no upgrade for us.

- I spoke to the Front Desk Manager, Susan, who insisted their interpretation of the FHR contract was correct. Having now spent 20 mins waiting for them to check "round the back" as they put it, with nowhere offered for my family to sit, I just wanted to get to a room. I then called Amex, who contacted the hotel. Unfortunately by this point Susan had allocated the available Deluxe suites to other guests or at least blocked them, and lied to my Amex agent claiming that I had been seeking an upgrade to a Madison suite worth $1000 extra, and the contract prohibits a "triple" room type upgrade. I don't appreciate the hotel manipulating their inventory, nor lying to my Amex agent when my request was for a Deluxe suite allowable by the FHR contract and worth only approx $200-300 more. Amex advise the hotel clearly has different definitions of "available" and "category" and these do not equate to "available for sale on their website" and "category of room as listed on their website" - sounds like they are happy to use different definitions to deny loyalty benefits.

- On being shown to our room, the agent advised a butler would introduce himself "in a couple of minutes". One hour later, no butler. I page the butler and receive a call back, requesting a champagne ice bucket and child amenities (these weren't provided even though child was listed on the reservation). Another hour later, still no sign of anything. Page the butler again, received the amenities... never received the requested ice bucket. Last we ever saw of the butler. No offer of many of the complimentary services as advertised on their website, but nice of them to provide tea & cookies/milk.

- Ordered room service dinner (with the still missing ice bucket) - quality was very average for the price and beware families, this hotel charges an $8 per PERSON room service charge which I have never encountered at any other hotel. So a family of 3 would pay a whopping $24 in addition to mandatory 20% gratuity and sales tax. The waiter advised us just to lie and say we are just one person next time! Called for the trays/trolley to be collected, 90mins later nobody had come and it was collected by housekeeping at turndown.

- Tried to organise family activities through the concierge as advertised on their website, they acknowledged our request but never heard back from them after that. 

- Advertised functionality to stream your iPad media to the hotel TV does not work.

- "Included complimentary breakfast" worth $41 is the most basic continental breakfast ever seen, consisting solely of 4 pastries, coffee and one orange juice. 

- On checkout, the agent's only words from walking to the desk were "Mr __, here is your bill, let me correct this error, hope to see you again." No "how was your stay" or anything similar.

When paying four figures to stay in a hotel room, this doesn't meet any expectations and this stay was our first and last at a St Regis.

title: Excellent choice for the holidays
text: Had 2 of their luxury rooms for th eholidays. Excellent is service and surprisingly large with sitting areas. Butler service is what they are still famous for. And it is special even in the extremely busy season. Not as fast as one would have hoped but it was the holidays. Food expensive as expected but very well done for room service. Luxury at its best. We will be back!

title: Take a tour! Ask for Alexandre.
text: My husband and I brought our two girls ages 9 and 12 to New York City for the holidays. One of the highlights of our trip was a tour of the hotel. It is a must! Did you know the Saint Regis had the first public library ever? Did you know the ballroom has a Tiffany chandelier with over 5000 crystals? Did you know that the painting in the bar is worth over 15 million dollars? Did you know the marble staircase goes from the lobby all the way to the 18th floor? It is known as the million-dollar staircase.  The tour is free.

title: A delightful stay for New Year's
text: I stayed here for one night and was upgraded to the lounge room, a bigger room. Staff including the front desk, bellboy and butler Mariana were very friendly and helpful. Great service from  Mariana who welcomed us tea when we check in our room. Super comfortable beds, cosy and definitely like to stay here next time I'm back in NY!

title: A wonderful stay
text: This hotel excels on every level, especially their 24hr butler service. As previous reviewers noted, from the moment you arrive, all of your needs are met quickly and with care. The building itself is steeped in history and the rooms are elegantly appointed. You won't be disappointed with your stay at the St. Regis - New York, a true luxury hotel.
